title: A
description: Hand is in a closed fist with all fingers folded against the palm. Thumb is slightly out, still touching hand. Palm is facing out.
memory_aid: The hand, from the back, looks like a written 'a'.

title: A lot
note: While 'a lot' is a two-word phrase in English, it is one sign in KSL.
description: Right Full Open Handshape with palm facing down repetitively hits the side of the left hand which is in an S-Handshape.
memory_aid: The hand hits again and again meaning 'a lot'.

title: Abandon
description: Full Open Handshapes with palms facing signer are positioned at side of signing space. They move up from the wrists so that palms are now away from the signer.

title: Abashed
note: Note lowered eyebrows and raised shoulders. These are essential parts of the sign.
description: Right Claw Handshape with palm facing signer moves back and forth in front of face.
memory_aid: As if trying to hide from being abashed.

title: Abel
note: Name of a Bible character, son of Adam and Eve and was killed by his brother

title: Ability
note: The raising of eyebrows and tilting of head are important parts of this sign.
description: Both hands are in S-Handshapes with palms facing down. They move down.

title: Able
note: The raising of eyebrows and tilting of head are important parts of this sign.
description: Both hands are in S-Handshapes with palms facing down. They move down.

title: Abolish
description: Both hands are in Full Closed Handshapes. Right hand with palm facing left moves down to swipe across palm of upturned left hand. As right hand moves up, it closes into C-Handshape with palm facing signer.

title: Abolition
description: Both hands are in Full Closed Handshapes. Right hand with palm facing left moves down to swipe across palm of upturned left hand. As right hand moves up, it closes into C-Handshape with palm facing signer.

title: Abort
note: 'Abort' as in to end an activity or project before completion.
description: Full Open Handshapes with palms facing signer are positioned at side of signing space. They move up from the wrists so that palms are now away from the signer.

title: About 1
note: 'About' as in regarding something.
description: Extended Index Finger Handshapes are pointing at one another and move around one another in small circles.
memory_aid: Fingers are talking about one another.

title: About 2
note: 1. 'About' as in approximately. 2. Note shaking of lowered head, an essential part of the sign.
description: Both Full Open Handshapes with palms facing in are placed at either side of the signing space. As they move up and down alternately, hands twist from the wrists.

title: Above
description: Right hand in Full Closed Handshape starts near waist and moves in an arc until hand is over head with fingers pointing left. Palm is always facing down.
memory_aid: Indicates the above side of an object.

title: Abraham
note: Name of a Bible character, a friend of God and father to Isaac

title: Abrasion
note: While 'abrasion' is one word in English, it is a two-word phrase (SICK, CUT) in KSL.
description: SICK - Backside of Bent-B Handshape touches cheek. CUT - Fingertips of Bent-B Handshape with palm facing signer then move along backside of downturned left Full Closed Handshape.

title: Absence
description: Right Full Open Handshape with palm facing left and fingers pointing down moves up from wrist to the right. Palm is now facing out.

title: Absent
description: Right Full Open Handshape with palm facing left and fingers pointing down moves up from wrist to the right. Palm is now facing out.

title: Absolutely
note: Note raised eyebrows, an essential part of the sign.
description: Both hands are in Full Closed Handshapes. Left hand is positioned in center of signing space with palm up and fingertips pointing right. Right hand, with palm facing left, moves down to touch upon palm of left hand.

title: Absolve
description: Both hands are in Full Closed Handshapes. Right hand is positioned with palm up. Left hand starts on top of right hand where it moves down on the palm. Hands turn so that right hand is now on top of left hand. Right hand then moves down on palm of left hand.

title: Absorb
note: To engulf as in water

title: Abstain 1
note: 1. 'Abstain' as in to stop something. 2. Note lowered eyebrows, an important part of the sign.
description: Both hands are in Full Closed Handshapes. Left hand is held parallel to chest with palm facing signer. Palm of right hand is facing left. Right hand moves down in front of left hand.

title: Abstain 2
note: 1. 'Abstain' as in to command someone to stop something. 2. Note lowered eyebrows, an important part of the sign.
description: Full Closed Handshape with palm facing out moves forward.
memory_aid: Typical gesture when commanding one to stop.

title: Abundant
description: Right Full Open Handshape with palm facing down repetitively hits the side of the left hand which is in an S-Handshape.
memory_aid: The hand hits again and again meaning 'abundant'.

title: Abuse 1
note: 'Abuse' as in taking advantage of the system.
description: Right S-Handshape with palm facing signer is in front of chin. The elbow moves up so that S-Handshape is facing down.
memory_aid: Pushing someone out of the way.

title: Abuse 2
note: 'Abuse' as in treating one malignantly.
description: Both hands are in Claw Handshapes with palms facing out. Hands move forward repetitively.

title: Abuse 3
note: 'Abuse' as in taking advantage of the system.
description: Right S-Handshape with palm facing signer is in front of chin. The elbow moves up so that S-Handshape is facing down.
memory_aid: Pushing someone out of the way.

title: Accelerate
note: Speed

title: Accept
description: Full Open Handshapes with palms facing down start in middle of signing space. Hands move in to touch the chest. As they move, hands close into Flat-O Handshapes.

title: Acceptable
description: Both hands are in Full Closed Handshapes with palms facing down. Right hand with fingers pointing left moves to chest while left hand with fingers pointing right moves to waist.
memory_aid: Hands are saying it is acceptable.

title: Acceptance
description: Full Open Handshapes with palms facing down start in middle of signing space. Hands move in to touch the chest. As they move, hands close into Flat-O Handshapes.

title: Accident
description: Both hands are in Thumbs-Up Handshapes with palms facing the signer. Hands move in towards one another and move up and away simultaneously as soon as they touch.
memory_aid: Looks like an accident taking place.

title: Acclaim
description: Right Extended Index Finger Handshape with palm facing left points at mouth. It then changes into a Full Closed Handshape as it moves down to upturned left Full Closed Handshape. Right hand claps palm of left hand.

title: Account 1
note: story/ money matters

title: Account 2
note: story/ money matters

title: Account 3
note: story/ money matters

title: Accountability
description: U-Handshapes with palms facing down tap right shoulder.

title: Accountable
description: U-Handshapes with palms facing down tap right shoulder.

title: Accumulate
description: Right slightly curved Full Closed Handshape with palm facing signer is placed above upturned left Full Closed Handshape. Right hand moves in and out as it moves to left with left hand underneath.

title: Accurate 1
note: 1. 'Accurate' as in something true. 2. Note raised eyebrows, an essential part of the sign.
description: Both hands are in Full Closed Handshapes. Left hand is positioned in center of signing space with palm up and fingertips pointing right. Right hand, with palm facing left, moves down to touch upon palm of left hand.

title: Accurate 2
note: 'Accurate' as in free from error.
description: Right Extended Index Finger Handshape with palm facing down is held upright with finger pointing left. Hand moves up in a check-like motion. Palm is then facing out and finger pointing up.

title: Accuse
note: Lowered eyebrows, pursed mouth, intense movement and turned head are all essential parts of this sign. All parts indicate intensity and negativity.
description: Both Extended Index Finger Handshapes are pointing left. Palms are facing one another. Hands move forward and slightly down repetitively.

title: Ache
note: Note the raised shoulders and lowered eyebrows. These are essential parts of the sign.
description: Both hands are in Single-O Handshapes. Tips of fingers are touching one another so that palms face one another. Hands are moved back and forth in a tapping motion.
memory_aid: The throbbing sensation of an ache.

title: Acid
note: Sour or biting to the taste

title: Acknowledge
description: Full Open Handshapes with palms facing down start in middle of signing space. Hands move in to touch the chest. As they move, hands close into Flat-O Handshapes.

title: Acquiesce
description: Both hands are in S-Handshapes with palms facing one another. Hands move down repetitively from wrists simultaneously.

title: Acquiescence
description: Both hands are in S-Handshapes with palms facing one another. Hands move down repetitively from wrists simultaneously.

title: Acquit
description: Both hands are in Full Closed Handshapes. Right hand is positioned with palm up. Left hand starts on top of right hand where it moves down on the palm. Hands turn so that right hand is now on top of left hand. Right hand then moves down on palm of left hand.

title: Across
description: Right hand is in Full Closed Handshape with palm facing left. Hand moves over downturned left Full Closed Handshape.

title: Act
description: Both hands are in S-Handshapes with palms facing signer. Right hand is closer to the body. While staying in place, both hands move alternately in circles away from the body.

title: Action
note: 'Action' as in the process of doing.
description: Both hands are in S-Handshapes with palms facing signer. Right hand is closer to the body. While staying in place, both hands move alternately in circles away from the body.

title: Actions
note: 'Actions' as in one's behaviour.
description: Both hands are in Full Open Handshapes with palms facing signer. They alternately and repetitively move up the body.
memory_aid: Hands indicate the actions of a person.

title: Active
description: Both hands are in S-Handshapes with palms facing signer. Right hand is closer to the body. While staying in place, both hands move alternately in circles away from the body.

title: Activity
description: Both hands are in S-Handshapes with palms facing signer. Right hand is closer to the body. While staying in place, both hands move alternately in circles away from the body.

title: Actual
note: Note raised eyebrows, an essential part of the sign.
description: Both hands are in Full Closed Handshapes. Left hand is positioned in center of signing space with palm up and fingertips pointing right. Right hand, with palm facing left, moves down to touch upon palm of left hand.

title: Adam
note: Name of a Bible character, the first man, created by Jehovah God

title: Adam
note: Name of a Bible character, the first man, created by Jehovah God

title: Adapt
description: Both hands are in A-Handshapes with palms touching one another. The right hand is closest to the signer. Hands turn over still touching so that left hand is now closer to the signer.

title: Adaptation
description: Both hands are in A-Handshapes with palms touching one another. The right hand is closest to the signer. Hands turn over still touching so that left hand is now closer to the signer.

title: Add 1
note: 'Add' as in to add ten and five.
description: Both hands are in Extended Index Finger Handshapes. The left hand is pointing up while the right extended finger touches the left finger horizontally.
memory_aid: Looks like the sign for addition.

title: Add 2
note: 'Add' as in to increase.
description: Right Modified-C Handshape with palm facing out starts upside down. Hand uprights itself from the wrist. Palm is still facing out.

title: Add 3
note: 'Add' as in to add ten and five.
description: Both hands are in Extended Index Finger Handshapes. The left hand is pointing up while the right extended finger touches the left finger horizontally.
memory_aid: Looks like the sign for addition.

title: Addition
note: 'Addition' as for maths class.
description: Both hands are in Extended Index Finger Handshapes. The left hand is pointing up while the right extended finger touches the left finger horizontally.
memory_aid: Looks like the sign for addition.

title: Additional
description: Both hands are in Full Closed Handshapes. Palm of left hand is facing up while palm of right hand is facing down. Right hand starts on top of left hand and moves up in a straight line. Both hands turn from wrists so that they are facing out.
memory_aid: Adding more to what one already has.

title: Address 1
note: Direction

title: Address 1
note: Direction

title: Adequate
description: Both hands are in Full Closed Handshapes with palms facing down. Right hand with fingers pointing left moves to chest while left hand with fingers pointing right moves to waist.

title: Adjective
description: Left Full Closed Handshape with palm facing signer is pointing right. The right hand, in an O-Handshape with palm facing up, is underneath the left hand. As right hand moves forward repetitively, it opens into Full Open Handshape.

title: Adjust
description: Both hands are in A-Handshapes with palms touching one another. The right hand is closest to the signer. Hands turn over still touching so that left hand is now closer to the signer.

title: Administrate
description: Both hands are in Small-T Handshapes with palms facing down. They are held next to each other. Hands move forward and back alternately.

title: Administration
description: Both hands are in Small-T Handshapes with palms facing down. They are held next to each other. Hands move forward and back alternately.

title: Administrative Police
note: Police unit, tasked with administrative functions

title: Administrative Police
note: Police unit, tasked with administrative functions

title: Admit
note: 'Admit' as in to accept an idea.
description: Full Open Handshapes with palms facing down start in middle of signing space. Hands move in to touch the chest. As they move, hands close into Flat-O Handshapes.

title: Admitted
note: Grant entrance into a place/ accept

title: Admonish
description: Right Extended Index Finger Handshape with palm facing left is pointing out. It moves up and down from wrist repetitively.

title: Adopt
note: 'Adopt' as in to accept, not to adopt a child.
description: Full Open Handshapes with palms facing down start in middle of signing space. Hands move in to touch the chest. As they move, hands close into Flat-O Handshapes.

title: Adoption
note: 'Adoption' as in accepting something, not adopting a child.
description: Full Open Handshapes with palms facing down start in middle of signing space. Hands move in to touch the chest. As they move, hands close into Flat-O Handshapes.

title: Adult
description: Palm of right Full Closed Handshape is facing down with fingers pointing left. Hand is near head and moves across in a slight bouncing motion.
memory_aid: Indicates the height of an adult.

title: Adultery
note: Unfaithful to marriage partner

title: Advertisement
note: A commercial solicitation

title: Advice
description: Left hand is in Full Closed Handshape with palm facing down. Right O-Handshape is resting on top of left hand. Hand opens into Full Open Handshape and closes again into O-Handshape. This is done repetitively while right hand is still resting on left hand.

title: Advise
description: Left hand is in Full Closed Handshape with palm facing down. Right hand in an O-Handshape is resting on top of left hand. Hand opens into Full Open Handshape and closes again into O-Handshape. This is done repetitively while right hand is still resting on left hand.

title: Affection
description: Both hands are in S-Handshapes with palms facing signer. Hands are crossed at wrists and resting on chest.
memory_aid: A hug from a loved one.

title: Affluent
note: The more affluent one is, the more intense the facial expression and movement are.
description: Claw Handshape with palm facing signer is positioned under right shoulder. Hand moves out in a straight line.

title: Afraid
note: Appropriate facial expression should accompany this sign. See FEAR.
description: Right O-Handshape with palm facing left rests over the heart. Hand opens and closes repetitively into a Full Open Handshape.

title: Afraid 2
note: Appropriate facial expression should accompany this sign. See FEAR.
description: Right O-Handshape with palm facing left rests over the heart. Hand opens and closes repetitively into a Full Open Handshape.

title: Africa
note: Names of places are especially prone to variation. There may be another or a few other signs for 'Africa'.
description: Both hands are in Full Closed Handshapes with palms facing down. Right hand is resting upon back of left hand. It moves back and forth, still touching back of left hand.

title: Africa 3
note: Names of places are especially prone to variation. There may be another or a few other signs for 'Africa'.
description: Both hands are in Full Closed Handshapes with palms facing down. Right hand is resting upon back of left hand. It moves back and forth, still touching back of left hand.

title: African
note: While 'African' is one word in English, it is a two-word phrase (AFRICA, PERSON) in KSL.
description: AFRICA - Both hands are in Full Closed Handshapes with palms facing down. Right hand is resting upon back of left hand. It moves back and forth, still touching back of left hand. PERSON - Both Full Closed Handshapes with palms facing one another move down simultaneously to waist level.
memory_aid: Indicates colour of skin, body of person.

title: After
description: Both Full Closed Handshapes with palms facing body are positioned in front of signer. The right hand which is in front of left hand moves forward in an upward curve, ending up a few inches in front of the left hand.

title: Afternoon
description: Both hands are in Full Closed Handshapes. Left hand with palm facing down touches elbow of right arm. Right arm is raised at an angle to left arm. Right hand with palm facing left slightly moves down repetitively from wrist.

title: Afterward
description: Both Full Closed Handshapes with palms facing body are positioned in front of signer. The right hand which is in front of left hand moves forward in an upward curve, ending up a few inches in front of the left hand.

title: Afya Centre
note: Name of a building in Nairobi city, green in color

title: Again
description: Right Bent-B Handshape with palm facing down moves downward so the fingertips land on palm of the upturned left Full Closed Handshape.
memory_aid: The hand is returning to the same place to start again.

title: Against
description: Extended Index Finger Handshapes with palms facing signer point at one another. They move out in a straight line in the opposite directions.
memory_aid: The two fingers are moving away from one another as if they are against one another.

title: Aged
note: This refers both to people/animals and objects.
description: Right S-Handshape with palm facing left is positioned under the chin and moves down in a shaking, slightly side to side motion.
memory_aid: Indicates the shaking of an aged person.

title: Agenda
description: Both hands are in Full Closed Handshapes. Left hand is held upright so that palm is facing out. Thumb-side of right hand with palm facing down touches top of left hand. It moves down on left arm in steps.

title: Aggravated
description: Right Full Open Handshape with palm facing out is held in front of face and moved in downward circles.
memory_aid: As if something were obstructing one repetitively, keeping one from being able to do anything.

title: Aggravation
description: Right Full Open Handshape with palm facing out is held in front of face and moved in downward circles.
memory_aid: As if something were obstructing one repetitively, keeping one from being able to do anything.

title: Aghakhan
note: Name of a hospital

title: Aghakhan Walk
note: Name of a street

title: Ago
note: a long time

title: Agony
note: Note the raised shoulders and lowered eyebrows. These are essential parts of the sign.
description: Both hands are in Single-O Handshapes. Tips of fingers are touching one another so that palms face one another. Hands are moved back and forth in a tapping motion.
memory_aid: The throbbing sensation of a painful area.

title: Agree
description: Both hands are in S-Handshapes with palms facing one another. Hands move down repetitively from wrists simultaneously.

title: Agreement
description: Both hands are in S-Handshapes with palms facing one another. Hands move down repetitively from wrists simultaneously.

title: Agriculture
description: Both Claw Handshapes with palms facing down make repetitive backward motions. Then both hands assume Full Closed Handshapes, palms still facing down, and move outward away from one another in a straight line.
memory_aid: As if raking soil and indicating the ground.

title: Agriculture
note: art of food production by cultivating land

title: Aid
description: Both Full Closed Handshapes with palms facing up are in the middle of the signing space. The right hand is on top of the left hand. The left hand lifts the right hand slightly.
memory_aid: The left hand is helping the right hand move up.

title: Aid Worker
note: 1. While 'aid worker' is a two-word phrase in English, it is one sign in KSL. 2. Handshape can be either Single-O Handshape or F-Handshape.
description: Right Single-O Handshape with palm facing signer is under right shoulder. Hand moves away from body repetitively.

title: AIDS
description: Both hands, in the Modified C-Handshapes with palms facing out, are placed on the cheekbones.

title: Aids
note: Acquired immune deficiency syndrome

title: Aids 1
note: Acquired immune deficiency syndrome

title: Aim
description: Both hands are in Extended Index Finger Handshapes. Right hand is closer to signer and its palm is facing in. Finger of right hand points towards the left hand which is held away from the signer with the palm facing in. Right hand moves toward left hand.
memory_aid: An arrow moving towards its aim.

title: Air
note: Atmospheric substance which animals breath

title: Airplane
note: Heavier than air aircraft with fixed wings

title: Airport
note: The first part of this sign uses AIRPLANE.
description: Right Y-Handshape with palm facing down starts at the right side of the signing space. It moves across the signing space, and then touches down on the palm of upturned left Full Closed Handshape.
memory_aid: The hand looks like an airplane landing.

title: Airtel
note: The second biggest telecommunication company in Kenya

title: Akamba
note: Names of tribes are especially prone to variation. There may be another or a few other signs for 'Akamba'.
description: Fingers of Right Claw Handshape with palm facing signer repetitively touch upon the left Full Open Handshape which is upright with the palm facing out.
memory_aid: The sign looks like a carving, which is what the Akamba are renowned for.

title: Alarm
note: 1. 'Alarm' as in one feels alarm. 2. Appropriate facial expression should accompany this sign. See FEAR.
description: Right O-Handshape with palm facing left rests over the heart. Hand opens and closes repetitively into a Full Open Handshape.

title: Alcohol
note: An organic compound containing a hydroxyl functional group

title: Algeria
note: Names of places are especially prone to variation. There may be another or a few other signs for 'Algeria'.
description: Both hands are in Full Closed Handshapes with palms facing signer. They are positioned in front of chest with right hand on top. Right hand starts slightly above left hand and moves down repetitively.

title: Alike
description: The sides of the Extended Index Finger Handshapes are brought together once or repetitively. Palms are facing down.
memory_aid: Two same things are brought together.

title: Alive
description: Both A-Handshapes with palms facing signer are pointing down. They start at the waist and move up simultaneously in straight lines up the body.

title: All 1
note: 'All' as in entire.
description: Both Full Closed Handshapes with palms facing down start side by side. As hands turn up, they move away from one another in a circle. At the end they come back together touching at the fingers. Palms are facing up.

title: All 2
note: 'All' as in everything.
description: Both Full Open Handshapes with palms facing down start at opposite ends of signing space. Both hands move twice towards each other stopping in the middle then moving back to ends of signing space. The right hand moves over the left hand the first time. The second time the left hand is over the right hand.
memory_aid: Moving hands over all the things one has.

title: All Day 1
note: 1. 'All day' as in the whole day. 2. While 'all day' is a two-word phrase in English, it is one sign in KSL.
description: Right Full Closed Handshape with palm facing left is held upright with left arm supporting it. Hand starts at right end of signing space and moves in a downward arc to the left end of the signing space.

title: All Day 2
note: 1. 'All day' as in to do something the whole day. 2. Note the movement of the tongue. This is an essential part of the sign. It indicates that the day was long. 3. While 'all day' is a two-word phrase in English, it is one sign in KSL.
description: Right K-Handshape with palm facing left is held upright. Hand starts at right end of signing space and moves in a downward arc to the left end of the signing space. While moving, middle finger moves down repetitively as if snapping.

title: All The Best
note: General conversation

title: All The Time
note: 1. Note the lowering of eyebrows which indicate intensity. 2. While 'all the time' is a three-word phrase in English, it is one sign in KSL.
description: Palm of Bent-B Handshape of right hand is facing signer. Hand moves in small outward circles, but stays in place.

title: Allah
note: Name of God in Arabic, as it appears in the holy Quran

title: Allegiance
description: Right Full Closed Handshape with palm facing signer touches the chest. Head and body bow down slightly.

title: Alliance
description: Both hands are in Full Open Handshapes with palms facing one another. Both hands start slightly away from the center of signing space. The right hand is above the left hand. Hands move to the center as hands close into S-Handshapes.
memory_aid: Bringing things together for setting up an alliance.

title: Allow
description: Full Open Handshapes with palms facing down start in middle of signing space. Hands move in to touch the chest. As they move, hands close into Flat-O Handshapes.

title: All-Purpose
description: Heels of both Full Closed Handshapes are touching, with fingers pointing out. Both hands move out to either side of the signing space simultaneously.
memory_aid: Indicates a wide group of people.

title: Ally
description: Arms are crossed so that palms of both hands, in Full Closed Handshapes, tap lightly against opposite shoulders.

title: Almost
note: Note the tilt of head and shift of shoulders. These movements are typical of signs indicating proximity.
description: Both hands are in Bent-B Handshapes with palms facing signer. The right hand which is behind the left hand moves back and forth repetitively.
memory_aid: Hands indicate that the time is almost here.

title: Alone
description: Right Extended Index Finger Handshape with palm facing the body moves in small circles.
memory_aid: The index finger indicates a solitary person.

title: Aloud
description: S-Handshape with palm facing down is placed under chin. Hand opens into Full Open Handshape.
memory_aid: A lot of noise coming from the mouth.

title: Already
description: Right L-Handshape with palm facing left starts near the right cheek. Hand moves across and closes into Single-O Handshape.

title: Also
description: The sides of the Extended Index Finger Handshapes are brought together once or repetitively. Palms are facing down.
memory_aid: Two same things are brought together.

title: Alter
description: Both hands are in A-Handshapes with palms touching one another. The right hand is closest to the signer. Hands turn over still touching so that left hand is now closer to the signer.

title: Although
note: Note tilted head and raised eyebrows. These are essential parts of the sign.
description: Both hands are in Extended Index Handshapes. Palms are facing away from signer. Fingers are touching so that they form an 'x'. Hands move out so that fingers point to either side of the signing space.
memory_aid: Fingers move in opposite directions indicating otherwise.

title: Always
note: Note the lowering of eyebrows which indicate intensity.
description: Palm of Bent-B Handshape of right hand is facing signer. Hand moves in small outward circles, but stays in place.

title: Am Still Learning
note: Languages and communication

title: Amass
description: Right slightly curved Full Closed Handshape with palm facing signer is placed above upturned left Full Closed Handshape. Right hand moves in and out as it moves to left with left hand underneath.

title: Amazed 1
note: 1. There is no difference in meaning between AMAZED 1 and AMAZED 2. They are variants of 'amazed' in KSL. 2. Note movement of eyebrows. This is an important part of the sign.
description: Both O-Handshapes with palms facing out are placed on either side of head. They both move up and away from head while opening into Full Open Handshapes.
memory_aid: At first, hands indicate the shape of normal eyes and then open to indicate widened eyes.

title: Amazed 2
note: 1. There is no difference in meaning between AMAZED 1 and AMAZED 2. They are variants of 'amazed' in KSL. 2. Note raised eyebrows, an essential part of the sign.
description: Both F-Handshapes with palms facing out are placed at either side of head. They move towards one another repetitively.

title: Ambassador
note: Name of a building in Nairobi

title: Amble
note: Note the mouthing 'wah, wah' which is an important part of the sign.
description: Full Open Handshape with palm facing left moves forward in small curves.
memory_aid: Hand represents a person walking about the street.

title: Amend
description: Both hands are in A-Handshapes with palms touching one another. The right hand is closest to the signer. Hands turn over still touching so that left hand is now closer to the signer.

title: America
note: Names of places are especially prone to variation. There may be another or a few other signs for 'America'.
description: The fingers of both Full Open Handshapes with palms facing signer are interlocked. They move in an inward circular motion.
memory_aid: The interlocked fingers are reminiscent of the log cabins built by the early settlers of America.

title: American
note: While 'American' is one word in English, it is a two-word phrase (AMERICA, PERSON) in KSL.
description: AMERICA - The fingers of both Full Open Handshapes with palms facing signer are interlocked. They move in an inward circular motion. PERSON - Both Full Closed Handshapes with palms facing one another move down simultaneously to waist level.
memory_aid: The interlocked fingers are reminiscent of the log cabins built by the early settlers of America.

title: Amiss
description: Right Extended Index Finger Handshape with palm facing out makes an 'X' in the air.
memory_aid: X' in the air indicates a mistake.

title: Among
note: amidst

title: Amount
note: sum

title: Amusement
note: Entertainment

title: Amusing
description: Right Extended Index Finger Handshape with palm facing down moves under chin in a straight line and then wrist snaps moving the finger downward.

title: Ancient
note: This refers both to people/animals and objects.
description: Right S-Handshape with palm facing left is positioned under the chin and moves down in a shaking, slightly side to side motion.
memory_aid: Indicates the shaking of an ancient person.

title: And
description: Both hands are in Full Closed Handshapes with palms facing one another and thumbs up. They start at opposite ends of the signing space and come together until the palms touch.

title: Angels
note: Good Spirit persons

title: Anger
note: Strong feeling of displeasure

title: Angle
note: Figure formed by two or three planes that intersect

title: Angry
note: The eyebrows are lowered, indicating anger. The head also moves slightly to the side.
description: Right Claw Handshape with palm facing signer moves to the forehead.
memory_aid: The forehead is usually furrowed in anger.

title: Animal
description: Both Claw Handshapes with palms facing down are moving forward alternately.
memory_aid: Simulating the walking of an animal.

title: Animal Park
description: ANIMAL - Both Claw Handshapes with palms facing down are moving forward alternately. PARK - Full Open Handshapes with palms facing down begin in the center away from body. They move towards the body in a wide circle.

title: Anniversary
description: Both Full Open Handshapes with palms facing out are held at either side of the head. Staying in place, hands twist from the wrists.

title: Announce
description: Both Extended Index Finger Handshapes with palms facing signer are pointing at chin. Hands move out and away from one another. Palms then face out.

title: Announcement
description: Both Extended Index Finger Handshapes with palms facing signer are pointing at chin. Hands move out and away from one another. Palms then face out.

title: Annoy
note: Note the lowered eyebrows which indicate negativity. This is an important part of the sign.
description: Right Bent-B Handshape with palm facing down taps right shoulder repetitively.

title: Annoy
note: Irritate

title: Anoint
note: Appoint for special work

title: Another
description: Right Thumbs-Up Handshape with palm facing left starts pointing up. Hand moves from wrist so that thumb is pointing right and palm facing up.

title: Answer
description: Right Full Closed Handshape with palm facing signer is pointing left. Fingers of right hand touch mouth and move out forward. While hand is moving, it turns from the wrist so that palm is facing up.
memory_aid: An answer coming from the mouth.

title: Antelope
note: Any of the African mammals of the family of bovidae

title: Anti-
note: While 'anti-' is a prefix in English, it is one sign in KSL.
description: Extended Index Finger Handshapes with palms facing signer point at one another. They move out in a straight line in the opposite directions.
memory_aid: The two fingers are moving away from one another as if they are against one another.

title: Antibiotics
note: Substance that can inhibit or destroy the growth of bacteria

title: Anticipate
description: Both Full Closed Handshapes with palms facing signer are placed by the side of the head. Left hand is closer to signer and lower than right hand. Both move fingers down into Bent-B Handshapes repetitively.

title: Anticipation
description: Both Full Closed Handshapes with palms facing signer are placed by the side of the head. Left hand is closer to signer and lower than right hand. Both move fingers down into Bent-B Handshapes repetitively.

title: Antithesis
description: Extended Index Finger Handshapes with palms facing signer point at one another. They move out in a straight line in the opposite directions.
memory_aid: The two fingers are moving away from one another as if they oppose one another.

title: Antithetical
description: Extended Index Finger Handshapes with palms facing signer point at one another. They move out in a straight line in the opposite directions.
memory_aid: The two fingers are moving away from one another as if they oppose one another.

title: Anxiety
note: Note the lowered eyebrows, an important part of the sign.
description: Full Open Handshapes with palms facing down are near temples of forehead. Hands move simultaneously in small outward circles.

title: Anxious
note: Note the lowered eyebrows, an important part of the sign.
description: Full Open Handshapes with palms facing down are near temples of forehead. Hands move simultaneously in small outward circles.

title: Apart
description: Both hands are in Bent-B Handshapes with palms facing signer. Backs of hands are touching one another and then move away directly from one another in a straight line.

title: Apart 2
description: Both hands are in Bent-B Handshapes with palms facing signer. Backs of hands are touching one another and then move away directly from one another in a straight line.

title: Ape 1
description: S-Handshapes with palms facing signer strike across chest repetitively and alternately.
memory_aid: The typical gesture of an ape.

title: Ape 2
note: 'Ape' as in to copy, to imitate.
description: Left hand is in Full Closed Handshape with palm facing up. Right Claw Handshape with palm facing up is positioned underneath left hand. Right hand moves down in a straight line as it closes into O-Handshape.
memory_aid: Taking from another piece of paper.

title: Apiece
description: Right Extended Index Finger Handshape with palm facing signer is held upright. Hand moves over repetitively.

title: Apologize
description: Right S-Handshape with palm facing signer is circled several times over the area of the heart.
memory_aid: Movement over the chest indicates a heartfelt apology.

title: Apology
description: Right S-Handshape with palm facing signer is circled several times over the area of the heart.
memory_aid: Movement over the chest indicates a heartfelt apology.

title: Apparel
description: Single-O Handshape with palm facing signer is touching near the right shoulder. Hand moves away from and back to the signer repetitively.

title: Apparent
note: Note lowered head and eyebrows, essential parts of the sign.
description: Flat-O Handshapes with palms facing down start at opposite ends of signing space. Hands move down towards one another as hands open into Full Open Handshapes.
memory_aid: Open hands show that something is apparent.

title: Appellation
description: Left Full Closed Handshape is held upright with palm facing right. The thumb of right G-Handshape with palm facing signer touches palm of left hand while index finger touches back of left hand. Right hand moves slightly down and out, while fingers close into a Single-O Handshape. This is done repetitively.
memory_aid: Tag of a person or thing.

title: Appetite
description: Fingers of right hand, in Full Open Handshape with palm facing signer, move down repetitively on throat.

title: Apple
description: Right Curved-Three Handshape with palm facing signer moves upward in small motions in front of the mouth.

title: Apple
note: Fruit of the apple tree

title: Appoint
description: F-Handshape starts with palm facing down. Hand moves up from wrist so that palm is facing out.

title: Appointment
note: 'Appointment' as in a job.
description: The little-finger side of the right S-Handshape with palm facing left is brought down repetitively on top of the index finger side of the left S-Handshape with palm facing right.

title: Apprehension
note: Appropriate facial expression should accompany this sign. See FEAR.
description: Right O-Handshape with palm facing left rests over the heart. Hand opens and closes repetitively into a Full Open Handshape.

title: Approach
description: Full Closed Handshape with palm facing up closes into Bent-B Handshape repetitively.

title: Appropriate
description: Right Extended Index Finger Handshape with palm facing down is held upright with finger pointing left. Hand moves up in a check-like motion. Palm is then facing out and finger pointing up.

title: Approval
description: Right hand is in Extended Index Finger Handshape with palm facing signer and finger pointing up. Left Full Closed Handshape is in front of waist with palm facing up. Finger of right hand moves down touching upon palm of left hand and then up. Palm of right hand is then facing out.
memory_aid: An approving check on a form.

title: Approve
description: Right hand is in Extended Index Finger Handshape with palm facing signer and finger pointing up. Left Full Closed Handshape is in front of waist with palm facing up. Finger of right hand moves down touching upon palm of left hand and then up. Palm of right hand is then facing out.
memory_aid: An approving check on a form.

title: Approximate
note: Note shaking of lowered head, an essential part of the sign.
description: Both Full Open Handshapes with palms facing in are placed at either side of the signing space. As they move up and down alternately, hands twist from the wrists.

title: April
note: Name of the fourth month

title: Apron
note: An article of clothing worn over the front of the torso

title: Aptitude
note: The raising of eyebrows and tilting of head are important parts of this sign.
description: Both hands are in S-Handshapes with palms facing down. They move down.

title: Arch
note: Principal

title: Arch
note: Principal

title: Are You Afraid?
note: General conversation

title: Are You Afraid?
note: General conversation

title: Are You Free?
note: Making friends

title: Are You Hungry?
note: General conversation

title: Are You Hungry?
note: General conversation

title: Are You Kenyan?
note: Making friends

title: Are You Married?
note: Making friends

title: Are You Married?
note: Making friends

title: Are You Married?
note: Making friends

title: Are You Ok?
note: General conversation

title: Are You Ok?
note: General conversation

title: Are You Ok?
note: General conversation

title: Are You Sick?
note: Family and relationships

title: Are You Sick?
note: Family and relationships

title: Are You Sure?
note: General conversation

title: Are You Taking Any Medications?
note: Family and relationships

title: Area
description: Right Full Open Handshape with palm facing down and fingers pointing left is positioned near right shoulder. Hand moves in an inward circular motion while remaining in place.

title: Area
note: A measure of the extent of a surface/ A particular geographic region

title: Argument
note: Verbal dispute

title: Arid
note: Note lowered eyebrows, an important part of this sign.
description: Extended Index Finger Handshape with palm facing down is placed below mouth and moves to side of face while closing into X-Handshape.

title: Arithmetic
description: Left hand is in a Claw Handshape with palm facing up. Right Extended Index Finger Handshape with palm facing signer touches upon fingers of left hand, which close after being touched.

title: Arm
description: Right Full Closed Handshape with palm facing down rests upon upper part of left arm and moves down.

title: Armageddon
note: War of God the Almighty

title: Around 1
note: 1. 'Around' as in to go around something. 2. Hand can move in repetitive circles.
description: Right Extended Index Finger Handshape with palm facing signer points down. Hand moves forward and to the left in a circular motion. Palm is still facing body.

title: Around 2
note: 1. 'Around' as in approximately. 2. Note shaking of lowered head, an essential part of the sign.
description: Both Full Open Handshapes with palms facing in are placed at either side of the signing space. As they move up and down alternately, hands twist from the wrists.

title: Arrange
description: Both hands are in Full Closed Handshapes with palms facing one another. Hands move slightly up and down alternately. At the same time they are both moving to the right.

title: Arrangement
description: Both hands are in Full Closed Handshapes with palms facing one another. Hands move slightly up and down alternately. At the same time they are both moving to the right.

title: Arrest
description: Both E-Handshapes are placed in center of signing space with palms facing one another. Right hand is closer to signer. It moves forward so that wrists of both hands are touching. Both hands then move back and forth in opposite directions from wrists.

title: Art 1
note: There is no difference in meaning between ART 1 and ART 2. They are variants of 'art' in KSL.
description: Left arm supports right arm. Right Small T-Handshape with palm facing left moves in an arc towards signer with repetitive motion.

title: Art 2
note: There is no difference in meaning between ART 1 and ART 2. They are variants of 'art' in KSL.
description: Right arm is propped upon left arm. Right Extended Index Finger Handshape with palm facing down is pointing away from signer. Finger of right hand moves slightly up and down.
memory_aid: Looks like someone painting a picture.

title: Article 1
note: 'Article' as in a story in the newspaper.
description: Both Full Closed Handshapes with palms facing one another are placed together. They move side to side from the wrists.
memory_aid: The hands are telling a story.

title: Article 2
note: 1. 'Article' as in an object. 2. There is no difference in meaning between ARTICLE 2 and ARTICLE 3. They are variants of 'article' in KSL.
description: Both hands are in Full Open Handshapes with palms facing up. They start side by side and move away from one another in a slight bouncing motion.

title: Article 3
note: 1. 'Article' as in a thing. 2. There is no difference in meaning between ARTICLE 2 and ARTICLE 3. They are variants of 'article' in KSL.
description: Both Extended Index Finger Handshapes with palms facing down are pointing out. Right hand starts above left hand. Hands move towards one another slightly and then reverse while switching so that left hand is now on top. This is done repetitively.

title: Artificial
description: Both hands are in Full Closed Handshapes. Left hand is positioned in center of signing space with palm down and fingertips pointing right. Right hand, with palm facing left, moves down to touch repetitively upon back of left hand.

title: Artist
note: A person who creates art

title: As
description: The sides of the Extended Index Finger Handshapes are brought together once or repetitively. Palms are facing down.
memory_aid: Two same things are brought together.

title: Ash
note: By product after burning things

title: Ashamed
note: Note lowered eyebrows and raised shoulders. These are essential parts of the sign.
description: Right Claw Handshape with palm facing signer moves back and forth in front of face.
memory_aid: As if trying to hide from being ashamed.

title: Asia
note: Names of places are especially prone to variation. There may be another or a few other signs for 'Asia'.
description: Right Extended Index Finger Handshape with palm facing down points to center of forehead.
memory_aid: Looks like the bindi used by Indian women and men for marriage.

title: Ask
note: This sign can change direction depending on who one is asking. In this video, the direction used indicates that the signer is asking you a question. If she were asking herself a question, the palm would face her. If she were asking many people a question, she would move the hand to indicate different people.
description: Right Bent-B Handshape with palm facing out is held upright supported by the left hand at the elbow. Right hand moves forward once.
memory_aid: Tapping someone to ask a question.

title: Ask Me
note: General conversation

title: Ask Me
note: General conversation

title: Asleep
description: Both hands are placed together in Full Closed Handshapes with palms facing one another. The signer's head leans to the right and rests on the back of the left hand.

title: Aspiration
description: Both hands are in Extended Index Finger Handshapes. Right hand is closer to signer and its palm is facing in. Finger of right hand points towards the left hand which is held away from the signer with the palm facing in. Right hand moves toward left hand.
memory_aid: An arrow moving towards its aim.

title: Aspire
description: Both hands are in Extended Index Finger Handshapes. Right hand is closer to signer and its palm is facing in. Finger of right hand points towards the left hand which is held away from the signer with the palm facing in. Right hand moves toward left hand.
memory_aid: An arrow moving towards its aim.

title: Assemble
note: 'Assemble' as in to put together, to build.
description: Both hands are in Full Closed Handshapes with palms facing signer. One hand is placed on top of the other alternately and repetitively.

title: Assembly
description: Both hands, in C-Handshapes with palms facing one another, start at opposite ends of signing space. They move towards one another simultaneously.

title: Assent
description: Both hands are in S-Handshapes with palms facing one another. Hands move down repetitively from wrists simultaneously.

title: Assignment
description: The little-finger side of the right S-Handshape with palm facing left is brought down repetitively on top of the index finger side of the left S-Handshape with palm facing right.

title: Assimilate
description: Both hands are in Bent-B Handshapes with palms facing down. The left hand is slightly behind and to the left of the right hand. Both hands move simultaneously forward and to the right.
memory_aid: Left hand is assimilating to ways of the right hand.

title: Assist
description: Both Full Closed Handshapes with palms facing up are in the middle of the signing space. The right hand is on top of the left hand. The left hand lifts the right hand slightly.
memory_aid: The left hand is helping the right hand move up.

title: Assistance
description: Both Full Closed Handshapes with palms facing up are in the middle of the signing space. The right hand is on top of the left hand. The left hand lifts the right hand slightly.
memory_aid: The left hand is helping the right hand move up.

title: Association
description: Both hands are in Full Open Handshapes with palms facing one another. Both hands start slightly away from the center of signing space. The right hand is above the left hand. Hands move to the center as hands close into S-Handshapes.
memory_aid: Bringing things together for setting up an association.

title: Assortment
description: Both Extended Index Finger Handshapes with palms facing down are positioned in the center of the signing space pointing out. Hands move up and down alternately.
memory_aid: The different things in a group.

title: Assure
description: Right Extended Index Finger Handshape with palm facing left points to the mouth. Then it opens into a Full Closed Handshape as it moves down to touch upon palm of upturned left Full Closed Handshape.

title: Astonished 1
note: 1. There is no difference in meaning between ASTONISHED 1 and ASTONISHED 2. They are variants of 'astonished' in KSL. 2. Note movement of eyebrows. This is an important part of the sign.
description: Both O-Handshapes with palms facing out are placed on either side of head. They both move up and away from head while opening into Full Open Handshapes.
memory_aid: At first, hands indicate the shape of normal eyes and then open to indicate widened eyes.

title: Astonished 2
note: 1. There is no difference in meaning between ASTONISHED 1 and ASTONISHED 2. They are variants of 'astonished' in KSL. 2. Note raised eyebrows, an essential part of the sign.
description: Both F-Handshapes with palms facing out are placed at either side of head. They move towards one another repetitively.

title: Astounded 1
note: 1. There is no difference in meaning between ASTOUNDED 1 and ASTOUNDED 2. They are variants of 'astounded' in KSL. 2. Note movement of eyebrows. This is an important part of the sign.
description: Both O-Handshapes with palms facing out are placed on either side of head. They both move up and away from head while opening into Full Open Handshapes.
memory_aid: At first, hands indicate the shape of normal eyes and then open to indicate widened eyes.

title: Astounded 2
note: 1. There is no difference in meaning between ASTOUNDED 1 and ASTOUNDED 2. They are variants of 'astounded' in KSL. 2. Note raised eyebrows, an essential part of the sign.
description: Both F-Handshapes with palms facing out are placed at either side of head. They move towards one another repetitively.

title: Astute
description: Thumb of right Thumbs-Up Handshape with palm facing left touches the forehead. While it moves slightly forward, hand turns so palm is facing signer.

title: Atrocious
description: The left arm, in an S-Handshape with palm facing signer, is held upright while right Full Closed Handshape with palm facing signer slaps the left elbow.
memory_aid: As if slapping someone for behaving badly.

title: Attack 1
note: 1. 'Attack' as in to hit, to physically attack. 2. This verb changes movement depending on the object. If it is you being attacked, the hand moves towards yourself, as shown in this video. If it is to attack someone else, the hand moves away from the signer.
description: S-Handshape with palm facing down moves towards head. Upon touching head, hand moves up slightly.

title: Attack 2
note: 1. 'Attack' as in to blame, to verbally attack. 2. Lowered eyebrows, pursed mouth, intense movement and turned head are all essential parts of this sign. All parts indicate intensity and negativity.
description: Both Extended Index Finger Handshapes are pointing left. Palms are facing one another. Hands move forward and slightly down repetitively.

title: Attain
description: Right Full Open Handshape is positioned above left arm which is lying parallel to waist. Right hand moves down to grasp left wrist.
memory_aid: Reaching for something and bringing it to oneself.

title: Attempt
description: Palms of both I-Handshapes are facing signer. As they are moving forward simultaneously, hands turn so that palms are facing out.

title: Attend
description: Left Full Closed Handshape is positioned in center of signing space with palm facing down. Right Extended Index Finger Handshape with palm facing down is pointing outward. It moves forward under the left hand.

title: Attention
note: General conversation

title: Attire
description: Single-O Handshape with palm facing signer is touching near the right shoulder. Hand moves away from and back to the signer repetitively.

title: Attitude
note: The facial expression used by the signer in the video indicates a negative attitude. If one wishes to express a positive attitude, the facial expressions should change to reflect so.
description: Right V-Handshape with palm facing down is placed in front of face pointing left. Hand moves up and down from wrist.

title: Attract
note: To arouse interest

title: August
note: Name of the 8th month

title: Aunt
note: The first part of this sign uses the sign GIRL indicating female.
description: Right Thumbs-Up Handshape with palm facing up is on chest. The hand turns down to touch the right side of the body, changing hand to Extended Index Finger Handshape. Finger is pointing out.

title: Aunt
note: Father's or Mother's sister

title: Australia
note: Names of places are especially prone to variation. There may be another or a few other signs for 'Australia'.
description: Middle Finger Extended Handshapes start at waist with palms facing signer. Hands move up and forward simultaneously in an arc. As hands move, middle fingers close in, touching the thumbs. When coming down in the arc, hands open into Full Open Handshapes.

title: Australia 2
note: Names of places are especially prone to variation. There may be another or a few other signs for 'Australia'.
description: Middle Finger Extended Handshapes start at waist with palms facing signer. Hands move up and forward simultaneously in an arc. As hands move, middle fingers close in, touching the thumbs. When coming down in the arc, hands open into Full Open Handshapes.

title: Austria
note: Names of places are especially prone to variation. There may be another or a few other signs for 'Austria'.
description: Arms are held upright and crossed at wrists. Both hands form V-Handshapes which face the signer. Fingers of handshapes move down and up repetitively.
memory_aid: Taken from their own sign language.

title: Authentic
note: Note raised eyebrows, an essential part of the sign.
description: Both hands are in Full Closed Handshapes. Left hand is positioned in center of signing space with palm up and fingertips pointing right. Right hand, with palm facing left, moves down to touch upon palm of left hand.

title: Authority
description: Right Full Closed Handshape with palm facing down is placed at left shoulder. Thumb-side of hand is touching shoulder. Hand moves in an arc to elbow where little-finger side is now touching arm.

title: Authorization
description: Right hand is in Extended Index Finger Handshape with palm facing signer and finger pointing up. Left Full Closed Handshape is in front of waist with palm facing up. Finger of right hand moves down touching upon palm of left hand and then up. Palm of right hand is then facing out.
memory_aid: An authorizing check on a form.

title: Authorize
description: Right hand is in Extended Index Finger Handshape with palm facing signer and finger pointing up. Left Full Closed Handshape is in front of waist with palm facing up. Finger of right hand moves down touching upon palm of left hand and then up. Palm of right hand is then facing out.
memory_aid: An authorizing check on a form.

title: Automatic
description: Extended Index Finger Handshape with palm facing down points to lower side of signing space and moves up from wrist so that it is pointing up.
memory_aid: Pointing at something and indicating it will act on its own.

title: Automobile
description: Both S-Handshapes with palms facing signer are moved up and down alternately and repetitively. Then both hands are placed in the B-Handshapes with palms facing down at eye level. B-Handshapes are moved apart, angled down and then flattened out.
memory_aid: Steering a wheel, outline of a car.

title: Avenue
description: Both Full Closed Handshapes with palms facing one another are held with fingers pointing out. Hands are moved simultaneously forward.

title: Average
note: Note lowered eyebrows, an essential part of the sign.
description: U-Handshapes with palms facing one another are placed in center of signing space. Hands move up and down simultaneously.
memory_aid: Repetitive motion indicates something that happens a lot.

title: Avocado
note: Fruit of the avocado tree

title: Awake
description: Right arm, with hand in S-Handshape and palm facing up, is held horizontally to the side. Arm moves up until vertical with body.

title: Awake
note: Brochure

title: Awake
note: Brochure

title: Aware 1
note: There is no difference in meaning between AWARE 1 and AWARE 2. They are variants of 'aware' in KSL.
description: Full Closed Handshapes with palms facing signer touch sides of forehead. Hands move out to sides of signing space while wrists move out so that palms are facing out.

title: Aware 2
note: There is no difference in meaning between AWARE 1 and AWARE 2. They are variants of 'aware' in KSL.
description: The fingertips of right Bent-B Handshape with palm facing down pat the forehead repetitively.

title: Aware 3
note: There is no difference in meaning between AWARE 1 and AWARE 2. They are variants of 'aware' in KSL.
description: Full Closed Handshapes with palms facing signer touch sides of forehead. Hands move out to sides of signing space while wrists move out so that palms are facing out.

title: Awareness 1
note: There is no difference in meaning between AWARENESS 1 and AWARENESS 2. They are variants of 'awareness' in KSL.
description: Full Closed Handshapes with palms facing signer touch sides of forehead. Hands move out to sides of signing space while wrists move out so that palms are facing out.

title: Awareness 2
note: There is no difference in meaning between AWARENESS 1 and AWARENESS 2. They are variants of 'awareness' in KSL.
description: The fingertips of right Bent-B Handshape with palm facing down pat the forehead repetitively.

title: Away
description: Right Full Open Handshape with palm facing left and fingers pointing down moves up from wrist to the right. Palm is now facing out.

title: Awful
description: The left arm, in an S-Handshape with palm facing signer, is held upright while right Full Closed Handshape with palm facing signer slaps the left elbow.
memory_aid: As if slapping someone for behaving badly.

title: Awhile 1
note: 1. There is no difference in meaning between AWHILE 1 and AWHILE 2. They are variants of 'awhile' in KSL. 2. Note the lowered eyebrows and scrunched face. These are important parts of the sign.
description: Right G-Handshape with palm facing left is held in front of the face.

title: Awhile 2
note: 1. There is no difference in meaning between AWHILE 1 and AWHILE 2. They are variants of 'awhile' in KSL. 2. Note the lowered eyebrows, an essential part of the sign.
description: Both Bent-B Handshapes with palms facing signer are in front of body. The right hand is in front of the left hand. Right hand moves back and forth repetitively.

title: B
description: All fingers are straight and pointing up. Thumb is folded across palm. Palm is facing out.
memory_aid: The thumb divides the hand into a 'b'.

title: Baboon
description: S-Handshapes with palms facing signer strike across chest repetitively and alternately.
memory_aid: The typical gesture of a baboon.

title: Baby
description: Both hands are in Full Closed Handshapes with palms facing up. Right arm is laid on top of left arm so right hand is over left wrist. Arms are moved from side to side.

title: Back
note: 'Back' as in someone coming back.
description: Full Closed Handshape is facing palm up by right side of signing space. It moves up and down in an arc towards center of signing space so that palm is then facing down.
memory_aid: Looks like a person coming back.

title: Backbone
note: Main part of the skeleton, which supports the body structure

title: Backpack
description: Both Modified-C Handshapes with palms facing signer touch shoulders. The hands then move down repetitively.

title: Bad
description: The left arm, in an S-Handshape with palm facing signer, is held upright while right Full Closed Handshape with palm facing signer slaps the left elbow.
memory_aid: As if slapping someone for behaving badly.

title: Bad-Mannered
note: While CRUEL shares the same sign as other English words like 'inhumane', 'mean', and 'rude', they have slightly different facial expressions. The more intense the meanness, the more intense the facial expression. Hence CRUEL gets a more intense facial expression than RUDE does.
description: Claw Handshapes with palms facing down rest upon either side of head. Hands move out simultaneously in a straight line.

title: Bag
note: A flexible container made of cloth, paper, plastic etc

title: Bahati
note: Name of a place in Eastland's

title: Balance
description: Both hands are in Full Closed Handshapes with palms facing up. They start at bottom edges of the signing space. Alternately and repetitively the hands move up and down.

title: Balanced Diet
note: Foods from all food groups

title: Ball
note: A solid or hollow sphere

title: Ban
description: Both hands are in Full Closed Handshapes. Left hand is held horizontally in front of signer with palm facing in. Right hand is held to side of signer with palm facing left. Right hand moves to palm of left hand.
memory_aid: Left hand bans right hand from moving on.

title: Banana
description: The left hand is in a Flat-O Handshape with the palm facing up. The right hand, also in a Flat-O Handshape, moves down and up while moving around left hand.

title: Banana
note: Yellow fruit of the banana tree

title: Band
description: Both hands, in C-Handshapes with palms facing one another, start at opposite ends of signing space. They move towards one another simultaneously.

title: Bandage
description: Both hands are in Full Closed Handshapes with palms facing down. The left arm is held horizontally in the air while the right hand moves around the left arm.
memory_aid: Wrapping an arm in a cloth bandage.

title: Bank
description: Left Full Closed Handshape with palm facing up is held out, slightly bent at base of fingers. The right hand, in same handshape as left hand but with palm facing down, covers the left in a light clapping motion.
memory_aid: Someone keeping something safe for you.

title: Banker
note: While 'banker' is one word in English, it is a two-word phrase (BANK, PERSON) in KSL.
description: BANK - Left Full Closed Handshape with palm facing up is held out, slightly bent at base of fingers. The right hand, in same handshape as left hand but with palm facing down, covers the left in a light clapping motion. PERSON - Both Full Closed Handshapes with palms facing one another move down simultaneously to waist level.
memory_aid: Someone keeping something safe for you.

title: Bar
note: Business licensed to sell alcoholic drinks for consumption on the premises

title: Barclays
note: Name of a commercial bank in Kenya

title: Bare
description: Left Full Closed Handshape lies with palm facing up. Full Closed Handshape of right hand with palm facing left moves from side to side upon palm of left hand.

title: Barrier
description: Both hands are in Full Closed Handshapes. Left hand is held horizontally in front of signer with palm facing in. Right hand is held to side of signer with palm facing left. Right hand moves to palm of left hand.

title: Base
note: 'Base' as in the base of an object.
description: The right hand is in a Bent-B Handshape with palm facing down and moves in a slight circle.
memory_aid: Indication of the base of an object.

title: Bashful
note: Note lowered eyebrows, an important part of the sign.
description: Full Open Handshape with palm facing signer moves up and down face.
memory_aid: Hiding one's face because of being bashful.

title: Basin
description: Bent-B Handshapes are held together side by side with palms facing up. They move upward and outward, away from one another, in a curve. The hands then come together and rub.
memory_aid: Shows the shape of a basin.

title: Basket
note: A lightweight container, generally round, open at the top

title: Bathe
description: Both hands are in slightly curved Full Open Handshapes with palms facing up. They throw themselves over the left shoulder and then over the right side.

title: Bathing Room
description: BATHE - Both hands are in slightly curved Full Open Handshapes with palms facing up. They throw themselves over the left shoulder and then over the right side. ROOM - With palms facing down, both Extended Index Finger Handshapes start side by side and move away from each other then back together in a square-like motion.
memory_aid: Looks like a splash bath then the shape of a room.

title: Batter
note: 'Batter' as in to hit someone repeatedly.
description: Hand assumes K-Handshape. Palm is facing signer and hand is tipped down. Thumb moves away from index and middle fingers and moves back down as wrist snaps. This is done repetitively.
memory_aid: The thumb is a cane coming down on two legs represented by the middle and index fingers.

title: Battle
description: Hands are in Modified-C Handshapes with palms facing one another and thumbs pointing up. Right hand is behind left hand. They move simultaneously side to side.

title: Bawl
note: 1. 'Bawl' as in to cry tears. 2. While 'cry', 'sob', 'wail' and so on share the same essential meaning, they all differ in intensity. The same is true in KSL. The difference in intensity is indicated by facial expression and movement of hands.
description: Extended Index Finger Handshapes with palms facing signer are placed under each eye. They move down in straight lines repetitively.
memory_aid: Looks like tears falling down one's face.

title: Bbc
note: TV station

title: Be Careful
note: 1. Note lowered eyebrows and tilted head. These are essential parts of the sign. 2. While 'be careful' is a two-word phrase in English, it is one sign in KSL.
description: Both Full Open Handshapes with palms facing down are slowly moved forward in circles.

title: Be Careful
note: General conversation

title: Be Careful
note: General conversation

title: Be Punctual
note: Time expressions

title: Be Punctual
note: Time expressions

title: Beach
note: While 'beach' is one word in English, it is a two-word phrase (WATER, WAVES) in KSL.
description: WATER - Right C-Handshape with palm facing left is just below the mouth. Movement is slightly upwards repetitively. WAVES - Full Open Handshapes with palms facing down move away from each other while hands tilt repetitively.
memory_aid: As if drinking a glass of water and mimicking the motions of waves.

title: Bean
description: Right Extended Index Finger Handshape points to tongue. Palm is facing signer. Hand then moves down while turning into a Single-O Handshape.
memory_aid: The bean is the same colour as the tongue and is small enough to hold between the fingers.

title: Bean
note: Edible seed pod of the bean plant/ plant

title: Bear
note: 'Bear' as in to be patient.
description: C-Handshape is placed upon heart, thumbside against body. Handshape closes into S-Handshape which moves down and up on heart.

title: Beard
note: Facial hair on the chin, cheeks and jaw

title: Beast
description: Both Claw Handshapes with palms facing down are moving forward alternately.
memory_aid: Simulating the walking of a beast.

title: Beat
note: 'Beat' as in to hit someone repeatedly.
description: Hand assumes K-Handshape. Palm is facing signer and hand is tipped down. Thumb moves away from index and middle fingers and moves back down as wrist snaps. This is done repetitively.
memory_aid: The thumb is a cane coming down on two legs represented by the middle and index fingers.

title: Beautiful
note: 'Beautiful', 'gorgeous', 'pretty', and 'good-looking' all basically mean the same but differ in intensity. In KSL, this difference in degree is indicated by facial expression. For example, 'beautiful' and 'gorgeous' would have stronger facial expressions than 'pretty' and 'good-looking'.
description: The right hand is in an O-Handshape with palm facing out. Hand moves across face as hand turns opening into Full Open Handshape with palm facing signer.
memory_aid: The hand outlines a beautiful face.

title: Because
description: Full Open Handshapes start palm down. They move up from the wrists so that palms are facing up.
memory_aid: Reason turning up in your hands.

title: Beckon
description: Full Closed Handshape with palm facing out is placed at right side of signer. As hand is changing into A-Handshape, it moves towards signer.

title: Become
description: Both hands are in A-Handshapes with palms touching one another. The right hand is closest to the signer. Hands turn over still touching so that left hand is now closer to the signer.

title: Bed
description: The right hand is a Full Closed Handshape touching the side of the face. Then both hands are in Full Closed Handshapes with palms facing down. They start side by side and then move out away from one another in a straight line.
memory_aid: Head is lying on a pillow and the length of the bed is indicated.

title: Bed
note: Piece of furniture usually flat and soft, for resting or sleeping on

title: Bed Time
note: Time expressions

title: Bed Time
note: Time expressions

title: Bedroom
note: The sign BED is different than the other shown in this dictionary. This is an example of variation in KSL.
description: BED - Both Full Closed Handshapes are placed together on the side of the head, which is slightly crooked. ROOM - With palms facing down, both Extended Index Finger Handshapes start side by side and move away from each other then back together in a square-like motion.
memory_aid: Head is lying on a pillow and the shape of the room is indicated.

title: Bee
note: Flying insect of the family apoidea

title: Beef
note: Cow's meet

title: Beer
note: Alcoholic beverage fermented from starch material

title: Before 1
note: 'Before' as in coming earlier than another thing.
description: The left hand is in the Bent-B Handshape facing the body. The right hand, also in the Bent-B Handshape with palm facing signer, is behind. The right hand moves backward once.

title: Before 2
note: 'Before' as in the past.
description: Full Closed Handshape is placed by right side of head with palm facing back. Hand moves back in a straight line.
memory_aid: Indicating a time behind the signer, the past.

title: Beg
description: Claw Handshape with palm facing up is placed to left side of signer. Hand moves in a slightly bouncing motion around to the right side of signer.

title: Beggar
description: Claw Handshape with palm facing up is placed to left side of signer. Hand moves in a slightly bouncing motion around to the right side of signer.

title: Begin
description: Right Extended Index Finger Handshape is placed between index and middle fingers of left hand in V-Handshape. Palms of both hands are facing signer. Hands move backwards, away from each other.
memory_aid: Hands open up to begin something.

title: Behave
description: Both hands are in Full Open Handshapes with palms facing signer. They alternately and repetitively move up the body.
memory_aid: Hands indicate the behaviour of a person.

title: Behaviour
description: Both hands are in Full Open Handshapes with palms facing signer. They alternately and repetitively move up the body.
memory_aid: Hands indicate the behaviour of a person.

title: Behind
note: At the back of

title: Belated
description: Right Full Closed Handshape starts with palm facing up. It moves down and back towards right side of signer.

title: Belief
description: Right Extended Index Finger Handshape with palm facing down points to the head. Both hands are in Full Closed Handshapes. Left hand is positioned in center of signing space with palm facing up and fingertips pointing right. Right hand, with palm facing left, moves down to touch upon palm of left hand.
memory_aid: The head is where one thinks. The hand comes down strong, as if one is convinced.

title: Believe
description: Right Extended Index Finger Handshape with palm facing down points to the head. Both hands are in Full Closed Handshapes. Left hand is positioned in center of signing space with palm facing up and fingertips pointing right. Right hand, with palm facing left, moves down to touch upon palm of left hand.
memory_aid: The head is where one thinks. The hand comes down strong, as if one is convinced.

title: Belittle
note: Lowered eyebrows, pursed mouth, intense movement and turned head are all essential parts of this sign. All parts indicate intensity and negativity.
description: Both Extended Index Finger Handshapes are pointing left. Palms are facing one another. Hands move forward and slightly down repetitively.

title: Bell
description: Right Small-T Handshape is held upside-down with palm facing signer. The hand moves from side to side slightly.

title: Belong
description: Full Open Handshapes with palms facing one another come together closing into F-Handshapes. Handshapes are connected at thumb and index fingers.

title: Below
description: Both hands are in Full Closed Handshapes with palms facing down. Right hand starts under left hand and then moves down in a straight line.
memory_aid: The right hand is below the left hand.

title: Belt
note: A band worn round the waist to hold clothing

title: Bend
note: To become curved

title: Beneath
description: Both hands are in Full Closed Handshapes with palms facing down. Right hand starts under left hand and then moves down in a straight line.
memory_aid: The right hand is beneath the left hand.

title: Beseech
note: Note lowered eyebrows and head, essential parts of the sign.
description: Full Closed Handshape with palm facing signer is circled on the chest over the heart.
memory_aid: A plea coming from the heart.

title: Beside
description: Both hands are in Full Closed Handshapes. The right hand rests at right side with palm facing left. Left hand is next to right hand, but twisted so that palm faces left as well. Both hands move up and down alternately and repetitively.
memory_aid: Indicates the proximity of two items.

title: Besides
note: Note tilted head and raised eyebrows. These are essential parts of the sign.
description: Both hands are in Extended Index Handshapes. Palms are facing away from signer. Fingers are touching so that they form an 'x'. Hands move out so that fingers point to either side of the signing space.
memory_aid: Fingers move in opposite directions indicating otherwise.

title: Best
description: Full Closed Handshape with palm facing signer touches chin and moves up to right in strong motion. Hand ends into Thumbs-Up Handshape.

title: Better
note: Note the lowered eyebrows which indicate intensity.
description: Both hands assume Full Closed Handshapes with palms facing down. The right hand pats the back of the left hand.

title: Between
description: Both hands are in Full Closed Handshapes. Left hand is parallel to waist with palm facing up. Little-finger side of right hand is placed upon palm of left hand. Right hand moves side to side.
memory_aid: Indicating the in-between of two things.

title: Bewildered
note: Facial expressions help indicate difference in degree of confusion. For example, a more emphatic facial expression would be the equivalent of 'bewildered' (which means 'really confused') while a lesser one would probably be best translated as 'confused'.
description: Both hands are in Claw Handshapes with palms facing one another. The right hand is directly above the left hand. Both hands move simultaneously in opposite circles.
memory_aid: How a mind looks when bewildered.

title: Bias 1
note: Note the mouth movement 'ba ba ba'. This is an important part of the sign.
description: Full Closed Handshape starts at side of signer with palm facing down. Hand moves up from wrist as arm moves slightly forward. Palm is now facing out.

title: Bias 2
note: This is usually used with BIAS 1. BIAS 2 is signed first then BIAS 1, which means 'one's bias' or LAW HIS/HER.
description: Right L-Handshape starts down with thumb pointing up. Palm is facing left. Hand moves so that thumb of L-Handshape touches shoulder.

title: Biashara Street
note: Name of a street

title: Bible
note: While 'bible' is one word in English, it is a two-word phrase (JESUS, BOOK) in KSL.
description: JESUS - Both Full Open Handshapes with palms facing one another are before the signer. The middle finger of the right hand touches the center of the left-handed palm, and vice versa. BOOK - The palms of both Full Open Handshapes move away from one another until they come to a rest facing the signer.
memory_aid: Jesus is indicated by the nails in hands. The book is then indicated by mimicking pages.

title: Bicycle
description: Both S-Handshapes with palms facing down rotate forward alternately.

title: Big
note: Note the raising of eyebrows which indicate largeness. This is an essential part of the sign.
description: Full Open Handshapes with palms facing one another start above the shoulders. They move apart and upwards.
memory_aid: Showing the size of something big.

title: Big 2
note: Note the raising of eyebrows which indicate largeness. This is an essential part of the sign.
description: Full Open Handshapes with palms facing one another start above the shoulders. They move apart and upwards.
memory_aid: Showing the size of something big.

title: Billboard
