note: 1. While 'billboard' is one word in English, it is a two-word phrase (SIGN, ROAD) in KSL. 2. 'Billboard' is signed here as SIGN then ROAD. This is typical of sentence structure in KSL. Nouns are signed first and then their adjectives come after. SIGN is a noun here and is then modified by the adjective ROAD.
description: Both Extended Index Fingers of both hands are side by side pointing out. They move away from one another tracing a rectangle. Then both Full Closed Handshapes are held out with palms facing one another and fingers pointing out. Hands are moved simultaneously forward.
memory_aid: Shape of sign, shape of road.

title: Biology
note: Unit of science

title: Bird
note: To specify a certain type of bird, fingerspell.
description: Right G-Handshape with palm facing out is on the mouth. The fingers close repetitively. Then both hands are in B-Handshapes with palms facing out are near the shoulders. They move up and down repetitively.
memory_aid: Beak like a bird, flap like a bird.

title: Birth
description: Both Full Closed Handshapes are held by chest with palms facing one another and fingertips pointing down. Hands simultaneously move down and then out.

title: Birthday
note: Day of birth

title: Bishop
description: Both hands are in Full Closed Handshapes with palms facing signer. Right hand touches the forehead while the left hand touches the back of the head. Both hands move back and forth, lightly hitting the head.

title: Bishop
note: An overseer of congregations

title: Bison
description: Both Full Open Handshapes with palms facing out start at the sides of the head. They move down and out while closing into S-Handshapes.

title: Bit
note: 1. 'Bit' as in not much. 2. Note the lowered eyebrows and 'th' mouth movement. These are essential parts of the sign.
description: Small-T Handshape with palm facing up is positioned in center of signing space. Hand moves forward slightly.
memory_aid: Just a few things can be held between these two fingers.

title: Bite
note: To convey the meaning of 'gnaw', 'chew' and so forth, the right hand has to come down on left hand repetitively.
description: Right Claw Handshape with palm facing down is in front of signer. It comes down on the downturned left Full Open Handshape.

title: Bitter
note: Note the lowered eyebrows and puckered mouth. These are important parts of the sign.
description: Right A-Handshape with palm facing up is held against right cheek and pulled away. Mouth puckers as hand is moved away.

title: Bitter Lemon
note: brand of coca cola

title: Black
description: Right Extended Index Finger Handshape with palm facing down points to the head at hairline near temple then moves down.

title: Blackboard
note: While 'blackboard' is one word in English, it is a two-word phrase (BLACK, BOARD) in KSL.
description: BLACK - Right Extended Index Finger Handshape with palm facing down points to the head at hairline near temple then moves down. BOARD - Both Extended Index Finger Handshapes with palms facing out are put together, pointing up and out, above and in front of head. They move out, down and back together.
memory_aid: The colour of black hair and the shape of a large rectangle.

title: Bladder
note: Urinary bladder

title: Bladder 2
note: Urinary bladder
memory_aid: Shows shape of bladder and penis

title: Blade
description: X-Handshape with palm facing signer touches the side of mouth. Hand moves down repetitively.
memory_aid: Looks like someone shaving their cheek.

title: Blame
description: Right Extended Index Finger Handshape with palm facing out makes an 'X' in the air.
memory_aid: X' in the air indicates fault.

title: Blank
description: Left Full Closed Handshape lies with palm facing up. Full Closed Handshape of right hand with palm facing left moves from side to side upon palm of left hand.

title: Blanket
note: Piece of clothe made of cotton, used to cover one at night when sleeping

title: Bless
description: Full Closed Handshape with palm facing left and fingertips pointing out starts in front of face. Hand moves in a cross.
memory_aid: Looks like the gesture used in church.

title: Bless
note: To confer blessing upon

title: Bless
note: To confer blessing upon

title: Blind
description: Right L-Handshape with palm facing signer passes over eyes.

title: Block
note: 'Block' as in to deter.
description: Both hands are in Full Closed Handshapes. Left hand is held horizontally in front of signer with palm facing in. Right hand is held to side of signer with palm facing left. Right hand moves to palm of left hand.

title: Blockade
description: Both hands are in Full Closed Handshapes. Left hand is held horizontally in front of signer with palm facing in. Right hand is held to side of signer with palm facing left. Right hand moves to palm of left hand.

title: Blood
description: Right Full Open Handshape with palm facing down strikes the side of the neck twice.

title: Blood Test
note: The video shows two signs, the first being BLOOD and the second PRICK-TEST.
description: Right Full Open Handshape with palm facing down strikes the side of the neck twice. Both hands then assume Single-O Handshapes. Right hand moves down to touch Single-O Handshape of left hand which is resting palm up in center of signing space.
memory_aid: Blood spurting out of neck, pricking finger for test.

title: Blood Test
note: Analysis of a sample of blood

title: Blood Vessels
note: A component of the circulatory system

title: Blouse
note: Outer garment, usually loose, that is similar to a shirt

title: Blow
note: 1. 'Blow' as in hit. 2. This verb changes movement depending on the object. If it is to hit yourself, the hand moves towards yourself, as shown in this video. If it is to hit someone else, the hand moves away from the signer.
description: S-Handshape with palm facing down moves towards head. Upon touching head, hand moves up slightly.

title: Blue
description: Right Extended Index Finger Handshape with palm facing out is held up and moved from side to side slightly from the wrist.
memory_aid: The finger is painting something blue.

title: Blueband
description: The tips of the fingers of downturned right U-Handshape are moved over the palm of upturned left Full Closed Handshape. Movement is done repetitively and towards the signer.

title: Board
note: 'Board' as in to get in a vehicle.
description: Left Full Closed Handshape is positioned in center of signing space with palm facing down. Right Extended Index Finger Handshape with palm facing down is pointing outward. It moves forward under the left hand.

title: Boarding School
note: School with sleeping facilities for students

title: Boat
description: Both hands are in the Full Closed Handshapes with bottom sides touching and with palms facing one another. Both hands move together forward in an up and down motion.
memory_aid: Shape of a boat out on the water.

title: Body 1
note: 'Body' as in the human body.
description: Both Full Open Handshapes start at either side of the chest and move down to touch the waist. Palms are facing the signer.

title: Body 2
note: 'Body' as in an organisation.
description: Both hands are in Full Open Handshapes with palms facing one another. Both hands start slightly away from the center of signing space. The right hand is above the left hand. Hands move to the center as hands close into S-Handshapes.
memory_aid: Bringing things together for setting up a body.

title: Body Type
note: While 'body type' is a two-word phrase in English, it is one sign in KSL.
description: Both Full Open Handshapes start at either side of the chest and move down to touch the waist. Palms are facing the signer.

title: Bold
description: Both hands are in S-Handshapes with palms facing signer. Arms move in close to the body and strike down slightly once.

title: Bomb
note: Explosive device

title: Bon Voyage
note: Farewell

title: Bon Voyage
note: Farewell

title: Bondo
note: Names of towns are especially prone to variation. There may be another or a few other signs for 'Bondo'.
description: Both A-Handshapes with palms facing one another are held together touching at the wrists.

title: Bone
note: a composite material which makes up the skeleton of most vertebrates

title: Bonus
description: Right Modified-C Handshape with palm facing out starts upside down. Hand uprights itself from the wrist. Palm is still facing out.

title: Book
description: Full Closed Handshapes are held with palms together and fingertips pointing away. Palms are facing signer. Hands open and close repetitively with sides always touching.

title: Bookcase
description: Full Closed Handshapes are held with palms together and fingertips pointing away. Palms are facing signer. Hands open and close repetitively with sides always touching. Then right hand, still in Full Closed Handshape, moves to front of face with palm facing left. Hand moves in steps to the right.
memory_aid: Demonstrating the organisation of books in a bookcase.

title: Bookshelf
description: Full Closed Handshapes are held with palms together and fingertips pointing away. Palms are facing signer. Hands open and close repetitively with sides always touching. Then right hand, still in Full Closed Handshape, moves to front of face with palm facing left. Hand moves in steps to the right.
memory_aid: Demonstrating the organisation of books on a shelf.

title: Border
description: Both hands are in Full Closed Handshapes with palms facing signer. They are positioned in front of chest with right hand on top. Right hand starts slightly above left hand and moves down repetitively.

title: Borehole
description: WATER - Right C-Handshape with palm facing left is placed just below the mouth. Movement is slightly upwards repetitively. HOLE - Right Extended Index Finger Handshape with palm facing signer points down and makes small circles as it moves down.
memory_aid: As if drinking a glass of water and then indicating a hole in the ground.

title: Boring
note: Appropriate facial expression is important for this sign. One should lower eyebrows and otherwise indicate boredom.
description: Right Full Closed Handshape with palm facing signer taps mouth.

title: Born
description: Both Full Closed Handshapes are held by chest with palms facing one another and fingertips pointing down. Hands simultaneously move down and then out.

title: Borrow
description: Full Closed Handshape with palm facing left moves up to tap chin.

title: Boss
description: Both S-Handshapes with palms facing down start at waist level. They move up to chest level simultaneously.
memory_aid: Looks like the stature of a boss.

title: Bother
note: Note the lowered eyebrows which indicate negativity. This is an important part of the sign.
description: Right Bent-B Handshape with palm facing down taps right shoulder repetitively.

title: Bothersome
note: Note the lowered eyebrows which indicate negativity. This is an important part of the sign.
description: Right Bent-B Handshape with palm facing down taps right shoulder repetitively.

title: Bottle
description: The left hand is in an upright Full Closed Handshape with palm facing signer. The right hand grabs lightly and repetitively the lower part of the left arm.

title: Bottom
description: The right hand is in a Bent-B Handshape with palm facing down and moves in a slight circle.
memory_aid: Indication of the bottom of an object.

title: Bowl
description: The slightly curved Full Open Handshapes with palms facing up are held with sides touching. They move upwards away from one another.
memory_aid: Showing the shape of a bowl.

title: Box
note: A rectangular or square container, mostly opened at the top

title: Boxing Day
note: Celebration of the day or days following Christmas

title: Boy
note: While this sign can also be used for MAN or FATHER, the other signs (see MAN, FATHER 1 and 2) are more common.
description: Small-T Handshape with palm facing left touches chin. Hand moves down as fingers of Small-T Handshape close in repetitively.

title: Boyfriend
description: Both Modified-C Handshapes with palms facing one another are placed over area of heart. Index fingers move down repetitively.

title: Boyfriend
note: A male partner in a romantic relationship

title: Bra
note: Dress worn by women to hide their breast

title: Brain
note: Control center of the nervous system located in the skull

title: Branch
note: Sub/ part of a tree protruding from the main stem

title: Brand-New 1
note: There is no difference in meaning between BRAND-NEW 1 and BRAND-NEW 2. They are variants of 'brand-new' in KSL.
description: I-Handshapes with palms facing out are at either side of signing space. Wrists turn hands back and up.
memory_aid: Hands turning up signifies something new.

title: Brand-New 2
note: There is no difference in meaning between BRAND-NEW 1 and BRAND-NEW 2. They are variants of 'brand-new' in KSL.
description: Right Thumbs-Up Handshape is held with thumb against right corner of mouth. Palm is facing out. Hand moves forward, turning until palm is facing signer.

title: Brave
description: Both hands are in S-Handshapes with palms facing signer. Arms move in close to the body and strike down slightly once.

title: Brazil
note: Names of places are especially prone to variation. There may be another or a few other signs for 'Brazil'.
description: Full Closed Handshape with palm facing signer touches side of forehead. Hand turns so that palm is now facing out.

title: Brazil 2
note: Names of places are especially prone to variation. There may be another or a few other signs for 'Brazil'.
description: Full Closed Handshape with palm facing signer touches side of forehead. Hand turns so that palm is now facing out.

title: Bread
description: The fingertips of the right Bent-B Handshape with palm facing down touch the cheek. Both hands are then in Full Closed Handshapes. The palm of the left hand is facing signer while the palm of right hand is facing left. The right hand moves down on the left hand repetitively while moving over to the fingertips.

title: Bread
note: Food stuff made by baking dough

title: Bread
note: Food stuff made by baking dough

title: Break 1
note: 1. There is no difference in meaning between BREAK 1 and BREAK 2. They are variants of 'break' in KSL. 2. Note the lowered eyebrows, mouth movement and tilted head. These are all important parts of the sign.
description: Both Small-T Handshapes with palms facing down are placed side by side. Hands move up and slightly away repetitively.
memory_aid: Looks like the breaking up of something.

title: Break 2
note: 1. There is no difference in meaning between BREAK 1 and BREAK 2. They are variants of 'break' in KSL. 2. Note the lowered eyebrows, mouth movement and tilted head. These are all important parts of the sign.
description: Both hands are in A-Handshapes with palm of left hand facing up and palm of right hand facing down. Hands move in opposite directions with right hand always touching top of left hand.

title: Break Up
note: While 'break up' is a two-word phrase in English, it is one sign in KSL.
description: Both hands are in Bent-B Handshapes with palms facing signer. Backs of hands are touching one another and then move away directly from one another in a straight line.

title: Breakfast
note: While 'breakfast' is one word in English, it is a two-word phrase (FOOD, MORNING) in KSL.
description: FOOD - Right Flat-O Handshape with palm facing down taps repetitively on the mouth. MORNING - Right Full Closed Handshape with palm facing down is positioned at the side of the signer. The hand moves slightly forward repetitively.
memory_aid: Action of eating and the position of morning sun.

title: Breast
description: Full Open Handshape taps one side of the chest. Palm is facing signer.
memory_aid: Indicates the area of a breast.

title: Breeze
description: Full Open Handshapes with palms facing one another point out. They start at ends of signing space and move back and forth alternately.

title: Bridge
note: A construction that spans a divide

title: Brief
description: Both hands are in Full Closed Handshapes with palms facing one another. Hands start at ends of signing space and move in a straight line towards one another.
memory_aid: Indicates a brief period of time.

title: Briefcase
note: A case used for carrying documents

title: Bright 1
note: 'Bright' as in clever.
description: Thumb of right Thumbs-Up Handshape with palm facing left touches the forehead. While it moves slightly forward, hand turns so palm is facing signer.

title: Bright 2
note: 'Bright' as in having light, being bright.
description: Both hands, in O-Handshapes with palms facing out, start side by side in center of signing space. Both hands move simultaneously outward away from each other in slight arc. Hands open into Full Open Handshapes.
memory_aid: Indicates light given out by some light source.

title: Brilliant
description: Thumb of right Thumbs-Up Handshape with palm facing left touches the forehead. While it moves slightly forward, hand turns so palm is facing signer.

title: Bring
description: Both hands are in Full Open Handshapes with palms facing up. They both start on the right of the signer and move in towards the body.

title: Bring About
note: 1. Note the slight puffing of mouth as well as the tongue sticking out slightly. These are essential parts of the sign. 2. While 'bring about' is a two-word phrase in English, it is one sign in KSL.
description: Right O-Handshape with palm facing signer starts at the bottom center of the signing space. The left hand is in a Full Open Handshape facing the chest. While right hand moves up towards the left hand, it opens into a Full Open Handshape. Left hand has moved down.
memory_aid: Something coming out of the ground.

title: British Person
description: BRITAIN - Right Thumbs-Up Handshape with palm facing out is touching the side of the mouth. PERSON - Both Full Closed Handshapes with palms facing one another move down simultaneously to waist level.

title: Broad
note: 'Broad' as in general.
description: Heels of both Full Closed Handshapes are touching, with fingers pointing out. Both hands move out to either side of the signing space simultaneously.
memory_aid: Indicates a wide group of people.

title: Broadcast
description: Both Extended Index Finger Handshapes with palms facing signer are pointing at chin. Hands move out and away from one another. Palms then face out.

title: Brochure
note: Booklet of printed informational matter

title: Bronze
note: Man made alloy of copper, usually of tin, but also with one or more other metals

title: Broth
description: Right Extended Index Finger Handshape moves down from the nose to the base of throat. Palm is facing left.

title: Brother
note: The first part of this sign uses BOY, indicating male.
description: Right G-Handshape with palm facing left is placed on the chin so the index finger is in front of the chin and the thumb is underneath. The hand is pulled down slightly and the fingers come together. Then the sides of both Extended Index Finger Handshapes with palms facing down are brought together once.

title: Brother-In-Law
note: Wife's or husband's brother

title: Brown
description: Right Extended Index Finger Handshape with palm facing down rubs the outside of palm of upturned left Full Closed Handshape.
memory_aid: Brown is like the colour of a palm.

title: Bucket
description: Upside-down S-Handshape with palm facing signer is in front of the chest. The hand moves up and down.

title: Budget
note: Plan on how to spend money

title: Buffalo
description: Both Full Open Handshapes with palms facing out start at the sides of the head. They move down and out while closing into S-Handshapes.

title: Buffalo
note: Any of the old-world mammals of the family of bovidae

title: Bug
description: Both Extended Index Finger Handshapes with palms facing signer rest on either side of the head. Hands move back and forth alternately and repetitively.

title: Bui Bui
description: Both hands are in Full Closed Handshapes with palms facing signer. They touch the face, the right hand on the forehead and the left on the mouth.

title: Build 1
note: 'Build' as in to make something.
description: Both hands are in Full Closed Handshapes with palms facing signer. One hand is placed on top of the other alternately and repetitively.

title: Build 2
note: 'Build' as in a type of body.
description: Both Full Open Handshapes start at either side of the chest and move down to touch the waist. Palms are facing the signer.

title: Building
note: 'Building' as in a place.
description: Both hands are in Full Closed Handshapes with palms facing signer. One hand is placed on top of the other alternately and repetitively.

title: Bulb
note: A light bulb

title: Bull
note: If signer wants to emphasize the maleness of 'bull', sign MALE after COW.
description: Both hands are in L-Handshapes with palms facing out. Thumbs touch the sides of forehead. Hands move in and out repetitively.

title: Bungoma
note: Names of towns are especially prone to variation. There may be another or a few other signs for 'Bungoma'.
description: Right B-Handshape with palm facing left touches the forehead repetitively.

title: Burglar
description: Right V-Handshape with palm facing down and fingers pointing right starts at right side of signing space. Hand moves in as fingers close to form an S-Handshape.

title: Burn
description: Extended Index Finger Handshapes with palms facing signer are pointing up. The hands move alternately up and down.

title: Buru Buru
note: Name of a place in Eastland's, next to Jericho

title: Buru Buru
note: Name of a place in Eastland's, next to Jericho

title: Burundi
note: Names of places are especially prone to variation. There may be another or a few other signs for 'Burundi'.
description: B-Handshape is held in front of signer with palm facing out. Hand moves in a small circular motion.

title: Bury
note: Inter a dead person in a grave or tomb

title: Bury
note: To place in the ground

title: Bus
description: O-Handshapes with palms facing signer are held away from the shoulders. Hands are then moved towards the ears while opening into Full Open Handshapes.
memory_aid: Dust and smoke at the back of a moving bus.

title: Busaa
note: A local alcoholic beverage, most common in western Kenya

title: Busia
note: Names of towns are especially prone to variation. There may be another or a few other signs for 'Busia'.
description: Both hands are in the Flat-O Handshapes with palms facing up. Hands are moved up and down alternately and repetitively.

title: Business
description: Both hands in C-Handshapes with palms facing up are placed side by side. They slide back and forth (toward and away from signer) alternately and repetitively.

title: Business Person
description: BUSINESS - Both hands in C-Handshapes with palms facing up are placed side by side. They slide back and forth (toward and away from signer) alternately and repetitively. PERSON - Both Full Closed Handshapes with palms facing one another move down simultaneously to waist level.

title: Busy
note: Having a lot to do

title: But
note: Note tilted head and raised eyebrows. These are essential parts of the sign.
description: Both hands are in Extended Index Handshapes. Palms are facing away from signer. Fingers are touching so that they form an 'x'. Hands move out so that fingers point to either side of the signing space.
memory_aid: Fingers move in opposite directions indicating otherwise.

title: Butere
note: Names of towns are especially prone to variation. There may be another or a few other signs for 'Butere'.
description: Right Full Closed Handshape with palm facing out is at a slight downward angle. It moves up and down repetitively.

title: Butter
description: The tips of the fingers of downturned right U-Handshape are moved over the palm of upturned left Full Closed Handshape. Movement is done repetitively and towards the signer.

title: Buttocks
note: Posterior part of the body between the base of the back and the top of the legs

title: Button
note: A knob that is passed through a loop serving as a fastener

title: Buy
description: The right hand, in a Flat-O Handshape with palm facing up, rests on the palm of upturned left Full Closed Handshape. Right hand moves forward changing into an A-Handshape.

title: Buy
note: Purchase

title: Bye
note: Farewell

title: C
description: All fingers, including thumb, are partially folded. Hand is turned slightly to the left so viewer can see 'C' shape formed by thumb and fingers.

title: Cab
note: The first part of this sign uses CAR.
description: Both S-Handshapes with palms facing signer. Hands are moved up and down alternately and repetitively. Then right Full Closed Handshape with palm facing back moves to top of head.
memory_aid: Steering wheel of a car, sign of a cab.

title: Cabbage
description: Both hands are in Bent-B Handshapes. The hands face one another with fingertips touching and heels apart. Hands are moved down and apart bringing them back together at the heels. Right Extended Index Finger Handshape with palm facing left comes up and wriggles.
memory_aid: The shape of a cabbage and a worm inside.

title: Cabbage
note: edible plant having a head of green leaves

title: Cain
note: Name of a Bible character, son of Adam and Eve and killed his brother

title: Cake
description: Right Claw Handshape with palm facing down repetitively touches down upon upturned left Full Closed Handshape.

title: Cake
note: A sweet rich dessert food made of flour, sugar and eggs, baked in an oven

title: Calculate
description: Left hand is in a Claw Handshape with palm facing up. Right Extended Index Finger Handshape with palm facing signer touches upon fingers of left hand, which close after being touched.

title: Calculation
description: Left hand is in a Claw Handshape with palm facing up. Right Extended Index Finger Handshape with palm facing signer touches upon fingers of left hand, which close after being touched.

title: Calendar
note: The first part of this sign uses MONTH.
description: Right Small-T Handshape with palm facing signer moves down as hand turns into G-Handshape with thumb sticking out. This is done twice. Hand then changes to Full Closed Handshape with palm facing down. Hand moves up towards signer so that palm is now facing in.

title: Call
note: 'Call' as in to summon someone.
description: Full Closed Handshape with palm facing out is placed at right side of signer. As hand is changing into A-Handshape, it moves towards signer.

title: Call An Ambulance
note: Emergencies

title: Call An Ambulance
note: Emergencies

title: Call The Police
note: Emergencies

title: Callous
note: While CRUEL shares the same sign as other English words like 'inhumane', 'mean', and 'rude', they have slightly different facial expressions. The more intense the meanness, the more intense the facial expression. Hence CRUEL gets a more intense facial expression than RUDE does.
description: Claw Handshapes with palms facing down rest upon either side of head. Hands move out simultaneously in a straight line.

title: Camel
description: The right hand, in a Full Closed Handshape, touches the back of the shoulder. Hand then moves in front of left shoulder. With palm facing down, hand moves to the right in two curves.

title: Camel
note: A beast of burden. Much used in deserts

title: Camera
description: The left hand is in an L-Handshape while the right hand assumes the Modified-C Handshape. Both hands with palms facing out are just before the eye forming a rectangle. The index finger of the right hand moves down and up repetitively.
memory_aid: The eye peers through viewfinder of imaginary camera and index finger clicks the shutter.

title: Cameroon
note: Names of places are especially prone to variation. There may be another or a few other signs for 'Cameroon'.
description: Slightly curved Full Closed Handshape is held upside down with palm facing out. Hand turns to right so that palm is facing signer.

title: Campaign
note: A series of operations undertaken to achieve a certain goal

title: Can
note: 1. 'Can' as in to be able. 2. The raising of eyebrows and tilting of head are important parts of this sign.
description: Both hands are in S-Handshapes with palms facing down. They move down.

title: Can I Buy You A Drink?
note: Dating and romance

title: Can I Buy You A Drink?
note: Dating and romance

title: Can I Come In?
note: Making friends

title: Can I Use Your Phone?
note: General conversation

title: Can You Help Me?
note: Emergencies

title: Can You Tell Us?
note: asking for direction

title: Canada
note: Names of places are especially prone to variation. There may be another or a few other signs for 'Canada'.
description: C-Handshape with palm facing left taps gently above heart.

title: Cancel
description: Right Extended Index Finger Handshape with palm facing out makes an 'X' in the air.
memory_aid: X' in the air indicates a cancellation.

title: Cancer
note: A disease in which cells of a tissue undergo uncontrolled proliferation

title: Candid
description: Both hands are in Full Closed Handshapes. Left hand is positioned in center of signing space with palm up and fingertips pointing right. Right hand, with palm facing left, moves down to touch upon palm of left hand. Once right hand touches down, it moves forward in a slightly up motion.
memory_aid: Arm goes in a straight direction, not off to the side as one would when untruthful.

title: Candle
description: Both hands assume Small-T Handshapes with palms facing sides. Right hand is above and before left hand. The right hand moves to touch the top of the left hand. Both hands simultaneously change into Extended Index Handshapes. The left hand is pointing right and right hand is pointing up above left finger. Right finger moves slightly side to side.
memory_aid: The striking of a match, the shape of a candle and the flickering flame.

title: Candy
description: The tongue pushes out on the right cheek so that a bump is visible. X-Handshape with palm facing left taps the bump on the cheek.

title: Cane
note: 'Cane' as in to cane someone.
description: Right Extended Index Finger Handshape with palm facing down is in upturned A-Handshape of left hand. Right hand moves out and down as wrist snaps.

title: Cane 2
note: 'Cane' as in to cane someone.
description: Right Extended Index Finger Handshape with palm facing down is in upturned A-Handshape of left hand. Right hand moves out and down as wrist snaps.

title: Canine
note: To specify the breed of a canine, fingerspell.
description: The right hand assumes the Full Open Handshape with palm facing out. The back of the hand is near the right cheek. Hand moves sideways repetitively.
memory_aid: The floppy ears of a canine.

title: Capability
note: The raising of eyebrows and tilting of head are important parts of this sign.
description: Both hands are in S-Handshapes with palms facing down. They move down.

title: Capable
note: The raising of eyebrows and tilting of head are important parts of this sign.
description: Both hands are in S-Handshapes with palms facing down. They move down.

title: Capital
note: A city designed as a legislative seat by the government/ most important

title: Capture
description: Both Full Open Handshapes with palms facing out move down and forward while hands close into S-Handshapes with palms facing down.

title: Car
description: Both S-Handshapes with palms facing signer are moved up and down alternately and repetitively. Then both hands are placed in the B-Handshapes with palms facing down at eye level. B-Handshapes are moved apart, angled down and then flattened out.
memory_aid: Steering a wheel, outline of a car.

title: Card
note: a playing card

title: Care
note: 'Care' as in to tend to someone or something.
description: Both Full Closed Handshapes with palms facing signer are held upright. Right hand touches back of left hand and moves up repetitively.

title: Careful
note: Note lowered eyebrows and tilted head. These are essential parts of the sign.
description: Both Full Open Handshapes with palms facing down are slowly moved forward in circles.

title: Careless
note: Lowered eyebrows, shrugged shoulders, shaking head and pursed lips are all important parts of the sign. They all indicate carelessness.
description: Full Open Handshapes start at center of signing space with palms facing down. They move up to either side of signing space with palms facing up.

title: Careless 2
note: Lowered eyebrows, shrugged shoulders, shaking head and pursed lips are all important parts of the sign. They all indicate carelessness.
description: Full Open Handshapes start at center of signing space with palms facing down. They move up to either side of signing space with palms facing up.

title: Carpet
note: A fabric used as a complete floor cover

title: Carrot
description: Right Extended Index Finger Handshape with palm facing down is twisted back and forth in front of mouth.

title: Carrot
note: A vegetable with a nutritious, juicy, orange root

title: Carry
description: Both hands, in the Full Open Handshapes with palms facing up, are held near one another. They start at the left of signer and move slightly up and down to the right.

title: Cart
description: Both X-Handshapes are linked. Palm of right hand is facing down while palm of left hand is facing signer. Both hands move to right simultaneously.
memory_aid: The right is pulling the left.

title: Case
description: Right Claw Handshape with palm facing down moves up and down on upturned left Full Closed Handshape.

title: Case History
note: While 'case history' is a two-word phrase in English, it is one sign in KSL.
description: Both Full Closed Handshapes with palms facing signer are above right shoulder. They move backward in a circular motion alternately.

title: Cat
note: To specify the breed of a cat, fingerspell.
description: Fingertips of Full Open Handshapes, with palms facing signer, are brushed repetitively against the cheeks from corners of the mouth.

title: Catch 1
note: 'Catch' as in to catch a ball.
description: Both Claw Handshapes with palms facing one another start in center of signing space. Both move back towards the signer and move in closer to one another but never touch.
memory_aid: Looks like one catching a ball.

title: Catch 2
note: 'Catch' as in to capture someone.
description: Both Full Open Handshapes with palms facing out move down and forward while hands close into S-Handshapes with palms facing down.

title: Catholic
note: Trinitarian church, with Pope as the head

title: Cattle
description: Both hands are in L-Handshapes with palms facing out. Thumbs touch the sides of forehead. Hands move in and out repetitively.

title: Cause
note: Note the slight puffing of mouth as well as the tongue sticking out slightly. These are essential parts of the sign.
description: Right O-Handshape with palm facing signer starts at the bottom center of the signing space. The left hand is in a Full Open Handshape facing the chest. While right hand moves up towards the left hand, it opens into a Full Open Handshape. Left hand has moved down.
memory_aid: Something coming out of the ground.

title: Caution
note: 'Caution' as in to warn someone.
description: Right Extended Index Finger Handshape with palm facing left is pointing out. It moves up and down from wrist repetitively.

title: Cautious
note: Note lowered eyebrows and tilted head. These are essential parts of the sign.
description: Both Full Open Handshapes with palms facing down are slowly moved forward in circles.

title: Cave
note: A large, natural occurring cavity formed underground

title: Cd (Compact Disc)

DISC - Left hand is then in a Full Closed Handshape with the palm facing up. Right Extended Index Finger Handshape draws a circle over left palm. Then the right hand, in a Modified-C Handshape, with the palm facing out moves forward once.
memory_aid: Screen of computer, circular shape of a disc and insertion into a computer.

title: Cease 1
note: 1. 'Cease' as in to stop something. 2. Note lowered eyebrows, an important part of the sign.
description: Both hands are in Full Closed Handshapes. Left hand is held parallel to chest with palm facing signer. Palm of right hand is facing left. Right hand moves down in front of left hand.

title: Cease 2
note: 1. 'Cease' as in to command someone to stop something. 2. Note lowered eyebrows, an important part of the sign.
description: Full Closed Handshape with palm facing out moves forward.
memory_aid: Typical gesture when commanding one to stop.

title: Celebrate
description: Both Full Open Handshapes with palms facing out are held at either side of the head. Staying in place, hands twist from the wrists.

title: Celebration
description: Both Full Open Handshapes with palms facing out are held at either side of the head. Staying in place, hands twist from the wrists.

title: Cell
note: A room in prison/ Chamber in a tissue or organism having a specific function

title: Cell Phone
note: While 'cell phone' is a two-word phrase in English, it is one sign in KSL.
description: L-Handshape with palm facing signer moves back and forth in front of ear.

title: Censure
note: Lowered eyebrows, pursed mouth, intense movement and turned head are all essential parts of this sign. All parts indicate intensity and negativity.
description: Both Extended Index Finger Handshapes are pointing left. Palms are facing one another. Hands move forward and slightly down repetitively.

title: Cent
description: X-Handshape with palm facing down taps palm of upturned left Full Closed Handshape.
memory_aid: Tapping the top of a cent.

title: Center
description: Right Extended Index Finger Handshape with palm facing down makes a circle over the upturned left Full Closed Handshape. Finger then touches down upon the middle of the left palm.

title: Central
description: Right Extended Index Finger Handshape with palm facing down makes a circle over the upturned left Full Closed Handshape. Finger then touches down upon the middle of the left palm.

title: Ceremony
note: Feast

title: Certain
note: Note raised eyebrows, an essential part of the sign.
description: Both hands are in Full Closed Handshapes. Left hand is positioned in center of signing space with palm up and fingertips pointing right. Right hand, with palm facing left, moves down to touch upon palm of left hand.

title: Certificate
description: Both L-Handshapes with palms facing out are held together at thumbs. The hands move in and out repetitively.

title: Chagrined
note: Note lowered eyebrows and raised shoulders. These are essential parts of the sign.
description: Right Claw Handshape with palm facing signer moves back and forth in front of face.
memory_aid: As if trying to hide from being chagrined.

title: Chain
note: A series of interconnected links

title: Chair
description: Both Extended Index Finger Handshapes with palms facing signer move down and out in the opposite directions.

title: Chairman
note: A person presiding over a meeting

title: Chalk
description: Right Extended Index Finger Handshape with palm facing signer points to teeth. Then hand turns into Modified-C Handshape with palm facing out. It moves in a slight up and down motion from left to right.
memory_aid: White as the colour of teeth, then the action of writing.

title: Chalkboard
note: While 'chalkboard' is one word in English, it is a two-word phrase (BLACK, BOARD) in KSL.
description: BLACK - Right Extended Index Finger Handshape with palm facing down points to the head at hairline near temple then moves down. BOARD - Both Extended Index Finger Handshapes with palms facing out are put together, pointing up and out, above and in front of head. They move out, down and back together.
memory_aid: The colour of black hair and the shape of a large rectangle.

title: Challenge
description: Both S-Handshapes with palms facing signer are together at fingers. Arms move side to side.
memory_aid: Both hands are pushing one another struggling to win.

title: Chameleon
note: A small reptile, able to change color and project its long tongue

title: Chance
description: Both hands are in Thumbs-Up Handshapes with palms facing signer. They move towards each other and upon touching move out again.
memory_aid: Hands hitting one another is chance.

title: Chang'Aa
note: A local alcoholic beverage, most common in Kenya

title: Change 1
note: 'Change' as in to replace.
description: Both hands are in Extended Index Finger Handshapes. They are held together at the palms. The right hand is closer to the signer. Hands turn around so that left hand is then closer to the signer.
memory_aid: One finger takes place of the other.

title: Change 2
note: 'Change' as in to get money back.
description: Both hands are in Extended Index Finger Handshapes pointing at one another. Hands move in forward circles around one another.
memory_aid: Things are moving around to change.

title: Change 3
note: 'Change' as in to change into something else.
description: Both hands are in A-Handshapes with palms touching one another. The right hand is closest to the signer. Hands turn over still touching so that left hand is now closer to the signer.

title: Change 3
note: 'Change' as in to get money back.
description: Both hands are in Extended Index Finger Handshapes pointing at one another. Hands move in forward circles around one another.
memory_aid: Things are moving around to change.

title: Chapati
description: Both Full Closed Handshapes with palms facing down move back and forth simultaneously.

title: Chapter
note: One of the main sections in which the texts of a book is divided

title: Charcoal
note: The first part of this sign uses 'black' with reverse movement, forward rather than back.
description: Right Extended Index Finger Handshape with palm facing signer points to head at hairline and then moves down slightly. Hand moves down and changes into Claw Handshape with palm facing signer. The hand moves back and forth slightly.
memory_aid: The shape of a piece of charcoal.

title: Chart
description: Both hands are in Full Open Handshapes. Left arm is held parallel with palm facing signer. Palm of right hand is facing down. It moves towards left hand and moves down. As it moves back up, palm turns to face left and it moves across left hand.

title: Chase
description: Both hands are in Bent-B Handshapes with palms facing down. The left hand is slightly behind and to the left of the right hand. Both hands move simultaneously forward and to the right.
memory_aid: Left hand is chasing right hand.

title: Chat
description: Extended Index Finger Handshapes with palms facing one another start by the mouth. Hands move out and back alternately and repetitively.
memory_aid: Fingers represent words being exchanged between two people.

title: Cheap
description: L-Handshape with palm facing out starts in center of signing space. Hand moves down as handshape turns into Single-O Handshape.
memory_aid: Pile of money needed is small.

title: Cheating
note: Lying

title: Check
note: 'Check' as in to check a paper.
description: Right Extended Index Finger Handshape with palm facing left starts at head level and moves down in a repetitive check-like motion.

title: Cheeck
note: Soft skin on each side of the skin

title: Cheerful
description: Arms are bent with both S-Handshapes with palms facing signer by sides of chest. Arms move up and down in a flapping motion.
memory_aid: Cheer is lifting up the arms.

title: Cheers
note: Eating and drinking

title: Cheers
note: Eating and drinking

title: Chef
note: While 'chef' is one word in English, it is a two-word phrase (COOK, PERSON) in KSL.
description: COOK - Extended Index Finger Handshapes with palms facing signer are pointing up. The hands move alternately up and down. PERSON - Both Full Closed Handshapes with palms facing one another move down simultaneously to waist level.
memory_aid: A person using fire to cook.

title: Chemical
note: Of or relating to chemistry

title: Chemical
note: Of or relating to chemistry

title: Chest
note: Portion of the front of the human body

title: Chicken
note: This sign refers both to the animal and to the meat.
description: The back of the right hand, in an X-Handshape, touches the mouth. Downward motions are made from the wrist.

title: Chicken Pox
note: A common childhood disease caused by the varicellazoster virus

title: Chief
description: Right Extended Index Finger Handshape is placed under the left armpit. Then both hands, in the Full Handshapes, are facing each other. Hands are moved down simultaneously to waist level.

title: Child
description: Right Bent-B Handshape with palm facing signer starts chest high then moves down.

title: Chili
note: Spicy fresh or dried fruit of any of several cultivated varieties of peppers

title: Chilly
note: Note lowered eyebrows and raised shoulders, essential parts of the sign.
description: Both S-Handshapes with palms facing each other are placed at sides of body. In this position the arms move in slightly and repetitively.

title: Chin
note: the bottom of a face

title: China
note: Names of places are especially prone to variation. There may be another or a few other signs for 'China'.
description: Extended Index Finger Handshape with palm facing signer points to left shoulder, to right shoulder, and then down to right side of waist.
memory_aid: Refers to a Chinese style of dress.

title: China 2
note: Names of places are especially prone to variation. There may be another or a few other signs for 'China'.
description: Extended Index Finger Handshape with palm facing signer points to left shoulder, to right shoulder, and then down to right side of waist.
memory_aid: Refers to a Chinese style of dress.

title: Chips
description: Right G-Handshape with palm facing left starts on palm of upturned left Full Closed Handshape. The right hand moves up to the mouth repetitively.

title: Chips
note: Food made from potatoes cut in small pieces then fried

title: Chiromo Road
note: Name of a road

title: Chocolate
note: A food made from ground roasted cocoa beans

title: Choice
description: F-Handshape starts with palm facing down. Hand moves up from wrist so that palm is facing out.

title: Cholera
note: Pathology caused by the vibrio cholerae bacterium

title: Chomp
note: To convey the meaning of 'gnaw', 'chew' and so forth, the right hand has to come down on left hand repetitively.
description: Right Claw Handshape with palm facing down is in front of signer. It comes down on the downturned left Full Open Handshape.

title: Choose
description: F-Handshape starts with palm facing down. Hand moves up from wrist so that palm is facing out.

title: Chopping Board
note: Board used to place food stuff to be chopped

title: Chortle
description: Fingers of Bent-V Handshape with palm facing signer taps upon chin.

title: Christmas
note: Celebration of the birth of Jesus

title: Chronicle
description: Both Full Closed Handshapes with palms facing signer are above right shoulder. They move backward in a circular motion alternately.

title: Chubby
description: Both hands are in Full Open Handshapes with palms facing one another and fingers pointing down. They start by the waist and move out to the sides of the signing space.

title: Chuckle
description: Fingers of Bent-V Handshape with palm facing signer taps upon chin.

title: Church
description: Right C-Handshape with palm facing out taps the back of downturned left Full Closed Handshape.

title: Cigarette
description: V-Handshape with palm facing signer taps side of mouth.

title: Circle
note: 1. 'Circle' as in to go around something. 2. Hand can move in repetitive circles.
description: Right Extended Index Finger Handshape with palm facing signer points down. Hand moves forward and to the left in a circular motion. Palm is still facing body.

title: Circulation
note: Movement of blood in the blood vascular system

title: Circumcise 1
note: This refers to female circumcision.
description: Left A-Handshape with palm facing right has thumb sticking out from between index and middle fingers. Right Extended Index Finger Handshape with palm facing signer moves down on thumb of left hand.
memory_aid: Looks like the cutting of the female genitalia.

title: Circumcise 2
note: This refers to male circumcision.
description: Both hands are in Extended Index Finger Handshapes. Left hand is pointing out and palm facing down. Right hand with palm facing signer moves around and away from left hand.
memory_aid: Looks like the cutting of the male foreskin.

title: Circumstance
description: Right Claw Handshape with palm facing down moves up and down on upturned left Full Closed Handshape.
memory_aid: A lot of information in hand.

title: Citizen
note: TV Station

title: City
description: Both C-Handshapes with palms facing one another move up and down alternately while moving to opposite sides of the signing space.

title: City Hall
note: Building

title: Civic Education
note: Public awareness

title: Civil Rights
note: This is actually the KSL phrase 'HUMAN RIGHT'.
description: Both Full Closed Handshapes with palms facing one another move down simultaneously to waist level. Then left hand is positioned in center of signing space with palm up and fingertips pointing right. Right hand, with palm facing left, moves down to touch upon palm of left hand. Once right hand touches down, it moves forward in a slightly up motion.
memory_aid: Indicating the body and something one is entitled to.

title: Claim
note: 'Claim' as in to declare something is yours.
description: Both Full Open Handshapes with palms facing out move down and forward while hands close into S-Handshapes with palms facing down.

title: Clan
description: Both hands are in slightly bent Full Closed Handshapes with palms facing one another. Fingertips of hands are touching to form a half-circle. Fingertips separate and hands curve back so hands meet at heels to form another half-circle.
memory_aid: Clan is enclosed within the circle.

title: Clandestine
description: Thumbs-Up Handshape is placed on mouth with palm facing signer. Hand moves down and then across on mouth.

title: Classified
description: Thumbs-Up Handshape with palm facing signer traces a cross on the mouth. Then hand assumes K-Handshape. Palm is facing left and hand is tipped down. Thumb moves away from index and middle fingers and moves back down as wrist snaps.

title: Classroom
note: While 'classroom' is one word in English, it is a two-word phrase (SCHOOL, ROOM) in KSL.
description: SCHOOL - Both hands are in S-Handshapes with palms facing down. The right arm rests upon the left arm. ROOM - With palms facing down, both Extended Index Finger Handshapes start side by side and move away from each other then back together in a square-like motion.
memory_aid: The top of a table and the shape of a room.

title: Clay
note: An earth material with ductile qualities

title: Clean 1
note: 'Clean' as in a clean room.
description: Both hands are in I-Handshapes with palms facing out. The right hand is placed behind the left hand. Both move out, away from one another, in a straight line.

title: Clean 2
note: 'Clean' as in to clean something.
description: Both hands are in I-Handshapes with palms facing out. The right hand starts behind the left hand. Both move out, away from one another, in a straight line. Hands then come back together and away repetitively.

title: Cleanse
description: Both hands are in I-Handshapes with palms facing out. The right hand starts behind the left hand. Both move out, away from one another, in a straight line. Hands then come back together and away repetitively.

title: Clear
note: Note lowered head and eyebrows, essential parts of the sign.
description: Flat-O Handshapes with palms facing down start at opposite ends of signing space. Hands move down towards one another as hands open into Full Open Handshapes.
memory_aid: Open hands show the clarity of something.

title: Clearing
note: 'Clearing' as in a field.
description: Full Open Handshapes with palms facing down begin in the center away from body. They move towards the body in a wide circle.

title: Cleave
description: Both hands are in Bent-B Handshapes with palms facing signer. Backs of hands are touching one another and then move away directly from one another in a straight line.
memory_aid: Hands are cleaving from one another.

title: Clever
description: Thumb of right Thumbs-Up Handshape with palm facing left touches the forehead. While it moves slightly forward, hand turns so palm is facing signer.

title: Client
note: A customer

title: Clinic
description: Right X-Handshape with palm facing signer taps the side of the left arm.
memory_aid: Indicating the armband of a medical worker.

title: Clitoris
description: Left hand is in A-Handshape with palm facing down but with thumb sticking out from between index and middle fingers. Right hand in Single-O Handshape pulls down on thumb of left hand.

title: Clock
description: Right Extended Index Finger Handshape with palm facing down points to back of left wrist. It then moves up to front of face where it is moved down to right from wrist repetitively.

title: Close 1
note: 'Close' as in close the door.
description: Left Full Closed Handshape is held with palm facing signer. Right Full Closed Handshape is held with palm out. The right hand moves forward and to side so the palm covers the back of the left hand.

title: Close 2
note: 1. 'Close' as in near. 2. Note the lowered eyebrows, tilt of head and shift of shoulders. These movements are typical of signs indicating proximity.
description: Both Bent-B Handshapes with palms facing signer are in front of body. The right hand is in front of the left hand. Right hand moves back and forth repetitively.

title: Cloth
description: Single-O Handshape with palm facing signer is touching near the right shoulder. Hand moves away from and back to the signer repetitively.

title: Clothes
description: Single-O Handshape with palm facing signer is touching near the right shoulder. Hand moves away from and back to the signer repetitively.

title: Cloud
note: To specify the type of cloud, fingerspell.
description: Both Claw Handshapes with palms facing up are just above the head. Hands move in a circle to the right simultaneously.

title: Clouds
note: A visible mass of water droplets suspended in the air

title: Clout
description: Right Full Closed Handshape with palm facing down is placed at left shoulder. Thumb-side of hand is touching shoulder. Hand moves in an arc to elbow where little-finger side is now touching arm.

title: Club
description: Both hands, in C-Handshapes with palms facing one another, start at opposite ends of signing space. They move towards one another simultaneously.

title: Clutch
note: 'Clutch' as in to grab someone.
description: Both Full Open Handshapes with palms facing out move down and forward while hands close into S-Handshapes with palms facing down.

title: Cnn
note: Cable network news

title: Coalition
description: Both hands are in Full Open Handshapes with palms facing one another. Both hands start slightly away from the center of signing space. The right hand is above the left hand. Hands move to the center as hands close into S-Handshapes.
memory_aid: Bringing things together for setting up a coalition.

title: Coast
description: Right Modified-C Handshape with palm facing out is resting on its side. It moves down in a slight side to side motion.

title: Coast 2
description: Right Modified-C Handshape with palm facing out is resting on its side. It moves down in a slight side to side motion.

title: Coat
description: Both hands are in S-Handshapes with palms facing signer. Hands start on opposing sides of signing space and move in toward each other. Both move to bottom center of signing space. While left hand remains at bottom, right hand moves up torso of signer.
memory_aid: The putting on and zipping up of a coat.

title: Cock
note: If signer wants to emphasize the maleness of the 'cock', sign MALE after CHICKEN.
description: The back of the right hand, in an X-Handshape, touches the mouth. Downward motions are made from the wrist.

title: Cocoa
note: A hot drink made with milk, cocoa powder and sugar

title: Cocoa
note: A hot drink made with milk, cocoa powder and sugar

title: Coconut
description: Both C-Handshapes with palms facing one another are by the right ear. They move back and forth simultaneously and repetitively.

title: Coconut
note: A fruit of the coconut palm/ the coconut palm

title: Coerce
description: Slightly curved Full Open Handshapes with palms facing out are positioned at either side of signing space. Hands move forward once in a strong motion.
memory_aid: Hands pushing one to do something.

title: Coffee
description: Both hands, in Bent-V Handshapes with palms facing one another, circle one another alternately and repetitively.

title: Coffee
note: Beverage made by infusing the beans of the coffee plant in hot water

title: Cognizant
description: Full Closed Handshapes with palms facing signer touch sides of forehead. Hands move out to sides of signing space while wrists move out so that palms are facing out.
memory_aid: Mind opens into a cognizant state.

title: Coin
description: X-Handshape with palm facing down taps palm of upturned left Full Closed Handshape.
memory_aid: Tapping the top of a coin.

title: Coke
note: Drink from the coca cola company

title: Cold
note: 1. 'Cold' as in feeling chilly. 2. Note lowered eyebrows and raised shoulders, essential parts of the sign.
description: Both S-Handshapes with palms facing each other are placed at sides of body. In this position the arms move in slightly and repetitively.

title: Collapse
note: 'Collapse' in this sign usually refers to people.
description: Fingers of V-Handshape are placed on upturned left Full Closed Handshape. Right hand moves up and then down so that palm of V-Handshape is facing up.

title: Collar
note: Anything that encircles the neck

title: Collect
description: Right hand in slightly curved Full Closed Handshape is placed above upturned left Full Closed Handshape. Right hand moves in and out as it moves to left with left hand underneath.

title: College
note: School that offers certificates and diploma's

title: Collide
description: Both hands are in Thumbs-Up Handshapes with palms facing the signer. Hands move in towards one another and move up and away simultaneously as soon as they touch.
memory_aid: Looks like a collision taking place.

title: Collision
description: Both hands are in Thumbs-Up Handshapes with palms facing the signer. Hands move in towards one another and move up and away simultaneously as soon as they touch.

title: Color
note: The spectral composition of visible light

title: Colossal
note: Note the raising of eyebrows which indicate largeness. This is an essential part of the sign.
description: Full Open Handshapes with palms facing one another start above the shoulders. They move apart and upwards.
memory_aid: Showing the size of something colossal.

title: Comb
note: Brush hair/ brush

title: Combine
description: Both hands are in Full Closed Handshapes with palms facing one another and thumbs up. They start at opposite ends of the signing space and come together until the palms touch.

title: Come 1
note: 'Come' as in a person is coming.
description: Right Extended Index Finger Handshape with palm facing down starts by end of signing space. As hand moves towards center of signing space, hand points down.

title: Come 2
note: 'Come' as in a person is coming very soon or will definitely come.
description: Full Closed Handshape with palm facing up closes into Bent-B Handshape repetitively.

title: Come 3
note: 'Come' as in a person is coming.
description: Right Extended Index Finger Handshape with palm facing down starts by end of signing space. As hand moves towards center of signing space, hand points down.

title: Come 3
note: 'Come' as in to beckon a person to come to you.
description: Full Closed Handshape with palm facing out is placed at right side of signer. As hand is changing into A-Handshape, it moves towards signer.

title: Come Back
note: While 'come back' is a two-word phrase in English, it is one sign in KSL.
description: Full Closed Handshape is facing palm up by right side of signing space. It moves up and down in an arc towards center of signing space so that palm is then facing down.
memory_aid: Looks like a person coming back.

title: Come From
note: While 'come from' is a two-word phrase in English, it is one sign in KSL.
description: Full Closed Handshape with palm facing away from signer moves back and closes into A-Handshape with palm facing signer.

title: Comedy
description: Right Extended Index Finger Handshape with palm facing down moves under chin in a straight line and then wrist snaps moving the finger downward.

title: Comfort
note: Ease

title: Comic
description: Right Extended Index Finger Handshape with palm facing down moves under chin in a straight line and then wrist snaps moving the finger downward.

title: Comma
note: Punctuation mark indicating a pause/

title: Command
description: Extended Index Finger Handshape with palm facing left is placed on mouth. Hand moves out in a straight line.
memory_aid: A command coming from the mouth.

title: Commence
description: Right Extended Index Finger Handshape is placed between index and middle fingers of left hand in V-Handshape. Palms of both hands are facing signer. Hands move backwards, away from each other.
memory_aid: Hands open up to commence something.

title: Commend
description: Right Extended Index Finger Handshape with palm facing left points at mouth. It then changes into a Full Closed Handshape as it moves down to upturned left Full Closed Handshape. Right hand claps palm of left hand.

title: Comment
description: Right Extended Index Finger Handshape with palm facing signer is placed below mouth with finger pointing left. Hand moves forward in an outward circular motion.
memory_aid: Words are coming out of mouth.

title: Commerce
description: Both hands in C-Handshapes with palms facing up are placed side by side. They slide back and forth (toward and away from signer) alternately and repetitively.

title: Commitment
description: Both Full Closed Handshapes, fingers pointing up and palms facing one another, are held at the sides of face. They move straight out from the face as hands move down so that fingertips point away from signer.
memory_aid: Indicating the area where one is watching.

title: Committee
note: A group of persons convened for the accomplishment of some specific purpose

title: Common
description: The sides of the Extended Index Finger Handshapes are brought together once or repetitively. Palms are facing down.
memory_aid: Two common things are brought together.

title: Communicate
description: Extended Index Finger Handshapes with palms facing one another start by the mouth. Hands move out and back alternately and repetitively.
memory_aid: Fingers represent words being exchanged between two people.

title: Communication
description: Extended Index Finger Handshapes with palms facing one another start by the mouth. Hands move out and back alternately and repetitively.
memory_aid: Fingers represent words being exchanged between two people.

title: Community
note: To sign this repetitively as done in the sign video means 'communities'. To sign this in the singular form, the movement is not repetitive, only done once to signify 'community'.
description: Both hands, in C-Handshapes with palms facing one another, start at one end of signing space. They move towards one another simultaneously. This is done repetitively as hands move to other side of signing space.

title: Community 2
note: To sign this repetitively as done in the sign video means 'communities'. To sign this in the singular form, the movement is not repetitive, only done once to signify 'community'.
description: Both hands, in C-Handshapes with palms facing one another, start at one end of signing space. They move towards one another simultaneously. This is done repetitively as hands move to other side of signing space.

title: Companion
description: Arms are crossed so that palms of both hands, in Full Closed Handshapes, tap lightly against opposite shoulders.

title: Compare
description: Both hands are in Full Closed Handshapes with palms facing up. They start at bottom edges of the signing space. Alternately and repetitively the hands move up and down.

title: Comparison
description: Both hands are in Full Closed Handshapes with palms facing up. They start at bottom edges of the signing space. Alternately and repetitively the hands move up and down.

title: Compartment
description: Both Extended Index Finger Handshapes with palms facing down start side by side and move away from each other then back together in a square-like motion.

title: Compel
description: Slightly curved Full Open Handshapes with palms facing out are positioned at either side of signing space. Hands move forward once in a strong motion.
memory_aid: Hands pushing one to do something.

title: Compelling
description: Both hands are in S-Handshapes with palms facing signer. Arms move in close to the body and strike down slightly once.

title: Competence
note: The raising of eyebrows and tilting of head are important parts of this sign.
description: Both hands are in S-Handshapes with palms facing down. They move down.

title: Competent
note: The raising of eyebrows and tilting of head are important parts of this sign.
description: Both hands are in S-Handshapes with palms facing down. They move down.

title: Complain 1
note: 1. There is no difference in meaning between COMPLAIN 1 and COMPLAIN 2. They are variants of 'complain' in KSL. 2. Note lowered eyebrows, an essential part of the sign.
description: S-Handshape with palm facing down is placed under chin. Hand opens into Full Open Handshape repetitively.
memory_aid: Hand opening under mouth is complaining.

title: Complain 2
note: 1. There is no difference in meaning between COMPLAIN 1 and COMPLAIN 2. They are variants of 'complain' in KSL. 2. Note the lowered eyebrows and movement of tongue. They are important parts of this sign. 3. KSL users consider this sign as part of KSL slang.
description: Extended Index Finger Handshape with palm facing signer points to throat repetitively.
memory_aid: Finger is pointing to complaining mouth.

title: Complete 1
note: 'Complete' as in to finish.
description: Right L-Handshape with palm facing left starts near the right cheek. Hand moves across and closes into Single-O Handshape.

title: Complete 2
note: 'Complete' as in whole.
description: Both Full Closed Handshapes with palms facing down start side by side. As hands turn up, they move away from one another in a circle. At the end they come back together touching at the fingers. Palms are facing up.

title: Completeness
description: Both Full Closed Handshapes with palms facing down start side by side. As hands turn up, they move away from one another in a circle. At the end they come back together touching at the fingers. Palms are facing up.

title: Complicated
note: Note lowered eyebrows, an important part of the sign.
description: Right hand is in S-Handshape with palm facing up. Back of right hand touches upon back of downturned left S-Handshape.

title: Compliment
description: Right Extended Index Finger Handshape with palm facing left points at mouth. It then changes into a Full Closed Handshape as it moves down to upturned left Full Closed Handshape. Right hand claps palm of left hand.

title: Complimentary
description: Both F-Handshapes with palms facing signer swing out so that palms face out.
memory_aid: F' for free which also means complimentary.

title: Comply
description: Both hands are in Bent-B Handshapes with palms facing down. The left hand is slightly behind and to the left of the right hand. Both hands move simultaneously forward and to the right.
memory_aid: Left hand is complying with right hand.

title: Component
description: Both hands are in Full Closed Handshapes. Right hand with palm facing left moves down on upturned palm of left hand.
memory_aid: A component of the left hand.

title: Compose
note: 'Compose' as in to write.
description: Right Single-O Handshape with palm facing out moves to right in slight up and down motions.
memory_aid: Looks like the action of writing.

title: Composition
note: 'Composition' as in writing.
description: Right Single-O Handshape with palm facing out moves to right in slight up and down motions.
memory_aid: Looks like the action of writing.

title: Compound
description: Both Extended Index Finger Handshapes with palms facing down start side by side and move away from each other then back together in a square-like motion.

title: Comprehend 1
note: There is no difference in meaning between COMPREHEND 1 and COMPREHEND 2. They are variants of 'comprehend' in KSL.
description: The S-Handshape with palm facing back is placed on side of the forehead. Index finger is then extended.
memory_aid: Light going on in the head.

title: Comprehend 2
note: 1. There is no difference in meaning between COMPREHEND 1 and COMPREHEND 2. They are variants of 'comprehend' in KSL. 2. Note the tongue sticking out. This is an essential part of the sign.
description: Flat-O Handshape with palm facing signer moves towards shoulder opening into Full Open Handshape.

title: Comprise
description: Finger of I-Handshape with palm facing signer taps upon palm of upturned left Full Closed Handshape.

title: Compromise
description: Both hands are in S-Handshapes with palms facing one another. Hands move down repetitively from wrists simultaneously.

title: Computer
description: Both Full Closed Handshapes with palms facing signer are held together. The right is in front of left. Right hand moves in a circular motion repetitively.

title: Computer Mouse
note: 1. This sign refers to a mouse used for a computer, not the animal. 2. While 'computer mouse' is a two-word phrase in English, it is one sign in KSL.
description: Right Modified-C Handshape with palm facing down is held on its side. Hand moves in a circular motion.
memory_aid: As if moving a computer mouse around.

title: Conceal
description: Both hands are in Full Closed Handshapes. Left hand is facing right while right hand is facing left. They are positioned in front of the face, one in front of the other. Hands move back and forth in opposite directions.

title: Concealment
description: Both hands are in Full Closed Handshapes. Left hand is facing right while right hand is facing left. They are positioned in front of the face, one in front of the other. Hands move back and forth in opposite directions.

title: Conceive
note: 'Conceive' as in to have an idea.
description: I-Handshape with palm facing signer starts by side of head. Hand moves out upward.

title: Concentrate
description: Both Full Closed Handshapes, fingers pointing up and palms facing one another, are held at the sides of face. They move straight out from the face as hands move down so that fingertips point away from signer.
memory_aid: Indicating the area where one is watching.

title: Concentration
description: Both Full Closed Handshapes, fingers pointing up and palms facing one another, are held at the sides of face. They move straight out from the face as hands move down so that fingertips point away from signer.
memory_aid: Indicating the area where one is watching.

title: Concept
description: I-Handshape with palm facing signer starts by side of head. Hand moves out upward.

title: Conception
description: I-Handshape with palm facing signer starts by side of head. Hand moves out upward.

title: Concern
note: Note the lowered eyebrows, an important part of the sign.
description: Full Open Handshapes with palms facing down are near temples of forehead. Hands move simultaneously in small outward circles.

title: Concerning
description: Extended Index Finger Handshapes are pointing at one another and move around one another in small circles.
memory_aid: Fingers are talking about one another.

title: Conclude
description: Right L-Handshape with palm facing left starts near the right cheek. Hand moves across and closes into Single-O Handshape.

title: Conclusion
description: Right Full Closed Handshape starts with palm facing up. It moves down and back towards right side of signer.
memory_aid: Indicating the past in the timeline.

title: Concur
description: Both hands are in S-Handshapes with palms facing one another. Hands move down repetitively from wrists simultaneously.

title: Condemn
note: Lowered eyebrows, pursed mouth, intense movement and turned head are all essential parts of this sign. All parts indicate intensity and negativity.
description: Both Extended Index Finger Handshapes are pointing left. Palms are facing one another. Hands move forward and slightly down repetitively.

title: Condition
description: Right Claw Handshape with palm facing down moves up and down on upturned left Full Closed Handshape.
memory_aid: A lot of information in hand.

title: Condom
description: Left Extended Index Finger Handshape with palm facing signer is pointing up. The right hand in an O-Handshape with palm facing signer moves down on left index finger. Left index finger is in the closed fingers of right hand.

note: STI protection device

note: STI protection device

memory_aid: Hands indicate the conduct of a person.

title: Conductor
note: The last part of this sign uses the sign PERSON.
description: The left hand is in a Curved-Three Handshape with palm facing signer. Right Extended Index Finger Handshape with palm facing left touches against back of the left fingers and then moves down repetitively. Both Full Closed Handshapes with palms facing one another move down simultaneously to waist level.
memory_aid: This imitates the way conductors hold money.

title: Conductor
note: Controller

title: Conductor
note: Controller

title: Confidence
description: Both hands are in S-Handshapes with palms facing signer. Arms move in close to the body and strike down slightly once.

title: Confident
description: Both hands are in S-Handshapes with palms facing signer. Arms move in close to the body and strike down slightly once.

title: Confidential
description: Thumbs-Up Handshape with palm facing signer traces a cross on the mouth. Then hand assumes K-Handshape. Palm is facing left and hand is tipped down. Thumb moves away from index and middle fingers and moves back down as wrist snaps.

title: Confirm
description: Both hands are in Full Closed Handshapes. Left hand is positioned in center of signing space with palm up and fingertips pointing right. Right hand, with palm facing left, moves down to touch upon palm of left hand. Once right hand touches down, it moves forward in a slightly up motion.
memory_aid: Arm goes in a straight direction, not off to the side as one would when untruthful.

title: Conform
description: Both hands are in Bent-B Handshapes with palms facing down. The left hand is slightly behind and to the left of the right hand. Both hands move simultaneously forward and to the right.
memory_aid: Left hand is conforming to dictates of the right hand.

title: Confounded
note: Facial expressions help indicate difference in degree of confusion. For example, a more emphatic facial expression would be the equivalent of 'bewildered' (which means 'really confused') while a lesser one would probably be best translated as 'confused'.
description: Both hands are in Claw Handshapes with palms facing one another. The right hand is directly above the left hand. Both hands move simultaneously in opposite circles.
memory_aid: How a mind looks when confounded.

title: Confused
note: Facial expressions help indicate difference in degree of confusion. For example, a more emphatic facial expression would be the equivalent of 'bewildered' (which means 'really confused') while a lesser one would probably be best translated as 'confused'.
description: Both hands are in Claw Handshapes with palms facing one another. The right hand is directly above the left hand. Both hands move simultaneously in opposite circles.
memory_aid: How a mind looks when confused.

title: Congo
note: Names of places are especially prone to variation. There may be another or a few other signs for 'Congo'.
description: Right hand is in the Claw Handshape with palm facing down. Hand makes downward repetitive motions from the wrist.
memory_aid: Right in the middle of Africa.

title: Congratulate
description: Right Extended Index Finger Handshape with palm facing left points at mouth. It then changes into a Full Closed Handshape as it moves down to upturned left Full Closed Handshape. Right hand claps palm of left hand.

title: Connect
description: Both hands are in Full Closed Handshapes with palms facing one another and thumbs up. They start at opposite ends of the signing space and come together until the palms touch.

title: Conscious 2

description: Full Closed Handshapes with palms facing signer touch sides of forehead. Hands move out to sides of signing space while wrists move out so that palms are facing out.
memory_aid: Mind is open, free of prejudice.

title: Consecrate
description: Full Closed Handshape with palm facing left and fingertips pointing out starts in front of face. Hand moves in a cross.
memory_aid: Looks like the gesture used in church.

title: Consensus
description: Both hands are in S-Handshapes with palms facing one another. Hands move down repetitively from wrists simultaneously.

title: Consent
description: Full Open Handshapes with palms facing down start in middle of signing space. Hands move in to touch the chest. As they move, hands close into Flat-O Handshapes.

title: Conservation
description: Left Full Closed Handshape with palm facing up is held out, slightly bent at base of fingers. The right hand, in same handshape as left hand but with palm facing down, covers the left in a light clapping motion.

title: Conserve
description: Left Full Closed Handshape with palm facing up is held out, slightly bent at base of fingers. The right hand, in same handshape as left hand but with palm facing down, covers the left in a light clapping motion.

title: Consider It Done
note: General conversation

title: Consist Of
note: While 'consist of' is a two-word phrase in English, it is one sign in KSL.
description: Finger of I-Handshape with palm facing signer taps upon palm of upturned left Full Closed Handshape.

title: Constantly
note: Note the lowering of eyebrows which indicate intensity.

title: Constitutional Rights
note: This is actually the KSL phrase 'HUMAN RIGHT'.
description: Both Full Closed Handshapes with palms facing one another move down simultaneously to waist level. Then left hand is positioned in center of signing space with palm up and fingertips pointing right. Right hand, with palm facing left, moves down to touch upon palm of left hand. Once right hand touches down, it moves forward in a slightly up motion.
memory_aid: Indicating the body and something one is entitled to.

title: Construct
note: 'Construct' as in to build something.
description: Both hands are in Full Closed Handshapes with palms facing signer. One hand is placed on top of the other alternately and repetitively.

title: Construction
description: Both hands are in Full Closed Handshapes with palms facing signer. One hand is placed on top of the other alternately and repetitively.

title: Contact 1
note: 'Contact' as in to get in touch with.
