description: Both hands are in Bent-V Handshapes with palms facing one another. Right hand is closer to signer. Hands move in together so that fingertips tap one another.
memory_aid: Two sets of eyes making contact.

title: Contact 2
note: 'Contact' as in to touch something.
description: Right hand, in a Bent-B Handshape with palm facing down, touches upon the downturned left Full Closed Handshape.

title: Contemporary 1
note: There is no difference in meaning between CONTEMPORARY 1 and CONTEMPORARY 2. They are variants of 'contemporary' in KSL.
description: I-Handshapes with palms facing out are at either side of signing space. Wrists turn hands back and up.
memory_aid: Hands turning up signifies something new.

title: Contemporary 2
note: There is no difference in meaning between CONTEMPORARY 1 and CONTEMPORARY 2. They are variants of 'contemporary' in KSL.
description: Right Thumbs-Up Handshape is held with thumb against right corner of mouth. Palm is facing out. Hand moves forward, turning until palm is facing signer.

title: Continue
description: Both Extended Index Finger Handshapes with palms facing signer are pointing at one another. They move forward in a circular motion alternately and repetitively.

title: Continuously
note: Note the lowering of eyebrows which indicate intensity.
description: Palm of Bent-B Handshape of right hand is facing signer. Hand moves in small outward circles, but stays in place.

title: Contrary
description: Extended Index Finger Handshapes with palms facing signer point at one another. They move out in a straight line in the opposite directions.
memory_aid: The two fingers are moving away from one another as if they contrast one another.

title: Contrast
description: Extended Index Finger Handshapes with palms facing signer point at one another. They move out in a straight line in the opposite directions.
memory_aid: The two fingers are moving away from one another as if they contrast one another.

title: Contrite
description: Right S-Handshape with palm facing signer is circled several times over the area of the heart.
memory_aid: Movement over the chest indicates heartfelt contrition.

title: Contrition
description: Right S-Handshape with palm facing signer is circled several times over the area of the heart.
memory_aid: Movement over the chest indicates heartfelt contrition.

title: Control
description: Both hands are in Small-T Handshapes with palms facing down. They are held next to each other. Hands move forward and back alternately.

title: Convenience
description: Both Full Open Handshapes with palms facing signer move slightly down closing into Flat-O Handshapes repetitively.
memory_aid: Hands seem to be squeezing something soft, not hard, indicating 'convenience'.

title: Convenient
description: Both Full Open Handshapes with palms facing signer move slightly down closing into Flat-O Handshapes repetitively.
memory_aid: Hands seem to be squeezing something soft, not hard, indicating 'convenient'.

title: Conversation
description: Extended Index Finger Handshapes with palms facing one another start by the mouth. Hands move out and back alternately and repetitively.
memory_aid: Fingers represent words being exchanged between two people.

title: Converse 1
note: 'Converse' as in to talk.
description: Extended Index Finger Handshapes with palms facing one another start by the mouth. Hands move out and back alternately and repetitively.
memory_aid: Fingers represent words being exchanged between two people.

title: Converse 2
note: 'Converse' as in the opposite.
description: Extended Index Finger Handshapes with palms facing signer point at one another. They move out in a straight line in the opposite directions.
memory_aid: The two fingers are moving away from one another as if they contrast one another.

title: Conversion
description: Both hands are in A-Handshapes with palms touching one another. The right hand is closest to the signer. Hands turn over still touching so that left hand is now closer to the signer.

title: Convert
description: Both hands are in A-Handshapes with palms touching one another. The right hand is closest to the signer. Hands turn over still touching so that left hand is now closer to the signer.

title: Cook 1
note: 1. 'Cook' as in a person who cooks. 2. While 'cook' is one word in English, it is a two-word phrase (COOK, PERSON) in KSL.
description: COOK - Extended Index Finger Handshapes with palms facing signer are pointing up. The hands move alternately up and down. PERSON - Both Full Closed Handshapes with palms facing one another move down simultaneously to waist level.
memory_aid: A person using fire to cook.

title: Cook 2
note: 'Cook' as in to cook food.
description: Extended Index Finger Handshapes with palms facing signer are pointing up. The hands move alternately up and down.

title: Cool
note: 1. 'Cool' as in feeling chilly. 2. Note lowered eyebrows and raised shoulders, essential parts of the sign.
description: Both S-Handshapes with palms facing each other are placed at sides of body. In this position the arms move in slightly and repetitively.

title: Cooperative House
note: Name of a building that acts like a headquarters for the co-operative bank

title: Copulate
description: Palm of right Full Closed Handshape is facing down. As hand moves slightly forward, hand moves up and down from wrist.
memory_aid: Movement of the body during sex.

title: Copulation
description: Palm of right Full Closed Handshape is facing down. As hand moves slightly forward, hand moves up and down from wrist.
memory_aid: Movement of the body during sex.

title: Copy
note: With the verb form of this sign the movement is done repetitively. The sign in this entry is a noun, which has only one movement.
description: Left hand is in Full Closed Handshape with palm facing up. Right Claw Handshape with palm facing up is positioned underneath left hand. Right hand moves down in a straight line as it closes into O-Handshape.
memory_aid: Taking from another piece of paper.

title: Cord
note: A long , thin, flexible length of twisted strands

title: Coriander
note: Annual herb used in many cuisines

title: Corn
description: Both hands are in Thumbs-Up Handshapes with palms facing one another. The thumb of the right hand is resting on top of thumb of the left hand. Right hand moves forward and downward repetitively.
memory_aid: As if pulling kernels of corn off a cob.

title: Corps
description: Both hands, in C-Handshapes with palms facing one another, start at opposite ends of signing space. They move towards one another simultaneously.

title: Correct 1
note: 'Correct' as in to correct a paper.
description: Right Extended Index Finger Handshape with palm facing left starts at head level and moves down in a repetitive check-like motion.

title: Correct 2
note: 'Correct' as in to be right.
description: Right Extended Index Finger Handshape with palm facing down is held upright with finger pointing left. Hand moves up in a check-like motion. Palm is then facing out and finger pointing up.

title: Corrupt
description: Both hands are in Flat-O Handshapes with palms facing signer. They move down repetitively and alternately.
memory_aid: As if stuffing money in one's shirt.

title: Corruption
description: Both hands are in Flat-O Handshapes with palms facing signer. They move down repetitively and alternately.
memory_aid: As if stuffing money in one's shirt.

title: Cost
description: Palms of both Small-T Handshapes are facing one another. Thumbs rub over tips of index fingers. Then both hands move up as they turn from wrists opening into Full Open Handshapes with palms facing up.

title: Costly
note: Note lowered eyebrows, an important part of the sign.
description: Right S-Handshape with palm facing left moves down in a straight line then moves directly back up as hand changes into Full Open Handshape that shakes up and down slightly.

title: Cough
note: To push air from the lungs in a quick, noisy explosion

title: Could I See The Menu, Please
note: At a restaurant

title: Counsel
description: Left hand is in Full Closed Handshape with palm facing down. Right O-Handshape is resting on top of left hand. Hand opens into Full Open Handshape and closes again into O-Handshape. This is done repetitively while right hand is still resting on left hand.

title: Counseling
note: Assistance in the resolution of personal difficulties

title: Counselling
description: Left hand is in Full Closed Handshape with palm facing down. Right O-Handshape is resting on top of left hand. Hand opens into Full Open Handshape and closes again into O-Handshape. This is done repetitively while right hand is still resting on left hand.

title: Count
description: Left hand is in a Claw Handshape with palm facing up. Right Extended Index Finger Handshape with palm facing signer touches upon fingers of left hand, which close after being touched.

title: Country
description: Claw Handshape with palm facing out moves in a circular motion.
memory_aid: The shape of a country on the map.

title: County
note: The territory of a nation

title: Courage
description: Both hands are in S-Handshapes with palms facing signer. Arms move in close to the body and strike down slightly once.

title: Courageous
description: Both hands are in S-Handshapes with palms facing signer. Arms move in close to the body and strike down slightly once.

title: Court
note: Place cases are heard and determined

title: Cousin
description: Right C-Handshape with palm facing left is shaken from side to side.

title: Cousin
note: Uncle's or aunt's son or daughter

title: Cover
note: A hiding from view/ a lid/ front and back of a book or magazine/ top sheet of a bed

title: Covet
description: Fingers of right hand, in Full Open Handshape with palm facing signer, move down repetitively on throat.

title: Cow
note: If signer wants to emphasize the femaleness of 'cow', sign FEMALE after COW. Or one could sign MILK after COW.
description: Both hands are in L-Handshapes with palms facing out. Thumbs touch the sides of forehead. Hands move in and out repetitively.

title: Coward
description: Right X-Handshape with palm facing left starts at bottom of signing space. Hand moves up so that palm is then facing up.

title: Coward 2
description: Right X-Handshape with palm facing left starts at bottom of signing space. Hand moves up so that palm is then facing up.

title: Crack
note: to break apart under pressure/ to form cracks

title: Craft
note: 'Craft' as in to make something.
description: Both hands are in Flat-O Handshapes. They are together, touching at the fingertips. Left hand is facing up and right hand is facing down. Right hand moves around fingers of left hand. As it is moving, it opens and closes.

title: Crammed
note: 'Crammed' as in no more room.
description: Right Full Open Handshape with palm facing down repetitively hits the side of the left hand which is in an S-Handshape.
memory_aid: Hitting upon hand means nothing more can be put there.

title: Crash
description: Both hands are in Thumbs-Up Handshapes with palms facing the signer. Hands move in towards one another and move up and away simultaneously as soon as they touch.

title: Crave
description: Fingers of right hand, in Full Open Handshape with palm facing signer, move down repetitively on throat.

title: Crazy
description: Right Extended Index Finger Handshape with palm facing down points to side of head and moves in a circular motion.
memory_aid: Things are mixed up in the head.

title: CRE
note: 'CRE' as in the school subject 'Christian Religion Education'.
description: Right Extended Index Finger Handshape with palm facing left points upward slightly and repetitively.

title: Create
description: Both hands are in Flat-O Handshapes. They are together, touching at the fingertips. Left hand is facing up and right hand is facing down. Right hand moves around fingers of left hand. As it is moving, it opens and closes.

title: Creation
description: Both hands are in Flat-O Handshapes. They are together, touching at the fingertips. Left hand is facing up and right hand is facing down. Right hand moves around fingers of left hand. As it is moving, it opens and closes.

title: Creature
description: Both Claw Handshapes with palms facing down are moving forward alternately.
memory_aid: Simulating the walking of a creature.

title: Crime
note: Against the law

title: Crisis
note: Note lowered eyebrows and tilted head, essential parts of the sign.
description: The left hand is in a Full Closed Handshape with palm facing right. Right Thumbs-Up Handshape with palm facing down touches palm of left hand repetitively.

title: Critical
note: Note head tilt, head nod and lowered eyebrows. These are essential parts of the sign.
description: Both hands, in Full Closed Handshapes with palms facing out, are at face level and moved simultaneously down to chest level.
memory_aid: Hands move over a critical object.

title: Criticise 1
note: 'Criticise' as in to tell someone they are wrong.
description: Right Extended Index Finger Handshape with palm facing out makes an 'X' in the air.
memory_aid: X' in the air indicates a criticism.

title: Criticise 2
note: 1. 'Criticise' as in to find fault in someone. 2. Lowered eyebrows, pursed mouth, intense movement and turned head are all essential parts of this sign. All parts indicate intensity and negativity.
description: Both Extended Index Finger Handshapes are pointing left. Palms are facing one another. Hands move forward and slightly down repetitively.

title: Criticism
description: Right Extended Index Finger Handshape with palm facing out makes an 'X' in the air.
memory_aid: X' in the air indicates a criticism.

title: Crook
description: Right V-Handshape with palm facing down and fingers pointing right starts at right side of signing space. Hand moves in as fingers close to form an S-Handshape.

title: Crop
note: Plant grown to be harvested as food

title: Cross
note: 'Cross' as in to cross the road.
description: Right hand is in Full Closed Handshape with palm facing left. Hand moves over downturned left Full Closed Handshape.

title: Cruel
note: While CRUEL shares the same sign as other English words like 'inhumane', 'mean', and 'rude', they have slightly different facial expressions. The more intense the meanness, the more intense the facial expression. Hence CRUEL gets a more intense facial expression than RUDE does.
description: Claw Handshapes with palms facing down rest upon either side of head. Hands move out simultaneously in a straight line.

title: Cruelty
note: While CRUEL shares the same sign as other English words like 'inhumane', 'mean', and 'rude', they have slightly different facial expressions. The more intense the meanness, the more intense the facial expression. Hence CRUEL gets a more intense facial expression than RUDE does.
description: Claw Handshapes with palms facing down rest upon either side of head. Hands move out simultaneously in a straight line.

title: Crush
note: Violent collision

title: Crush
note: Violent collision

title: Cry
note: 1. 'Cry' as in to cry tears. 2. While 'cry', 'sob', 'wail' and so on share the same essential meaning, they all differ in intensity. The same is true in KSL. The difference in intensity is indicated by facial expression and movement of hands.
description: Extended Index Finger Handshapes with palms facing signer are placed under each eye. They move down in straight lines repetitively.
memory_aid: Looks like tears falling down one's face.

title: Cry Out
note: 1. Note lowering of eyebrows and movement of mouth. These are important parts of the sign. 2. While 'cry out' is a two-word phrase in English, it is one sign in KSL.
description: S-Handshape with palm facing down is placed under chin. Hand opens into Full Open Handshape.
memory_aid: Hand opening means mouth is crying out.

title: Cultural
description: Both F-Handshapes with palms facing one another are linked. Hands move back and forth.
memory_aid: Culture is what links people together.

title: Culture
description: Both F-Handshapes with palms facing one another are linked. Hands move back and forth.
memory_aid: Culture is what links people together.

title: Culture 2
description: Both F-Handshapes with palms facing one another are linked. Hands move back and forth.
memory_aid: Culture is what links people together.

title: Cup
description: Right hand is in C-Handshape with palm facing left. It rests upon upturned left Full Closed Handshape. Right hand moves up and down on left hand.
memory_aid: Looks like the body of a cup.

title: Cure
note: Note mouth movement, an essential part of the sign.
description: Flat-O Handshapes with palms facing up move down simultaneously. As they move down, thumbs move forward so that hands become A-Handshapes.

title: Curriculum
description: Right C-Handshape with palm facing left moves down in steps on upright left Full Closed Handshape with palm facing out.
memory_aid: Indicates things listed on a curriculum.

title: Curse
description: Both Small-T Handshapes with palms facing one another are positioned at either end of signing space. Hands move up in circular motions.
memory_aid: Looks like the ritual gestures of a witch doctor.

title: Curtain
description: Both hands, in Small-T Handshapes and palms facing one another, start at opposite ends of signing space. With wrists moving from side to side, both hands move towards each other until they meet.

title: Customary
note: Note lowered eyebrows, an essential part of the sign.
description: U-Handshapes with palms facing one another are placed in center of signing space. Hands move up and down simultaneously.
memory_aid: Repetitive motion indicates something that happens a lot.

title: Customs
note: Traditions

title: Cut
note: 1. 'Cut' as in a wound. 2. While 'cut' is one word in English, it is a two-word phrase (SICK, CUT) in KSL.
description: SICK - Backside of Bent-B Handshape touches cheek. CUT - Fingertips of Bent-B Handshape with palm facing signer then move along backside of downturned left Full Closed Handshape.

title: D
description: Index finger is straight. Middle, ring and little fingers are partially folded. Tip of thumb is touching tip of middle finger. Palm is facing out.
memory_aid: Looks like a written 'd' from the back.

title: Daily
note: Note the lowering of eyebrows which indicate intensity.
description: Palm of Bent-B Handshape of right hand is facing signer. Hand moves in small outward circles, but stays in place.

title: Dale
description: Both hands are in Full Closed Handshapes with palms facing down. Hands start at opposite ends of signing space. Hands move down in arc to meet one another.
memory_aid: Indicates the shape of a dale.

title: Damage 1
note: 1. There is no difference in meaning between DAMAGE 1 and DAMAGE 2. They are variants of 'damage' in KSL. 2. Note the lowered eyebrows, mouth movement and tilted head. These are all important parts of the sign.
description: Both Small-T Handshapes with palms facing down are placed side by side. Hands move up and slightly away repetitively.

title: Damage 2
note: 1. There is no difference in meaning between DAMAGE 1 and DAMAGE 2. They are variants of 'damage' in KSL. 2. Note the lowered eyebrows, mouth movement and tilted head. These are all important parts of the sign.
description: Both hands are in A-Handshapes with palm of left hand facing up and palm of right hand facing down. Hands move in opposite directions with right hand always touching top of left hand.

title: Damp
description: Right Bent-B Handshape with palm facing signer taps backside of downturned left Full Closed Handshape.

title: Dance
description: Both hands are in F-Handshapes with palms facing out. They start chest high and move up and down in straight lines alternately.
memory_aid: Up and down movements look like dancing.

title: Dandora
note: Name of a place in Eastland's, with the biggest dumping sites

title: Danger
note: Note lowered eyebrows and sticking-out tongue. These are essential parts of the sign.
description: Right Extended Index Finger Handshape with palm facing left moves from side to side in front of mouth.
memory_aid: Something dangerous in front of face.

title: Danger 2
note: Note lowered eyebrows and sticking-out tongue. These are essential parts of the sign.
description: Right Extended Index Finger Handshape with palm facing left moves from side to side in front of mouth.
memory_aid: Something dangerous in front of face.

title: Dangerous
note: Note lowered eyebrows and sticking-out tongue. These are essential parts of the sign.
description: Right Extended Index Finger Handshape with palm facing left moves from side to side in front of mouth.
memory_aid: Something dangerous in front of face.

title: Dark
note: 'Dark' as in the night.
description: Both Full Closed Handshapes with palms facing signer are positioned at the sides of head. Both hands move down and towards one another simultaneously. They stop moving when right hand covers front of left hand.

title: Data
description: O-Handshapes with palms facing out are positioned in front of mouth. Hands move out to either side of the signing space as handshapes open into Full Open Handshapes. Palms are then facing down.

title: Date
description: Right Extended Index Finger Handshape with palm facing out is moved slightly side to side from the wrist.
memory_aid: Looks like the hand of a clock.

title: Daughter
note: The first part of this sign uses GIRL.
description: Right Thumbs-Up Handshape with palm facing up is placed on chest. Then hand moves down as hand opens into Full Closed Handshape with palm facing down.

title: David
note: Name of a Bible character, the second King of Israel

title: David
note: Name of a Bible character, the second King of Israel

title: Dawn
description: O-Handshape with palm facing up starts at side of signing space. While moving up, hand opens into Full Open Handshape.
memory_aid: The emerging rays of the sun.

title: Day
note: The handshape can be changed to a number to indicate number of days. Using a 3-Handshape instead of Extended Index Finger Handshape would indicate '3 days' and so on.
description: Right Extended Index Finger Handshape with palm facing left is held upright at side of signer. Arm moves down left to lie horizontally by chest of signer.
memory_aid: Progression of the sun from east to west.

title: Day School
note: School where children commute to and from

title: Daybreak
description: O-Handshape with palm facing up starts at side of signing space. While moving up, hand opens into Full Open Handshape.
memory_aid: The emerging rays of the sun.

title: Daylight
description: Both hands, in O-Handshapes with palms facing out, start side by side in center of signing space. Both hands move simultaneously outward away from each other in slight arc. Hands open into Full Open Handshapes.
memory_aid: Indicates light given out by some light source.

title: Dazed
note: Facial expressions help indicate difference in degree of confusion. For example, a more emphatic facial expression would be the equivalent of 'bewildered' (which means 'really confused') while a lesser one would probably be best translated as 'confused'.
description: Both hands are in Claw Handshapes with palms facing one another. The right hand is directly above the left hand. Both hands move simultaneously in opposite circles.
memory_aid: How a mind looks when dazed.

title: Dead
description: Full Closed Handshape with palm facing down comes up to touch the underside of chin.

title: Deaf
description: Right Full Closed Handshape with palm facing signer covers the right ear.

title: Death
description: Full Closed Handshape with palm facing down comes up to touch the underside of chin.

title: Debt
note: Own someone something

title: Decease
description: Full Closed Handshape with palm facing down comes up to touch the underside of chin.

title: December
note: Name of the 12th month

title: December
note: Name of the 12th month

title: Decide
description: Index fingers of both Full Open Handshapes with palms facing signer touch either side of forehead. Hands move down and change into F-Handshapes with palms facing one another.

title: Decision
description: Index fingers of both Full Open Handshapes with palms facing signer touch either side of forehead. Hands move down and change into F-Handshapes with palms facing one another.

title: Declaration
description: Both Extended Index Finger Handshapes with palms facing signer are pointing at chin. Hands move out and away from one another. Palms then face out.

title: Declare
description: Both Extended Index Finger Handshapes with palms facing signer are pointing at chin. Hands move out and away from one another. Palms then face out.

title: Decline
note: 'Decline' as in to say no.
description: Both arms with Full Closed Handshapes are held upright and crossed at the wrists. Palms are facing sides. Both hands move down to opposite sides of the signing space. Palms are then facing down.

title: Decontaminate
description: Both hands are in I-Handshapes with palms facing out. The right hand starts behind the left hand. Both move out, away from one another, in a straight line. Hands then come back together and away repetitively.

title: Decontamination
description: Both hands are in I-Handshapes with palms facing out. The right hand starts behind the left hand. Both move out, away from one another, in a straight line. Hands then come back together and away repetitively.

title: Decrease
note: Note the eyebrows lowering and the tongue sticking out. These are important parts of the sign.
description: Right L-Handshape with palm facing out moves down as fingers close into a Single-O Handshape.

title: Deduct
description: Right C-Handshape with palm facing left moves down on palm of left Full Closed Handshape with palm facing right. As right hand moves down, it flattens out into Full Open Handshape with palm facing down.

title: Deduction
description: Right C-Handshape with palm facing left moves down on palm of left Full Closed Handshape with palm facing right. As right hand moves down, it flattens out into Full Open Handshape with palm facing down.

title: Deed 1
note: 'Deed' as in something done.
description: The little-finger side of the right S-Handshape with palm facing left is brought down repetitively on top of the index finger side of the left S-Handshape with palm facing right.

title: Deed 2
note: 'Deed' as in an action.
description: Both hands are in S-Handshapes with palms facing signer. Right hand is closer to the body. While staying in place, both hands move alternately in circles away from the body.

title: Deep
note: Extending far down

title: Defect
note: Fault

title: Defence
description: Both S-Handshapes with palms facing sides are held upright crossed at the wrists. They move forward once.

title: Defend
description: Both S-Handshapes with palms facing sides are held upright crossed at the wrists. They move forward once.

title: Defer
description: Full Closed Handshape with palm facing signer and fingers pointing left moves in steps forward repetitively.

title: Deferment
description: Full Closed Handshape with palm facing signer and fingers pointing left moves in steps forward repetitively.

title: Deficient
description: Both Full Closed Handshapes with palms facing signer move back and forth in opposite directions. The fingers of both hands come in contact as they move pass each other.
memory_aid: Right hand is not with left hand.

title: Define
description: Left Full Closed Handshape with palm facing signer is pointing right. The right hand, in an O-Handshape with palm facing up, is underneath the left hand. As right hand moves forward repetitively, it opens into Full Open Handshape.

title: Definition
description: Left Full Closed Handshape with palm facing signer is pointing right. The right hand, in an O-Handshape with palm facing up, is underneath the left hand. As right hand moves forward repetitively, it opens into Full Open Handshape.

title: Degree
note: A stage of rank or proficiency

title: Dehydrated
description: Right Full Open Handshape with palm facing signer is placed on throat. Fingers move down the throat.

title: Dehydration
description: Right Full Open Handshape with palm facing signer is placed on throat. Fingers move down the throat.

title: Delayed
description: Right Full Closed Handshape starts with palm facing up. It moves down and back towards right side of signer.

title: Delete
description: Both hands are in Full Closed Handshapes. Right hand with palm facing left moves down to swipe across palm of upturned left hand. As right hand moves up, it closes into C-Handshape with palm facing signer.

title: Deletion
description: Both hands are in Full Closed Handshapes. Right hand with palm facing left moves down to swipe across palm of upturned left hand. As right hand moves up, it closes into C-Handshape with palm facing signer.

title: Delighted
description: Arms are bent with both S-Handshapes with palms facing signer by sides of chest. Arms move up and down in a flapping motion.
memory_aid: Delight is lifting up the arms.

title: Deliver
note: set free/ to do with birth/ bring something to its destination

title: Deliverance Church
note: Church

title: Demand
note: A need/ a claim for something

title: Demon
note: Bad spirit persons

title: Demon
note: Bad spirit persons

title: Demonstrate
note: The video shows the verb form of 'demonstrate' in which the movement is only done once. To do the noun form 'demonstration', the movement would become repetitive.
description: Right Extended Index Finger Handshape with palm facing signer is pointing to palm of outturned left Full Closed Handshape. Both hands move forward simultaneously in a straight line.
memory_aid: Pointing out something on the left hand for a demonstration.

title: Demonstrate
note: Show by example/ participate in a demonstration

title: Demonstrate
note: Show by example/ participate in a demonstration

title: Denmark
note: Names of places are especially prone to variation. There may be another or a few other signs for 'Denmark'.
description: V-Handshape with palm facing signer points left and moves up and down across the chest.
memory_aid: Looks like a boat out on the water.

title: Denounce
note: Lowered eyebrows, pursed mouth, intense movement and turned head are all essential parts of this sign. All parts indicate intensity and negativity.
description: Both Extended Index Finger Handshapes are pointing left. Palms are facing one another. Hands move forward and slightly down repetitively.

title: Depart
description: Right G-Handshape with palm facing left moves to the right while fingers close into a Single-O Handshape.
memory_aid: G' turns into an 'O', spelling G-O.

title: Department
note: Subdivision

title: Dependability
description: U-Handshapes with palms facing down tap right shoulder.

title: Dependable
description: U-Handshapes with palms facing down tap right shoulder.

title: Depends
description: Both F-Handshapes with palms facing one another are placed by right side of head. Right hand is above left hand. Hands move up and down in opposite directions repetitively.
memory_aid: Depends on what's going on in the head.

title: Depressed
note: Note lowered eyebrows and head. These are essential parts of the sign.
description: Claw Handshape with palm facing signer touches right cheek and moves out in a straight line.
memory_aid: Hand is like a bucket catching one's tears.

title: Deputy President
note: One who deputizes the president

title: Deputy President
note: One who deputizes the president

title: Deride
note: Lowered eyebrows, pursed mouth, intense movement and turned head are all essential parts of this sign. All parts indicate intensity and negativity.
description: Both Extended Index Finger Handshapes are pointing left. Palms are facing one another. Hands move forward and slightly down repetitively.

title: Describe
description: Left Full Closed Handshape with palm facing signer is pointing right. The right hand, in an O-Handshape with palm facing up, is underneath the left hand. As right hand moves forward repetitively, it opens into Full Open Handshape.

title: Description
description: Left Full Closed Handshape with palm facing signer is pointing right. The right hand, in an O-Handshape with palm facing up, is underneath the left hand. As right hand moves forward repetitively, it opens into Full Open Handshape.

title: Desert
description: Full Open Handshapes with palms facing signer are positioned at side of signing space. They move up from the wrists so that palms are now away from the signer.

title: Design
description: Left arm supports right arm. Right Small T-Handshape with palm facing left moves in an arc towards signer with repetitive motion.
memory_aid: Looks like one drawing a design.

title: Designate
description: F-Handshape starts with palm facing down. Hand moves up from wrist so that palm is facing out.

title: Designation
description: F-Handshape starts with palm facing down. Hand moves up from wrist so that palm is facing out.

title: Desire
description: Fingers of right hand, in Full Open Handshape with palm facing signer, move down repetitively on throat.

title: Desist 1
note: 1. 'Desist' as in to stop something. 2. Note lowered eyebrows, an important part of the sign.
description: Both hands are in Full Closed Handshapes. Left hand is held parallel to chest with palm facing signer. Palm of right hand is facing left. Right hand moves down in front of left hand.

title: Desist 2
note: 1. 'Desist' as in to command someone to stop something. 2. Note lowered eyebrows, an important part of the sign.
description: Full Closed Handshape with palm facing out moves forward.
memory_aid: Typical gesture when commanding one to stop.

title: Desk
description: Both hands are in Full Closed Handshapes with palms facing down. Hands start side by side and move out away from one another. They then turn so that palms are facing one another and move down simultaneously.
memory_aid: The top and legs of a desk.

title: Despite
note: Note tilted head and raised eyebrows. These are essential parts of the sign.
description: Both hands are in Extended Index Handshapes. Palms are facing away from signer. Fingers are touching so that they form an 'x'. Hands move out so that fingers point to either side of the signing space.
memory_aid: Fingers move in opposite directions indicating otherwise.

title: Destitute
note: Note lowered eyebrows, an important part of the sign.
description: Right Claw Handshape with palm facing signer is positioned at elbow of upright bent left arm. Fingers of right hand move down elbow of left arm.

title: Destroy 1
note: 1. There is no difference in meaning between DESTROY 1 and DESTROY 2. They are variants of 'destroy' in KSL. 2. Note the lowered eyebrows, mouth movement and tilted head. These are all important parts of the sign.
description: Both Small-T Handshapes with palms facing down are placed side by side. Hands move up and slightly away repetitively.
memory_aid: Looks like the destruction of something.

title: Destroy 2
note: 1. There is no difference in meaning between DESTROY 1 and DESTROY 2. They are variants of 'destroy' in KSL. 2. Note the lowered eyebrows, mouth movement and tilted head. These are all important parts of the sign.
description: Both hands are in A-Handshapes with palm of left hand facing up and palm of right hand facing down. Hands move in opposite directions with right hand always touching top of left hand.

title: Destruction 1
note: 1. There is no difference in meaning between DESTRUCTION 1 and DESTRUCTION 2. They are variants of 'destruction' in KSL. 2. Note the lowered eyebrows, mouth movement and tilted head. These are all important parts of the sign.
description: Both Small-T Handshapes with palms facing down are placed side by side. Hands move up and slightly away repetitively.
memory_aid: Looks like the destruction of something.

title: Destruction 2
note: 1. There is no difference in meaning between DESTRUCTION 1 and DESTRUCTION 2. They are variants of 'destruction' in KSL. 2. Note the lowered eyebrows, mouth movement and tilted head. These are all important parts of the sign.
description: Both hands are in A-Handshapes with palm of left hand facing up and palm of right hand facing down. Hands move in opposite directions with right hand always touching top of left hand.

title: Detach
description: Both hands are in Bent-B Handshapes with palms facing signer. Backs of hands are touching one another and then move away directly from one another in a straight line.

title: Detachment
description: Both hands are in Bent-B Handshapes with palms facing signer. Backs of hands are touching one another and then move away directly from one another in a straight line.

title: Detain
description: Both Full Open Handshapes with palms facing out move down and forward while hands close into S-Handshapes with palms facing down.

title: Deter
description: Both hands are in Full Closed Handshapes. Left hand is held horizontally in front of signer with palm facing in. Right hand is held to side of signer with palm facing left. Right hand moves to palm of left hand.

title: Determine
description: Index fingers of both Full Open Handshapes with palms facing signer touch either side of forehead. Hands move down and change into F-Handshapes with palms facing one another.

title: Deterrent
description: Both hands are in Full Closed Handshapes. Left hand is held horizontally in front of signer with palm facing in. Right hand is held to side of signer with palm facing left. Right hand moves to palm of left hand.

title: Detrimental
description: The left arm, in an S-Handshape with palm facing signer, is held upright while right Full Closed Handshape with palm facing signer slaps the left elbow.
memory_aid: As if slapping someone for behaving badly.

title: Development
note: Progress

title: Devil
note: Leader of demons

title: Devoid
description: Both Full Closed Handshapes with palms facing signer move back and forth in opposite directions. The fingers of both hands come in contact as they move pass each other.
memory_aid: Right hand is not with left hand.

title: Dew
note: Moisture in the air that settles on plants

title: Diabetes
note: Inability to produce or metabolize insulin

title: Diagnose
description: Right X-Handshape with palm facing signer taps the side of left arm. Both hands then assume C-Handshapes with palms facing one another. They are positioned in center of signing space with right hand above left hand. Hands both twist up and down from the wrists repetitively.
memory_aid: Indicates the armband of a medical worker and the lens of a microscope.

title: Diagnosis
description: Right X-Handshape with palm facing signer taps the side of left arm. Both hands then assume C-Handshapes with palms facing one another. They are positioned in center of signing space with right hand above left hand. Hands both twist up and down from the wrists repetitively.
memory_aid: Indicates the armband of a medical worker and the lens of a microscope.

title: Diameter
note: radius x2

title: Diarrhea
note: A condition in which the sufferer has frequent and watery bowel movements

title: Diary
note: A book where one records his daily events

title: Dictionary
note: To do the movement repetitively is to say 'a big vocabulary'.
description: Left A-Handshape is held upright with palm facing right. The thumb of right Thumbs-Up Handshape touches palm of left hand. Right hand moves away and turns into A-Handshape.

title: Dictionary
note: Book containing words and their meaning in a particular language

title: Did You Get My Text?
note: Family and relationships

title: Die
description: Full Closed Handshape with palm facing down comes up to touch the underside of chin.

title: Diet
note: 'Diet' as in a person's usual food.
description: Right Flat-O Handshape with palm facing down taps repetitively on the mouth.

title: Differ
note: While 'differ' is one word in English, it is a two-sign phrase (AGREE, NOTHING) in KSL.
description: AGREE - Both hands are in S-Handshapes with palms facing out. Hands move down repetitively from wrists simultaneously. NOTHING - Then both hands change to O-Handshapes with palms facing out. Starting near mouth, they move out away from one another to the sides while opening into Full Open Handshapes.
memory_aid: Two heads agreeing not at all.

title: Difference
description: Extended Index Finger Handshapes with palms facing out are held upright. Left hand moves forward while finger of right hand bounces off and turns away from left finger. Palm of right hand is then facing signer.

title: Different
description: Extended Index Finger Handshapes with palms facing out are held upright. Left hand moves forward while finger of right hand bounces off and turns away from left finger. Palm of right hand is then facing signer.

title: Difficult
note: Note lowering of eyebrows, which is an essential part of this sign.
description: Both hands, in S-Handshapes with palms facing signer, are held upright. Arms move back and forth simultaneously and repetitively.

title: Difficulty
note: Note lowering of eyebrows, which is an essential part of this sign.
description: Both hands, in S-Handshapes with palms facing signer, are held upright. Arms move back and forth simultaneously and repetitively.

title: Digest
note: To separate food in its passage through the alimentary canal into the nutritive and non-nutritive parts

title: Digo
note: Names of tribes are especially prone to variation. There may be another or a few other signs for 'Digo'.
description: Both hands are in Full Closed Handshapes with palms facing signer. They touch the face, the right hand on the forehead and the left on the mouth.

title: Dilemma
note: Note lowered eyebrows and tilted head, essential parts of the sign.
description: The left hand is in a Full Closed Handshape with palm facing right. Right Thumbs-Up Handshape with palm facing down touches palm of left hand repetitively.

title: Diminish
note: Note the eyebrows lowering and the tongue sticking out. These are important parts of the sign.
description: Right L-Handshape with palm facing out moves down as fingers close into a Single-O Handshape.

title: Dine
note: Normally 'dine' is signed with one movement. To use repetitive motion as indicated in the video means 'dining'.
description: Right Flat-O Handshape with palm facing down taps repetitively on the mouth.

title: Dining Room
description: EAT - Right Flat-O Handshape with palm facing down taps repetitively on the mouth. ROOM - Both Extended Index Finger Handshapes with palms facing down start side by side and move away from each other then back together in a square-like motion.
memory_aid: Action of eating, shape of room.

title: Dinner
note: While 'dinner' is one word in English, it is a two-word phrase (EAT, EVENING) in KSL.
description: EAT - Right Flat-O Handshape with palm facing down taps repetitively on the mouth. EVENING - Right hand is in Full Closed Handshape with palm down. Hand moves to left end of signing space and moves back and forth slightly.
memory_aid: Action of eating, position of sun.

title: Dip
note: A trough where cattle or sheep are immersed in chemicals to kill parasites

title: Direct 1
note: 'Direct' as in to explain something.
description: Left Full Closed Handshape with palm facing signer is pointing right. The right hand, in an O-Handshape with palm facing up, is underneath the left hand. As right hand moves forward repetitively, it opens into Full Open Handshape.

title: Direct 2
note: 'Direct' as in to manage something.
description: Both hands are in Small-T Handshapes with palms facing down. They are held next to each other. Hands move forward and back alternately.

title: Direction
description: Left Full Closed Handshape with palm facing signer is pointing right. The right hand, in an O-Handshape with palm facing up, is underneath the left hand. As right hand moves forward repetitively, it opens into Full Open Handshape.

title: Director
description: Both hands are in Small-T Handshapes with palms facing down. They are held next to each other. Hands move forward and back alternately.

title: Dirty
note: Note the lowered eyebrows and scrunched face, important parts of the sign.
description: Right Extended Index Finger Handshape with palm facing left moves from side to side in front of face.
memory_aid: Hand seems to be waving away an unpleasant odour.

title: Disagree
note: While 'disagree' is one word in English, it is a two-sign phrase (AGREE, NOTHING) in KSL.
description: AGREE - Both hands are in S-Handshapes with palms facing out. Hands move down repetitively from wrists simultaneously. NOTHING - Then both hands change to O-Handshapes with palms facing out. Starting near mouth, they move out away from one another to the sides while opening into Full Open Handshapes.
memory_aid: Two heads agreeing not at all.

title: Disagreement
note: While 'disagreement' is one word in English, it is a two-sign phrase (AGREE, NOTHING) in KSL.
description: AGREE - Both hands are in S-Handshapes with palms facing out. Hands move down repetitively from wrists simultaneously. NOTHING - Then both hands change to O-Handshapes with palms facing out. Starting near mouth, they move out away from one another to the sides while opening into Full Open Handshapes.
memory_aid: Two heads agreeing not at all.

title: Disappearance
note: Out of sight

title: Discard
description: Both O-Handshapes with palms facing out are held in front of face. Right hand is slightly ahead of left hand. Both hands move simultaneously forward and down as hands open into Full Open Handshapes.

title: Discharge
note: 'Discharge' as in to free.
description: Both S-Handshapes with palms facing signer are crossed in front of the body. Hands swing out so that palms face out.
memory_aid: Hands look like they are breaking free from some kind of bind.

title: Discharged
note: send away/ expel/ release

title: Discipline
description: Right Extended Index Finger Handshape with palm facing down is in upturned A-Handshape of left hand. Right hand moves out and down as wrist snaps.

title: Disco
description: Both hands are in F-Handshapes with palms facing out. They start chest high and move up and down in straight lines alternately.
memory_aid: Up and down movements look like dancing.

title: Discombobulated
note: Facial expressions help indicate difference in degree of confusion. For example, a more emphatic facial expression would be the equivalent of 'bewildered' (which means 'really confused') while a lesser one would probably be best translated as 'confused'.
description: Both hands are in Claw Handshapes with palms facing one another. The right hand is directly above the left hand. Both hands move simultaneously in opposite circles.
memory_aid: How a mind looks when discombobulated.

title: Disconnect
description: Both hands are in Bent-B Handshapes with palms facing signer. Backs of hands are touching one another and then move away directly from one another in a straight line.

title: Disconnection
description: Both hands are in Bent-B Handshapes with palms facing signer. Backs of hands are touching one another and then move away directly from one another in a straight line.

title: Disconsolate
note: Note lowered eyebrows and head. These are essential parts of the sign.
description: Claw Handshape with palm facing signer touches right cheek and moves out in a straight line.
memory_aid: Hand is like a bucket catching one's tears.

title: Discontinue 1
note: 1. 'Discontinue' as in to stop something. 2. Note lowered eyebrows, an important part of the sign.
description: Both hands are in Full Closed Handshapes. Left hand is held parallel to chest with palm facing signer. Palm of right hand is facing left. Right hand moves down in front of left hand.

title: Discontinue 2
note: 1. 'Discontinue' as in to command someone to stop something. 2. Note lowered eyebrows, an important part of the sign.
description: Full Closed Handshape with palm facing out moves forward.
memory_aid: Typical gesture when commanding one to stop.

title: Discount
description: L-Handshape with palm facing out starts in center of signing space. Hand moves down as handshape turns into Single-O Handshape.
memory_aid: Pile of money needed is small.

title: Discount
note: To deduct from a n account

title: Discouraged
description: Right Full Open Handshape with palm facing out is held in front of face and moved in downward circles.
memory_aid: As if something were obstructing one repetitively, keeping one from being able to do anything.

title: Discover
description: Full Open Handshape starts with palm facing down. As hand moves up, handshape closes into a Flat-O Handshape. Palm is now facing out.
memory_aid: Picking up something that has been discovered.

title: Discuss
description: Extended Index Finger Handshapes with palms facing one another start by the mouth. Hands move out and back alternately and repetitively.
memory_aid: Fingers represent words being exchanged between two people.

title: Discussion
description: Extended Index Finger Handshapes with palms facing one another start by the mouth. Hands move out and back alternately and repetitively.
memory_aid: Fingers represent words being exchanged between two people.

title: Disease
note: Appropriate facial expression is important.
description: Backside of Bent-B Handshape touches cheek.

title: Disfellowship
note: Excommunicate

title: Disgrace
note: Being out of favor

title: Disgust
note: To cause an intense dislike

title: Dish
description: Both Full Closed Handshapes with palms facing up are held together at fingertips. They are then separated and brought around in a circle so that they reconnect at the heels.

title: Disinfect
description: Both hands are in I-Handshapes with palms facing out. The right hand starts behind the left hand. Both move out, away from one another, in a straight line. Hands then come back together and away repetitively.

title: Dislike
description: Fingers of the right hand, in a Full Open Handshape with palm facing signer, touch the throat. Hand turns out from wrist while moving down and out.

title: Dismay
note: Appropriate facial expression should accompany this sign. See FEAR.
description: Right O-Handshape with palm facing left rests over the heart. Hand opens and closes repetitively into a Full Open Handshape.

title: Disobedient
note: Lowered eyebrows, shrugged shoulders, shaking head and pursed lips are all important parts of the sign. They all indicate carelessness.
description: Full Open Handshapes start at center of signing space with palms facing down. They move up to either side of signing space with palms facing up.

title: Disparage
note: Lowered eyebrows, pursed mouth, intense movement and turned head are all essential parts of this sign. All parts indicate intensity and negativity.
description: Both Extended Index Finger Handshapes are pointing left. Palms are facing one another. Hands move forward and slightly down repetitively.

title: Display
note: The video shows the verb form of 'display' in which the movement is only done once. To do the noun form 'display', the movement would become repetitive.
description: Right Extended Index Finger Handshape with palm facing signer is pointing to palm of outturned left Full Closed Handshape. Both hands move forward simultaneously in a straight line.
memory_aid: Pointing out something on the left hand for display.

title: Dispute
note: While 'dispute' is one word in English, it is a two-sign phrase (AGREE, NOTHING) in KSL.
description: AGREE - Both hands are in S-Handshapes with palms facing out. Hands move down repetitively from wrists simultaneously. NOTHING - Then both hands change to O-Handshapes with palms facing out. Starting near mouth, they move out away from one another to the sides while opening into Full Open Handshapes.
memory_aid: Two heads agreeing not at all.

title: Disregard
description: Base of C-Handshape with palm facing up starts near nose. Hand moves out slightly sideways.
memory_aid: Turning the nose up on someone.

title: Disrupt
note: Note the lowered eyebrows which indicate negativity. This is an important part of the sign.
description: Right Bent-B Handshape with palm facing down taps right shoulder repetitively.

title: Disruption
note: Note the lowered eyebrows which indicate negativity. This is an important part of the sign.
description: Right Bent-B Handshape with palm facing down taps right shoulder repetitively.

title: Dissent
note: While 'dissent' is one word in English, it is a two-sign phrase (AGREE, NOTHING) in KSL.
description: AGREE - Both hands are in S-Handshapes with palms facing out. Hands move down repetitively from wrists simultaneously. NOTHING - Then both hands change to O-Handshapes with palms facing out. Starting near mouth, they move out away from one another to the sides while opening into Full Open Handshapes.
memory_aid: Two heads agreeing not at all.

title: Dissimilar
description: Extended Index Finger Handshapes with palms facing out are held upright. Left hand moves forward while finger of right hand bounces off and turns away from left finger. Palm of right hand is then facing signer.

title: Dissolution
note: Note mouth movement, an essential part of the sign.
description: Flat-O Handshapes with palms facing up move down simultaneously. As they move down, thumbs move forward so that hands become A-Handshapes.

title: Dissolve
note: Note mouth movement, an essential part of the sign.
description: Flat-O Handshapes with palms facing up move down simultaneously. As they move down, thumbs move forward so that hands become A-Handshapes.

title: Distant
note: 1. 'Distant' as in faraway. 2. Note the lowered eyebrows, an important part of the sign.
description: Right hand starts near face in an O-Handshape with palm facing out. Hand moves forward while changing into Full Open Handshape.
memory_aid: Throwing a spear to measure the distance.

title: Distinct
description: Extended Index Finger Handshapes with palms facing out are held upright. Left hand moves forward while finger of right hand bounces off and turns away from left finger. Palm of right hand is then facing signer.

title: Distinction
description: Extended Index Finger Handshapes with palms facing out are held upright. Left hand moves forward while finger of right hand bounces off and turns away from left finger. Palm of right hand is then facing signer.

title: Distract
note: Note the lowered eyebrows which indicate negativity. This is an important part of the sign.
description: Right Bent-B Handshape with palm facing down taps right shoulder repetitively.

title: Distribute
description: Both Flat-O Handshapes with palms facing down are together in center of signing space. They move out and away from one another as hands open into Full Open Handshapes.

title: Distribution
description: Both Flat-O Handshapes with palms facing down are together in center of signing space. They move out and away from one another as hands open into Full Open Handshapes.

title: District
note: An administrative division of an area

title: Disturb
note: Note the lowered eyebrows which indicate negativity. This is an important part of the sign.
description: Right Bent-B Handshape with palm facing down taps right shoulder repetitively.

title: Disturb
note: To confuse a constant quiet state

title: Disturbance
note: Note the lowered eyebrows which indicate negativity. This is an important part of the sign.
description: Right Bent-B Handshape with palm facing down taps right shoulder repetitively.

title: Dither
description: Both hands are in Full Closed Handshapes. Left hand is parallel to waist with palm facing up. Little-finger side of right hand is placed upon palm of left hand and moves side to side.
memory_aid: The right hand is swaying to and fro with indecision.

title: Dithering
description: Both hands are in Full Closed Handshapes. Left hand is parallel to waist with palm facing up. Little-finger side of right hand is placed upon palm of left hand and moves side to side.
memory_aid: The right hand is swaying to and fro with indecision.

title: Dive
note: To swim under water/ to jump into water head-first

title: Diverse
description: Both Extended Index Finger Handshapes with palms facing down are positioned in the center of the signing space pointing out. Hands move up and down alternately.
memory_aid: The different levels in a group.

title: Diversity
description: Both Extended Index Finger Handshapes with palms facing down are positioned in the center of the signing space pointing out. Hands move up and down alternately.
memory_aid: The different levels in a group.

title: Divide
note: 'Divide' as in maths.
description: Left Extended Index Finger Handshape with palm facing down is pointing right. Right X-Handshape with palm facing out taps once above the left finger and again below.

title: Division
note: 'Division' as in maths.
description: Left Extended Index Finger Handshape with palm facing down is pointing right. Right X-Handshape with palm facing out taps once above the left finger and again below.

title: Divorce
note: The legal dissolution of a marriage

title: Divorce
note: The legal dissolution of a marriage

title: Divorce 1
note: 'Divorce' in this case refers to a traditional divorce, where one simply moves out of the house.
description: Both hands are in Bent-B Handshapes with palms facing signer. Backs of hands are touching one another and then move away directly from one another in a straight line.

title: Divorce 2
note: 'Divorce' in this case refers to disintegration of church marriages.
description: Right O-Handshape with palm facing signer moves over and away from ring finger of inturned left Full Open Handshape.

title: Diwali
note: Hinduism annual festival of light

title: Do 1
note: There is no difference in meaning between DO 1 and DO 2. They are variants of 'do' in KSL.
description: The little-finger side of the right S-Handshape with palm facing left is brought down repetitively on top of the index finger side of the left S-Handshape with palm facing right.

title: Do 2
note: There is no difference in meaning between DO 1 and DO 2. They are variants of 'do' in KSL.
description: Both hands are in S-Handshapes with palms facing signer. Right hand is closer to the body. While staying in place, both hands move alternately in circles away from the body.

title: Do I Know You?
note: getting to know each other

title: Do Not
note: 1. This sign serves as a negator in KSL. For example, 'I do not go to the beach' would be signed as ME GO BEACH DO-NOT. 2. Note lowered eyebrows, an essential part of the sign. 3. While 'do not' is a two-word phrase in English, it is one sign in KSL.
description: Both O-Handshapes with palms facing out are held near mouth. They move out away from one another to the sides while opening into Full Open Handshapes.

title: Do Not Disturb
note: Hotels and accomodation

title: Do Not Enter
note: Hotels and accomodation

title: Do You Believe In God?
note: Religion

title: Do You Come Here Often?
note: Making friends

title: Do You Have A Boyfriend?
note: Dating and romance

title: Do You Have A Boyfriend?
note: Dating and romance

title: Do You Have A Girl Friend?
note: Dating and romance

title: Do You Have A Girl Friend?
note: Dating and romance

title: Do You Have Children?
note: Dating and romance

title: Do You Know?
note: General conversation

title: Do You Like It?
note: General conversation

title: Do You Need Help?
note: Emergencies

title: Do You Speak English?
note: Making friends

title: Doable
note: Note raised eyebrows and raised chin. These are important parts of the sign.
description: Both hands are in S-Handshapes with palms facing down. They move up and down from the wrists.

title: Doctor
note: While 'doctor' is one word in English, it is a two-word phrase (MEDICAL, PERSON) in KSL.
description: MEDICAL - Right X-Handshape with palm facing signer taps the side of the left arm. PERSON - Both Full Closed Handshapes with palms facing one another move down simultaneously to waist level.

title: Does Anyone Here Speak English?
note: asking for direction

title: Dog
note: To specify the breed of a dog, fingerspell.
description: The right hand assumes the Full Open Handshape with palm facing out. The back of the hand is near the right cheek. Hand moves sideways repetitively.
memory_aid: The floppy ears of a dog.

title: Doll
note: A toy in the form of a woman

title: Domestic
description: Right Extended Index Finger Handshape with palm facing signer touches tip of nose.
memory_aid: Home is center of life like nose is center of face.

title: Domestic Violence
note: Violence against another in an intimate relationship

title: Domestic Violence 1
note: Violence against another in an intimate relationship

title: Domicile
note: Domicile as in place a person lives
description: Right Extended Index Finger Handshape with palm facing signer touches tip of nose.
memory_aid: Home is center of life like nose is center of face.

title: Dominance
description: Both hands are in Small-T Handshapes with palms facing down. They are held next to each other. Hands move forward and back alternately.

title: Dominant
description: Both hands are in Small-T Handshapes with palms facing down. They are held next to each other. Hands move forward and back alternately.

title: Dominate
description: Both hands are in Small-T Handshapes with palms facing down. They are held next to each other. Hands move forward and back alternately.

title: Done
description: Right L-Handshape with palm facing left starts near the right cheek. Hand moves across and closes into Single-O Handshape.

title: Donholm
note: Name of a place in Eastland's, along jogoo road

title: Donkey
description: Both B-Handshapes with palms facing signer are touching sides of the forehead. Remaining on sides of the forehead, both hands slightly move back and forth simultaneously in opposite directions. Lips of mouth move side to side while hands move.
memory_aid: Ears of a donkey, movement of mouth.

title: Donkey
note: A domestic animal

title: Don't
note: 1. This sign serves as a negator in KSL. For example, 'Don't hit your brother' would be signed as HIT BROTHER YOUR DON'T. 2. Note lowered eyebrows, an essential part of the sign. 3. While 'don't' is a contraction for 'do not' in English, it is one sign in KSL.
description: Both O-Handshapes with palms facing out are held near mouth. They move out away from one another to the sides while opening into Full Open Handshapes.

title: Don't Care
note: 1. While 'don't care' is a two-word (or three-word) phrase in English, it is one sign in KSL. 2. Lowered eyebrows, shrugged shoulders, shaking head and pursed lips are all important parts of the sign. They all indicate carelessness.
description: Full Open Handshapes start at center of signing space with palms facing down. They move up to either side of signing space with palms facing up.
memory_aid: Looks like someone who does not care.

title: Don't Like
note: While 'don't like' is a two-word (or three-word) phrase in English, it is one sign in KSL.
description: Fingers of the right hand, in a Full Open Handshape with palm facing signer, touch the throat. Hand turns out from wrist while moving down and out.
memory_aid: Throwing away something one does not like.

title: Don't Want
note: While 'don't want' is a two-word (or three-word) phrase in English, it is one sign in KSL.
description: Fingers of the right hand, in a Full Open Handshape with palm facing signer, touch the throat. Hand turns out from wrist while moving down and out.
memory_aid: Throwing away something one does not want.

title: Don't Worry
note: General conversation

title: Don't Worry
note: General conversation

title: Don't Worry
note: General conversation

title: Door
description: Right hand in Small-T Handshape and palm facing left moves towards and away from signer repetitively.

title: Doubt
note: Not sure

title: Down 1
note: 'Down' as in indicating position.
description: Right Extended Index Finger Handshape with palm facing signer points down once.

title: Down 2
note: 1. 'Down' as in sad. 2. Note lowered eyebrows and head. These are essential parts of the sign.
description: Claw Handshape with palm facing signer touches right cheek and moves out in a straight line.
memory_aid: Hand is like a bucket catching one's tears.

title: Downward
note: 'Down' as in indicating position.
description: Right Extended Index Finger Handshape with palm facing signer points down once.

title: Doze
description: Both hands are placed together in Full Closed Handshapes with palms facing one another. The signer's head leans to the right and rests on the back of the left hand.

title: Drag
description: Both X-Handshapes are linked. Palm of right hand is facing down while palm of left hand is facing signer. Both hands move to right simultaneously.
memory_aid: The right is dragging the left.

title: Dragon
note: Flying creature that breaths fire

title: Dragon
note: Flying creature that breaths fire

title: Drain
note: A conduit allowing fluids to flow

title: Drama
note: Acting in a stage

title: Draw
description: Left arm supports right arm. Right Small T-Handshape with palm facing left moves in an arc towards signer with repetitive motion.

title: Drawing
description: Left arm supports right arm. Right Small T-Handshape with palm facing left moves in an arc towards signer with repetitive motion.

title: Dread
note: Appropriate facial expression should accompany this sign. See FEAR.
description: Right O-Handshape with palm facing left rests over the heart. Hand opens and closes repetitively into a Full Open Handshape.

title: Dreadful
description: The left arm, in an S-Handshape with palm facing signer, is held upright while right Full Closed Handshape with palm facing signer slaps the left elbow.
memory_aid: As if slapping someone for behaving badly.

title: Dream
description: Right Extended Index Finger Handshape with palm facing down is placed on forehead. As hand moves down repetitively, handshape closes into X-Handshape.
memory_aid: What happens in a head when one dreams.

title: Dream Up
note: 1. Note the mouth movement 'wah wah wah'. This is an essential part of the sign. 2. While 'dream up' is a two-word phrase in English, it is one sign in KSL.
description: Finger of X-Handshape with palm facing signer touches side of forehead. It moves up and down repetitively.
memory_aid: Different things coming from the head.

title: Dreary
note: Appropriate facial expression is important for this sign. One should lower eyebrows and otherwise indicate boredom.
description: Right Full Closed Handshape with palm facing signer taps mouth.

title: Drenched
description: Right Bent-B Handshape with palm facing signer taps backside of downturned left Full Closed Handshape.

title: Dress 1
note: 1. 'Dress' as in female attire. 2. The first part of this sign uses the sign CLOTHES.
description: Right Single-O Handshape with palm facing signer touches the right shoulder. Then both hands, in Full Open Handshapes with palms facing signer, line the body with the thumbs.

title: Dress 2
note: 'Dress' as in to put on clothes.
description: Flat-O Handshapes with palms facing up start at shoulders. They move down simultaneously to waist.

title: Dress Smart
note: Family and relationships

title: Dress Smart
note: Family and relationships

title: Dressing
note: 'Dressing' as in bandage.
description: Both hands are in Full Closed Handshapes with palms facing down. The left arm is held horizontally in the air while the right hand moves around the left arm.

title: Drink
description: Right C-Handshape with palm facing left moves up to open lips. At lips, wrist turns upwards.
memory_aid: An imaginary glass is tipped at the open lips.

title: Drive 1
note: 'Drive' as in to drive a car.
description: Both S-Handshapes with palms facing signer are held in front of body. Hands move up and down alternately and repetitively.

title: Drive 2
note: 'Drive' as in to force one to do something.
description: Slightly curved Full Open Handshapes with palms facing out are positioned at either side of signing space. Hands move forward once in a strong motion.
memory_aid: Hands pushing one to do something.

title: Driver
note: While 'driver' is one word in English, it is a two-word phrase (DRIVE, PERSON) in KSL.
description: DRIVE - Both S-Handshapes with palms facing signer are held in front of body. Hands move up and down alternately and repetitively. PERSON - Both Full Closed Handshapes with palms facing one another move down simultaneously to waist level.

title: Droll
description: Right Extended Index Finger Handshape with palm facing down moves under chin in a straight line and then wrist snaps moving the finger downward.

title: Drop
note: let go

title: Drug
note: 'Drug' as in medicine.
description: The right hand is in an S-Handshape which faces the chin. The index finger pops out repetitively towards the mouth.

title: Drug
note: Medicine

title: Drum
description: Both Full Closed Handshapes with palms facing down move up and down alternately.

title: Drunk
description: Full Open Handshape with palm facing signer starts at front of head and moves back closing into an S-Handshape.

title: Dry
note: Note lowered eyebrows, an important part of this sign.
description: Extended Index Finger Handshape with palm facing down is placed below mouth and moves to side of face while closing into X-Handshape.

title: Dull
note: Appropriate facial expression is important for this sign. One should lower eyebrows and otherwise indicate boredom.
description: Right Full Closed Handshape with palm facing signer taps mouth.

title: Dump
description: Both O-Handshapes with palms facing out are held in front of face. Right hand is slightly ahead of left hand. Both hands move simultaneously forward and down as hands open into Full Open Handshapes.

title: Duplicate
note: With the verb form of this sign the movement is done repetitively. The sign in this entry is a noun, which has only one movement.
description: Left hand is in Full Closed Handshape with palm facing up. Right Claw Handshape with palm facing up is positioned underneath left hand. Right hand moves down in a straight line as it closes into O-Handshape.
memory_aid: Taking from another piece of paper.

title: Duruma
note: Names of tribes are especially prone to variation. There may be another or a few other signs for 'Duruma'.
description: The right hand, in a Full Closed Handshape with palm facing down, touches the upper left arm. Hand moves back and forth across left arm.

title: Dusk
description: Slightly bent Full Open Handshape with palm facing down starts in center of signing space. As it moves down to right of signing space, hand closes into Flat-O Handshape with palm facing up.

title: Dustcoat
note: Coat worn in the laboratory

title: Duty
description: U-Handshapes with palms facing down tap right shoulder.

title: Dwarf
description: Right hand, in a Claw Handshape with palm facing down, moves down in a straight line.

title: Dwell
description: Both A-Handshapes with palms facing signer are pointing down. They start at the waist and move up simultaneously in straight lines up the body. Hands then change into Full Closed Handshapes with palms facing down. They move down to rest in middle of signing space.

title: Dwelling
description: Both Full Closed Handshapes with palms facing down are held with fingertips touching, so they form a pyramid a bit above eye level. From this position, the hands separate and move diagonally downward.
memory_aid: This movement traces outline of the roof of a dwelling.

title: E
description: Thumb is folded across in front of palm. All fingers are partially folded, resting upon the thumb. Palm is facing out.

title: Each
description: Right Extended Index Finger Handshape with palm facing signer is held upright. Hand moves over repetitively.

title: Ear
note: organ for hearing

title: Earlier
description: The left hand is in the Bent-B Handshape facing the body. The right hand, also in the Bent-B Handshape with palm facing signer, is behind. The right hand moves backward once.

title: Early
description: Bent-B Handshape with palm facing left is at side of signer. Tips of fingers are pointing down. Hand moves down repetitively.

title: Early
note: At a time in advance of the usual event

title: Earth
description: Slightly bent Full Open Handshapes with palms facing out start together and move around forward until they meet. Palms are now facing signer.

title: Earthquake
note: Shaking of the ground caused by volcanic activities

title: Ease
description: Both Full Open Handshapes with palms facing signer move slightly down closing into Flat-O Handshapes repetitively.
memory_aid: Hands seem to be squeezing something soft, not hard, indicating 'ease'.

title: East
note: Do not reverse direction for others. Sign EAST to your right.
description: Right hand is in E-Handshape with palm facing out and moves to the right.

title: Easter
note: A Christian feast commemorating the resurrection of Christ

title: Eastern
note: Do not reverse direction for others. Sign EAST to your right.
description: Right hand is in E-Handshape with palm facing out and moves to the right.

title: Eastleigh
note: Name of a place in Nairobi, mostly occupied by Kenyan Somali's

title: Easy
description: Both Full Open Handshapes with palms facing signer move slightly down closing into Flat-O Handshapes repetitively.
memory_aid: Hands seem to be squeezing something soft, not hard, indicating 'easy'.

title: Easy 2
description: Both Full Open Handshapes with palms facing signer move slightly down closing into Flat-O Handshapes repetitively.
memory_aid: Hands seem to be squeezing something soft, not hard, indicating 'easy'.

title: Eat
note: Normally 'eat' is signed with one movement. To use repetitive motion as indicated in the video means 'eating'.
description: Right Flat-O Handshape with palm facing down taps repetitively on the mouth.

title: Economy
note: Effective management of the resources of a community

title: Eden
note: Home of Adam and Eve in the Bible

title: Educate
description: Both hands are in Flat-O Handshapes with palms facing out. Hands move forward slightly and repetitively.

title: Education
description: Flat-O Handshape with palm facing signer taps side of forehead.

title: Effective
description: Both hands are in S-Handshapes with palms facing signer. Arms move in close to the body and strike down slightly once.

title: Effort
description: Both hands are in S-Handshapes with palms facing signer. Right hand is closer to the body. While staying in place, both hands move alternately in circles away from the body.

title: Egg
description: Both hands are in U-Handshapes with palms facing signer. The right hand touches down on top of the left. Then both hands change into C-Handshapes with palms facing down and simultaneously move outward, turning at the wrists.

title: Egg
note: Spherical body housing an embryo

title: Egypt
note: Names of places are especially prone to variation. There may be another or a few other signs for 'Egypt'.
description: X-Handshape taps center of forehead. Palm is facing out.
memory_aid: Resembles the headwear of ancient Egyptians.

title: Eight
description: The left hand is in an S-Handshape (which means 'five') with palm facing left. The right hand with extended little, ring and middle fingers (which means 'three') is brought against the knuckles of the left hand.

title: Either
note: Note tilted head, an important part of the sign.
description: Both hands are in Full Open Handshapes with palms facing down. Hands turn so that palms are facing up.

title: Ejaculate
note: Note mouth movement, an essential part of the sign.
description: Right O-Handshape with palm facing left is in center of signing space. It moves forward as hand opens into Full Closed Handshape.

title: Ejaculation
note: Note mouth movement, an essential part of the sign.
description: Right O-Handshape with palm facing left is in center of signing space. It moves forward as hand opens into Full Closed Handshape.

title: Elastic
note: Capable of stretching

title: Elder
description: Palm of right Full Closed Handshape is facing down with fingers pointing left. Hand is near head and moves across in a slight bouncing motion.
memory_aid: Indicates the height of an elder.

title: Elderly
description: Right S-Handshape with palm facing left is positioned under the chin and moves down in a shaking, slightly side to side motion.
memory_aid: Indicates the shaking of an elderly person.

title: Eldoret
note: Names of towns are especially prone to variation. There may be another or a few other signs for 'Eldoret'.
description: Palm of right Bent-B Handshape touches side of head.
memory_aid: Name sign given by Deaf residents of Eldoret.

title: Eldoret Express
note: Bus company that transports people to western Kenya

title: Elect
description: Both hands are in Bent-B Handshapes with palms facing signer and fingers pointing down. Hands move up and down alternately.

title: Election
description: Both hands are in Bent-B Handshapes with palms facing signer and fingers pointing down. Hands move up and down alternately.

title: Election
note: Process choosing a leader democratically

title: Election
note: Process choosing a leader democratically

title: Election
note: Process choosing a leader democratically

title: Electric
description: Right Extended Index Finger Handshape with palm facing left points up. It moves slightly up and then changes into a Flat-O Handshape with palm facing down. Still above head, right hand opens into the Full Open Handshape.

title: Electricity
description: Right Extended Index Finger Handshape with palm facing left points up. It moves slightly up and then changes into a Flat-O Handshape with palm facing down. Still above head, right hand opens into the Full Open Handshape.

title: Electricity 2
description: Right Extended Index Finger Handshape with palm facing left points up. It moves slightly up and then changes into a Flat-O Handshape with palm facing down. Still above head, right hand opens into the Full Open Handshape.

title: Element
note: 'Element' as in a part.
description: Both hands are in Full Closed Handshapes. Right hand with palm facing left moves down on upturned palm of left hand.
memory_aid: An element of the left hand.

title: Elephant
description: Right Full Closed Handshape with palm facing signer points down. Starting at nose, hand moves downward in a curving motion.

title: Elephantiasis
note: A complication in which nematode worms block the lymphatic vessels

title: Elevated
description: Full Closed Handshape with palm facing down and fingers pointing left moves up in a straight line.

title: Eleven
note: This sign is composed of two signs, the first being TEN and the second ONE. They are signed continuously. There should be no pause in between.
description: TEN - Both A-Handshapes with palms facing one another are brought together. ONE - Extended Index Finger Handshape with palm facing left is brought up.

title: Eliminate
description: Both hands are in Full Closed Handshapes. Right hand with palm facing left moves down to swipe across palm of upturned left hand. As right hand moves up, it closes into C-Handshape with palm facing signer.

title: Elimination
