description: Both Full Open Handshapes with palms facing down rest on either side of the hip. Hip shakes slightly.

title: Girl
description: Right A-Handshape with palm facing up taps the side of chest.

title: Girlfriend
description: Both Modified-C Handshapes with palms facing one another are placed over area of heart. Index fingers move down repetitively.

title: Girlfriend
note: The girl in a romantic relationship

title: Githeri
description: Right Modified-C Handshape with palm facing signer taps chin.

title: Githeri
note: Food made from boiling maize and beans together, common in central Kenya

title: Githurai
note: Name of a place along thika road

title: Give
note: This sign can change direction depending on who is being given something. In this video, the direction used indicates that the signer is giving you something. If she were given something, the hand would move towards her. If she were giving to many people, she would move the hand to indicate different people.
description: Right Flat-O Handshape with palm facing up starts near signer. Hand moves forward in a slight arc.
memory_aid: Looks like something is being given.

title: Give Me
note: General conversation

title: Give Up
note: General conversation

title: Glad
description: Arms are bent with both S-Handshapes with palms facing signer by sides of chest. Arms move up and down in a flapping motion.
memory_aid: Gladness is lifting up the arms.

title: Glass
description: Right hand is in C-Handshape with palm facing left. It rests upon upturned left Full Closed Handshape. Right hand moves up and down on left hand.
memory_aid: Looks like the body of a glass.

title: Glasses
description: Both Modified-C Handshapes with palms facing one another touch the face by eyes.

title: Glasses 2
description: Both Modified-C Handshapes with palms facing one another touch the face by eyes.

title: Globe
description: Slightly bent Full Open Handshapes with palms facing out start together and move around forward until they meet. Palms are now facing signer.

title: Gloomy
note: Note lowered eyebrows and head. These are essential parts of the sign.
description: Claw Handshape with palm facing signer touches right cheek and moves out in a straight line.
memory_aid: Hand is like a bucket catching one's tears.

title: Glory
note: Great beauty or splendor

title: Glove
note: An item of clothing covering part of the hand and fingers

title: Glue
note: Adhesive used to stick two things together

title: Go
description: Right G-Handshape with palm facing left moves to the right while fingers close into a Single-O Handshape.
memory_aid: G' turns into an 'O', spelling G-O.

title: Go By
note: While 'go by' is a two-word phrase in English, it is one sign in KSL.
description: Both Extended Index Finger Handshapes with palms facing one another are pointing up. Right hand moves past left hand.

title: Go In
note: While 'go in' is a two-word phrase in English, it is one sign in KSL.
description: Left Full Closed Handshape is positioned in center of signing space with palm facing down. Right Extended Index Finger Handshape with palm facing down is pointing outward. It moves forward under the left hand.

title: Go Into
note: While 'go into' is a two-word phrase in English, it is one sign in KSL.
description: Left Full Closed Handshape is positioned in center of signing space with palm facing down. Right Extended Index Finger Handshape with palm facing down is pointing outward. It moves forward under the left hand.

title: Go Slowly
note: While 'go slowly' is a two-word phrase in English, it is one sign in KSL.
description: Both Full Open Handshapes with palms facing down are slowly moved forward in circles.

title: Go Through
note: While 'go through' is a two-word phrase in English, it is one sign in KSL.
description: Left Full Closed Handshape with palm facing down is held parallel to chest. Right Full Closed Handshape with palm facing signer moves towards and over left hand. Once right hand is over left hand, it turns so that it moves in a straight line and that palm is facing left.
memory_aid: Right hand is going through the center of signing space.

title: Goal
note: 'Goal' as in an objective.
description: Both hands are in Extended Index Finger Handshapes. Right hand is closer to signer and its palm is facing in. Finger of right hand points towards the left hand which is held away from the signer with the palm facing in. Right hand moves toward left hand.
memory_aid: An arrow moving towards its goal.

title: Goat
description: Both Extended Index Finger Handshapes with palms facing out are placed on either side of head on the temples. Head is tilted once to the side and back upright.

title: God
description: Right Extended Index Finger Handshape with palm facing left points upward slightly and repetitively.

title: God
note: Deity

title: Goitre
note: Inflammation of the thyroid gland

title: Gold
description: Claw Handshape with palm facing up is held upright. Hand twists from wrist repetitively.
memory_aid: Moving the gold around to see it shine.

title: Gold
note: A heavy yellow elemental metal of great value

title: Goldenberg
note: Corruption case in Kenya

title: Gone
description: Right Full Open Handshape with palm facing left and fingers pointing down moves up from wrist to the right. Palm is now facing out.

title: Good
description: Both hands are in Full Closed Handshapes with palms facing down. The right hand pats the back of the left hand.
memory_aid: As if patting someone for doing good work.

title: Good Afternoon
note: greeting

title: Good Day
note: greeting

title: Good Evening
note: greeting

title: Good Idea
note: General conversation

title: Good Luck
note: Family and relationships

title: Good Morning
note: greeting

title: Good Night
note: greeting

title: Goodbye
note: greeting

title: Good-Looking
note: 'Beautiful', 'gorgeous', 'pretty', and 'good-looking' all basically mean the same but differ in intensity. In KSL, this difference in degree is indicated by facial expression. For example, 'beautiful' and 'gorgeous' would have stronger facial expressions than 'pretty' and 'good-looking'.
description: The right hand is in an O-Handshape with palm facing out. Hand moves across face as hand turns opening into Full Open Handshape with palm facing signer.
memory_aid: The hand outlines a good-looking face.

title: Goodness
note: characteristic of being good

title: Gorgeous
note: 'Beautiful', 'gorgeous', 'pretty', and 'good-looking' all basically mean the same but differ in intensity. In KSL, this difference in degree is indicated by facial expression. For example, 'beautiful' and 'gorgeous' would have stronger facial expressions than 'pretty' and 'good-looking'.
description: The right hand is in an O-Handshape with palm facing out. Hand moves across face as hand turns opening into Full Open Handshape with palm facing signer.
memory_aid: The hand outlines a gorgeous face.

title: Gorilla
description: S-Handshapes with palms facing signer strike across chest repetitively and alternately.
memory_aid: The typical gesture of a gorilla.

title: Gorilla
note: Largest of the apes

title: Gossip
note: Talking about someone behind their back

title: Got It
note: General conversation

title: Got It
note: General conversation

title: Govern
description: Both hands are in Small-T Handshapes with palms facing down. They are held next to each other. Hands move forward and back alternately.

title: Government 1
note: There is no difference in meaning between GOVERNMENT 1 and GOVERNMENT 2. They are variants of 'government' in KSL.
description: Right Extended Index Finger Handshape with palm facing out touches center of forehead. Hand then moves away and shakes slightly side to side from the wrist.

title: Government 2
note: There is no difference in meaning between GOVERNMENT 1 and GOVERNMENT 2. They are variants of 'government' in KSL.
description: Both Extended Index Finger Handshapes with palms facing one another are in front of forehead. Fingers move forward one another forming an 'x' repetitively.
memory_aid: Resembles a badge worn on a cap.

title: Governor
note: One who controls a county

title: Grab
description: Both Full Open Handshapes with palms facing out move down and forward while hands close into S-Handshapes with palms facing down.

title: Grade
note: 'Grade' as in to grade a paper.
description: Right Extended Index Finger Handshape with palm facing left starts at head level and moves down in a repetitive check-like motion.

title: Grammar
description: F-Handshapes with palms facing one another are connected at thumb and index fingers. Hands let go of one another, twisting around and reconnecting at thumb and index fingers. This is done repetitively as hands move to left side of signing space.

title: Grandchild
note: Child of your son or daughter

title: Grandfather
note: While 'grandfather' is one word in English, it is a two-word phrase (OLD, FATHER 2) in KSL.
description: OLD - Right S-Handshape with palm facing left is positioned under the chin and moves down in a shaking, slightly side to side motion. FATHER 2 - Right Full Closed Handshape with palm facing signer is placed on the face with the thumb on the right side of the jaw and the other four fingers on the left side of the jaw. The fingers close into Flat-O Handshape as the hand moves down repetitively.
memory_aid: An old man stroking his beard.

title: Grandfather
note: your fathers or mothers father

title: Grandmother
note: While 'grandmother' is one word in English, it is a two-word phrase (OLD, MOTHER 2) in KSL.
description: OLD - Right S-Handshape with palm facing left is positioned under the chin and moves down in a shaking, slightly side to side motion. MOTHER 2 - Right Full Closed Handshape with palm facing down is pointing out. It is placed on chest where it moves up and down from the wrist.

title: Grandmother
note: Your father's or mother's mother

title: Grandparent
note: Your father's or mother's mother or father

title: Grasp
note: 'Grasp' as in to grab someone.
description: Both Full Open Handshapes with palms facing out move down and forward while hands close into S-Handshapes with palms facing down.

title: Grass
description: Both Full Open Handshapes with palms facing down move slightly up closing into Flat-O Handshapes repetitively.

title: Grassland
description: Full Open Handshapes with palms facing down begin in the center away from body. They move towards the body in a wide circle.

title: Gratis
description: Both F-Handshapes with palms facing signer swing out so that palms face out.
memory_aid: F' for free which also means gratis.

title: Gratitude
description: Right Full Closed Handshape with palm facing signer starts below mouth. Hand moves down in an arc so that palm ends facing up.
memory_aid: Gratitude from mouth is given to another.

title: Grave
note: Where the dead are buried

title: Great
note: 1. 'Great' as in big. 2. Note the raising of eyebrows which indicate largeness. This is an essential part of the sign.
description: Full Open Handshapes with palms facing one another start above the shoulders. They move apart and upwards.
memory_aid: Showing the size of something great.

title: Great Tribulation
note: Big problem

title: Greater Than
note: While 'greater than' is a two-word phrase in English, it is one sign in KSL.
description: Both hands are in Full Closed Handshapes. Palm of left hand is facing up while palm of right hand is facing down. Right hand starts on top of left hand and moves up in a straight line. Both hands turn from wrists so that they are facing out.
memory_aid: Adding more to what one already has.

title: Green
description: The palm of right hand, in a Full Closed Handshape, is facing signer. Hand moves slightly from the wrist towards and away from the signer.

title: Green Gram
description: GRAM - Small-T Handshape with palm facing up is positioned in center of signing space. Hand moves forward slightly. GREEN - The palm of right hand, in a Full Closed Handshape, is facing signer. Hand moves slightly from the wrist towards and away from the signer.

title: Greens
description: Left Extended Index Finger Handshape with palm facing down is pointing right. Right F-Handshape with palm facing down moves down left finger and then shakes down in a double motion.
memory_aid: Like cleaning off stalks of vegetables.

title: Greetings
note: Salutations

title: Grey
note: While 'grey' is one word in English, it is a two-word phrase (BLACK, SMALL) in KSL.
description: Right Extended Index Finger Handshape with palm facing signer points to the head and then moves down back. Hand moves down to center of signing space and assumes Single-O Handshape with palm facing out. Fingers move against one another.

title: Grieve
note: While 'grieve' is one word in English, it is a two-word phrase (DEAD, CRY) in KSL.
description: DEAD - Right Full Closed Handshape with palm facing down comes up to touch the underside of chin. CRY - Both Extended Index Finger Handshapes with palms facing signer touch underneath both eyes. They move down alternately and repetitively.

title: Grin
description: Both Extended Index Finger Handshapes with palms facing down point at sides of mouth. Both hands move up and outward, following the line of the cheekbones.

title: Gripe 1
note: 1. There is no difference in meaning between GRIPE 1 and GRIPE 2. They are variants of 'gripe' in KSL. 2. Note lowered eyebrows, an essential part of the sign.
description: S-Handshape with palm facing down is placed under chin. Hand opens into Full Open Handshape repetitively.
memory_aid: Hand opening under mouth is griping.

title: Gripe 2
note: 1. There is no difference in meaning between GRIPE 1 and GRIPE 2. They are variants of 'gripe' in KSL. 2. Note the lowered eyebrows and movement of tongue. They are important parts of this sign. 3. KSL users consider this sign as part of KSL slang.
description: Extended Index Finger Handshape with palm facing signer points to throat repetitively.
memory_aid: Finger is pointing to griping mouth.

title: Ground
description: Both hands are in Full Closed Handshapes with palms facing down. Hands start side by side and move out away from one another in a straight line.

title: Group
description: Both hands, in C-Handshapes with palms facing one another, start at opposite ends of signing space. They move towards one another simultaneously.

title: Grow 1
note: 'Grow' as in the growth of living beings.
description: Right Bent-B Handshape with palm facing signer starts at bottom of signing space. As hand moves up in a straight line, hand straightens out into a Full Closed Handshape.
memory_aid: Imitates the growing up of a person.

title: Grow 2
note: 'Grow' as in the growth of plant life.
description: Left C-Handshape with palm facing signer surrounds right Flat-O Handshape which is facing up. Right hand moves up as it opens into Full Open Handshape.

title: Grown-Up
description: Palm of right Full Closed Handshape is facing down with fingers pointing left. Hand is near head and moves across in a slight bouncing motion.
memory_aid: Indicates the height of a grown-up.

title: Grumble 1
note: 1. There is no difference in meaning between GRUMBLE 1 and GRUMBLE 2. They are variants of 'grumble' in KSL. 2. Note lowered eyebrows, an essential part of the sign.
description: S-Handshape with palm facing down is placed under chin. Hand opens into Full Open Handshape repetitively.
memory_aid: Hand opening under mouth is grumbling.

title: Grumble 2
note: 1. There is no difference in meaning between GRUMBLE 1 and GRUMBLE 2. They are variants of 'grumble' in KSL. 2. Note the lowered eyebrows and movement of tongue. They are important parts of this sign. 3. KSL users consider this sign as part of KSL slang.
description: Extended Index Finger Handshape with palm facing signer points to throat repetitively.
memory_aid: Finger is pointing to grumbling mouth.

title: Guarantee
description: Right Extended Index Finger Handshape with palm facing left points to the mouth. Then it opens into a Full Closed Handshape as it moves down to touch upon palm of upturned left Full Closed Handshape.

title: Guard
description: Right Full Closed Handshape with palm facing left moves upright to shoulder.
memory_aid: Imitates the movement of a guard.

title: Guess
note: To reach a partly unqualified conclusion

title: Guest
description: Full Open Handshape with palm facing signer is placed on chest. Thumb and middle finger are touching body. Hand moves up chest.
memory_aid: Tidying yourself up for a guest.

title: Guide
note: Lead

title: Guilt
description: Right Extended Index Finger Handshape with palm facing out makes an 'X' in the air.
memory_aid: X' in the air indicates guilt.

title: Guitar
note: a stringed music instrument with a diaphragm and neck

title: Gumboots
note: boot that cover up to the middle part of the leg

title: Gun
note: a fireman

title: Gun
note: a fireman

title: Gust
description: Full Open Handshapes with palms facing one another point out. They start at ends of signing space and move back and forth alternately.

title: H
description: Ring and little fingers are folded down. Thumb is folded over ring and little fingers. Index finger and middle fingers are extended out straight and together. The hand is tilted over so that the fingers are horizontal and pointing to the left. Palm is facing signer.

title: Habit
note: behavior

title: Habit
note: behavior

title: Hair
note: Pigmented filament that grows on the follicle on the skin

title: Half
description: Both hands are in Full Closed Handshapes. Right hand with palm facing left moves down on upturned palm of left hand.

title: Halt 1
note: 1. 'Halt' as in to stop something. 2. Note lowered eyebrows, an important part of the sign.
description: Both hands are in Full Closed Handshapes. Left hand is held parallel to chest with palm facing signer. Palm of right hand is facing left. Right hand moves down in front of left hand.

title: Halt 2
note: 1. 'Halt' as in to order someone to stop. 2. Note lowered eyebrows, an important part of the sign.
description: Full Closed Handshape with palm facing out moves forward.
memory_aid: Typical gesture when commanding one to stop.

title: Hammer
note: A tool with a heavy head and handle used for pounding

title: Hand
note: Front part of the arm

title: Handbook
description: Full Closed Handshapes are held with palms together and fingertips pointing away. Palms are facing signer. Hands open and close repetitively with sides always touching.

title: Handcart
description: Both X-Handshapes are linked. Palm of right hand is facing down while palm of left hand is facing signer. Both hands move to right simultaneously.
memory_aid: The right is pulling the left.

title: Handkerchief
note: A piece of cloth, usually square, used for wiping the face

title: Handle
description: Both hands are in Small-T Handshapes with palms facing down. They are held next to each other. Hands move forward and back alternately.

title: Hang
note: suspension by a noose around the neck

title: Hang
note: suspension by a noose around the neck

title: Haphazard
note: Lowered eyebrows, shrugged shoulders, shaking head and pursed lips are all important parts of the sign. They all indicate carelessness.
description: Full Open Handshapes start at center of signing space with palms facing down. They move up to either side of signing space with palms facing up.

title: Happen
description: Both hands are in Thumbs-Up Handshapes with palms facing signer. They move towards each other and upon touching move out again.
memory_aid: Hands hitting one another is something happening.

title: Happiness
description: Arms are bent with both S-Handshapes with palms facing signer by sides of chest. Arms move up and down in a flapping motion.
memory_aid: Happiness is lifting up the arms.

title: Happy
description: Arms are bent with both S-Handshapes with palms facing signer by sides of chest. Arms move up and down in a flapping motion.
memory_aid: Happiness is lifting up the arms.

title: Happy Birthday
note: Family and relationships

title: Happy Christmas
note: Holiday wishes

title: Happy Christmas
note: Holiday wishes

title: Happy Easter
note: Holiday wishes

title: Happy Holidays
note: Holiday wishes

title: Happy New Year
note: Holiday wishes

title: Happy Ramadan
note: Holiday wishes

title: Harambee
note: Holiday

title: Harass
note: Note the lowered eyebrows which indicate negativity. This is an important part of the sign.
description: Right Bent-B Handshape with palm facing down taps right shoulder repetitively.

title: Harassment
note: Note the lowered eyebrows which indicate negativity. This is an important part of the sign.
description: Right Bent-B Handshape with palm facing down taps right shoulder repetitively.

title: Hard 1
note: 1. 'Hard' as in difficult. 2. There is no difference in meaning between HARD 1 and HARD 2. They are variants of 'hard' in KSL. 3. Note lowering of eyebrows, which is an essential part of this sign.
description: Both hands, in S-Handshapes with palms facing signer, are held upright. Arms move back and forth simultaneously and repetitively.

title: Hard 2
note: 1. 'Hard' as in difficult. 2. There is no difference in meaning between HARD 1 and HARD 2. They are variants of 'hard' in KSL. 3. Note lowered eyebrows, an important part of the sign.
description: Right hand is in S-Handshape with palm facing up. Back of right hand touches upon back of downturned left S-Handshape.

title: Hard 3
note: 'Hard' as in solid.
description: Right hand is in Claw Handshape with palm facing up. Back of right hand taps upon back of downturned left Claw Handshape.

title: Hard Of Hearing
note: While 'hard of hearing' is a three-word phrase in English, it is one sign in KSL.
description: Right Full Closed Handshape with palm facing right moves down the center of face.

title: Hard Of Hearing 2
note: While 'hard of hearing' is a three-word phrase in English, it is one sign in KSL.
description: Right Full Closed Handshape with palm facing right moves down the center of face.

title: Harmful
description: The left arm, in an S-Handshape with palm facing signer, is held upright while right Full Closed Handshape with palm facing signer slaps the left elbow.
memory_aid: As if slapping someone for behaving badly.

title: Has
description: Fingers of upturned Full Closed Handshape touches middle of chest.
memory_aid: Indicating something on or with the person.

title: Hassle
note: Note the lowered eyebrows which indicate negativity. This is an important part of the sign.
description: Right Bent-B Handshape with palm facing down taps right shoulder repetitively.

title: Hasty
note: Note lowered eyebrows, an essential part of the sign.
description: Both hands are in Full Closed Handshapes with palms facing each other. The left hand is in center of signing space facing the right. The right hand slaps upon the palm of left hand in upward motions.

title: Hat
description: Right Full Open Handshape with palm facing down touches top of head.

title: Hate
description: Fingers of the right hand, in a Full Open Handshape with palm facing signer, touch the throat. Hand turns out from wrist while moving down and out.

title: Haul
description: Both X-Handshapes are linked. Palm of right hand is facing down while palm of left hand is facing signer. Both hands move to right simultaneously.
memory_aid: The right is hauling the left.

title: Have
description: Fingers of upturned Full Closed Handshape touches middle of chest.
memory_aid: Indicating something on or with the person.

title: Have A Nice Day
note: greeting

title: Have A Seat
note: General conversation

title: Have Fun
note: Travel

title: Have Fun
note: Travel

title: Have To
note: 1. Note lowered eyebrows and head. These are important parts of the sign. 2. While 'have to' is a two-word phrase in English, it is one sign in KSL.
description: Right X-Handshape with palm facing down moves down once.

title: Hay
description: Both Full Open Handshapes with palms facing down move slightly up closing into Flat-O Handshapes repetitively.

title: Hazard
note: Note lowered eyebrows and sticking-out tongue. These are essential parts of the sign.
description: Right Extended Index Finger Handshape with palm facing left moves from side to side in front of mouth.
memory_aid: Something hazardous in front of face.

title: Hazardous
note: Note lowered eyebrows and sticking-out tongue. These are essential parts of the sign.
description: Right Extended Index Finger Handshape with palm facing left moves from side to side in front of mouth.
memory_aid: Something hazardous in front of face.

title: He
description: Extended Index Finger Handshape points at side of signing space.

title: Head
note: 'Head' as someone in charge.
description: Both S-Handshapes with palms facing down start at waist level. They move up to chest level simultaneously.
memory_aid: Looks like the stature of a head.

title: Head
note: The top part of the body

title: Head Teacher
note: Note that the sign for 'teacher' here is slightly different from the main entry in this dictionary. See TEACHER. This is an example of variation.
description: TEACHER - Right Small-T Handshape with palm facing out moves slightly up and down while moving to the right side of signing space. BOSS - Both S-Handshapes with palms facing down start at waist level. They move up to chest level simultaneously.
memory_aid: A person who writes on the board and has strong arms is the boss.

title: Headmaster
note: Note that the sign for 'teacher' here is slightly different from the main entry in this dictionary. See TEACHER. This is an example of variation.
description: TEACHER - Right Small-T Handshape with palm facing out moves slightly up and down while moving to the right side of signing space. BOSS - Both S-Handshapes with palms facing down start at waist level. They move up to chest level simultaneously.
memory_aid: A person who writes on the board and has strong arms is the boss.

title: Headstrong
note: Note lowered eyebrows, an important part of the sign.
description: Right hand is in S-Handshape with palm facing up. Back of right hand touches upon back of downturned left S-Handshape.

title: Health
description: Both Full Open Handshapes with palms facing signer are positioned at shoulders. Hands move out while handshapes change to S-Handshapes.

title: Health 2
description: Both Full Open Handshapes with palms facing signer are positioned at shoulders. Hands move out while handshapes change to S-Handshapes.

title: Hear
description: Right Full Open Handshape with palm facing out touches the side of the head just before the ear. Head tilts downward at same time.

title: Heart
note: Body part that pumps blood

title: Heart Attack
note: Obstruction to the flow of blood to the heart caused by a coronary thrombosis

title: Heat
description: X-Handshape with palm facing down begins above left eyebrow and moves across forehead. While moving, finger of X-Handshape closes in.

title: Heavy
note: Note the lowered eyebrows and tilted head. These are essential parts of the sign.
description: Both slightly curved Full Open Handshapes with palms facing up are positioned at either side of the signer. They move up and down simultaneously.
memory_aid: Trying to lift up something heavy.

title: Heed 1
note: 'Heed' as in to pay attention.
description: Both Full Closed Handshapes, fingers pointing up and palms facing one another, are held at the sides of face. They move straight out from the face as hands move down so that fingertips point away from signer.
memory_aid: Indicating the area where one is watching.

title: Heed 2
note: 'Heed' as in to follow orders.
description: Both hands are in Bent-B Handshapes with palms facing down. The left hand is slightly behind and to the left of the right hand. Both hands move simultaneously forward and to the right.
memory_aid: Left hand is heeding right hand.

title: Heedful
description: Full Closed Handshapes with palms facing signer touch sides of forehead. Hands move out to sides of signing space while wrists move out so that palms are facing out.
memory_aid: Mind opens into a heedful state.

title: Heedless
note: Lowered eyebrows, shrugged shoulders, shaking head and pursed lips are all important parts of the sign. They all indicate carelessness.
description: Full Open Handshapes start at center of signing space with palms facing down. They move up to either side of signing space with palms facing up.

title: Height
description: Full Closed Handshape with palm facing down and fingers pointing left moves up in a straight line.
memory_aid: Indicates the height of a person.

title: Hell
note: Figurative Place of total destruction in the Bible

title: Hell
note: Figurative Place of total destruction in the Bible

title: Hello
note: greeting

title: Help
description: Both Full Closed Handshapes with palms facing up are in the middle of the signing space. The right hand is on top of the left hand. The left hand lifts the right hand slightly.
memory_aid: The left hand is helping the right hand move up.

title: Help
note: Emergencies

title: Help
note: Assist

title: Hen
note: If signer wants to emphasize the femaleness of the 'hen', sign FEMALE after CHICKEN.
description: The back of the right hand, in an X-Handshape, touches the mouth. Downward motions are made from the wrist.

title: Her
description: Extended Index Finger Handshape points at side of signing space.

title: Here
description: Both Full Closed Handshapes with palms facing out point down. They move down simultaneously twice.

title: Here You Are
note: General conversation

title: Heritage
description: Both F-Handshapes with palms facing one another are linked. Hands move back and forth.
memory_aid: Heritage is what links people together.

title: Hers
note: Note the mouth movement 'ba ba ba'. This is an important part of the sign.
description: Full Closed Handshape starts at side of signer with palm facing down. Hand moves up from wrist as arm moves slightly forward.

title: Herself
description: Extended Index Finger Handshape with palm facing down points to lower side of signing space and moves up from wrist so that it is pointing up.
memory_aid: Pointing at her and telling her to do it herself.

title: He's Unconscious
note: Emergencies

title: Hesitant
description: Both hands are in Full Closed Handshapes. Left hand is parallel to waist with palm facing up. Little-finger side of right hand is placed upon palm of left hand and moves side to side.
memory_aid: The right hand is swaying to and fro with indecision.

title: Hesitate
description: Both hands are in Full Closed Handshapes. Left hand is parallel to waist with palm facing up. Little-finger side of right hand is placed upon palm of left hand and moves side to side.
memory_aid: The right hand is swaying to and fro with indecision.

title: Hidden
description: Both hands are in Full Closed Handshapes. Left hand is facing right while right hand is facing left. They are positioned in front of the face, one in front of the other. Hands move back and forth in opposite directions.

title: Hide
note: 'Hide' as in to hide somewhere.
description: Both hands are in Full Closed Handshapes. Left hand is facing right while right hand is facing left. They are positioned in front of the face, one in front of the other. Hands move back and forth in opposite directions.

title: Hideous
description: The left arm, in an S-Handshape with palm facing signer, is held upright while right Full Closed Handshape with palm facing signer slaps the left elbow.
memory_aid: As if slapping someone for behaving badly.

title: High
description: Full Closed Handshape with palm facing down and fingers pointing left moves up in a straight line.

title: High Heels
note: women shoes with elevated heels

title: High-Priced
note: Note lowered eyebrows, an important part of the sign.
description: Right S-Handshape with palm facing left moves down in a straight line then moves directly back up as hand changes into Full Open Handshape that shakes up and down slightly.

title: Highway
description: Both Full Closed Handshapes with palms facing one another are held with fingers pointing out. Hands are moved simultaneously forward.

title: Hilarious
description: Right Extended Index Finger Handshape with palm facing down moves under chin in a straight line and then wrist snaps moving the finger downward.

title: Hill
description: Right Full Closed Handshape with palm facing down starts on left side of signing space and moves rightward in two sloping motions.

title: Hilton
note: Name of a hotel in Nairobi

title: Him
description: Extended Index Finger Handshape points at side of signing space.

title: Himself
description: Extended Index Finger Handshape with palm facing down points to lower side of signing space and moves up from wrist so that it is pointing up.
memory_aid: Pointing at him and telling him to do it himself.

title: Hinder
description: Both hands are in Full Closed Handshapes. Left hand is held horizontally in front of signer with palm facing in. Right hand is held to side of signer with palm facing left. Right hand moves to palm of left hand.

title: Hindrance
description: Both hands are in Full Closed Handshapes. Left hand is held horizontally in front of signer with palm facing in. Right hand is held to side of signer with palm facing left. Right hand moves to palm of left hand.

title: Hippo
description: Both hands are in Full Closed Handshapes. Downturned right hand is placed upon upturned left hand. They both move in opposite directions up and down and move back to the same place.
memory_aid: The large mouth of a hippo.

title: Hippopotamus
note: A large semi-aquatic herbivorous

title: Hire
note: Employ

title: His
note: Note the mouth movement 'ba ba ba'. This is an important part of the sign.
description: Full Closed Handshape starts at side of signer with palm facing down. Hand moves up from wrist as arm moves slightly forward.

title: History
description: Both Full Closed Handshapes with palms facing signer are above right shoulder. They move backward in a circular motion alternately.

title: History 2
description: Both Full Closed Handshapes with palms facing signer are above right shoulder. They move backward in a circular motion alternately.

title: Hit
note: This verb changes movement depending on the object. If it is to hit yourself, the hand moves towards yourself, as shown in this video. If it is to hit someone else, the hand moves away from the signer.
description: S-Handshape with palm facing down moves towards head. Upon touching head, hand moves up slightly.

title: Hiv
description: Right Extended Index Finger Handshape with palm facing down is pointing out. Finger closes into an X-Handshape repetitively.

title: Hold On
note: 1. 'Hold on' as in to wait. 2. While 'hold on' is a two-word phrase in English, it is one sign in KSL.
description: Both hands are in Bent-B Handshapes with palms facing signer. Hands are pulled back in towards body.

title: Hold On To
note: 1. 'Hold on to' as in to keep a grasp on something. 2. While 'hold on to' is a three-word phrase in English, it is one sign in KSL.
description: Both Full Open Handshapes with palms facing out move down and forward while hands close into S-Handshapes with palms facing down.
memory_aid: Looks like one holding onto something.

title: Hole
note: Opening in the ground

title: Holiday
description: Both Full Open Handshapes with palms facing out are held at either side of the head. Staying in place, hands twist from the wrists.

title: Holiday
note: A special day for celebrations

title: Holler
note: Note lowering of eyebrows and movement of mouth. These are important parts of the sign.
description: S-Handshape with palm facing down is placed under chin. Hand opens into Full Open Handshape.
memory_aid: Hand opening means mouth is hollering.

title: Holy
note: clean

title: Holy Spirit
note: God's active power

title: Homa Bay
note: Names of towns are especially prone to variation. There may be another or a few other signs for 'Homa Bay'.
description: Both S-Handshapes with palms facing signer start on left side of signer. Right hand is above left hand. Both hands move simultaneously back. Then they both move to the right side of the signer. The left hand is now above the right hand. Both hands again move simultaneously back.

title: Homa Bay 2
note: Names of towns are especially prone to variation. There may be another or a few other signs for 'Homa Bay'.
description: Both S-Handshapes with palms facing signer start on left side of signer. Right hand is above left hand. Both hands move simultaneously back. Then they both move to the right side of the signer. The left hand is now above the right hand. Both hands again move simultaneously back.

title: Home
description: Right Extended Index Finger Handshape with palm facing signer touches tip of nose.
memory_aid: Home is center of life like nose is center of face.

title: Home 2
description: Right Extended Index Finger Handshape with palm facing signer touches tip of nose.
memory_aid: Home is center of life like nose is center of face.

title: Home Science
description: HOME - Right Extended Index Finger Handshape with palm facing signer touches tip of nose. SCIENCE - Then both A-Handshapes with palms facing one another are placed together in center of signing space. Hands move up and down against one another.
memory_aid: HOME and SCIENCE together mean 'home science'.

title: Home Science
note: Unit of science

title: Home Science
note: Unit of science

title: Home Science 3
description: HOME - Right Extended Index Finger Handshape with palm facing signer touches tip of nose. SCIENCE - Then both A-Handshapes with palms facing one another are placed together in center of signing space. Hands move up and down against one another.
memory_aid: HOME and SCIENCE together mean 'home science'.

title: Honest
description: Both hands are in Full Closed Handshapes. Left hand is positioned in center of signing space with palm up and fingertips pointing right. Right hand, with palm facing left, moves down to touch upon palm of left hand. Once right hand touches down, it moves forward in a slightly up motion.
memory_aid: Arm goes in a straight direction, not off to the side as one would when untruthful.

title: Honey
note: Sweet substance made by bees

title: Hook
note: A rod bent into a curved shape

title: Hop
description: Both hands, in Bent-B Handshapes with palms facing signer, start side by side near the signer. Both hands move forward once simultaneously.

title: Hope
description: Both Full Closed Handshapes with palms facing signer are placed by the side of the head. Left hand is closer to signer and lower than right hand. Both move fingers down into Bent-B Handshapes repetitively.

title: Hopeless
note: Note lowered and shaking head, important parts of the sign.
description: Both hands are in S-Handshapes with palms facing one another. They move towards and past one other to reach other sides of signing space. They move back towards center of signing space. At the same time they are turning over so that palms are up. They then move down to respective sides of the signing space. The right hand ends up by the right side of the signing space and the left hand ends up by the left side.

title: Horn
note: Hard part that protrudes from the heads of many mammals

title: Horn
note: Hard part that protrudes from the heads of many mammals

title: Horrendous
description: The left arm, in an S-Handshape with palm facing signer, is held upright while right Full Closed Handshape with palm facing signer slaps the left elbow.
memory_aid: As if slapping someone for behaving badly.

title: Horrible
description: The left arm, in an S-Handshape with palm facing signer, is held upright while right Full Closed Handshape with palm facing signer slaps the left elbow.
memory_aid: As if slapping someone for behaving badly.

title: Horror
note: Appropriate facial expression should accompany this sign. See FEAR.
description: Right O-Handshape with palm facing left rests over the heart. Hand opens and closes repetitively into a Full Open Handshape.

title: Horse
description: Both hands are in S-Handshapes with palms facing signer. Right hand is above left hand. Both move in circular motions toward the signer.

title: Horse
note: A hoofed mammal, often used throughout history for riding and draft work

title: Hospital
description: Right X-Handshape with palm facing signer taps the side of the left arm.
memory_aid: Indicating the armband of a medical worker.

title: Hostile
description: Extended Index Finger Handshapes with palms facing signer point at one another. They move out in a straight line in the opposite directions.
memory_aid: The two fingers are moving away from one another as if they oppose one another.

title: Hot
description: X-Handshape with palm facing down begins above left eyebrow and moves across forehead. While moving, finger of X-Handshape closes in.

title: Hot 2
description: X-Handshape with palm facing down begins above left eyebrow and moves across forehead. While moving, finger of X-Handshape closes in.

title: Hotel
description: Both H-Handshapes with palms facing signer are pointing at one another. They move in repetitive and alternate circles towards mouth.
memory_aid: As if using two spoons to eat.

title: Hound
note: To specify the breed of a hound, fingerspell.
description: The right hand assumes the Full Open Handshape with palm facing out. The back of the hand is near the right cheek. Hand moves sideways repetitively.
memory_aid: The floppy ears of a hound.

title: Hour
description: Right Extended Index Finger Handshape with palm facing signer points to wrist of left arm. Handshape moves in an inward circular motion.
memory_aid: Indicates the hour hand of a wristwatch.

title: House
description: Both Full Closed Handshapes with palms facing down are held with fingertips touching, so they form a pyramid a bit above eye level. From this position, the hands separate and move diagonally downward.
memory_aid: This movement traces outline of the roof of a house.

title: How
note: Appropriate facial expression is important. Lowered eyebrows indicate a question.
description: Full Open Handshapes with palms facing down are moved up from the wrists so that palms are facing up.
memory_aid: Shoulders are slightly shrugging indicating one does not know how.

title: How About You?
note: Making friends

title: How About You?
note: Making friends

title: How Come
note: 1. 'How come' as in why? 2. Lowered eyebrows can indicate a question. Thus it is very important that while asking a 'how come' question, eyebrows are lowered. 3. While 'how come' is a two-word phrase in English, it is one sign in KSL.
description: Shoulders are shrugged as downturned Full Open Handshapes turn over so that palms are facing up.

title: How Do I Get To The Airport?
note: asking for direction

title: How Do I Get To The Bus Station?
note: asking for direction

title: How Do I Get To The Train Station?
note: asking for direction

title: How Do I Get To?
note: asking for direction

title: How Do You Sign?
note: Languages and communication

title: How Do You Spell This Word?
note: Languages and communication

title: How Many
note: 1. Appropriate facial expression is important. Lowered eyebrows indicate a question. 2. While 'how many' is a two-word phrase in English, it is one sign in KSL.
description: Both O-Handshapes with palms facing up are opened wide finger by finger and moved outward, ending in Full Open Handshapes.
memory_aid: Fingers move as if in a counting motion asking 'how many?'

title: How Much
note: 1. Appropriate facial expression is important. Lowered eyebrows indicate a question. 2. While 'how much' is a two-word phrase in English, it is one sign in KSL.
description: Palms of both Small-T Handshapes are facing one another. Thumbs rub over tips of index fingers. Then both hands move up as they turn from wrists opening into Full Open Handshapes with palms facing up.

title: How Much?
note: Shopping

title: How Old Are You?
note: Making friends

title: How Old Are You?
note: Making friends

title: However
note: Note tilted head and raised eyebrows. These are essential parts of the sign.
description: Both hands are in Extended Index Handshapes. Palms are facing away from signer. Fingers are touching so that they form an 'x'. Hands move out so that fingers point to either side of the signing space.
memory_aid: Fingers move in opposite directions indicating otherwise.

title: How's The Weather?
note: The weather

title: Huge
note: Note the raising of eyebrows which indicate largeness. This is an essential part of the sign.
description: Full Open Handshapes with palms facing one another start above the shoulders. They move apart and upwards.
memory_aid: Showing the size of something huge.

title: Human
description: Both Full Closed Handshapes with palms facing one another move down simultaneously to waist level.
memory_aid: Indicating the body of a person.

title: Human Being
note: While 'human being' is a two-word phrase in English, it is one sign in KSL.
description: Both Full Closed Handshapes with palms facing one another move down simultaneously to waist level.
memory_aid: Indicating the body of a person.

title: Human Race
note: While 'human race' is a two-word phrase in English, it is one sign in KSL.
description: Both hands are in Full Open Handshapes with palms facing signer. Hands are near chest with thumbs the only fingers touching chest. Hands slightly move down repetitively.

title: Human Rights
description: Both Full Closed Handshapes with palms facing one another move down simultaneously to waist level. Then left hand is positioned in center of signing space with palm up and fingertips pointing right. Right hand, with palm facing left, moves down to touch upon palm of left hand. Once right hand touches down, it moves forward in a slightly up motion.
memory_aid: Indicating the body and something one is entitled to.

title: Humankind
description: Both hands are in Full Open Handshapes with palms facing signer. Hands are near chest with thumbs the only fingers touching chest. Hands slightly move down repetitively.

title: Humdrum
note: Appropriate facial expression is important for this sign. One should lower eyebrows and otherwise indicate boredom.
description: Right Full Closed Handshape with palm facing signer taps mouth.

title: Humiliated
note: Note lowered eyebrows and raised shoulders. These are essential parts of the sign.
description: Right Claw Handshape with palm facing signer moves back and forth in front of face.
memory_aid: As if trying to hide from being humiliated.

title: Humorous
description: Right Extended Index Finger Handshape with palm facing down moves under chin in a straight line and then wrist snaps moving the finger downward.

title: Humour
description: Right Extended Index Finger Handshape with palm facing down moves under chin in a straight line and then wrist snaps moving the finger downward.

title: Hunger
note: Note lowered eyebrows, raised shoulders and tilted head. These are all important parts of the sign.
description: Both Bent-B Handshapes with palms facing up are pointing to the stomach. Hands move in slightly.
memory_aid: Pointing at the stomach to indicate it needs food.

title: Hungry
note: Note lowered eyebrows, raised shoulders and tilted head. These are all important parts of the sign.
description: Both Bent-B Handshapes with palms facing up are pointing to the stomach. Hands move in slightly.
memory_aid: Pointing at the stomach to indicate it needs food.

title: Hunt
note: To chase down prey and kill it

title: Hurry
note: Note lowered eyebrows, an essential part of the sign.
description: Both hands are in Full Closed Handshapes with palms facing each other. The left hand is in center of signing space facing the right. The right hand slaps upon the palm of left hand in upward motions.

title: Hurry Up
note: General conversation

title: Hurt 1
note: 1. 'Hurt' as in to feel pain. 2. Note the raised shoulders and lowered eyebrows. These are essential parts of the sign.
description: Both hands are in Single-O Handshapes. Tips of fingers are touching one another so that palms face one another. Hands are moved back and forth in a tapping motion.
memory_aid: The throbbing sensation of an area that hurts.

title: Hurt 2
note: 'Hurt' as in to inflict pain on someone.
description: Both hands are in Claw Handshapes with palms facing out. Hands move forward repetitively.

title: Huruma
note: Name of a place in Nairobi

title: Husband
note: The first part of this sign uses MAN, indicating male.
description: Right Full Closed Handshape with palm facing signer is placed on the face with the thumb on the right side of the jaw and the other four fingers on the left side of the jaw. The fingers close into Flat-O Handshape as the hand moves down. Then both hands form I-Handshapes with little fingers bent. The left hand is held sideways so palm is facing signer. The right little finger with palm facing out hooks on the left little finger.

title: Hushed
note: Note lowered eyebrows, an important part of the sign.
description: Right Extended Index Finger Handshape with palm facing left moves down lips.

title: Hut
description: Both Full Closed Handshapes with palms facing down are held with fingertips touching, so they form a pyramid a bit above eye level. From this position, the hands separate and move diagonally downward.
memory_aid: This movement traces outline of the roof of a hut.

title: Hyena
note: large, canine-resembling carnivore, often notable for the sound similar to laughter

title: Hypertension
note: Disorder of abnormally high blood pressure

title: I 1
note: 'I' as in the alphabetic letter.
description: Index, middle and ring fingers are folded down. Thumb is folded across middle and ring fingers. Little finger is straight up. Palm is facing out.
memory_aid: Little finger looks like a little 'i'.

title: I 2
note: 'I' as in the subject pronoun that means 'me'.
description: Extended Index Finger Handshape with palm facing left points to chest.

title: Idea
description: I-Handshape with palm facing signer starts by side of head. Hand moves out upward.

title: Ideal
note: Note the lowered eyebrows and tilted head, important parts of the sign.
description: Both F-Handshapes are placed in front of signer with palms facing out.

title: Identical
description: The sides of the Extended Index Finger Handshapes are brought together once or repetitively. Palms are facing down.
memory_aid: Two identical things are brought together.

title: Idle
description: Full Open Handshapes with palms facing signer are placed at sides of signing space. Hands move back and forth. Hands are not held up firmly so that when moving they fall back and forth from wrist.

title: Idyllic
note: Note the lowered eyebrows and tilted head, important parts of the sign.
description: Both F-Handshapes are placed in front of signer with palms facing out.

title: If 1
note: There is no difference in meaning between IF 1 and IF 2. They are variants of 'if' in KSL.
description: Both hands are in O-Handshapes with palms facing one another. Hands move down while changing into F-Handshapes.

title: If 2
note: There is no difference in meaning between IF 1 and IF 2. They are variants of 'if' in KSL.
description: Both hands are in F-Handshapes with palms facing one another. Hands move up and down alternately.

title: If 3
note: There is no difference in meaning between IF 1 and IF 2. They are variants of 'if' in KSL.
description: Both hands are in O-Handshapes with palms facing one another. Hands move down while changing into F-Handshapes.

title: Ignite
description: Both hands are in O-Handshapes with palms facing one another. The right hand moves to touch the top of the left hand. Both hands simultaneously change into Full Open Handshapes and move up slightly shaking.
memory_aid: The lighting of a match and the shape of flames.

title: Ignorant
description: Right S-Handshape with palm facing left strikes center of forehead.

title: Ignore
description: Base of C-Handshape with palm facing up starts near nose. Hand moves out slightly sideways.
memory_aid: Turning the nose up on someone.

title: Ill
note: Appropriate facial expression is important.
description: Backside of Bent-B Handshape touches cheek.

title: I'll Call The Police
note: Emergencies

title: I'll Text
note: Making friends

title: Illustrate
note: 'Illustrate' as in to show.
description: Right Extended Index Finger Handshape with palm facing signer is pointing to palm of outturned left Full Closed Handshape. Both hands move forward simultaneously in a straight line.
memory_aid: Pointing out something on the left hand to illustrate.

note: Making friends
