title: Imagination
description: I-Handshape with palm facing signer starts by side of head. Hand moves out upward.

title: Imagine
description: I-Handshape with palm facing signer starts by side of head. Hand moves out upward.

title: Imitate
description: Left hand is in Full Closed Handshape with palm facing up. Right Claw Handshape with palm facing up is positioned underneath left hand. Right hand moves down in a straight line as it closes into O-Handshape.
memory_aid: Taking from another piece of paper.

title: Imitation 1
note: 'Imitation' as in a copy.
description: Left hand is in Full Closed Handshape with palm facing up. Right Claw Handshape with palm facing up is positioned underneath left hand. Right hand moves down in a straight line as it closes into O-Handshape.
memory_aid: Taking from another piece of paper.

title: Imitation 2
note: 'Imitation' as in something that is fake.
description: Both hands are in Full Closed Handshapes. Left hand is positioned in center of signing space with palm down and fingertips pointing right. Right hand, with palm facing left, moves down to touch repetitively upon back of left hand.

title: Immature
description: Right Bent-B Handshape with palm facing signer starts chest high then moves down.

title: Immediate
note: Note raised shoulders, an essential part of the sign.
description: Both Full Closed Handshapes with palms facing out point down. They move down simultaneously twice.

title: Immediately
note: Note raised shoulders, an essential part of the sign.
description: Both Full Closed Handshapes with palms facing out point down. They move down simultaneously twice.

title: Immense
note: Note the raising of eyebrows which indicate largeness. This is an essential part of the sign.
description: Full Open Handshapes with palms facing one another start above the shoulders. They move apart and upwards.
memory_aid: Showing the size of something immense.

title: Immigration
description: Full Closed Handshapes are held with palms together and fingertips pointing away from body. They open. Then left hand is in a Full Closed Handshape with palm facing up. The right is in an S-Handshape with palm facing signer and strikes repetitively back and forth on left palm.
memory_aid: A stamped piece of paper in a book.

title: Immune
note: Exempt/ resistance to pathogens

title: Immunization
note: Exposure to a material that is designed to prime one's immune system against that material

title: Impair 1
note: 1. There is no difference in meaning between IMPAIR 1 and IMPAIR 2. They are variants of 'impair' in KSL. 2. Note the lowered eyebrows, mouth movement and tilted head. These are all important parts of the sign.
description: Both Small-T Handshapes with palms facing down are placed side by side. Hands move up and slightly away repetitively.

title: Impair 2
note: 1. There is no difference in meaning between IMPAIR 1 and IMPAIR 2. They are variants of 'impair' in KSL. 2. Note the lowered eyebrows, mouth movement and tilted head. These are all important parts of the sign.
description: Both hands are in A-Handshapes with palm of left hand facing up and palm of right hand facing down. Hands move in opposite directions with right hand always touching top of left hand.

title: Impart
description: O-Handshapes with palms facing out are positioned in front of mouth. Hands move out to either side of the signing space as handshapes open into Full Open Handshapes. Palms are then facing down.

title: Impede
description: Both hands are in Full Closed Handshapes. Left hand is held horizontally in front of signer with palm facing in. Right hand is held to side of signer with palm facing left. Right hand moves to palm of left hand.

title: Impediment
description: Both hands are in Full Closed Handshapes. Left hand is held horizontally in front of signer with palm facing in. Right hand is held to side of signer with palm facing left. Right hand moves to palm of left hand.

title: Imperative
note: Note head tilt, head nod and lowered eyebrows. These are essential parts of the sign.
description: Both hands, in Full Closed Handshapes with palms facing out, are at face level and moved simultaneously down to chest level.

title: Implausible
note: Note lowered and shaking head, important parts of the sign.
description: Both hands are in S-Handshapes with palms facing one another. They move towards and past one other to reach other sides of signing space. They move back towards center of signing space. At the same time they are turning over so that palms are up. They then move down to respective sides of the signing space. The right hand ends up by the right side of the signing space and the left hand ends up by the left side.

title: Implore
note: Note lowered eyebrows and head, essential parts of the sign.
description: Full Closed Handshape with palm facing signer is circled on the chest over the heart.
memory_aid: A plea coming from the heart.

title: Import
description: Both hands are in Full Open Handshapes with palms facing up. They both start on the right of the signer and move in towards the body.

title: Importance
note: Note head tilt, head nod and lowered eyebrows. These are essential parts of the sign.
description: Both hands, in Full Closed Handshapes with palms facing out, are at face level and moved simultaneously down to chest level.
memory_aid: Hands move over an important object.

title: Important
note: Note head tilt, head nod and lowered eyebrows. These are essential parts of the sign.
description: Both hands, in Full Closed Handshapes with palms facing out, are at face level and moved simultaneously down to chest level.
memory_aid: Hands move over an important object.

title: Impose
description: Slightly curved Full Open Handshapes with palms facing out are positioned at either side of signing space. Hands move forward once in a strong motion.
memory_aid: Hands pushing one to do something.

title: Impossible
note: Note lowered and shaking head, important parts of the sign.
description: Both hands are in S-Handshapes with palms facing one another. They move towards and past one other to reach other sides of signing space. They move back towards center of signing space. At the same time they are turning over so that palms are up. They then move down to respective sides of the signing space. The right hand ends up by the right side of the signing space and the left hand ends up by the left side.

title: Impound
description: Both E-Handshapes are placed in center of signing space with palms facing one another. Right hand is closer to signer. It moves forward so that wrists of both hands are touching. Both hands then move back and forth in opposite directions from wrists.

title: Impoverished
note: Note lowered eyebrows, an important part of the sign.
description: Right Claw Handshape with palm facing signer is positioned at elbow of upright bent left arm. Fingers of right hand move down elbow of left arm.

title: Imprison
description: Both E-Handshapes are placed in center of signing space with palms facing one another. Right hand is closer to signer. It moves forward so that wrists of both hands are touching. Both hands then move back and forth in opposite directions from wrists.

title: Improve
description: Both Full Closed Handshapes with palms facing up and fingers pointing out are positioned at either side of the waist. Hands move up in steps.
memory_aid: Levels are getting higher and better.

title: Improved
note: Note the lowered eyebrows which indicate intensity.
description: Both hands assume Full Closed Handshapes with palms facing down. The right hand pats the back of the left hand.

title: In
description: Left Full Closed Handshape is positioned in center of signing space with palm facing down. Right Extended Index Finger Handshape with palm facing down is pointing outward. It moves forward under the left hand.

title: In
note: within

title: In A Little Bit
note: 1. Note the lowered eyebrows and 'th' mouth movement. These are essential parts of the sign. 2. While 'in a little bit' is a four-word phrase in English, it is one sign in KSL.
description: Small-T Handshape with palm facing up is positioned in center of signing space. Hand moves forward slightly.
memory_aid: Just a few things can be held between these two fingers.

title: In A While
note: While 'in a while' is a three-word phrase in English, it is one sign in KSL.
description: Full Closed Handshape with palm facing signer and fingers pointing left moves in steps forward repetitively.

title: In Charge
note: While 'in charge' is a two-word phrase in English, it is one sign in KSL.
description: U-Handshapes with palms facing down tap right shoulder.

title: In Spite Of
note: 1. Note tilted head and raised eyebrows. These are essential parts of the sign. 2. While 'in spite of' is a three-word phrase in English, it is one sign in KSL.
description: Both hands are in Extended Index Handshapes. Palms are facing away from signer. Fingers are touching so that they form an 'x'. Hands move out so that fingers point to either side of the signing space.
memory_aid: Fingers move in opposite directions indicating otherwise.

title: Inaccurate 1
note: 'Inaccurate' as in to make a mistake.
description: Right Extended Index Finger Handshape with palm facing out makes an 'X' in the air.
memory_aid: X' in the air indicates something inaccurate.

title: Inaccurate 2
note: 'Inaccurate' as in to be false.
description: Both hands are in Full Closed Handshapes. Left hand is positioned in center of signing space with palm down and fingertips pointing right. Right hand, with palm facing left, moves down to touch repetitively upon back of left hand.

title: In-Between
description: Both hands are in Full Closed Handshapes. Left hand is parallel to waist with palm facing up. Little-finger side of right hand is placed upon palm of left hand. Right hand moves side to side.
memory_aid: Indicating the in-between of two things.

title: Incident
description: Both hands are in Thumbs-Up Handshapes with palms facing signer. They move towards each other and upon touching move out again.
memory_aid: Hands hitting one another is an incident.

title: Inclination 1
note: Note the mouth movement 'ba ba ba'. This is an important part of the sign.
description: Full Closed Handshape starts at side of signer with palm facing down. Hand moves up from wrist as arm moves slightly forward. Palm is now facing out.

title: Inclination 2
note: This is usually used with INCLINATION 1. INCLINATION 2 is signed first then INCLINATION 1, which means 'one's inclination' or LAW HIS/HER.
description: Right L-Handshape starts down with thumb pointing up. Palm is facing left. Hand moves so that thumb of L-Handshape touches shoulder.

title: Include
description: Finger of I-Handshape with palm facing signer taps upon palm of upturned left Full Closed Handshape.
memory_aid: Putting someone or something in a group.

title: Income
note: Money one earns by working

title: Inconceivable
note: Note lowered and shaking head, important parts of the sign.
description: Both hands are in S-Handshapes with palms facing one another. They move towards and past one other to reach other sides of signing space. They move back towards center of signing space. At the same time they are turning over so that palms are up. They then move down to respective sides of the signing space. The right hand ends up by the right side of the signing space and the left hand ends up by the left side.

title: Inconsiderate
note: Lowered eyebrows, shrugged shoulders, shaking head and pursed lips are all important parts of the sign. They all indicate carelessness.
description: Full Open Handshapes start at center of signing space with palms facing down. They move up to either side of signing space with palms facing up.

title: Incorrect
description: Right Extended Index Finger Handshape with palm facing out makes an 'X' in the air.
memory_aid: X' in the air indicates something incorrect.

title: Increase
description: Right Modified-C Handshape with palm facing out starts upside down. Hand uprights itself from the wrist. Palm is still facing out.

title: Incredible
description: Index finger of Modified-C handshape is resting on top of chin while thumb is underneath chin. Head moves slightly side to side.

title: Indecisive
description: Both hands are in Full Closed Handshapes. Left hand is parallel to waist with palm facing up. Little-finger side of right hand is placed upon palm of left hand and moves side to side.
memory_aid: The right hand is swaying to and fro with indecision.

title: Indeed
description: Right S-Handshape with palm facing out moves up and down from wrist.

title: Indian
note: While 'Indian' is one word in English, it is a two-word phrase (INDIA, PERSON) in KSL.
description: INDIA - Right Extended Index Finger Handshape with palm facing signer points to center of forehead. PERSON - Both Full Closed Handshapes with palms facing one another move down simultaneously to waist level.
memory_aid: A married Indian with bindi on forehead.

title: Indian
note: from India

title: Indian Ocean
note: 1. Note the mouth moving while signing AREA. This is an adjective to indicate the bigness of the ocean. 2. While 'Indian Ocean' is a two-word phrase in English, it is a three-word phrase (MOMBASA, WATER, AREA) in KSL.
description: MOMBASA - Right G-Handshape with palm facing left is next to right eye. Fingers open and close into Single-O Handshape. WATER - Right C-Handshape with palm facing left moves up to open lips. At lips, wrist turns upwards. AREA - Full Open Handshapes with palms facing down begin in center away from body. They then move towards the body in a wide circle.

title: Individual 1
note: 'Individual' as in single or separate.
description: Right Extended Index Finger Handshape with palm facing the body moves in small circles.
memory_aid: The index finger indicates an individual.

title: Individual 2
note: 'Individual' as in a person.
description: Both Full Closed Handshapes with palms facing one another move down simultaneously to waist level.
memory_aid: Indicating the body of a person.

title: Individually
description: Right Extended Index Finger Handshape with palm facing signer is held upright. Hand moves over repetitively.

title: Industry
note: Place where goods are produced

title: Inebriated
description: Full Open Handshape with palm facing signer starts at front of head and moves back closing into an S-Handshape.

title: Inexpensive
description: L-Handshape with palm facing out starts in center of signing space. Hand moves down as handshape turns into Single-O Handshape.
memory_aid: Pile of money needed is small.

title: Inexperienced 1
note: There is no difference in meaning between INEXPERIENCED 1 and INEXPERIENCED 2. They are variants of 'inexperienced' in KSL.
description: I-Handshapes with palms facing out are at either side of signing space. Wrists turn hands back and up.
memory_aid: Hands turning up signifies something new.

title: Inexperienced 2
note: There is no difference in meaning between INEXPERIENCED 1 and INEXPERIENCED 2. They are variants of 'inexperienced' in KSL.
description: Right Thumbs-Up Handshape is held with thumb against right corner of mouth. Palm is facing out. Hand moves forward, turning until palm is facing signer.

title: Infant
description: Both hands are in Full Closed Handshapes with palms facing up. Right arm is laid on top of left arm so right hand is over left wrist. Arms are moved from side to side.

title: Infantile
description: Right Bent-B Handshape with palm facing signer starts chest high then moves down.

title: Infect
description: Right O-Handshape with palm facing signer starts above wrist of left arm. As right hand moves up left arm, handshape opens into Full Open Handshape.

title: Infection
description: Right O-Handshape with palm facing signer starts above wrist of left arm. As right hand moves up left arm, handshape opens into Full Open Handshape.

title: Infection
note: An uncontrolled growth of harmful microorganisms in a host

title: Inflexible
note: Note lowered eyebrows, an important part of the sign.
description: Right hand is in S-Handshape with palm facing up. Back of right hand touches upon back of downturned left S-Handshape.

title: Inform
description: O-Handshapes with palms facing out are positioned in front of mouth. Hands move out to either side of the signing space as handshapes open into Full Open Handshapes. Palms are then facing down.

title: Information
description: O-Handshapes with palms facing out are positioned in front of mouth. Hands move out to either side of the signing space as handshapes open into Full Open Handshapes. Palms are then facing down.

title: Information
note: Knowledge of something

title: Information
note: Knowledge of something

title: Infuriated
note: The eyebrows are lowered, indicating anger. The head also moves slightly to the side.
description: Right Claw Handshape with palm facing signer moves to the forehead.
memory_aid: The forehead is usually furrowed in anger.

title: Ingenious
description: Thumb of right Thumbs-Up Handshape with palm facing left touches the forehead. While it moves slightly forward, hand turns so palm is facing signer.

title: Inhabit
description: Both A-Handshapes with palms facing signer are pointing down. They start at the waist and move up simultaneously in straight lines up the body. Hands then change into Full Closed Handshapes with palms facing down. They move down to rest in middle of signing space.
memory_aid: Movement shows something inhabits that area.

title: Inherit
note: Receive property by legal succession after the previous owners death

title: Inhumane
note: While CRUEL shares the same sign as other English words like 'inhumane', 'mean', and 'rude', they have slightly different facial expressions. The more intense the meanness, the more intense the facial expression. Hence CRUEL gets a more intense facial expression than RUDE does.
description: Claw Handshapes with palms facing down rest upon either side of head. Hands move out simultaneously in a straight line.

title: Initial
note: 'Initial' as in being first.
description: Extended Index Finger Handshape with palm facing out is placed in center of signing space. Hand twists around so that palm is then facing signer.
memory_aid: Number one is twisted to make it first which means the same as 'initial'.

title: Inject
description: V-Handshape with thumb sticking out and palm facing right moves down to elbow of left hand. While moving, thumb moves down to touch base of index and middle fingers.

title: Injection
description: V-Handshape with thumb sticking out and palm facing right moves down to elbow of left hand. While moving, thumb moves down to touch base of index and middle fingers.

title: Injure
note: Note the raised shoulders and lowered eyebrows. These are essential parts of the sign.
description: Both hands are in Single-O Handshapes. Tips of fingers are touching one another so that palms face one another. Hands are moved back and forth in a tapping motion.
memory_aid: The throbbing sensation of an injury.

title: Injury 1
note: 1. 'Injury' as in something that hurts. 2. Note the raised shoulders and lowered eyebrows. These are essential parts of the sign.
description: Both hands are in Single-O Handshapes. Tips of fingers are touching one another so that palms face one another. Hands are moved back and forth in a tapping motion.
memory_aid: The throbbing sensation of an injury.

title: Injury 2
note: 1. 'Injury' as in a cut. 2. While 'injury' is one word in English, it is a two-word phrase (SICK, CUT) in KSL.
description: SICK - Backside of Bent-B Handshape touches cheek. CUT - Fingertips of Bent-B Handshape with palm facing signer then move along backside of downturned left Full Closed Handshape.

title: Ink
note: Pigment based fluid used for writing, printing, e.t.c

title: Innocent
note: Free from guilt

title: Inquire
note: This sign can change direction depending on who one is asking. In this video, the direction used indicates that the signer is asking you a question. If she were asking herself a question, the palm would face her. If she were asking many people a question, she would move the hand to indicate different people.
description: Right Bent-B Handshape with palm facing out is held upright supported by the left hand at the elbow. Right hand moves forward once.
memory_aid: Tapping someone to ask a question.

title: Inquiry
description: Right Extended Index Finger Handshape with palm facing out starts in center of signing space. Hand moves down as it changes into an X-Handshape.
memory_aid: Looks like a written question mark - ?.

title: Insane
description: Right Extended Index Finger Handshape with palm facing down points to side of head and moves in a circular motion.
memory_aid: Things are mixed up in the head.

title: Insect
description: Both Extended Index Finger Handshapes with palms facing signer rest on either side of the head. Hands move back and forth alternately and repetitively.

title: Insensitive
note: Lowered eyebrows, shrugged shoulders, shaking head and pursed lips are all important parts of the sign. They all indicate carelessness.
description: Full Open Handshapes start at center of signing space with palms facing down. They move up to either side of signing space with palms facing up.

title: Inside
description: Left Full Closed Handshape is positioned in center of signing space with palm facing down. Right Extended Index Finger Handshape with palm facing down is pointing outward. It moves forward under the left hand.

title: Insignificant
note: Note face scrunch and lowered eyebrows, important elements of this sign.
description: Right G-Handshape with palm facing left is held in front of the face.

title: Inspect 1
note: 'Inspect' as in to search.
description: Bent-V Handshape with palm facing out is held by right side of face. Hand is moved out and around, while shaking slightly from wrist.
memory_aid: As if a pair of eyes were inspecting.

title: Inspect 2
note: 'Inspect' as in to check up on something or someone.
description: Right Bent-V Handshape with palm facing out moves side to side on top of wrist of downturned left Full Closed Handshape.
memory_aid: Pair of eyes looking over a desk.

title: Inspection
description: Right Bent-V Handshape with palm facing out moves side to side on top of wrist of downturned left Full Closed Handshape.
memory_aid: Pair of eyes looking over a desk.

title: Install
description: Flat-O Handshape with palm facing down starts in front of face. It moves down in a straight line.

title: Installation
description: Flat-O Handshape with palm facing down starts in front of face. It moves down in a straight line.

title: Instant
note: Note raised shoulders, an essential part of the sign.
description: Both Full Closed Handshapes with palms facing out point down. They move down simultaneously twice.
memory_aid: Indicating the immediate present which is the same as this 'instant'.

title: Instantly
note: Note raised shoulders, an essential part of the sign.
description: Both Full Closed Handshapes with palms facing out point down. They move down simultaneously twice.
memory_aid: Indicating the immediate present which is the same as 'instantly'.

title: Instead
note: Note tilted head and raised eyebrows. These are essential parts of the sign.
description: Both hands are in Extended Index Handshapes. Palms are facing away from signer. Fingers are touching so that they form an 'x'. Hands move out so that fingers point to either side of the signing space.
memory_aid: Fingers move in opposite directions indicating otherwise.

title: Institution
note: An established organization

title: Instruct
description: Both hands are in Flat-O Handshapes with palms facing out. Hands move forward slightly and repetitively.

title: Instruction
description: Both hands are in Flat-O Handshapes with palms facing out. Hands move forward slightly and repetitively.

title: Insubordinate
note: Lowered eyebrows, shrugged shoulders, shaking head and pursed lips are all important parts of the sign. They all indicate carelessness.
description: Full Open Handshapes start at center of signing space with palms facing down. They move up to either side of signing space with palms facing up.

title: Intelligence
description: Thumb of right Thumbs-Up Handshape with palm facing left touches the forehead. While it moves slightly forward, hand turns so palm is facing signer.

title: Intelligent
description: Thumb of right Thumbs-Up Handshape with palm facing left touches the forehead. While it moves slightly forward, hand turns so palm is facing signer.

title: Intend
description: Both hands are in Extended Index Finger Handshapes. Right hand is closer to signer and its palm is facing in. Finger of right hand points towards the left hand which is held away from the signer with the palm facing in. Right hand moves toward left hand.
memory_aid: An arrow moving towards its target.

title: Intention
description: Both hands are in Extended Index Finger Handshapes. Right hand is closer to signer and its palm is facing in. Finger of right hand points towards the left hand which is held away from the signer with the palm facing in. Right hand moves toward left hand.
memory_aid: An arrow moving towards its aim.

title: Interest
note: price received for providing money or goods in accredit transaction

title: Interest
note: price received for providing money or goods in accredit transaction

title: Interest
note: price received for providing money or goods in accredit transaction

title: International
description: Slightly bent Full Open Handshapes with palms facing out start together and move around forward until they meet. Palms are now facing signer.

title: Internet
description: Middle finger Extended Handshapes are facing one another. Middle fingers are also touching. Both hands move side to side simultaneously in opposite directions.
memory_aid: Hands communicating with one another through internet connection represented by connecting fingers.

title: Interpret
description: Both F-Handshapes with palms facing one another are touching at the fingertips. Staying in place, they move up and down from the wrists in opposite directions.

title: Interpretation
description: Both F-Handshapes with palms facing one another are touching at the fingertips. Staying in place, they move up and down from the wrists in opposite directions.

title: Interpreter
description: Both F-Handshapes with palms facing one another are touching at the fingertips. Staying in place, they move up and down from the wrists in opposite directions.

title: Interrupt
note: Note the lowered eyebrows which indicate negativity. This is an important part of the sign.
description: Right Bent-B Handshape with palm facing down taps right shoulder repetitively.

title: Interruption
note: Note the lowered eyebrows which indicate negativity. This is an important part of the sign.
description: Right Bent-B Handshape with palm facing down taps right shoulder repetitively.

title: Intestine
note: The alimentary canal of an animal

title: Into
description: Left Full Closed Handshape is positioned in center of signing space with palm facing down. Right Extended Index Finger Handshape with palm facing down is pointing outward. It moves forward under the left hand.

title: Intoxicated
description: Full Open Handshape with palm facing signer starts at front of head and moves back closing into an S-Handshape.

title: Intrude
note: Note the lowered eyebrows which indicate negativity. This is an important part of the sign.
description: Right Bent-B Handshape with palm facing down taps right shoulder repetitively.

title: Intrusion
note: Note the lowered eyebrows which indicate negativity. This is an important part of the sign.
description: Right Bent-B Handshape with palm facing down taps right shoulder repetitively.

title: Invent
note: Note the mouth movement 'wah wah wah'. This is an essential part of the sign.
description: Finger of X-Handshape with palm facing signer touches side of forehead. It moves up and down repetitively.
memory_aid: Different things coming from the head.

title: Invention
note: Note the mouth movement 'wah wah wah'. This is an essential part of the sign.
description: Finger of X-Handshape with palm facing signer touches side of forehead. It moves up and down repetitively.
memory_aid: Different things coming from the head.

title: Inventory
description: Right Extended Index Finger Handshape with palm facing down points to top of upright left Full Closed Handshape with palm facing out. Right hand moves down left hand pointing at different places.

title: Investigate
description: Both V-Handshapes with palms facing one another are positioned in center of signing space. Hands move slightly back and down while fingers bend in Bent-V Handshapes. This is done repetitively.
memory_aid: Two sets of eyes looking over something.

title: Investigation
description: Both V-Handshapes with palms facing one another are positioned in center of signing space. Hands move slightly back and down while fingers bend in Bent-V Handshapes. This is done repetitively.
memory_aid: Two sets of eyes looking over something.

title: Invitation
description: Both Full Closed Handshapes with palms facing left are held up near right side of body. Both move down simultaneously in an arc closer to the body. Hands end up in middle of signing space with palms facing up.

title: Invite
description: Both Full Closed Handshapes with palms facing left are held up near right side of body. Both move down simultaneously in an arc closer to the body. Hands end up in middle of signing space with palms facing up.

title: Involve
description: Finger of I-Handshape with palm facing signer taps upon palm of upturned left Full Closed Handshape.
memory_aid: Putting someone or something in a group.

note: Names of places are especially prone to variation. There may be another or a few other signs for 'Iraq'.
description: Index finger of Full Closed Handshape with palm facing down outlines upper lip.
memory_aid: Refers to moustache of former leader.

title: Irate
note: The eyebrows are lowered, indicating anger. The head also moves slightly to the side.
description: Right Claw Handshape with palm facing signer moves to the forehead.
memory_aid: The forehead is usually furrowed in anger.

note: A common inexpensive metal, often black in color, and is attracted by magnets

title: Islamic
description: Full Closed Handshapes with palms facing out start at center of forehead and move down as head bends down. Hands move down in a straight line and once at the bottom of the signing space move out to the sides. Palms are then facing down.

note: General conversation

title: Isn't It So
note: General conversation

memory_aid: The index finger indicates one in isolation.

title: Israel

description: Full Closed Handshape with palm facing signer covers right eye.
memory_aid: Refers to eye patch of an Israeli leader.

title: Israel
note: Nation of God/ Name of a Bible character, Jacob

title: Issue
note: 'Issue' as in a topic.
description: Both hands are in Bent-V Handshapes with palms facing one another. They are placed at top of signing space where they move slightly back and forth.

note: General conversation

title: Item 1
note: There is no difference in meaning between ITEM 1 and ITEM 2. They are variants of 'item' in KSL.

title: Item 2
note: 1. 'Item' as in a thing. 2. There is no difference in meaning between ITEM 1 and ITEM 2. They are variants of 'item' in KSL.
description: Both Extended Index Finger Handshapes with palms facing down are pointing out. Right hand starts above left hand. Hands move towards one another slightly and then reverse while switching so that left hand is now on top. This is done repetitively.

title: Itemize
description: Right Extended Index Finger Handshape with palm facing down points to top of upright left Full Closed Handshape with palm facing out. Right hand moves down left hand pointing at different places.

note: Shopping

note: Emergencies

title: I'Ve Burned Myself
note: Emergencies

title: I'Ve Lost My Keys
note: Emergencies

title: J
description: Index, middle and ring fingers are folded down. Thumb is folded across index middle and ring fingers. Little finger is straight up. Palm is facing out. The hand is moved so that little finger draws a 'J' shape. Motion is a curve moving down and then to the left.

title: Jacket
description: Both hands are in S-Handshapes with palms facing signer. Hands start on opposing sides of signing space and move in toward each other. Both move to bottom center of signing space. While left hand remains at bottom, right hand moves up torso of signer.
memory_aid: The putting on and zipping up of a jacket.

title: Jacob
note: Name of a Bible character, Esau's twin brother

title: Jam
note: A sweet mixture of fruit boiled with sugar and allowed to congeal/ Difficult situation

title: Jam
note: A sweet mixture of fruit boiled with sugar and allowed to congeal/ Difficult situation

title: Jamhuri Day
note: public holiday on 12th December

title: January
note: Name of the 1st month

title: Japan
note: Names of places are especially prone to variation. There may be another or a few other signs for 'Japan'.
description: Both L-Handshapes with palms facing out are placed by side of head. Hands are touching at index fingers and thumbs. They move out in opposite directions, while closing into Single-O Handshapes.
memory_aid: Looks like the shape of Japan.

title: Japan 2
note: Names of places are especially prone to variation. There may be another or a few other signs for 'Japan'.
description: Both L-Handshapes with palms facing out are placed by side of head. Hands are touching at index fingers and thumbs. They move out in opposite directions, while closing into Single-O Handshapes.
memory_aid: Looks like the shape of Japan.

title: Jaw
note: One of the bones, usually bearing teeth, which forms the frame of the mouth

title: Jeans
note: Pair of trousers made from denim cotton

title: Jehovah
note: God's name, as found in the Bible

title: Jehovah's Witnesses
note: A monotheistic and non-Trinitarian Christian denomination

title: Jericho
note: Name of a place in Eastland's/ A city in Bible times

title: Jewel
note: A precious stone

title: Jews
note: people of the Kingdom of Judah in the Bible

title: Job
description: The little-finger side of the right S-Handshape with palm facing left is brought down repetitively on top of the index finger side of the left S-Handshape with palm facing right.

title: Job
note: Name of a Bible character, Bible book

title: Jog
description: Both S-Handshapes with palms facing one another move in opposing circular motions.

title: Jogoo Road
note: Name of the road from donholm roundabout to the capital city

title: John
note: Name of a Bible character, who wrote the book of John and others

title: Join
note: 'Join' as in to come together.
description: Both hands are in Full Closed Handshapes with palms facing one another and thumbs up. They start at opposite ends of the signing space and come together until the palms touch.

title: Joke
note: While 'joke' is one word in English, it is a two-word phrase (LIE 1, FUNNY) in KSL.
description: LIE 1 - The thumb of right hand, in a Full Open Handshape with palm facing left, touches the nose. Fingers move in a wriggling motion. FUNNY - Right Extended Index Finger Handshape with palm facing down moves under chin in a straight line and then wrist snaps moving the finger downward.

title: Joseph
note: Name of a Bible character, who was sold to slavery by his brothers

title: Joshua
note: Name of a Bible character, who took over leadership of the Israelites from Moses

title: Journal
note: 1. 'Journal' as in a book to write in. 2. While 'journal' is one word in English, it is a two-word phrase (BOOK, WRITE) in KSL.
description: BOOK - Full Closed Handshapes are held with palms together and fingers pointing out. The hands open and close, with sides always touching. WRITE - Right Small-T Handshape with palm facing down repetitively moves slightly across palm of left hand while moving down.

title: Journal
note: A daily record of a person/ newspaper dealing with a specific subject

title: Journalist
note: One whose occupation is journalism

title: Journalist
note: One whose occupation is journalism

title: Journey
description: Both Extended Index Finger Handshapes with palms facing down point out. They move forward alternately and repetitively.

title: Joy
description: Arms are bent with both S-Handshapes with palms facing signer by sides of chest. Arms move up and down in a flapping motion.
memory_aid: Joy is lifting up the arms.

title: Joyful
description: Arms are bent with both S-Handshapes with palms facing signer by sides of chest. Arms move up and down in a flapping motion.
memory_aid: Joy is lifting up the arms.

title: Jubilant
description: Arms are bent with both S-Handshapes with palms facing signer by sides of chest. Arms move up and down in a flapping motion.
memory_aid: Jubilance is lifting up the arms.

title: Judge
note: One who preside cases in a law court and renders judgment

title: Judge
note: One who preside cases in a law court and renders judgment

title: Jug
description: Both hands are in Full Closed Handshapes with palms facing one another. Hands are moved down, curving out away from each other and then back. Hands end up next to each other with palms facing up.

title: Jug
note: A serving vessel or container

title: Juice
note: A liquid from a plant, especially fruit

title: July
note: Name of the 7th month

title: Jump
description: Both hands, in Bent-B Handshapes with palms facing signer, start side by side near the signer. Both hands move forward once simultaneously.

title: June
note: Name of the 6th month

title: Junior
description: Right Bent-B Handshape with palm facing signer starts chest high then moves down.

title: Just
note: 1. 'Just' as in a little while ago. 2. Note the tongue sticking out. This is an important part of the sign.
description: Finger of L-Handshape with palm facing signer is placed on right shoulder. Hand moves forward changing into Single-O Handshape.

title: Juvenile
description: Right Bent-B Handshape with palm facing signer starts chest high then moves down.

title: K
note: This sign is similar to 'P' which is the same handshape, but tipped forward so the index finger points down.
description: Ring and little fingers are folded down. Index and middle fingers are straight with middle finger angled forward. Thumb is pointing up and touching the back of middle finger. Palm is facing out.
memory_aid: Top part looks like the top of a written 'k'.

title: Kahawa
note: Name of a place along thika road

title: Kahawa West
note: Name of a place along thika road

title: Kakamega
note: Names of towns are especially prone to variation. There may be another or a few other signs for 'Kakamega'.
description: Both hands are in Full Closed Handshapes with palms facing signer. Right hand touches the forehead while the left hand touches the back of the head. Both hands move back and forth, lightly hitting the head.

title: Kale
description: Left Extended Index Finger Handshape with palm facing down is pointing right. Right F-Handshape with palm facing down moves down left finger and then shakes down in a double motion.
memory_aid: Like cleaning off stalks of vegetables.

title: Kalenjin
note: Names of tribes are especially prone to variation. There may be another or a few other signs for 'Kalenjin'.
description: The fingertips of the Small-T Handshape with palm facing signer pull down on the right ear.
memory_aid: Long earlobes as caused by heavy earrings.

title: Kales
note: Sukuma wiki

title: Kambui
note: Names of towns are especially prone to variation. There may be another or a few other signs for 'Kambui'.
description: Right K-Handshape with palm facing out touches the right side of the forehead.

title: Kanga
description: Both hands are in Full Closed Handshapes. Left hand with palm facing out waits by side of waist while right hand with palm facing signer moves in to center of waist. Left hand follows.

title: Kangemi
note: Name of a place

title: Kanzu
description: Full Closed Handshapes with palms facing signer start at either shoulder. Hands move down and out while opening up in Full Open Handshapes.

title: Kapsabet
note: Names of towns are especially prone to variation. There may be another or a few other signs for 'Kapsabet'.
description: Both hands are in U-Handshapes with palms facing signer. Right U-Handshape taps the top of left U-Handshape which is pointing right.
memory_aid: Looks like the American sign for 'name'.

title: Karen
note: Names of places are especially prone to variation. There may be another or a few other signs for 'Karen'.
description: Right K-Handshape with palm facing signer is put against head at the temple and then moved down to jaw.
memory_aid: Sign name given by Deaf pupils at Karen School for the Deaf.

title: Karen 2
note: Names of places are especially prone to variation. There may be another or a few other signs for 'Karen'.
description: Right K-Handshape with palm facing signer is put against head at the temple and then moved down to jaw.
memory_aid: Sign name given by Deaf pupils at Karen School for the Deaf.

title: Kariobangi
note: Name of a place

title: Kariokor
note: Name of a place

title: Kasarani
note: Name of a place along thika road

title: Kasarani
note: Name of a place along thika road

title: Kaunda Street
note: Name of a street

title: Kayole
note: Name of a place in Eastland's, after Tena Estate

title: Kbc
note: TV station, Kenya's National broadcaster

title: Keen
description: Thumb of right Thumbs-Up Handshape with palm facing left touches the forehead. While it moves slightly forward, hand turns so palm is facing signer.

title: Keep
description: Left Full Closed Handshape with palm facing up is held out, slightly bent at base of fingers. The right hand, in same handshape as left hand but with palm facing down, covers the left in a light clapping motion.

title: Keep The Change
note: At a restaurant

title: Kencom
note: Name of a building

title: Kenya
description: The right hand is in a Small-T Handshape with palm facing out. As it turns inward to body, the hand also moves up.
memory_aid: The sign for 'Kenya' comes from the fly whisk Jomo Kenyatta used to carry.

title: Kenya Cinema
note: Name of a building, houses a cinema

title: Kenyan
note: While 'Kenyan' is one word in English, it is a two-word phrase (KENYA, PERSON) in KSL.
description: KENYA - The right hand is in a Small-T Handshape with palm facing out. As it turns inward to body, the hand also moves up. PERSON - Both Full Closed Handshapes with palms facing one another move down simultaneously to waist level.
memory_aid: The sign for 'Kenya' comes from the fly whisk Jomo Kenyatta used to carry.

title: Kenyatta Avenue
note: Name of an avenue

title: Kericho
note: Names of towns are especially prone to variation. There may be another or a few other signs for 'Kericho'.
description: Both hands, in S-Handshapes with palms facing up, start at bottom of signing space. Alternately hands move past sides of head. While moving, hands extend index fingers.

title: Kerosene
description: Right forearm is held straight out from body with hand in an S-Handshape with palm facing left. Arm is moved back and forward repetitively.
memory_aid: Shaking a lantern checking for kerosene.

title: Kerosene Lamp
note: While 'kerosene lamp' is a two-word phrase in English, it is one sign in KSL.
description: Both hands assume Small-T Handshapes with palms facing sides. Right hand moves to strike against the top of the left hand. Right hand then forms an upside-down S-Handshape with palm facing the signer and moves up and down.
memory_aid: Striking a match, holding the lamp.

title: Kerugoya
note: Names of places are especially prone to variation. There may be another or a few other signs for 'Kerugoya'.
description: Left S-Handshape with palm facing right is by face. Right Extended Index Finger Handshape with palm facing down moves from back of left fist to left elbow.
memory_aid: Name sign given by Deaf pupils at Kerugoya School for the Deaf.

title: Kettle
note: A vessel for boiling a liquid or cooking food

title: Key
description: Right Small-T Handshape with palm facing down rests in center of signing space. Moving from wrist, hand moves up and down slightly and repetitively.

title: Keyboard
description: Both Claw Handshapes with palms facing down start side by side in center of signing space. They move out away from one another simultaneously in a straight line. Then both hands move back to center and fingers wriggle. While fingers are wriggling, hands are moving side to side slightly.
memory_aid: The shape of a board, the typing on a board.

title: Kiambu
note: Names of towns are especially prone to variation. There may be another or a few other signs for 'Kiambu'.
description: Right O-Handshape with palm facing signer touches side of forehead. As hand turns out, it opens into Full Open Handshape with palm facing out.

title: Kibera
note: Name of a place, has the largest slum in Kenya

title: Kicc
note: Kenyatta International Conference Centre

title: Kick
note: Hit using one's legs

title: Kid
description: Right Bent-B Handshape with palm facing signer starts chest high then moves down.

title: Kidney Transplant
note: Giving one a kidney from another person

title: Kidneys
note: Organ in the body that filters the blood, producing urine

title: Kikoy
description: Both hands are in Full Closed Handshapes. Left hand with palm facing out waits by side of waist while right hand with palm facing signer moves in to center of waist. Left hand follows.

title: Kikuyu
note: Names of tribes are especially prone to variation. There may be another or a few other signs for 'Kikuyu'.
description: Right Full Closed Handshape with palm facing down repetitively swipes back of downturned left Full Closed Handshape.
memory_aid: Looks like a field of land.

title: Kilifi
note: Names of towns are especially prone to variation. There may be another or a few other signs for 'Kilifi'.
description: Both C-Handshapes with palms facing one another are by the right ear. They move back and forth simultaneously and repetitively.
memory_aid: Like a coconut, of which are aplenty in Kilifi.

title: Kill
description: Extended Index Finger Handshape with palm facing down traces a line across the neck.
memory_aid: Moving a knife across the neck.

title: Kill 2
description: Extended Index Finger Handshape with palm facing down traces a line across the neck.
memory_aid: Moving a knife across the neck.

title: Kilometre
description: Both hands are in F-Handshapes positioned in the center of the signing space. Left hand is closer to signer with palm facing up. Right hand with palm facing down starts by left hand and moves forward in a straight line. Movement is in several arcs.

title: Kimathi
note: Name of a place

title: Kin
description: Both hands are in slightly bent Full Closed Handshapes with palms facing one another. Fingertips of hands are touching to form a half-circle. Fingertips separate and hands curve back so hands meet at heels to form another half-circle.
memory_aid: Kin is enclosed within the circle.

title: Kind
note: One's natural disposition

title: King
note: Male ruler of a Kingdom

title: Kingdom Hall
note: Place of worship for Jehovah's witnesses

title: Kings Of Kings
note: Title

title: Kisii
note: Names of places are especially prone to variation. There may be another or a few other signs for 'Kisii'.
description: Fingertips of right hand, in Bent-B Handshape with palm facing signer, moves across right ear slightly and repetitively.

title: Kiss
note: Touching one's lips or cheecks with your lips

title: Kiss
note: Touching one's lips or cheecks with your lips

title: Kiss Me
note: Dating and romance

title: Kiss Me
note: Dating and romance

title: Kisumu
note: Names of towns are especially prone to variation. There may be another or a few other signs for 'Kisumu'.
description: Both hands are in Full Closed Handshapes with palms facing out. Hands move back and forth slightly and simultaneously.
memory_aid: Two hands represent the big size of Kisumu.

title: Kisumu 2
note: Names of towns are especially prone to variation. There may be another or a few other signs for 'Kisumu'.
description: Both hands are in Full Closed Handshapes with palms facing out. Hands move back and forth slightly and simultaneously.
memory_aid: Two hands represent the big size of Kisumu.

title: Kiswahili
description: Right X-Handshape with palm facing signer scratches little-finger side of left Full Closed Handshape.

title: Kitale
note: Names of towns are especially prone to variation. There may be another or a few other signs for 'Kitale'.
description: Right Claw Handshape with palm facing signer touches center of forehead. Hand taps forehead repetitively.
memory_aid: Derived from a name sign of Deaf resident.

title: Kitchen
note: While 'kitchen' is one word in English, it is a two-word phrase (COOK, ROOM) in KSL.
description: COOK 1 - Extended Index Finger Handshapes with palms facing signer are pointing up. The hands move alternately up and down. ROOM - Both Extended Index Finger Handshapes with palms facing down start side by side and move away from each other then back together in a square-like motion.

title: Kitui
note: Names of towns are especially prone to variation. There may be another or a few other signs for 'Kitui'.
description: Right Small-T Handshape with palm facing signer moves slightly up and down in front of mouth.

title: Knapsack
description: Both Modified-C Handshapes with palms facing signer touch shoulders. The hands then move down repetitively.

title: Kneel
note: Joint between the leg and thigh

title: Kneel
note: Joint between the leg and thigh

title: Knife
description: Right Full Closed Handshape with palm facing left is set on top of the left Full Closed Handshape with palm facing signer. The right hand moves back and forth on top of left hand.

title: Know
description: The fingertips of right Bent-B Handshape with palm facing down pat the forehead repetitively.

title: Knowledge
description: The fingertips of right Bent-B Handshape with palm facing down pat the forehead repetitively.

title: Knowledgeable
description: Full Closed Handshapes with palms facing signer touch sides of forehead. Hands move out to sides of signing space while wrists move out so that palms are facing out.

title: Koinange Street
note: Name of a street

title: Komarock
note: Name of a place

title: Ktn
note: Kenya Television Network

title: Kwale
note: Names of towns are especially prone to variation. There may be another or a few other signs for 'Kwale'.
description: Right Full Closed Handshape with palm facing down moves forward in several sloping motions.

title: L
description: Middle, ring and little fingers are folded down over palm. Index finger and thumb are straight. Thumb is sticking out sideways at 90 degrees to index finger. Palm is facing out.

title: Labor Day
note: Holiday, recognizing workers

title: Laborious
note: Note lowered eyebrows, an important part of the sign.
description: Right hand is in S-Handshape with palm facing up. Back of right hand touches upon back of downturned left S-Handshape.

title: Labour
description: The little-finger side of the right S-Handshape with palm facing left is brought down repetitively on top of the index finger side of the left S-Handshape with palm facing right.

title: Lack
description: Both Full Closed Handshapes with palms facing signer move back and forth in opposite directions. The fingers of both hands come in contact as they move pass each other.
memory_aid: Right hand is not with left hand.

title: Lackadaisical
note: Lowered eyebrows, shrugged shoulders, shaking head and pursed lips are all important parts of the sign. They all indicate carelessness.
description: Full Open Handshapes start at center of signing space with palms facing down. They move up to either side of signing space with palms facing up.

title: Lacking
description: Both Full Closed Handshapes with palms facing signer move back and forth in opposite directions. The fingers of both hands come in contact as they move pass each other.
memory_aid: Right hand is not with left hand.

title: Lady
note: A woman of higher class

title: Lake
note: While 'lake' is one word in English, it is a two-word phrase (WATER, AREA) in KSL.
description: WATER - Right C-Handshape with palm facing left moves up to open lips. At lips, wrist turns upwards. AREA - Full Open Handshapes with palms facing down begin in the center away from body. Hands then move towards the body in a wide circle.
memory_aid: Imaginary glass of water enclosed in an area.

title: Lake Victoria
note: 1. Note the mouth moving while signing AREA. This is an adjective to indicate the bigness of the lake. 2. While 'Lake Victoria' is a two-word phrase in English, it is a three-word phrase (KISUMU, WATER, AREA) in KSL. 3. Note that the sign for 'Kisumu' here is slightly different from the main entry in this dictionary. This is an example of variation. 4. Names of places are especially prone to variation. There may be another or a few other signs for 'Lake Victoria'.
description: KISUMU - Both hands are in Full Closed Handshapes with palms facing out. Hands move down slightly and simultaneously. WATER - Right C-Handshape with palm facing left moves up to open lips. At lips, wrist turns upwards. AREA - Full Open Handshapes with palms facing down begin in the center away from body. Hands then move towards the body in a wide circle.

title: Lame
note: Disabled
memory_aid: Mimics the motion of a lame person walking

title: Lament 1
note: 1. There is no difference in meaning between LAMENT 1 and LAMENT 2. They are variants of 'lament' in KSL. 2. Note lowered eyebrows, an essential part of the sign.
description: S-Handshape with palm facing down is placed under chin. Hand opens into Full Open Handshape repetitively.
memory_aid: Hand opening under mouth is lamenting.

title: Lament 2
note: 1. There is no difference in meaning between LAMENT 1 and LAMENT 2. They are variants of 'lament' in KSL. 2. Note the lowered eyebrows and movement of tongue. They are important parts of this sign. 3. KSL users consider this sign as part of KSL slang.
description: Extended Index Finger Handshape with palm facing signer points to throat repetitively.
memory_aid: Finger is pointing to lamenting mouth.

title: Lamp
description: Both hands assume Small-T Handshapes with palms facing sides. Right hand moves to strike against the top of the left hand. Right hand then forms an upside-down S-Handshape with palm facing the signer and moves up and down.
memory_aid: Striking a match, holding the lamp.

title: Lamu
note: Names of towns are especially prone to variation. There may be another or a few other signs for 'Lamu'.
description: Right Claw Handshape with palm facing down touches the top of head.
memory_aid: Looks like the traditional cap of Muslim men.

title: Land
description: Full Open Handshapes with palms facing down begin in the center away from body. They move towards the body in a wide circle.

title: Landslide
note: Downhill flow of rock, mud, water and anything caught in the path

title: Lane
description: Both Full Closed Handshapes with palms facing one another are held with fingers pointing out. Hands are moved simultaneously forward.

title: Lang'Ata
note: Name of a place

title: Language
description: Both L-Handshapes with palms facing down are next to each other with thumbs touching. The hands move straight apart in wavy motion.

title: Large
note: Note the raising of eyebrows which indicate largeness. This is an essential part of the sign.
description: Full Open Handshapes with palms facing one another start above the shoulders. They move apart and upwards.
memory_aid: Showing the size of something large.

title: Last
description: Right Full Closed Handshape starts with palm facing up. It moves down and back towards right side of signer.
memory_aid: Indicating the past in the timeline.

title: Late
description: Right Full Closed Handshape starts with palm facing up. It moves down and back towards right side of signer.

title: Late
note: Near the end of a period of time/ near the end of the day/ Not arriving until after an expected time

title: Late
note: Near the end of a period of time/ near the end of the day/ Not arriving until after an expected time

title: Late 2
description: Right Full Closed Handshape starts with palm facing up. It moves down and back towards right side of signer.

title: Later
description: Full Closed Handshape with palm facing signer and fingers pointing left moves in steps forward repetitively.

title: Latest 1
note: 1. 'Latest' as in new. 2. There is no difference in meaning between LATEST 1 and LATEST 2. They are variants of 'latest' in KSL.
description: I-Handshapes with palms facing out are at either side of signing space. Wrists turn hands back and up.
memory_aid: Hands turning up signifies something new.

title: Latest 2
note: 1. 'Latest' as in new. 2. There is no difference in meaning between LATEST 1 and LATEST 2. They are variants of 'latest' in KSL.
description: Right Thumbs-Up Handshape is held with thumb against right corner of mouth. Palm is facing out. Hand moves forward, turning until palm is facing signer.

title: Laugh
description: Fingers of Bent-V Handshape with palm facing signer taps upon chin.

title: Laughter
description: Fingers of Bent-V Handshape with palm facing signer taps upon chin.

title: Launch
note: Note the slight puffing of mouth as well as the tongue sticking out slightly. These are essential parts of the sign.
description: Right O-Handshape with palm facing signer starts at the bottom center of the signing space. The left hand is in a Full Open Handshape facing the chest. While right hand moves up towards the left hand, it opens into a Full Open Handshape. Left hand has moved down.
memory_aid: Something coming out of the ground.

title: Laundry
description: Both hands are in A-Handshapes. Right hand with palm facing down rests on upturned left hand. The right hand moves repetitively side to side.

title: Lavington
note: Name of a place

title: Law
description: Right L-Handshape starts down with thumb pointing up. Palm is facing left. Hand moves so that thumb of L-Handshape touches shoulder.

title: Law 2
description: Right L-Handshape starts down with thumb pointing up. Palm is facing left. Hand moves so that thumb of L-Handshape touches shoulder.

title: Lawyer
note: A professional person Qualified to practice law

title: Lax
description: Full Open Handshapes with palms facing signer are placed at sides of signing space. Hands move back and forth. Hands are not held up firmly so that when moving they fall back and forth from wrist.

title: Lazy
description: Full Open Handshapes with palms facing signer are placed at sides of signing space. Hands move back and forth. Hands are not held up firmly so that when moving they fall back and forth from wrist.

title: Lazy 2
description: Full Open Handshapes with palms facing signer are placed at sides of signing space. Hands move back and forth. Hands are not held up firmly so that when moving they fall back and forth from wrist.

title: Lea
description: Full Open Handshapes with palms facing down begin in the center away from body. They move towards the body in a wide circle.

title: Leader
description: Both S-Handshapes with palms facing down start at waist level. They move up to chest level simultaneously.
memory_aid: Looks like the stature of a leader.

title: Leaf
description: Full Closed Handshape with palm facing signer slightly moves back and forth from the wrist.
memory_aid: A leaf flapping in the air.

title: Leap
description: Both hands, in Bent-B Handshapes with palms facing signer, start side by side near the signer. Both hands move forward once simultaneously.

title: Learn
description: Flat-O Handshape with palm facing signer taps side of forehead.

title: Leather
note: A tough material produced from the skin of animals

title: Leave 1
note: 'Leave' as in to go.
description: Right G-Handshape with palm facing left moves to the right while fingers close into a Single-O Handshape.
memory_aid: G' turns into an 'O', spelling G-O.

title: Leave 2
note: 'Leave' as in to go away.
description: Right Full Open Handshape with palm facing left and fingers pointing down moves up from wrist to the right. Palm is now facing out.

title: Leave 3
note: 'Leave' as in to leave something alone or give away.
description: Full Open Handshapes with palms facing signer are positioned at side of signing space. They move up from the wrists so that palms are now away from the signer.

title: Leave Behind
note: While 'leave behind' is a two-word phrase in English, it is one sign in KSL.
description: Full Open Handshapes with palms facing signer are positioned at side of signing space. They move up from the wrists so that palms are now away from the signer.

title: Leave Me Alone
note: Family and relationships

title: Left
note: 1. 'Left' as in the left hand. 2. Sign LEFT with your own left arm. Do not reverse for other people.
description: Left hand is in S-Handshape with palm facing down. Arm is held horizontal with fist pointing away from signer. Hand moves slightly to the left repetitively.

title: Legal
description: Right L-Handshape starts down with thumb pointing up. Palm is facing left. Hand moves so that thumb of L-Handshape touches shoulder.

title: Leisure
description: Both hands are in Full Closed Handshapes with palms facing sides. Hands are crossed at the wrists with fingers pointing down.

title: Lemon
description: Right A-Handshape with palm facing up is held against right cheek and pulled away.
memory_aid: Sourness of lemon makes mouth puckers.

title: Lemon
note: A yellowish citrus fruit

title: Length
description: Both Flat-O Handshapes with palms facing signer are together touching at the fingertips. Hands move away from one another in a straight line simultaneously.

title: Lengthy
description: Both Flat-O Handshapes with palms facing signer are together touching at the fingertips. Hands move away from one another in a straight line simultaneously.

title: Leso
description: Both hands are in Full Closed Handshapes. Left hand with palm facing out waits by side of waist while right hand with palm facing signer moves in to center of waist. Left hand follows.

title: Lesotho
note: Names of places are especially prone to variation. There may be another or a few other signs for 'Lesotho'.
description: L-Handshape with palm facing out moves in small circles.

title: Less
note: Note the eyebrows lowering and the tongue sticking out. These are important parts of the sign.
description: Right L-Handshape with palm facing out moves down as fingers close into a Single-O Handshape.

title: Less Than
note: While 'less than' is a two-word phrase in English, it is one sign in KSL.
description: Full Closed Handshape with palm facing down is pointing out. Hand moves down and up repetitively.

title: Lessen
note: Note the eyebrows lowering and the tongue sticking out. These are important parts of the sign.
description: Right L-Handshape with palm facing out moves down as fingers close into a Single-O Handshape.

title: Lesson
description: Both hands are in Full Closed Handshapes. Left hand is held upright so that palm is facing out. Thumb-side of right hand with palm facing down touches top of left hand. It moves down on left arm in steps.

title: Lesson Plan
note: While 'lesson plan' is a two-word phrase in English, it is one sign in KSL.
description: Both hands are in Full Closed Handshapes. Left hand is held upright so that palm is facing out. Thumb-side of right hand with palm facing down touches top of left hand. It moves down on left arm in steps.

title: Let Go
note: While 'let go' is a two-word phrase in English, it is one sign in KSL.
description: Both S-Handshapes with palms facing signer are crossed in front of the body. Hands swing out so that palms face out.
memory_aid: Hands look like they are breaking free from some kind of bind.

title: Let Somebody Know
note: While 'let somebody know' is a three-word phrase in English, it is one sign in KSL.
description: O-Handshapes with palms facing out are positioned in front of mouth. Hands move out to either side of the signing space as handshapes open into Full Open Handshapes. Palms are then facing down.

title: Let's Go
note: General conversation

title: Letter 1
note: 'Letter' as in a posted letter.
description: Both hands are in Full Closed Handshapes. The fingertips of right hand with palm facing signer touch the mouth. While moving down, right hand turns so that palm is facing down to touch upon upturned left Full Closed Handshape.

title: Letter 2
note: 'Letter' as in an alphabetic letter like 'A, B, C'.
description: Full Open Handshape is positioned by the shoulder with palm facing down. Fingers wriggle as hand moves from side to side.
memory_aid: Indicates the shape of alphabetic letters.

title: Lexicon
description: Both G-Handshapes with palms facing one another are touching at fingers. Hands move away slightly from one another while closing into Single-O Handshapes. This is done repetitively.

title: Liability
description: U-Handshapes with palms facing down tap right shoulder.

title: Liable
description: U-Handshapes with palms facing down tap right shoulder.

title: Liberate
description: Both S-Handshapes with palms facing signer are crossed in front of the body. Hands swing out so that palms face out.
memory_aid: Hands look like they are breaking free from some kind of bind.

title: Liberation
note: secure' as in safe.
description: Both S-Handshapes with palms facing signer are crossed in front of the body. Hands swing out so that palms face out.
memory_aid: Hands look like they are breaking free from some kind of bind.

title: Library
description: Full Closed Handshapes are held with palms together and fingertips pointing away. Palms are facing signer. Hands open and close repetitively with sides always touching. Then right hand, still in Full Closed Handshape, moves to front of face with palm facing left. Hand moves in steps to the right.
memory_aid: Demonstrating the organisation of books in a library.

title: License
description: Both L-Handshapes with palms facing out are held together at thumbs. The hands move in and out repetitively.

title: Lie 1
note: 1. 'Lie' as in to tell a falsehood. 2. There is no difference in meaning between LIE 1, LIE 2 and LIE 3. They are variants of 'lie' in KSL.
description: The thumb of right hand, in a Full Open Handshape with palm facing left, touches the nose. Fingers move in a wriggling motion.
memory_aid: The nose wrinkles when one lies.

title: Lie 2
note: 1. 'Lie' as in to tell a falsehood. 2. There is no difference in meaning between LIE 1, LIE 2 and LIE 3. They are variants of 'lie' in KSL.
description: Right X-Handshape with palm facing signer moves in a line under chin repetitively.

title: Lie 3
note: 1. 'Lie' as in to tell a falsehood. 2. There is no difference in meaning between LIE 1, LIE 2 and LIE 3. They are variants of 'lie' in KSL. 3. This sign forms the number 'forty-five' with the 'five' moving down and to the right of the 'four'.
description: Right hand is held up with palm facing signer. Thumb remains folded against palm. Index and middle fingers are held together while ring and little fingers are held together. Hand moves down in an angle while changing into an S-Handshape.
memory_aid: If a 90-degree angle is a right angle, then a 45-degree angle is a false angle meaning a 'lie'.

title: Life
description: Both A-Handshapes with palms facing signer are pointing down. They start at the waist and move up simultaneously in straight lines up the body.

title: Life-Threatening
note: Note lowered eyebrows and sticking-out tongue. These are essential parts of the sign.
description: Right Extended Index Finger Handshape with palm facing left moves from side to side in front of mouth.
memory_aid: Something threatening in front of face.

title: Lift
note: To raise/ to remove

title: Light 1
note: 'Light' as in a light fixture.
description: Right O-Handshape with palm facing down is held above head and moved slightly downward while hand opens into Full Open Handshape.
memory_aid: Indicates the light emitted from a bulb overhead.

title: Light 2
note: 'Light' as in having light, being bright.
description: Both hands, in O-Handshapes with palms facing out, start side by side in center of signing space. Both hands move simultaneously outward away from each other in slight arc. Hands open into Full Open Handshapes.
memory_aid: Indicates light given out by some light source.

title: Light 3
note: 'Light' as in not heavy.
description: Full Open Handshapes with palms facing signer are placed at sides of signing space. Hands move back and forth. Hands are not held up firmly so that when moving they fall back and forth from wrist.

title: Lightning
note: A flash of light produced by short-duration, high voltage discharge of electricity within a cloud

title: Like 1
note: 'Like' as in being similar to something else.
description: The sides of the Extended Index Finger Handshapes are brought together once or repetitively. Palms are facing down.
memory_aid: Two same things are brought together.

title: Like 2
note: 'Like' as in to find something pleasant.
description: Fingers of right hand, in Full Open Handshape with palm facing signer, move down repetitively on throat.

title: Likoni
note: Names of towns are especially prone to variation. There may be another or a few other signs for 'Likoni'.
description: Both hands start side by side in Bent-B Handshapes with palms facing the signer. Hands move simultaneously upward from the wrists so that hands end up in Full Closed Handshapes with palms facing up.
memory_aid: The ferries that run out of Likoni.

title: Lime
description: Right A-Handshape with palm facing up is held against right cheek and pulled away.
memory_aid: Sourness of lime makes mouth puckers.

title: Limuru
note: Names of towns are especially prone to variation. There may be another or a few other signs for 'Limuru'.
description: Both hands are in Small-T Handshapes with palms facing out. Both hands move in and up simultaneously from the wrists so that palms face signer.

title: Limuru Road
note: Name of the road that leads to Limuru

title: Line
note: A path through two or more points/ an infinitely extended one-dimensional figure that has no curvature/ A rope

title: Link
note: 'Link' as in to come together.
description: Both hands are in Full Closed Handshapes with palms facing one another and thumbs up. They start at opposite ends of the signing space and come together until the palms touch.

title: Lion
description: Both Claw Handshapes with palms facing signer start at either side of head. Both move down simultaneously.

title: Lip
note: front fleshy part of the mouth

title: List
description: Right Extended Index Finger Handshape with palm facing down points to top of upright left Full Closed Handshape with palm facing out. Right hand moves down left hand pointing at different places.

title: Listen
description: Right Full Open Handshape with palm facing out touches the side of the head just before the ear. Head tilts downward at same time.

title: Little 1
note: 1. 'Little' as in not very tall. 2. This sign is used to refer to people or animals.
description: Right hand, in a Claw Handshape with palm facing down, moves down in a straight line.
memory_aid: Indicates the littleness of a person.

title: Little 2
note: 1. 'Little' as in a small thing. 2. This sign refers to objects only. 3. Note face scrunch and lowered eyebrows, important elements of this sign.
description: Right G-Handshape with palm facing left is held in front of the face.

title: Little 3
note: 'Little' as in young.
description: Right Bent-B Handshape with palm facing signer starts chest high then moves down.

title: Little 4
note: 1. 'Little' as in not much. 2. Note the lowered eyebrows and 'th' mouth movement. These are essential parts of the sign.
description: Small-T Handshape with palm facing up is positioned in center of signing space. Hand moves forward slightly.
memory_aid: Just a few things can be held between these two fingers.

title: Live
description: Both A-Handshapes with palms facing signer are pointing down. They start at the waist and move up simultaneously in straight lines up the body. Hands then change into Full Closed Handshapes with palms facing down. They move down to rest in middle of signing space.

title: Liver
note: Organ in the body that stores and metabolizes nutrients, destroys toxins and produced bile

title: Liver
note: Organ in the body that stores and metabolizes nutrients, destroys toxins and produced bile

title: Living Room
description: REST - Both hands are in Full Open Handshapes with palms facing down. Thumbs are tucked underneath armpits while fingers wriggle. ROOM - Both Extended Index Finger Handshapes with palms facing down start side by side and move away from each other then back together in a square-like motion.
memory_aid: How a person would look when relaxing in a living room.

title: Loan
note: lend money

title: Location
description: Right Full Open Handshape with palm facing down and fingers pointing left is positioned near right shoulder. Hand moves in an inward circular motion while remaining in place.

title: Lock
note: 'Lock' as in to fasten with a lock.
description: Right hand is in Small-T Handshape with palm facing down. Hand turns to the right so that palm faces left.
memory_aid: As if turning a key in a door.

title: Locomotive
description: Right Full Closed Handshape with the palm facing left is by right side of signer. Arm moves in forward circular motions.
memory_aid: Imitating the moving wheels on a train.

title: Lokichokio
note: This is an example of fingerspelling. There is not yet a standard sign for 'Lokichokio', however there may be signs in Lokichokio for the town's name.
description: The letters L, O, K, I, C, H, O, K, I, and O are spelled in succession.

title: Long
description: Both Flat-O Handshapes with palms facing signer are together touching at the fingertips. Hands move away from one another in a straight line simultaneously.

title: Long 2
description: Both Flat-O Handshapes with palms facing signer are together touching at the fingertips. Hands move away from one another in a straight line simultaneously.

title: Long Ago
note: 1. Note lowered eyebrows and round mouth. These are essential parts of the sign. 2. In the timeline of the signer, anything behind signer indicates the past.
description: Full Closed Handshape with palm facing back is placed by side of head. Hand moves in a backward circular motion repetitively.

title: Long Time Ago
note: General conversation

title: Long-Suffering
note: Interests

title: Look 1
note: 'Look' as in to look for.
description: Bent-V Handshape with palm facing out is held by right side of face. Hand is moved out and around, while shaking slightly from wrist.
memory_aid: As if a pair of eyes were looking around.

title: Look 2
note: 1. 'Look' as in to see, to look at. 2. This sign can change direction depending on who or what one is looking at. In this video, the direction used indicates that the signer is looking at you. If someone were looking at her, the hand would move towards her. If she were looking at many people or things, she would move the hand to indicate different people/things.
description: Right Bent-V Handshape with palm facing out starts by right eye. It moves out in a straight line.
memory_aid: As if looking at an object.

title: Lord Of Lords
note: Title

title: Lorry
note: Note the puffed up motion of the mouth. This is an adjective to indicate the bigness of a lorry.
description: Both hands are in S-Handshapes with palms facing up. Hands move back and forth alternately. Then when moving up to either side of head, both hands change into L-Handshapes with palms facing one another. Both hands move back from wrists simultaneously and repetitively.

title: Lose
note: 'Lose' as in to lose something.
description: Fingertips of both hands, in O-Handshapes with palms facing up, are touching. Hands turn down from wrists simultaneously while changing into Full Open Handshapes with palms facing down.
memory_aid: Looks like something is being lost.

title: Loss
description: Fingertips of both hands, in O-Handshapes with palms facing up, are touching. Hands turn down from wrists simultaneously while changing into Full Open Handshapes with palms facing down.
memory_aid: Looks like something is being lost.

title: Loud
description: S-Handshape with palm facing down is placed under chin. Hand opens into Full Open Handshape.
memory_aid: A lot of noise coming from the mouth.

title: Love
description: Both hands are in S-Handshapes with palms facing signer. Hands are crossed at wrists and resting on chest.
memory_aid: A hug from a loved one.

title: Lover
description: Both Modified-C Handshapes with palms facing one another are placed over area of heart. Index fingers move down repetitively.

title: Low
description: Full Closed Handshape with palm facing down is pointing out. Hand moves down and up repetitively.
memory_aid: Hand is indicating a low level.

title: Lower
description: The right hand is in a Bent-B Handshape with palm facing down and moves in a slight circle.
memory_aid: Indication of the lower part of an object.

title: Lower Than
note: While 'lower than' is a two-word phrase in English, it is one sign in KSL.
description: Full Closed Handshape with palm facing down is pointing out. Hand moves down and up repetitively.

title: Loyal
description: Right Full Closed Handshape with palm facing signer touches the chest. Head and body bow down slightly.

title: Loyalty
description: Right Full Closed Handshape with palm facing signer touches the chest. Head and body bow down slightly.

title: Lucid
note: Note lowered head and eyebrows, essential parts of the sign.
description: Flat-O Handshapes with palms facing down start at opposite ends of signing space. Hands move down towards one another as hands open into Full Open Handshapes.

title: Luck
description: Full Closed Handshape with palm facing signer is placed on chest. Hand moves in an inward circular motion.

title: Lucky
description: Full Closed Handshape with palm facing signer is placed on chest. Hand moves in an inward circular motion.

title: Luhya
note: Names of tribes are especially prone to variation. There may be another or a few other signs for 'Luhya'.
description: Fingertips of right hand, in Full Closed Handshape with palm facing the signer, touch the chin. Hand rocks side to side.
memory_aid: Refers to the male initiation ritual in which the four lower teeth are removed.

title: Lumber
description: Both C-Handshapes with palms facing down are together. They move away from one another then back again in a straight line.

title: Lunar
description: Both L-Handshapes with palms facing out are touching at the fingertips of the thumb and index fingers. Left hand moves up while right hand moves down. Both close into Single-O Handshapes.

title: Lunch
note: While 'lunch' is one word in English, it is a two-word phrase (FOOD, NOON) in KSL.
