description: FOOD - Right Flat-O Handshape with palm facing down taps repetitively on the mouth. NOON - Right Full Closed Handshape with palm facing left is pointing up in front of the body and head.
memory_aid: Action of eating and the position of sun at noontime.

title: Lungs
note: Body organ that pumps air in and out of the body

title: Lungs
note: Body organ that pumps air in and out of the body

title: Luo
note: Names of tribes are especially prone to variation. There may be another or a few other signs for 'Luo'.
description: Fingertips of right Modified-C Handshape with palm facing signer tap upon the chin.
memory_aid: Refers to the lower six teeth which are removed in a rite of passage for men.

title: Luo 2
note: Names of tribes are especially prone to variation. There may be another or a few other signs for 'Luo'.
description: Fingertips of right Modified-C Handshape with palm facing signer tap upon the chin.
memory_aid: Refers to the lower six teeth which are removed in a rite of passage for men.

title: M
description: Thumb folds across palm. Index, middle, ring and little fingers are folded down over thumb. Palm is facing out.

title: M.P. Shah
note: Name of a hospital

title: Maasai
note: Names of tribes are especially prone to variation. There may be another or a few other signs for 'Maasai'.
description: Fingertips of the Double-L Handshape with palm facing signer touch the center of forehead. Fingers, except the thumb, move down repetitively.
memory_aid: Refers to hair or head decoration of Maasai.

title: Machakos
note: Names of towns are especially prone to variation. There may be another or a few other signs for 'Machakos'.
description: Fingertips of the right Bent-B Handshape with palm facing left touch upon the palm of the outturned left Full Open Handshape.
memory_aid: The area is renowned for its carvings.

title: Mad
description: Right Extended Index Finger Handshape with palm facing down points to side of head and moves in a circular motion.
memory_aid: Things are mixed up in the head.

title: Madagascar
note: Names of places are especially prone to variation. There may be another or a few other signs for 'Madagascar'.
description: Full Closed Handshapes with palms facing back are positioned at right side of signer with fingers pointing down. Hands move back and forth from the wrists repetitively.

title: Magazine
note: A periodical publication/ a chamber in a firearm

title: Magic
description: Full Closed Handshape with palm facing signer is positioned before mouth. Hand moves down on mouth as mouth blows upon palm. Hand then moves to right side of signer where it assumes O-Handshape. O-Handshape moves to center of signing space while turning into a Full Open Handshape with palm facing left.

title: Magnificent
description: Index finger of Modified-C handshape is resting on top of chin while thumb is underneath chin. Head moves slightly side to side.

title: Mail 1
note: 'Mail' as in postal letters.
description: Both hands are in Full Closed Handshapes. The fingertips of right hand with palm facing signer touch the mouth. While moving down, right hand turns so that palm is facing down to touch upon upturned left Full Closed Handshape.

title: Mail 2
note: 'Mail' as in to send a postal letter.
description: Flat-O Handshape with palm facing down moves down and opens.
memory_aid: Hand is putting a letter in a postal box.

title: Maintenance
description: V-Handshape with palm facing signer is placed upon left Extended Index Finger Handshape which is pointing out. V-Handshape moves up and down on the left hand.
memory_aid: Looks like pliers tightening a part.

title: Maize
description: Both hands are in Thumbs-Up Handshapes with palms facing one another. The thumb of the right hand is resting on top of thumb of the left hand. Right hand moves forward and downward repetitively.
memory_aid: As if pulling kernels of maize off a cob.

title: Majority
description: Both hands are in Full Closed Handshapes. Palm of left hand is facing up while palm of right hand is facing down. Right hand starts on top of left hand and moves up in a straight line. Both hands turn from wrists so that they are facing out.
memory_aid: Adding more to what one already has.

title: Makadara
note: Name of a place along jogoo road

title: Make
description: Both hands are in Flat-O Handshapes. They are together, touching at the fingertips. Left hand is facing up and right hand is facing down. Right hand moves around fingers of left hand. As it is moving, it opens and closes.

title: Make Up Your Mind
note: While 'make up your mind' is a four-word phrase in English, it is one sign in KSL.
description: Index fingers of both Full Open Handshapes with palms facing signer touch either side of forehead. Hands move down and change into F-Handshapes with palms facing one another.

title: Make Use Of
note: While 'make use of' is a three-word phrase in English, it is one sign in KSL.
description: Right U-Handshape with palm facing out moves in a circular motion on top of downturned left Full Closed Handshape.

title: Make Yourself At Home
note: At home

title: Malaria
note: Note lowered eyebrows and raised shoulders, essential parts of the sign.
description: Both S-Handshapes with palms facing each other are placed at sides of body. In this position the arms move in slightly and repetitively.
memory_aid: Shivering as if sick with malaria.

title: Malaria
note: A disease spread by mosquito

title: Malawi
note: Names of places are especially prone to variation. There may be another or a few other signs for 'Malawi'.
description: Small-T Handshape with palm facing left moves in a slight circular motion from the wrist.

title: Male
description: Right Full Closed Handshape with palm facing signer is placed on the face with the thumb on the right side of the jaw and the other four fingers on the left side of the jaw. The fingers close into Flat-O Handshape as the hand moves down repetitively.

title: Malicious
note: While CRUEL shares the same sign as other English words like 'inhumane', 'mean', and 'rude', they have slightly different facial expressions. The more intense the meanness, the more intense the facial expression. Hence CRUEL gets a more intense facial expression than RUDE does.
description: Claw Handshapes with palms facing down rest upon either side of head. Hands move out simultaneously in a straight line.

title: Malindi
note: Names of towns are especially prone to variation. There may be another or a few other signs for 'Malindi'.
description: Right O-Handshape with palm facing signer moves over stomach in an inward circular motion repetitively.
memory_aid: This sign was given by travellers who felt ill in the stomach.

title: Mama Ngina Street
note: Name of a street

title: Man
description: Right Full Closed Handshape with palm facing signer is placed on the face with the thumb on the right side of the jaw and the other four fingers on the left side of the jaw. The fingers close into Flat-O Handshape as the hand moves down repetitively.

title: Manage
description: Both hands are in Small-T Handshapes with palms facing down. They are held next to each other. Hands move forward and back alternately.

title: Management
description: Both hands are in Small-T Handshapes with palms facing down. They are held next to each other. Hands move forward and back alternately.

title: Mandazi
description: The right hand is in a Claw Handshape with palm facing up. Hand moves up and down.

title: Mango
description: Modified C-Handshape with palm facing signer moves upward in front of the mouth.

title: Mango
note: Fruit from the mango tree/ mango tree

title: Manner
note: 1. 'Manner' as in attitude. 2. The facial expression used by the signer in the video indicates a negative manner. If one wishes to express a positive manner, the facial expressions should change to reflect so.
description: Right V-Handshape with palm facing down is placed in front of face pointing left. Hand moves up and down from wrist.

title: Manners
description: Both hands are in Full Open Handshapes with palms facing signer. They alternately and repetitively move up the body.
memory_aid: Hands indicate the manners of a person.

title: Manual
description: Full Closed Handshapes are held with palms together and fingertips pointing away. Palms are facing signer. Hands open and close repetitively with sides always touching.

title: Many
description: Right Full Open Handshape with palm facing down repetitively hits the side of the left hand which is in an S-Handshape.
memory_aid: The hand hits again and again meaning 'many'.

title: Map
description: Both Extended Index Finger Handshapes with palms facing out are positioned in middle of signing space. Fingers are pointing at one another and then move in opposite directions down. As they move down, they move in a side to side motion. They meet again at the bottom.

title: Mar 1
note: 1. There is no difference in meaning between MAR 1 and MAR 2. They are variants of 'mar' in KSL. 2. Note the lowered eyebrows, mouth movement and tilted head. These are all important parts of the sign.
description: Both Small-T Handshapes with palms facing down are placed side by side. Hands move up and slightly away repetitively.

title: Mar 2
note: 1. There is no difference in meaning between MAR 1 and MAR 2. They are variants of 'mar' in KSL. 2. Note the lowered eyebrows, mouth movement and tilted head. These are all important parts of the sign.
description: Both hands are in A-Handshapes with palm of left hand facing up and palm of right hand facing down. Hands move in opposite directions with right hand always touching top of left hand.

title: Margarine
description: The tips of the fingers of downturned right U-Handshape are moved over the palm of upturned left Full Closed Handshape. Movement is done repetitively and towards the signer.

title: Marijuana
note: Note the mouth movement. This is an important part of the sign.
description: F-Handshape with palm facing out is placed at side of mouth while face moves slightly back.

title: Maringo
note: Name of a place along jogoo road

title: Mark
note: 'Mark' as in to mark a paper.
description: Right Extended Index Finger Handshape with palm facing left starts at head level and moves down in a repetitive check-like motion.

title: Mark Pen
note: Pen used in white boards and charts

title: Market
description: Both Full Open Handshapes with palms facing down start side by side. They move away from one another in steps.
memory_aid: Indicating tables set out at the market.

title: Marriage
description: Both hands form I-Handshapes with little fingers bent. The left hand is held sideways so palm is facing signer. The right little finger hooks on the left little finger.

title: Marry
description: Both hands form I-Handshapes with little fingers bent. The left hand is held sideways so palm is facing signer. The right little finger hooks on the left little finger.

title: Marry Me
note: Dating and romance

title: Marry Me
note: Dating and romance

title: Marsabit
note: 1. The T shown in this video is a variation of the T shown in the manual alphabet on this video. See 'T'. 2. This is an example of fingerspelling. There is not yet a standard sign for 'Marsabit', however there may be signs in Marsabit for the town's name.
description: The letters M, A, R, S, A, B, I, and T are spelled in succession.

title: Marvellous
description: Index finger of Modified-C handshape is resting on top of chin while thumb is underneath chin. Head moves slightly side to side.

title: Mary
note: Name of a Bible character, the mother of Jesus

title: Maseno
note: Names of towns are especially prone to variation. There may be another or a few other signs for 'Maseno'.
description: Fingers of Right Modified-C Handshape with palm facing signer touch the side of the face near the ear. Hand moves down repetitively.

title: Massive
note: Note the raising of eyebrows which indicate largeness. This is an essential part of the sign.
description: Full Open Handshapes with palms facing one another start above the shoulders. They move apart and upwards.
memory_aid: Showing the size of something massive.

title: Matatu
description: Right hand is in the Claw Handshape with palm facing down. Hand makes downward repetitive motions from the wrist.
memory_aid: Similar to the gestures travellers make when beckoning a matatu.

title: Match
note: A competitive sporting event

title: Match
note: A competitive sporting event

title: Mater Hospital
note: Name of a hospital

title: Material 1
note: 1. 'Material' as in a thing. 2. There is no difference in meaning between MATERIAL 1 and MATERIAL 2. They are variants of 'material' in KSL.
description: Both hands are in Full Open Handshapes with palms facing up. They start side by side and move away from one another in a slight bouncing motion.

title: Material 2
note: 1. 'Material' as in a thing. 2. There is no difference in meaning between MATERIAL 1 and MATERIAL 2. They are variants of 'material' in KSL.
description: Both Extended Index Finger Handshapes with palms facing down are pointing out. Right hand starts above left hand. Hands move towards one another slightly and then reverse while switching so that left hand is now on top. This is done repetitively.

title: Maternity
note: Hospital ward for pregnant women

title: Mathare
note: Name of a place

title: Mathematics
description: Left hand is in a Claw Handshape with palm facing up. Right Extended Index Finger Handshape with palm facing signer touches upon fingers of left hand, which close after being touched.

title: Mathew
note: Name of the 1st Bible book in the new testament

title: Mathew
note: Name of the 1st Bible book in the new testament

title: Maths
description: Left hand is in a Claw Handshape with palm facing up. Right Extended Index Finger Handshape with palm facing signer touches upon fingers of left hand, which close after being touched.

title: Mature
note: Able to distinguish right and wrong

title: Maybe
description: Both hands are in Full Closed Handshapes with palms facing up. Hands move up and down alternately.

title: Mayor
description: Right C-Handshape with palm facing up taps chest.
memory_aid: As if holding a badge that indicates one is a mayor.

title: Me
description: Extended Index Finger Handshape with palm facing left points to chest.

title: Me
note: Myself

title: Me Too
note: General conversation

title: Me Too
note: General conversation

title: Meadow
description: Full Open Handshapes with palms facing down begin in the center away from body. They move towards the body in a wide circle.

title: Meagre
note: Note the lowered eyebrows and 'th' mouth movement. These are essential parts of the sign.
description: Small-T Handshape with palm facing up is positioned in center of signing space. Hand moves forward slightly.
memory_aid: Just a few things can be held between these two fingers.

title: Mean 1
note: 'Mean' as in not nice.
description: Right L-Handshape with palm facing signer touches the side of hip. The hand moves forward and slightly upward while the index finger bends.
memory_aid: As if someone were pulling out a gun.

title: Mean 2
note: 'Mean' as in to define something.
description: Right V-Handshape with palm facing left is pointing down on upturned left Full Closed Handshape. The right hand moves to the right and lands again on the left palm. Palm of right hand is now facing signer.

title: Mean 3
note: 1. 'Mean' as in cruel. 2. While CRUEL shares the same sign as other English words like 'inhumane', 'mean', and 'rude', they have slightly different facial expressions. The more intense the meanness, the more intense the facial expression. Hence CRUEL gets a more intense facial expression than RUDE does.
description: Claw Handshapes with palms facing down rest upon either side of head. Hands move out simultaneously in a straight line.

title: Meander
note: Note the mouthing 'wah, wah' which is an important part of the sign.
description: Full Open Handshape with palm facing left moves forward in small curves.
memory_aid: Hand represents a person walking about the street.

title: Meaning
description: Right V-Handshape with palm facing left is pointing down on upturned left Full Closed Handshape. The right hand moves to the right and lands again on the left palm. Palm of right hand is now facing signer.

title: Measles
note: An acute highly contagious disease caused by measles virus

title: Measure
note: Quantity/ size/ weight

title: Meat 1
note: 1. There is no difference in meaning between MEAT 1 and MEAT 2. They are variants of 'meat' in KSL. 2. To specify a type of meat, sign MEAT and the name of the animal it comes from. For example, to sign BEEF you would combine MEAT and COW.
description: Right Small-T Handshape with palm facing left starts by side of mouth. Hand moves down repetitively.

title: Meat 2
note: 1. There is no difference in meaning between MEAT 1 and MEAT 2. They are variants of 'meat' in KSL. 2. To specify a type of meat, sign MEAT and the name of the animal it comes from. For example, to sign BEEF you would combine MEAT and COW.
description: Left S-Handshape with palm facing right is placed in front of mouth. Right Full Closed Handshape with palm facing signer is closer to the mouth. It moves up and down between left hand and mouth.

title: Meat Soup
description: MEAT - Right Full Closed Handshape with palm facing signer is held at the right side of the mouth and moved slightly up and down. SOUP - Right Extended Index Finger Handshape with palm facing left moves down from the nose to the base of throat.
memory_aid: Indicates the way one eats meat and then the way soup flows down the throat.

title: Medical
description: Right X-Handshape with palm facing signer taps the side of the left arm.
memory_aid: Indicating the armband of a medical worker.

title: Medical
note: Pertaining to the practice of medicine

title: Medication
description: The right hand is in an S-Handshape which faces the chin. The index finger pops out repetitively towards the mouth.

title: Medicine
description: The right hand is in an S-Handshape which faces the chin. The index finger pops out repetitively towards the mouth.

title: Meet
note: The verb form of 'meet' is signed once, while the noun form 'meeting' is signed repetitively. For example, 'I will meet you at the store' is signed as ME MEET YOU THERE STORE with one movement for the sign MEET. 'They are in a meeting' is signed as THEY THERE MEETING with repetitive movement for the sign MEETING.
description: Both O-Handshapes with palms facing down are brought together so that the fingertips touch.
memory_aid: Faces coming together in a meeting.

title: Meeting
note: The verb form of 'meet' is signed once, while the noun form 'meeting' is signed repetitively. For example, 'I will meet you at the store' is signed as ME MEET YOU THERE STORE with one movement for the sign MEET. 'They are in a meeting' is signed as THEY THERE MEETING with repetitive movement for the sign MEETING.
description: Both O-Handshapes with palms facing down are brought together so that the fingertips touch.
memory_aid: Faces coming together in a meeting.

title: Melon
note: Note the mouth movement, an important part of the sign.
description: Both C-Handshapes with palms facing signer are placed at right side of signing space. Hands move in a straight line to the left.

title: Melt
note: Note mouth movement, an essential part of the sign.
description: Flat-O Handshapes with palms facing up move down simultaneously. As they move down, thumbs move forward so that hands become A-Handshapes.
memory_aid: Hands look like they are melting.

title: Memorize
description: X-Handshape with palm facing signer taps side of head.

title: Mend
description: V-Handshape with palm facing signer is placed upon left Extended Index Finger Handshape which is pointing out. V-Handshape moves up and down on the left hand.
memory_aid: Looks like pliers tightening a part.

title: Meningitis
note: Inflammation of the meninges

title: Menstruation
description: Right Full Open Handshape with palm facing down strikes the side of the neck twice. Hand then moves down body repetitively.
memory_aid: Blood flowing out of the body.

title: Mental
note: Relating to the mind/ Insane

title: Merciless
note: While CRUEL shares the same sign as other English words like 'inhumane', 'mean', and 'rude', they have slightly different facial expressions. The more intense the meanness, the more intense the facial expression. Hence CRUEL gets a more intense facial expression than RUDE does.
description: Claw Handshapes with palms facing down rest upon either side of head. Hands move out simultaneously in a straight line.
memory_aid: Head swells with lack of mercy.

title: Mercy
note: Note lowered eyebrows and head, essential parts of the sign.
description: Full Closed Handshape with palm facing signer is circled on the chest over the heart.
memory_aid: A plea coming from the heart.

title: Meru
note: Names of towns are especially prone to variation. There may be another or a few other signs for 'Meru'.
description: Both hands are in Full Closed Handshapes with palms facing the body. The hands are positioned at either side of the head. They move up and down from the wrists.
memory_aid: Meru is known as a cool place.

title: Messiah
note: Anointed one

title: Messy
note: Note the lowered eyebrows and scrunched face, important parts of the sign.
description: Right Extended Index Finger Handshape with palm facing left moves from side to side in front of face.
memory_aid: Hand seems to be waving away an unpleasant odour.

title: Metal
note: Any element in the periodic table that forms a metallic bond

title: Metamorphose
description: Both hands are in A-Handshapes with palms touching one another. The right hand is closest to the signer. Hands turn over still touching so that left hand is now closer to the signer.

title: Metamorphosis
description: Both hands are in A-Handshapes with palms touching one another. The right hand is closest to the signer. Hands turn over still touching so that left hand is now closer to the signer.

title: Midday
description: Right Full Closed Handshape with palm facing left is pointing up in front of head.

title: Middle
description: Right Extended Index Finger Handshape with palm facing down makes a circle over the upturned left Full Closed Handshape. Finger then touches down upon the middle of the left palm.

title: Midnight
description: Both Full Closed Handshapes with palms facing signer are positioned at the sides of head. Both hands move down and towards one another simultaneously. They stop moving when right hand covers front of left hand. Right hand then moves to bottom center of signing space and points down. Its palm is facing left.
memory_aid: Indicates darkness and the opposite of noon.

title: Midnight 2
description: Both Full Closed Handshapes with palms facing signer are positioned at the sides of head. Both hands move down and towards one another simultaneously. They stop moving when right hand covers front of left hand. Right hand then moves to bottom center of signing space and points down. Its palm is facing left.
memory_aid: Indicates darkness and the opposite of noon.

title: Might 1
note: 'Might' as in maybe.
description: Both hands are in Full Closed Handshapes with palms facing up. Hands move up and down alternately.

title: Might 2
note: 'Might' as in strength.
description: Both hands are in S-Handshapes with palms facing signer. Arms move in close to the body and strike down slightly once.

title: Might Be
note: While 'might be' is a two-word phrase in English, it is one sign in KSL.
description: Both hands are in Full Closed Handshapes with palms facing up. Hands move up and down alternately.

title: Migori
note: 1. This is how 'M' is signed in the Manual Alphabet of England. 2. Names of towns are especially prone to variation. There may be another or a few other signs for 'Migori'.
description: Fingers of Right B-Handshape with palm facing down touch down repetitively upon the palm of the upturned left Full Closed Handshape.

title: Mildness
note: Quality of being mild

title: Military
note: Relating to armed forces

title: Milk
description: Both hands are in Modified-C Handshapes with palms facing one another. As they move alternately up and down before the body, the thumbs close and open forming Small-T Handshapes.

title: Milo
note: Sorghum

title: Milo
note: Sorghum

title: Mindful
description: Full Closed Handshapes with palms facing signer touch sides of forehead. Hands move out to sides of signing space while wrists move out so that palms are facing out.

title: Mind-Set
note: The facial expression used by the signer in the video indicates a negative mind-set. If one wishes to express a positive mind-set, the facial expressions should change to reflect so.
description: Right V-Handshape with palm facing down is placed in front of face pointing left. Hand moves up and down from wrist.

title: Mine
note: 'Mine' as in belonging to me.
description: Full Closed Handshape with palm facing signer touches chest.

title: Mine
note: Owned by self

title: Miniskirt
note: Short skirt that does not exceed the knees

title: Minister
description: Right Extended Index Finger Handshape with palm facing out points up. It moves slightly side to side from the wrist.
memory_aid: Similar to the sign for a former political party's sign.

title: Ministry
description: Right Extended Index Finger Handshape with palm facing out points up. It moves slightly side to side from the wrist.
memory_aid: Similar to the sign for a former political party's sign.

title: Minuscule
note: 1. This sign refers to objects only. 2. Note face scrunch and lowered eyebrows, important elements of this sign.
description: Right G-Handshape with palm facing left is held in front of the face.

title: Minute 1
note: 'Minute' as in time.
description: Right Extended Index Finger Handshape with palm facing out rests on left wrist. Finger is pointing up and moves repetitively to right, still resting on wrist.
memory_aid: Indicates the minute hand of a wristwatch.

title: Minute 2
note: 1. 'Minute' as in not much. 2. Note the lowered eyebrows and 'th' mouth movement. These are essential parts of the sign.
description: Small-T Handshape with palm facing up is positioned in center of signing space. Hand moves forward slightly.
memory_aid: Just a few things can be held between these two fingers.

title: Miscellaneous
description: Both Extended Index Finger Handshapes with palms facing down are positioned in the center of the signing space pointing out. Hands move up and down alternately.
memory_aid: The different things in a group.

title: Miscellany
description: Both Extended Index Finger Handshapes with palms facing down are positioned in the center of the signing space pointing out. Hands move up and down alternately.
memory_aid: The different things in a group.

title: Mischance
description: Both hands are in Thumbs-Up Handshapes with palms facing the signer. Hands move in towards one another and move up and away simultaneously as soon as they touch.
memory_aid: Looks like a mischance taking place.

title: Mishap
description: Both hands are in Thumbs-Up Handshapes with palms facing the signer. Hands move in towards one another and move up and away simultaneously as soon as they touch.
memory_aid: Looks like a mishap taking place.

title: Misplace
description: Fingertips of both hands, in O-Handshapes with palms facing up, are touching. Hands turn down from wrists simultaneously while changing into Full Open Handshapes with palms facing down.
memory_aid: Looks like something is being misplaced.

title: Mistake
description: Right Extended Index Finger Handshape with palm facing out makes an 'X' in the air.
memory_aid: X' in the air indicates a mistake.

title: Mistreat
description: Both hands are in Claw Handshapes with palms facing out. Hands move forward repetitively.

title: Mistreatment
description: Both hands are in Claw Handshapes with palms facing out. Hands move forward repetitively.

title: Mix
note: Put together

title: Mobile 1
note: 'Mobile' as in a cell phone.
description: L-Handshape with palm facing signer moves back and forth in front of ear.

title: Mobile 2
note: 'Mobile' as in a mobile VCT or something that moves around.
description: Both Extended Index Finger Handshapes with palms facing down point out. They move forward alternately and repetitively.

title: Mock
note: Lowered eyebrows, pursed mouth, intense movement and turned head are all essential parts of this sign. All parts indicate intensity and negativity.
description: Both Extended Index Finger Handshapes are pointing left. Palms are facing one another. Hands move forward and slightly down repetitively.

title: Modern 1
note: There is no difference in meaning between MODERN 1 and MODERN 2. They are variants of 'modern' in KSL.
description: I-Handshapes with palms facing out are at either side of signing space. Wrists turn hands back and up.
memory_aid: Hands turning up signifies something new.

title: Modern 2
note: There is no difference in meaning between MODERN 1 and MODERN 2. They are variants of 'modern' in KSL.
description: Right Thumbs-Up Handshape is held with thumb against right corner of mouth. Palm is facing out. Hand moves forward, turning until palm is facing signer.

title: Modification
description: Both hands are in A-Handshapes with palms touching one another. The right hand is closest to the signer. Hands turn over still touching so that left hand is now closer to the signer.

title: Modify
description: Both hands are in A-Handshapes with palms touching one another. The right hand is closest to the signer. Hands turn over still touching so that left hand is now closer to the signer.

title: Moi Avenue
note: Name of an avenue

title: Moist
description: Right Bent-B Handshape with palm facing signer taps backside of downturned left Full Closed Handshape.

title: Mombasa
note: Names of towns are especially prone to variation. There may be another or a few other signs for 'Mombasa'.
description: Right G-Handshape with palm facing left is next to right eye. Fingers open and close into Single-O Handshape.
memory_aid: The winking of eyes against the bright sun.

title: Mombasa Road
note: Name of the road that leads to and from Mombasa

title: Moment
description: Right Extended Index Finger Handshape with palm facing out rests on left wrist. Finger is pointing up and moves repetitively to right, still resting on wrist.
memory_aid: Indicates the minute hand of a wristwatch.

title: Monday
note: Signs for days of the week are especially prone to variation. There may be another or a few other signs for 'Monday'.
description: Full Closed Handshape with palm facing signer is placed on forehead. Fingers are pointing back.

title: Monday 2
note: Signs for days of the week are especially prone to variation. There may be another or a few other signs for 'Monday'.
description: Full Closed Handshape with palm facing signer is placed on forehead. Fingers are pointing back.

title: Money
description: Right hand is in Small-T Handshape with palm facing left. The thumb rubs over the tip of the index finger.

title: Monitor
description: Right Bent-V Handshape with palm facing out moves side to side on top of wrist of downturned left Full Closed Handshape.
memory_aid: Pair of eyes looking over a desk.

title: Monkey
note: Any member of the clade simiiformes, distinguished by smaller size, a tail and cheek pouches

title: Monotonous
note: Appropriate facial expression is important for this sign. One should lower eyebrows and otherwise indicate boredom.
description: Right Full Closed Handshape with palm facing signer taps mouth.

title: Month
note: To specify a certain month, sign MONTH and then the number of the month. For example, 'January' would be signed as MONTH ONE, 'February' as MONTH TWO, 'March' as MONTH THREE and so on.
description: Right Small-T Handshape with palm facing out moves down as hand turns into G-Handshape with palm facing signer and thumb sticking out.
memory_aid: The turning of a page in a calendar.

title: Moon
description: Both L-Handshapes with palms facing out are touching at the fingertips of the thumb and index fingers. Left hand moves up while right hand moves down. Both close into Single-O Handshapes.

title: More
description: Both hands are in Full Closed Handshapes. Palm of left hand is facing up while palm of right hand is facing down. Right hand starts on top of left hand and moves up in a straight line. Both hands turn from wrists so that they are facing out.
memory_aid: Adding more to what one already has.

title: More Or Less
note: 1. Note shaking of lowered head, an essential part of the sign. 2. While 'more or less' is a three-word phrase in English, it is one sign in KSL.
description: Both Full Open Handshapes with palms facing in are placed at either side of the signing space. As they move up and down alternately, hands twist from the wrists.
memory_aid: Hands are unsure if they can do more.

title: Morning
description: The right hand in a Full Closed Handshape with the palm facing down is placed near the right end of the signing space. Hand moves forward slightly and repetitively.

title: Morning Tea
note: 'Morning tea' is signed here as TEA then MORNING. This is typical of sentence structure in KSL. Nouns are signed first and then their adjectives come after. TEA is a noun here and is then modified by the adjective MORNING.
description: TEA - Right Single-O Handshape with palm facing signer is placed by mouth. As hand moves up towards the mouth, it twists from wrist so that palm is facing out. MORNING - The right hand in a Full Closed Handshape with the palm facing down is placed near the right end of the signing space above the shoulder. Hand moves forward slightly and repetitively.
memory_aid: Action of drinking tea and the position of morning sun.

title: Morning Tea 2
note: 'Morning tea' is signed here as TEA then MORNING. This is typical of sentence structure in KSL. Nouns are signed first and then their adjectives come after. TEA is a noun here and is then modified by the adjective MORNING.
description: TEA - Right Single-O Handshape with palm facing signer is placed by mouth. As hand moves up towards the mouth, it twists from wrist so that palm is facing out. MORNING - The right hand in a Full Closed Handshape with the palm facing down is placed near the right end of the signing space above the shoulder. Hand moves forward slightly and repetitively.
memory_aid: Action of drinking tea and the position of morning sun.

title: Morocco
note: Names of places are especially prone to variation. There may be another or a few other signs for 'Morocco'.
description: Both hands are in Full Closed Handshapes with palms facing signer. They touch the face, the right hand on the forehead and the left on the mouth.

title: Mortified
note: Note lowered eyebrows and raised shoulders. These are essential parts of the sign.
description: Right Claw Handshape with palm facing signer moves back and forth in front of face.
memory_aid: As if trying to hide from being mortified.

title: Moses
note: Name of a Bible character, who led the Israelites out of bondage in Egypt

title: Mosque
description: Both Full Closed Handshapes with palms facing out are placed at either side of the head. Hands move toward the middle of the chest. Hands turn so that palms are facing signer. The right hand ends up in front of the left.

title: Mosque
note: Place of worship for Muslims

title: Mosquito
description: Fingers of right Single-O Handshape with palm facing signer are pressed into the right cheek.

title: Most
description: Both hands are in Full Closed Handshapes. Palm of left hand is facing up while palm of right hand is facing down. Right hand starts on top of left hand and moves up in a straight line. Both hands turn from wrists so that they are facing out.
memory_aid: Adding more to what one already has.

title: Mother 1
note: There is no difference in meaning between MOTHER 1 and MOTHER 2. They are variants of 'mother' in KSL.
description: The fingers of Full Closed Handshape with palm facing signer pat the right cheek.

title: Mother 2
note: There is no difference in meaning between MOTHER 1 and MOTHER 2. They are variants of 'mother' in KSL.
description: Right Full Closed Handshape with palm facing down is pointing out. It is placed on chest where it moves up and down from the wrist.

title: Mother-In-Law
note: Your wife's or husband's mother

title: Mother-In-Law
note: Your wife's or husband's mother

title: Motion
note: 'Motion' as in movement.
description: Both Flat-O Handshapes with palms facing down are placed at right side of signer. They move in an upward arc to left side.

title: Motorcycle
note: Note the mouth movements, a necessary part of this sign.
description: Both S-Handshapes with palms facing down move up from the wrists simultaneously and repetitively.

title: Mount Kenya
note: 1. Note that the sign for 'mountain' here is slightly different from the main entry in this dictionary. See MOUNTAIN. This is an example of variation. 2. Names of places are especially prone to variation. There may be another or a few other signs for 'Mount Kenya'.
description: MOUNT - Right Bent-B Handshape with palm facing down moves in an arc. KENYA - The right hand is in a Small-T Handshape with palm facing out. As it turns inward to body, the hand also moves up.

title: Mountain
description: Right Bent-B Handshape with palm facing down moves up and out to the right in small arcs.
memory_aid: As if going over mountain peaks.

title: Mourn
note: While 'mourn' is one word in English, it is a two-word phrase (DEAD, CRY) in KSL.
description: DEAD - Right Full Closed Handshape with palm facing down comes up to touch the underside of chin. CRY - Both Extended Index Finger Handshapes with palms facing signer touch underneath both eyes. They move down alternately and repetitively.

title: Mouse
description: Both Extended Index Finger Handshapes with palms facing signer are pointing out. Starting near the nose, right hand moves toward the left hand which is resting in center of signing space. Right finger moves forward repetitively on top of left finger.

title: Moustache
note: Hairs on the top lip

title: Mouth
note: Opening on the face that houses the teeth

title: Move
description: Both Flat-O Handshapes with palms facing down are placed at right side of signer. They move in an upward arc to left side.

title: Movement
note: 'Movement' as in an act of moving.
description: Both Flat-O Handshapes with palms facing down are placed at right side of signer. They move in an upward arc to left side.

title: Movie
description: Left Full Open Handshape with palm facing down is lying parallel to waist. In front of left hand is right Full Open Handshape with palm facing out. While closing in O-Handshape, it moves under and around left hand. It ends up again in front of left hand in Full Open Handshape.
memory_aid: Indicates the image projected from a movie projector.

title: Mozambique
note: Names of places are especially prone to variation. There may be another or a few other signs for 'Mozambique'.
description: Bent-B Handshapes with palms facing down are placed at either side of face. They move up simultaneously, tracing the outline of jaw.

title: Mt. Kilimanjaro
note: 1. This is an example of fingerspelling. There is not yet a standard sign for 'Mt. Kilimanjaro', however there may be signs in the area of Mt. Kilimanjaro for the mountain. 2. The first part of this uses the sign MOUNTAIN.
description: Right Bent-B Handshape with palm facing down moves up and out to the right in small arcs. Then the letters K, I, L, I, M, A, N, J, A, R, and O are spelled in succession.
memory_aid: The shape of a mountain and the letters spell 'Kilimanjaro'.

title: Much To Be Said
note: General conversation

title: Much To Be Said
note: General conversation

title: Mud
note: Note the mouthing movement, a necessary part of the sign.
description: Both hands are in Full Open Handshapes with palms facing down. They move forward and down repetitively and alternately.
memory_aid: As if walking on a muddy path.

title: Muddled
note: Facial expressions help indicate difference in degree of confusion. For example, a more emphatic facial expression would be the equivalent of 'bewildered' (which means 'really confused') while a lesser one would probably be best translated as 'confused'.
description: Both hands are in Claw Handshapes with palms facing one another. The right hand is directly above the left hand. Both hands move simultaneously in opposite circles.
memory_aid: How a mind looks when muddled.

title: Muddy
note: 1. MUDDY as used here only indicates a muddy surface, not a muddy thing. 2. Note the mouthing movement, a necessary part of the sign.
description: Both hands are in Full Open Handshapes with palms facing down. They move forward and down repetitively and alternately.
memory_aid: As if walking on a muddy path.

title: Mug
description: Right hand is in C-Handshape with palm facing left. It rests upon upturned left Full Closed Handshape. Right hand moves up and down on left hand.
memory_aid: Looks like the body of a mug.

title: Mug
note: A large cup and used without a saucer/ fool

title: Muindi Mbingu Street
note: Name of a street

title: Mukimo
note: Food made of mashed potatoes and maize, common in central Kenya

title: Multiplication
description: Both hands are in Extended Index Finger Handshapes with palms facing one another. The left hand is pointing right while the right extended finger is pointing left. They are side by side, touching at the knuckles.
memory_aid: Looks like the sign for multiplication.

title: Multiply
description: Both hands are in Extended Index Finger Handshapes with palms facing one another. The left hand is pointing right while the right extended finger is pointing left. They are side by side, touching at the knuckles.
memory_aid: Looks like the sign for multiplication.

title: Mumias
note: Names of towns are especially prone to variation. There may be another or a few other signs for 'Mumias'.
description: Right S-Handshape with palm facing signer is pointing up and moves in small inward circles.
memory_aid: Imagine the circling fist indicating the large population of Deaf people in Mumias.

title: Murang'A
note: Names of towns are especially prone to variation. There may be another or a few other signs for 'Murang'a'.
description: Bent-B Handshape with palm facing signer pats on the back or side of neck.

title: Murang'A Road
note: Name of the road that leads to and from Murang'a

title: Murder
description: Extended Index Finger Handshape with palm facing down traces a line across the neck.
memory_aid: Moving a knife across the neck.

title: Muscle
note: A contractile form of tissue which animals use to effect movement

title: Music
description: Right Full Closed Handshape with palm facing signer starts above wrist of left arm. Hand moves back and forth over the upturned left Full Closed Handshape.

title: Muslim
description: Full Closed Handshapes with palms facing out start at center of forehead and move down as head bends down. Hands move down in a straight line and once at the bottom of the signing space move out to the sides. Palms are then facing down.

title: Muslim
note: People who process the faith of Islam

title: Must
note: Note lowered eyebrows and head. These are important parts of the sign.
description: Right X-Handshape with palm facing down moves down once.

title: Mutate
description: Both hands are in A-Handshapes with palms touching one another. The right hand is closest to the signer. Hands turn over still touching so that left hand is now closer to the signer.

title: Mutation
description: Both hands are in A-Handshapes with palms touching one another. The right hand is closest to the signer. Hands turn over still touching so that left hand is now closer to the signer.

title: Muted
note: Note lowered eyebrows, an important part of the sign.
description: Right Extended Index Finger Handshape with palm facing left moves down lips.

title: Muthokoi
note: Food made of a mixture of boiled maize and beans, common in eastern Kenya

title: Mutt
description: The right hand assumes the Full Open Handshape with palm facing out. The back of the hand is near the right cheek. Hand moves sideways repetitively.
memory_aid: The floppy ears of a mutt.

title: Mwiki
note: Name of a place in Nairobi, after kasarani

title: My
description: Full Closed Handshape with palm facing signer touches chest.

title: My
note: Belonging to me

title: My Name Is
note: Making friends

title: My Name Is
note: Making friends

title: Myself
description: Extended Index Finger Handshape with palm facing signer points down to signer and moves up from wrist so that it is pointing up.
memory_aid: Pointing at me and saying I can do it myself.

title: N
note: To facilitate movement when fingerspelling quickly, the index and middle fingers can be kept partially folded, extending out over thumb, instead of folding them completely down.
description: Little finger and ring fingers are folded against palm. Thumb is folded across to touch ring finger. Index and middle fingers are folded down over thumb. Palm is facing out.
memory_aid: Looks like the legs of a written 'N'.

title: Nab
description: Both Full Open Handshapes with palms facing out move down and forward while hands close into S-Handshapes with palms facing down.

title: Nag
note: Note the lowered eyebrows which indicate negativity. This is an important part of the sign.
description: Right Bent-B Handshape with palm facing down taps right shoulder repetitively.

title: Nail
note: Thin horny plate at the ends of gingers and toes on humans and some other animals

title: Nail
note: Thin horny plate at the ends of gingers and toes on humans and some other animals

title: Nairobi
note: Names of towns are especially prone to variation. There may be another or a few other signs for 'Nairobi'. 'Nairobi' has three established variants.
description: Right Extended Index Finger Handshape with palm facing out points up. It moves slightly side to side from the wrist.
memory_aid: So named for a former political party's sign.

title: Nairobi 2
note: Names of towns are especially prone to variation. There may be another or a few other signs for 'Nairobi'. 'Nairobi' has three established variants.
description: Right Extended Index Finger Handshape with palm facing out points up. It moves slightly side to side from the wrist.
memory_aid: So named for a former political party's sign.

title: Nairobi Hospital
note: Name of a hospital

title: Nairobi West
note: Name of a place

title: Naivasha
note: Names of towns are especially prone to variation. There may be another or a few other signs for 'Naivasha'.
description: Right Full Closed Handshape with the palm facing left is by right side of signer. Arm moves in forward circular motions.
memory_aid: Imitating the moving wheels on a train.

title: Nakumatt
note: supermarket chain

title: Nakuru
note: Names of towns are especially prone to variation. There may be another or a few other signs for 'Nakuru'.
description: I-Handshape with palm facing down touches the side of the mouth and moves up to touch the upper part of the cheekbone.
memory_aid: Nakuru is close to the lake, which is represented by the mouth.

title: Name
description: Left Full Closed Handshape is held upright with palm facing right. The thumb of right G-Handshape with palm facing signer touches palm of left hand while index finger touches back of left hand. Right hand moves slightly down and out, while fingers close into a Single-O Handshape. This is done repetitively.
memory_aid: Tag of a person or thing.

title: Namibia
note: Names of places are especially prone to variation. There may be another or a few other signs for 'Namibia'.
description: Full Closed Handshape with palm facing signer is pointing down. Index finger is bent back. Hand moves down repetitively.
memory_aid: Hand represents map of Africa and where the finger is bent is location of Namibia.

title: Nanyuki
note: Names of towns are especially prone to variation. There may be another or a few other signs for 'Nanyuki'.
description: Both S-Handshapes with palms facing each other are placed at sides of body. In this position the arms move in slightly and repetitively.
memory_aid: Indicating that it is cold there.

title: Nap
description: Both hands are placed together in Full Closed Handshapes with palms facing one another. The signer's head leans to the right and rests on the back of the left hand.

title: Narrative
description: Both Full Closed Handshapes with palms facing one another are placed together. They move side to side from the wrists.
memory_aid: The hands are giving a narrative.

title: Narrow
description: Both hands are in Full Closed Handshapes with palms facing one another. Hands start at ends of signing space and move in a straight line towards one another.

title: Nasty
note: While CRUEL shares the same sign as other English words like 'inhumane', 'mean', and 'rude', they have slightly different facial expressions. The more intense the meanness, the more intense the facial expression. Hence CRUEL gets a more intense facial expression than RUDE does.
description: Claw Handshapes with palms facing down rest upon either side of head. Hands move out simultaneously in a straight line.

title: Nation
description: Claw Handshape with palm facing out moves in a circular motion.
memory_aid: The shape of a nation on the map.

title: Nation House
note: Building which houses the nation media house

title: Nation Tv
note: TV station

title: Natural
description: Left C-Handshape with palm facing signer surrounds right Flat-O Handshape which is facing up. Right hand moves up as it opens into Full Open Handshape.

title: Nature
note: The natural world

title: Nature 1
note: 1. 'Nature' as in one's tendency to do something. 2. Note the mouth movement 'ba ba ba'. This is an important part of the sign.
description: Full Closed Handshape starts at side of signer with palm facing down. Hand moves up from wrist as arm moves slightly forward. Palm is now facing out.

title: Nature 2
note: 1. 'Nature' as in one's tendency. 2. This is usually used with NATURE 1. NATURE 2 is signed first then NATURE 1, which means 'one's nature' or LAW HIS/HER.
description: Right L-Handshape starts down with thumb pointing up. Palm is facing left. Hand moves so that thumb of L-Handshape touches shoulder.

title: Naughty 1
note: 1. 'Naughty' as in cruel. 2. While CRUEL shares the same sign as other English words like 'inhumane', 'mean', and 'rude', they have slightly different facial expressions. The more intense the meanness, the more intense the facial expression. Hence CRUEL gets a more intense facial expression than RUDE does.
description: Claw Handshapes with palms facing down rest upon either side of head. Hands move out simultaneously in a straight line.

title: Naughty 2
note: 'Naughty' as in not nice.
description: Right L-Handshape with palm facing signer touches the side of hip. The hand moves forward and slightly upward while the index finger bends.
memory_aid: As if someone were pulling out a gun.

title: Navy
note: A country's entire sea force

title: Near
note: Note the lowered eyebrows, tilt of head and shift of shoulders. These movements are typical of signs indicating proximity.
description: Both Bent-B Handshapes with palms facing signer are in front of body. The right hand is in front of the left hand. Right hand moves back and forth repetitively.

title: Nearby
note: Note the lowered eyebrows, tilt of head and shift of shoulders. These movements are typical of signs indicating proximity.
description: Both Bent-B Handshapes with palms facing signer are in front of body. The right hand is in front of the left hand. Right hand moves back and forth repetitively.

title: Nearly
note: 1. 'Nearly' as in almost time. 2. Note the tilt of head and shift of shoulders. These movements are typical of signs indicating proximity.
description: Both hands are in Bent-B Handshapes with palms facing signer. The right hand which is behind the left hand moves back and forth repetitively.
memory_aid: Hands indicate that the time is nearly here.

title: Neat
description: Both hands are in I-Handshapes with palms facing out. The right hand is placed behind the left hand. Both move out, away from one another, in a straight line.

title: Necessary
note: Note lowered eyebrows and head. These are important parts of the sign.
description: Right X-Handshape with palm facing down moves down once.

title: Neck
note: The par of the body connecting the head and the trunk

title: Necklace
note: The first part of this sign uses the sign GOLD.
description: Right Curved-Three Handshape with palm facing up twists slightly and repetitively. Then both Extended Index Finger Handshapes with palms facing signer touch the middle of the collarbone, moving up and away from one another ending near the base of neck.
memory_aid: Shape of unrefined gold and a necklace.

title: Necktie
description: Right Full Closed Handshape with palm facing down is pointing out just below chin. Hand moves down so that palm touches chest.
memory_aid: Looks like the body of a necktie.

title: Need
description: The fingertips of upturned Full Open Handshapes are bent in. Both hands move in simultaneously towards the body.

title: Needle
note: A long thin sharp implement usually for piercing

title: Neighbour
description: Both hands are in Full Closed Handshapes. The right hand rests at right side with palm facing left. Left hand is next to right hand, but twisted so that palm faces left as well. Both hands move up and down alternately and repetitively.
memory_aid: Indicates the proximity of two items.

title: Nephew
note: Brother or sister's son

title: Nerve
note: A bundle of neurons with their connective tissue, sheaths, blood vessels and lymphatic's

title: Net
note: Overall/ A trap/ A system that interconnects a number of users/ A mesh

title: Netherlands
note: Names of places are especially prone to variation. There may be another or a few other signs for 'Netherlands'.
description: Bent-B Handshape with palm facing signer touches side of head and moves out while closing into Flat-O Handshape.

title: Netherlands 2
note: Names of places are especially prone to variation. There may be another or a few other signs for 'Netherlands'.
description: Bent-B Handshape with palm facing signer touches side of head and moves out while closing into Flat-O Handshape.

title: Never
note: Note lowered eyebrows and shaking head, essential parts of the sign.
description: Thumbs-Up Handshape with palm facing left is held upright. Hand moves slightly side to side from wrist as it moves down.

title: Never 2
note: Note lowered eyebrows and shaking head, essential parts of the sign.
description: Thumbs-Up Handshape with palm facing left is held upright. Hand moves slightly side to side from wrist as it moves down.

title: Nevertheless
note: Note tilted head and raised eyebrows. These are essential parts of the sign.
description: Both hands are in Extended Index Handshapes. Palms are facing away from signer. Fingers are touching so that they form an 'x'. Hands move out so that fingers point to either side of the signing space.
memory_aid: Fingers move in opposite directions indicating otherwise.

title: New 1
note: There is no difference in meaning between NEW 1 and NEW 2. They are variants of 'new' in KSL.
description: I-Handshapes with palms facing out are at either side of signing space. Wrists turn hands back and up.
memory_aid: Hands turning up signifies something new.

title: New 2
note: There is no difference in meaning between NEW 1 and NEW 2. They are variants of 'new' in KSL.
description: I-Handshapes with palms facing out are at either side of signing space. Wrists turn hands back and up.
memory_aid: Hands turning up signifies something new.

title: New 2
note: There is no difference in meaning between NEW 1 and NEW 2. They are variants of 'new' in KSL.
description: Right Thumbs-Up Handshape is held with thumb against right corner of mouth. Palm is facing out. Hand moves forward, turning until palm is facing signer.

title: Newborn
description: Both hands are in Full Closed Handshapes with palms facing up. Right arm is laid on top of left arm so right hand is over left wrist. Arms are moved from side to side.

title: News
description: I-Handshapes with palms facing out are at either side of signer. Wrists turn hands in repetitively.

title: Newspaper
description: Right S-Handshape with palm facing signer touches palm of left Full Closed Handshape with palm facing signer. Both hands then move together with palms facing one another. They turn away from one another so that palms face up.
memory_aid: The printing of a newspaper and then the opening of one.

title: Newspaper
note: A publication, usually published daily or weekly and printed on a cheep, low quality paper

title: Next
description: Both Full Closed Handshapes with palms facing body are positioned in front of signer. The right hand which is in front of left hand moves forward in an upward curve, ending up a few inches in front of the left hand.

title: Next To
note: While 'next to' is a two-word phrase in English, it is one sign in KSL.
description: Both hands are in Full Closed Handshapes. The right hand rests at right side with palm facing left. Left hand is next to right hand, but twisted so that palm faces left as well. Both hands move up and down alternately and repetitively.
memory_aid: Indicates the proximity of two items.

title: Ngara
note: Name of a place

title: Ngong
note: Name of a place

title: Nice
description: Right Thumbs-Up Handshape is held with thumb against right corner of mouth. Palm is facing out. Hand moves forward, turning until palm is facing signer.

title: Niece
note: Brother or sister's daughter

title: Nigeria
note: Names of places are especially prone to variation. There may be another or a few other signs for 'Nigeria'.
description: Full Closed Handshape with palm facing down is placed at shoulder. Thumb-side of hand is touching shoulder. Hand moves in an arc to elbow where little-finger side is now touching arm.

title: Night
note: 'Night' indicates the time when it is completely dark. This does not refer to 'evening'.
description: Both Full Closed Handshapes with palms facing signer are positioned at the sides of head. Both hands move down and towards one another simultaneously. They stop moving when right hand covers front of left hand.

title: Nightfall
description: Slightly bent Full Open Handshape with palm facing down starts in center of signing space. As it moves down to right of signing space, hand closes into Flat-O Handshape with palm facing up.

title: Nine
description: The left hand is in an S-Handshape (which means 'five') with palm facing left. The right hand with extended little, ring, middle and index fingers (which means 'four') is brought against the knuckles of the left hand.

title: No
description: Both arms with Full Closed Handshapes are held upright and crossed at the wrists. Palms are facing sides. Both hands move down to opposite sides of the signing space. Palms are then facing down.

title: No 2
description: Both arms with Full Closed Handshapes are held upright and crossed at the wrists. Palms are facing sides. Both hands move down to opposite sides of the signing space. Palms are then facing down.

title: No Entry
note: At a restaurant/ at a hotel

title: No Entry
note: At a restaurant/ at a hotel

title: No Hard Feelings
note: Family and relationships

title: No Offense
note: General conversation

title: No Parking
note: Travel

title: No Problem
note: General conversation

title: No Smoking
note: Health

title: No Trespassing
note: in town

title: No, This Is The First Time
note: Making friends

title: Noah
note: Name of a Bible character, who was commissioned to build an ark

title: Noise
description: S-Handshape with palm facing down is placed under chin. Hand opens into Full Open Handshape.
memory_aid: A lot of noise coming from the mouth.

title: Noisy
description: S-Handshape with palm facing down is placed under chin. Hand opens into Full Open Handshape.
memory_aid: A lot of noise coming from the mouth.

title: Nominate
description: F-Handshape starts with palm facing down. Hand moves up from wrist so that palm is facing out.

title: Nomination
description: F-Handshape starts with palm facing down. Hand moves up from wrist so that palm is facing out.

title: Nonetheless
note: Note tilted head and raised eyebrows. These are essential parts of the sign.
description: Both hands are in Extended Index Handshapes. Palms are facing away from signer. Fingers are touching so that they form an 'x'. Hands move out so that fingers point to either side of the signing space.
memory_aid: Fingers move in opposite directions indicating otherwise.

title: Nonplussed
note: Facial expressions help indicate difference in degree of confusion. For example, a more emphatic facial expression would be the equivalent of 'bewildered' (which means 'really confused') while a lesser one would probably be best translated as 'confused'.
description: Both hands are in Claw Handshapes with palms facing one another. The right hand is directly above the left hand. Both hands move simultaneously in opposite circles.
memory_aid: How a mind looks when nonplussed.

title: Nonsense
note: General conversation

title: Noon
description: Right Full Closed Handshape with palm facing left is pointing up in front of head.

title: Noon
note: period between morning and afternoon

title: Noon
note: period between morning and afternoon

title: Normal
note: Note lowered eyebrows, an essential part of the sign.
description: U-Handshapes with palms facing one another are placed in center of signing space. Hands move up and down simultaneously.
memory_aid: Repetitive motion indicates something that happens a lot.

title: North
description: Right Bent-B Handshape with palm facing down and fingers pointing left moves up in a straight line.

title: Northeastern
note: 1. Do not reverse direction for others. Sign EAST to your right. 2. Note that the sign for 'north' here is slightly different from the main entry in this dictionary. See NORTH. This is an example of variation.
description: NORTH - Right N-Handshape with palm facing out moves up. EAST - Right E-Handshape with palm facing out moves to the east (right).
memory_aid: Indicates the directions of north and east.

title: Nose
note: Body part that inhales and exhales air

title: Not
note: 1. This sign serves as a negator in KSL. For example, 'I have not seen the book' would be signed as ME SEE BOOK NOT. 2. Note lowered eyebrows, an essential part of the sign.
description: Both O-Handshapes with palms facing out are held near mouth. They move out away from one another to the sides while opening into Full Open Handshapes.

title: Not So Well
note: Health

title: Not Yet
note: 1. Note lowered eyebrows and shaking head, essential parts of the sign. 2. The signer here is mouthing the Kiswahili word 'bado'. 3. While 'not yet' is a two-word phrase in English, it is one sign in KSL.
description: Right Thumbs-Up Handshape with palm facing left shakes from side to side slightly.

title: Not Yet
note: General conversation

title: Notebook
note: While 'notebook' is one word in English, it is a two-word phrase (BOOK, WRITE) in KSL.
description: BOOK - Full Closed Handshapes are held with palms together and fingers pointing out. The hands open and close, with sides always touching. WRITE - Right Small-T Handshape with palm facing down repetitively moves slightly across palm of left hand while moving down.

title: Nothing
note: 1. This sign serves as a negator in KSL. For example, 'I have not seen the book' would be signed as ME SEE BOOK NOTHING. 2. Note lowered eyebrows, an essential part of the sign.
description: Both O-Handshapes with palms facing out are held near mouth. They move out away from one another to the sides while opening into Full Open Handshapes.

title: Notify
description: O-Handshapes with palms facing out are positioned in front of mouth. Hands move out to either side of the signing space as handshapes open into Full Open Handshapes. Palms are then facing down.

title: Notion
description: I-Handshape with palm facing signer starts by side of head. Hand moves out upward.

title: Notwithstanding
note: Note tilted head and raised eyebrows. These are essential parts of the sign.
description: Both hands are in Extended Index Handshapes. Palms are facing away from signer. Fingers are touching so that they form an 'x'. Hands move out so that fingers point to either side of the signing space.
memory_aid: Fingers move in opposite directions indicating otherwise.

title: Noun
description: Left Full Closed Handshape is held upright with palm facing right. The thumb of right G-Handshape with palm facing signer touches palm of left hand while index finger touches back of left hand. Right hand moves slightly down and out, while fingers close into a Single-O Handshape. This is done repetitively.
memory_aid: Tag of a person or thing.

title: Novel 1
note: 1. 'Novel' as in new. 2. There is no difference in meaning between NOVEL 1 and NOVEL 2. They are variants of 'novel' in KSL.
description: I-Handshapes with palms facing out are at either side of signing space. Wrists turn hands back and up.
memory_aid: Hands turning up signifies something new.

title: Novel 2
note: 1. 'Novel' as in new. 2. There is no difference in meaning between NOVEL 1 and NOVEL 2. They are variants of 'novel' in KSL.
description: Right Thumbs-Up Handshape is held with thumb against right corner of mouth. Palm is facing out. Hand moves forward, turning until palm is facing signer.

title: Novel 3
note: 'Novel' as in a literary book.
description: Full Closed Handshapes are held with palms together and fingertips pointing away. Palms are facing signer. Hands open and close repetitively with sides always touching.

title: November
note: Name of the 11th month

title: Now
note: Note raised shoulders, an essential part of the sign.
description: Both Full Closed Handshapes with palms facing out point down. They move down simultaneously twice.

title: Now
note: Currently

title: Now
note: Currently

title: Now And Again
note: 1. Note shaking of lowered head, an essential part of the sign. 2. While 'now and again' is a three-word phrase in English, it is one sign in KSL.
description: Both Full Open Handshapes with palms facing in are placed at either side of the signing space. As they move up and down alternately, hands twist from the wrists.
memory_aid: Hands are unsure if they can do more.

title: Now And Then
note: 1. Note shaking of lowered head, an essential part of the sign. 2. While 'now and then' is a three-word phrase in English, it is one sign in KSL.
description: Both Full Open Handshapes with palms facing in are placed at either side of the signing space. As they move up and down alternately, hands twist from the wrists.
memory_aid: Hands are unsure if they can do more.

title: Nssf House
note: Name of a building housing the National Social Security Fund headquarters

title: Number
description: Extended Index Finger Handshape with palm facing signer touches shoulder repetitively.
memory_aid: As if indicating the number on the back of a football jersey.

title: Numeral
description: Extended Index Finger Handshape with palm facing signer touches shoulder repetitively.
memory_aid: As if indicating the number on the back of a football jersey.

title: Numerous
description: Right Full Open Handshape with palm facing down repetitively hits the side of the left hand which is in an S-Handshape.
memory_aid: The hand hits again and again meaning 'numerous'.

title: Nuptial
description: Both F-Handshapes with palms facing one another begin at opposite sides of forehead and move simultaneously down and out past shoulders.

title: Nurse
note: The first part of this sign uses MEDICAL.
description: Right X-Handshape with palm facing signer taps the side of the left arm. Then it moves to tap upon top of head in Full Closed Handshape with palm facing back.
memory_aid: Indicates the armband and cap of a nurse.

title: Nurse
note: One who takes care of patients in a hospital

title: Nut
note: A hard shelled seed

title: Nutrition
description: Right Flat-O Handshape with palm facing down taps repetitively on the mouth.

title: Nyandarua
note: Names of towns are especially prone to variation. There may be another or a few other signs for 'Nyandarua'.
description: Right Extended Index Finger Handshape with palm facing left is tapped against forehead. Hand keeps tapping as it moves to the left of forehead.
memory_aid: Nyandarua is known for its bumpy roads.

title: Nyang'Oma
note: Names of towns are especially prone to variation. There may be another or a few other signs for 'Nyang'oma'.
description: X-Handshape with palm facing signer touches the side of mouth. Hand moves down repetitively.
memory_aid: Looks like someone shaving their cheek.

title: Nyanza
note: Names of places are especially prone to variation. There may be another or a few other signs for 'Nyanza'.
description: Right Modified-C Handshape with palm facing signer taps chin.

title: Nyayo House
note: name of a building near the intercontinental, which houses some government offices

title: Nyeri
note: Names of towns are especially prone to variation. There may be another or a few other signs for 'Nyeri'.
description: F-Handshape with palm facing signer touches the left nostril and moves slightly down and over to touch the right one.
memory_aid: Indicates a hoop worn on the nose.

title: O
description: All fingers are partially folded. Thumb is partially folded and tip of thumb is touching tip of index finger. Hand is turned slightly so viewer can see 'O' shape formed by thumb and index finger. Palm is facing left.

title: Obdurate
note: Note lowered eyebrows, an important part of the sign.
description: Right hand is in S-Handshape with palm facing up. Back of right hand touches upon back of downturned left S-Handshape.

title: Obese
description: Both hands are in Full Open Handshapes with palms facing one another and fingers pointing down. They start by the waist and move out to the sides of the signing space.

title: Obey 1
note: 'Obey' as in to pay attention.
description: Both Full Closed Handshapes, fingers pointing up and palms facing one another, are held at the sides of face. They move straight out from the face as hands move down so that fingertips point away from signer.
memory_aid: Indicating the area where one is watching.

title: Obey 2
note: 'Obey' as in to follow orders.
description: Both hands are in Bent-B Handshapes with palms facing down. The left hand is slightly behind and to the left of the right hand. Both hands move simultaneously forward and to the right.
memory_aid: Left hand is obeying right hand.

title: Object 1
note: 1. 'Object' as in a thing. 2. There is no difference in meaning between OBJECT 1 and OBJECT 2. They are variants of 'object' in KSL.
description: Both hands are in Full Open Handshapes with palms facing up. They start side by side and move away from one another in a slight bouncing motion.

title: Object 2
note: 1. 'Object' as in a thing. 2. There is no difference in meaning between OBJECT 1 and OBJECT 2. They are variants of 'object' in KSL.
description: Both Extended Index Finger Handshapes with palms facing down are pointing out. Right hand starts above left hand. Hands move towards one another slightly and then reverse while switching so that left hand is now on top. This is done repetitively.

title: Object 3
note: 'Object' as in a goal.
description: Both hands are in Extended Index Finger Handshapes. Right hand is closer to signer and its palm is facing in. Finger of right hand points towards the left hand which is held away from the signer with the palm facing in. Right hand moves toward left hand.
memory_aid: An arrow moving towards its aim.

title: Objective
description: Both hands are in Extended Index Finger Handshapes. Right hand is closer to signer and its palm is facing in. Finger of right hand points towards the left hand which is held away from the signer with the palm facing in. Right hand moves toward left hand.
memory_aid: An arrow moving towards its aim.

title: Obligation
description: U-Handshapes with palms facing down tap right shoulder.

title: Oblige
description: Slightly curved Full Open Handshapes with palms facing out are positioned at either side of signing space. Hands move forward once in a strong motion.
memory_aid: Hands pushing one to do something.

title: Obliterate
description: Both hands are in Full Closed Handshapes. Right hand with palm facing left moves down to swipe across palm of upturned left hand. As right hand moves up, it closes into C-Handshape with palm facing signer.

title: Obliteration
description: Both hands are in Full Closed Handshapes. Right hand with palm facing left moves down to swipe across palm of upturned left hand. As right hand moves up, it closes into C-Handshape with palm facing signer.

title: Observation
description: Right Bent-V Handshape with palm facing out moves side to side on top of wrist of downturned left Full Closed Handshape.
memory_aid: Pair of eyes looking over a desk.

title: Observe
description: Right Bent-V Handshape with palm facing out moves side to side on top of wrist of downturned left Full Closed Handshape.
memory_aid: Pair of eyes looking over a desk.

title: Obstacle 1
note: 'Obstacle' as in a barrier.
description: Both hands are in Full Closed Handshapes. Left hand is held horizontally in front of signer with palm facing in. Right hand is held to side of signer with palm facing left. Right hand moves to palm of left hand.

title: Obstacle 2
note: 1.'Obstacle' as in a problem. 2. Note lowered eyebrows and tilted head, essential parts of the sign.
description: The left hand is in a Full Closed Handshape with palm facing right. Right Thumbs-Up Handshape with palm facing down touches palm of left hand repetitively.

title: Obstinate
note: Note lowered eyebrows, an important part of the sign.
description: Right hand is in S-Handshape with palm facing up. Back of right hand touches upon back of downturned left S-Handshape.

title: Obstruct
description: Both hands are in Full Closed Handshapes. Left hand is held horizontally in front of signer with palm facing in. Right hand is held to side of signer with palm facing left. Right hand moves to palm of left hand.

title: Obstruction
description: Both hands are in Full Closed Handshapes. Left hand is held horizontally in front of signer with palm facing in. Right hand is held to side of signer with palm facing left. Right hand moves to palm of left hand.

title: Obtain
description: Right Full Open Handshape with palm facing down starts in the center of the signing space. It moves in towards the signer while closing into a Flat-O Handshape.

title: Obvious
note: Note lowered head and eyebrows, essential parts of the sign.
description: Flat-O Handshapes with palms facing down start at opposite ends of signing space. Hands move down towards one another as hands open into Full Open Handshapes.
memory_aid: Open hands show that something is obvious.

title: Occasionally
note: Note shaking of lowered head, an essential part of the sign.
description: Both Full Open Handshapes with palms facing in are placed at either side of the signing space. As they move up and down alternately, hands twist from the wrists.
memory_aid: Hands are unsure if they can do more.

title: Occupation
note: 'Occupation' as in a job.
description: The little-finger side of the right S-Handshape with palm facing left is brought down repetitively on top of the index finger side of the left S-Handshape with palm facing right.

title: Occupy
note: 'Occupy' as in to live in.
description: Both A-Handshapes with palms facing signer are pointing down. They start at the waist and move up simultaneously in straight lines up the body. Hands then change into Full Closed Handshapes with palms facing down. They move down to rest in middle of signing space.

title: Occupy
note: To fill or hold

title: Occur
description: Both hands are in Thumbs-Up Handshapes with palms facing signer. They move towards each other and upon touching move out again.
memory_aid: Hands hitting one another is something occurring.

title: Occurrence
description: Both hands are in Thumbs-Up Handshapes with palms facing signer. They move towards each other and upon touching move out again.
memory_aid: Hands hitting one another is an occurrence.

title: Ocean
note: 1. Note lowered eyebrows while signing LARGE. This is an adjective to indicate the largeness of the water. 2. While 'ocean' is one word in English, it is a two-word phrase (WATER, LARGE) in KSL.
description: WATER - Right C-Handshape with palm facing left moves up to open lips. At lips, wrist turns upwards. LARGE - Full Open Handshapes with palms facing one another move out and away from each other in a slight arc.

title: October
note: Name of the10th month

title: Odour
note: Note lowered eyebrows, raised mouth and wrinkled nose which all indicate negativity. These are important parts of the sign.
description: Full Open Handshape with palm and fingers facing signer moves up to nose.

title: Of
note: from

title: Of Course
note: While 'of course' is a two-word phrase in English, it is one sign in KSL.
description: Right S-Handshape with palm facing out moves up and down from wrist.

title: Off 1
note: 'Off' as in to take time off.
description: Full Open Handshape with palm facing signer touches chest.
memory_aid: Taking time off to breathe, to relax.

title: Off 2
note: 'Off' as in to take something off (not clothes).
description: Right Full Open Handshape with palm facing down is in curved left C-Handshape with palm facing right. Right hand moves back and up while closing into Flat-O Handshape.
memory_aid: Taking something off the left hand.

title: Off 3
note: 'Off' as in to turn off the light.
description: Full Closed Handshape with palm facing down is in front of face. Hand moves up as it closes into Flat-O Handshape.

title: Office
description: Right S-Handshape with palm facing signer moves down to rest on upturned left Full Closed Handshape.

title: Officer
note: One who has a position of authority in Military, police or the government

title: Officer
note: One who has a position of authority in Military, police or the government

title: Offspring
note: children of

title: Often
note: Note the lowering of eyebrows which indicate intensity.
description: Palm of Bent-B Handshape of right hand is facing signer. Hand moves in small outward circles, but stays in place.

title: Oh My God
note: General conversation

title: Oil
note: Liquid fat

title: Ok
note: The signer here is mouthing the Kiswahili word 'sawa'.
description: Both Thumbs-Up Handshapes with palms facing one another are shaken slightly from side to side.
memory_aid: Typical gesture for saying something is ok.

title: Okay
note: The signer here is mouthing the Kiswahili word 'sawa'.
description: Both Thumbs-Up Handshapes with palms facing one another are shaken slightly from side to side.
memory_aid: Typical gesture for saying something is okay.

title: Old
note: This refers both to people/animals and objects.
