description: Right S-Handshape with palm facing left is positioned under the chin and moves down in a shaking, slightly side to side motion.
memory_aid: Indicates the shaking of an old person.

title: On
note: This sign only refers to placing objects on a surface.
description: Right Full Closed Handshape with palm facing down moves down to rest upon back of downturned left Full Closed Handshape.
memory_aid: Putting something on the left hand.

title: On The Contrary
note: 1. Note tilted head and raised eyebrows. These are essential parts of the sign. 2. While 'on the contrary' is a three-word phrase in English, it is one sign in KSL.
description: Both hands are in Extended Index Handshapes. Palms are facing away from signer. Fingers are touching so that they form an 'x'. Hands move out so that fingers point to either side of the signing space.
memory_aid: Fingers move in opposite directions indicating otherwise.

title: On Top Of
note: 1. While 'on top of' is a three-word phrase in English, it is one sign in KSL. 2. This sign only refers to placing objects on a surface.
description: Right Full Closed Handshape with palm facing down moves down to rest upon back of downturned left Full Closed Handshape.
memory_aid: Putting something on the left hand.

title: One
description: Right Extended Index Finger Handshape with palm facing left is held up.

title: One Hundred
note: To change the number to mean 'two hundred', change the handshape to the one used for 'two'. The same can be done for 'three hundred' and so on.
description: Right Extended Index Finger Handshape with palm facing signer rests on chin directly below mouth. Hand moves straight out.

title: One Hundred 2
note: To change the number to mean 'two hundred', change the handshape to the one used for 'two'. The same can be done for 'three hundred' and so on.
description: Right Extended Index Finger Handshape with palm facing signer rests on chin directly below mouth. Hand moves straight out.

title: One Moment, Please
note: General conversation

title: One Thousand
note: To change the number to mean 'two thousand', change the handshape to the one used for 'two'. The same can be done for 'three thousand' and so on.
description: Right Extended Index Finger Handshape with palm facing out is positioned in center of signing space. Hand moves down to draw a small arc in the air.
memory_aid: Indicates the comma of a thousand figure.

title: One Thousand 2
note: To change the number to mean 'two thousand', change the handshape to the one used for 'two'. The same can be done for 'three thousand' and so on.
description: Right Extended Index Finger Handshape with palm facing out is positioned in center of signing space. Hand moves down to draw a small arc in the air.
memory_aid: Indicates the comma of a thousand figure.

title: Onion
description: Right Extended Index Finger Handshape with palm facing signer draws a small line down the face. Finger then moves down to the Extended Index Finger of the left hand. Right finger moves down and across repetitively on left finger.
memory_aid: Looks like a tear while cutting onions.

title: Onion
note: The bulb of an onion/ A monocotyledonous plant used as vegetable or spice

title: Onion
note: The bulb of an onion/ A monocotyledonous plant used as vegetable or spice

title: Only
description: Right Extended Index Finger Handshape with palm facing the body moves in small circles.
memory_aid: The index finger indicates only one thing.

title: Open
description: Both Full Closed Handshapes with palms facing signer are touching at fingers. Both hands move out from the wrists simultaneously.

title: Open-Minded
description: Full Closed Handshapes with palms facing signer touch sides of forehead. Hands move out to sides of signing space while wrists move out so that palms are facing out.

title: Operate
description: Right U-Handshape with palm facing out moves in a circular motion on top of downturned left Full Closed Handshape.
memory_aid: U' for use which also means 'operate'.

title: Operation
note: The method by which a device performs its function/ surgical procedure

title: Operation
note: The method by which a device performs its function/ surgical procedure

title: Opponent
description: Extended Index Finger Handshapes with palms facing signer point at one another. They move out in a straight line in the opposite directions.
memory_aid: The two fingers are moving away from one another as if they oppose one another.

title: Oppose 1
note: 1. 'Oppose' as in to not agree. 2. There is no difference in meaning between OPPOSE 1 and OPPOSE 2. They are different ways of saying 'oppose' in KSL. 3. While 'oppose' is one word in English, it is a two-sign phrase (AGREE, NOTHING) in KSL.
description: AGREE - Both hands are in S-Handshapes with palms facing out. Hands move down repetitively from wrists simultaneously. NOTHING - Then both hands change to O-Handshapes with palms facing out. Starting near mouth, they move out away from one another to the sides while opening into Full Open Handshapes.
memory_aid: Two heads agreeing not at all.

title: Oppose 2
note: 1. 'Oppose' as in to disagree. 2. There is no difference in meaning between OPPOSE 1 and OPPOSE 2. They are different ways of saying 'oppose' in KSL.
description: Extended Index Finger Handshapes with palms facing signer point at one another. They move out in a straight line in the opposite directions.
memory_aid: The two fingers are moving away from one another as if they oppose one another.

title: Opposite
description: Extended Index Finger Handshapes with palms facing signer point at one another. They move out in a straight line in the opposite directions.
memory_aid: The two fingers are moving away from one another as if they oppose one another.

title: Or
note: Note tilted head, an important part of the sign.
description: Both hands are in Full Open Handshapes with palms facing down. Hands turn so that palms are facing up.

title: Or 2
note: Note tilted head, an important part of the sign.
description: Both hands are in Full Open Handshapes with palms facing down. Hands turn so that palms are facing up.

title: Or Else
note: While 'or else' is a two-word phrase in English, it is one sign in KSL.
description: Right Thumbs-Up Handshape with palm facing left starts pointing up. Hand moves from wrist so that thumb is pointing right and palm facing up.

title: Oral
description: Bent-V Handshape with palm facing signer moves in small inward circular motions in front of mouth.

title: Orange
note: Fruit from the orange tree/ orange color

title: Orange 1
note: 'Orange' as in the colour.
description: Claw Handshape with palm facing signer is in front of mouth. Fingers bend in repetitively.
memory_aid: Looks like one eating the fruit orange.

title: Orange 2
note: 'Orange' as in the fruit.
description: Both hands are in Claw Handshapes. The left hand is before the body with palm facing the signer. The right hand with palm facing down is directly above the left. Right hand moves over two or three fingers of the left hand.
memory_aid: As if peeling the skin from an orange.

title: Order
note: 'Order' as in to tell someone what to do.
description: Extended Index Finger Handshape with palm facing left is placed on mouth. Hand moves out in a straight line.
memory_aid: An order coming from the mouth.

title: Ordinary
note: Note lowered eyebrows, an essential part of the sign.
description: U-Handshapes with palms facing one another are placed in center of signing space. Hands move up and down simultaneously.
memory_aid: Repetitive motion indicates something that happens a lot.

title: Organic
description: Both A-Handshapes with palms facing signer are pointing down. They start at the waist and move up simultaneously in straight lines up the body.
memory_aid: Hands are outlining the body which is a living, organic thing.

title: Organisation
description: Both hands are in Full Open Handshapes with palms facing one another. Both hands start slightly away from the center of signing space. The right hand is above the left hand. Hands move to the center as hands close into S-Handshapes.
memory_aid: Bringing things together for setting up an organisation.

title: Organise
description: Both hands are in Full Closed Handshapes with palms facing one another. Hands move slightly up and down alternately. At the same time they are both moving to the right.

title: Origin
note: Note the slight puffing of mouth as well as the tongue sticking out slightly. These are essential parts of the sign.
description: Right O-Handshape with palm facing signer starts at the bottom center of the signing space. The left hand is in a Full Open Handshape facing the chest. While right hand moves up towards the left hand, it opens into a Full Open Handshape. Left hand has moved down.
memory_aid: Something coming out of the ground.

title: Original
description: Extended Index Finger Handshape with palm facing out is placed in center of signing space. Hand twists around so that palm is then facing signer.
memory_aid: Number one is twisted to make it first which means the same as 'original'.

title: Originate
note: Note the slight puffing of mouth as well as the tongue sticking out slightly. These are essential parts of the sign.
description: Right O-Handshape with palm facing signer starts at the bottom center of the signing space. The left hand is in a Full Open Handshape facing the chest. While right hand moves up towards the left hand, it opens into a Full Open Handshape. Left hand has moved down.
memory_aid: Something coming out of the ground.

title: Other
description: Right Thumbs-Up Handshape with palm facing left starts pointing up. Hand moves from wrist so that thumb is pointing right and palm facing up.

title: Otherwise
description: Right Thumbs-Up Handshape with palm facing left starts pointing up. Hand moves from wrist so that thumb is pointing right and palm facing up.

title: Ought To
note: 1. Note lowered eyebrows and head. These are important parts of the sign. 2. While 'ought to' is a two-word phrase in English, it is one sign in KSL.
description: Right X-Handshape with palm facing down moves down once.

title: Our
description: Full Closed Handshape with palm facing signer taps chest.

title: Ours
description: Full Closed Handshape with palm facing signer taps chest.

title: Out
description: Right C-Handshape with palm facing up is in Left C-Handshape with palm facing right. Right hand moves back and up.

title: Out Of Order
note: At a restaurant/ at a hotel

title: Outline
note: 'Outline' as in a plan.
description: Both hands are in Full Closed Handshapes with palms facing one another. Hands move slightly up and down alternately. At the same time they are both moving to the right.

title: Outlook
note: The facial expression used by the signer in the video indicates a negative outlook. If one wishes to express a positive outlook, the facial expressions should change to reflect so.
description: Right V-Handshape with palm facing down is placed in front of face pointing left. Hand moves up and down from wrist.

title: Outraged
note: The eyebrows are lowered, indicating anger. The head also moves slightly to the side.
description: Right Claw Handshape with palm facing signer moves to the forehead.
memory_aid: The forehead is usually furrowed in anger.

title: Outside
description: Both Full Open Handshapes with palms facing signer are pointing down. Wrists turn out repetitively.

title: Outside
note: The space beyond some limits

title: Outside
note: The space beyond some limits

title: Outstanding
description: Full Closed Handshape with palm facing signer touches chin and moves up to right in strong motion. Hand ends into Thumbs-Up Handshape.

title: Over 1
note: 'Over' as in to go across something.
description: Right hand is in Full Closed Handshape with palm facing left. Hand moves over downturned left Full Closed Handshape.

title: Over 2
note: 'Over' as in above.
description: Right hand in Full Closed Handshape starts near waist and moves in an arc until hand is over head with fingers pointing left. Palm is always facing down.

title: Over 3
note: 'Over' as in finished.
description: Right L-Handshape with palm facing left starts near the right cheek. Hand moves across and closes into Single-O Handshape.

title: Overdue
description: Right Full Closed Handshape starts with palm facing up. It moves down and back towards right side of signer.

title: Overhead
note: 'Overhead' as in above one's head or in the sky.
description: Right hand in Full Closed Handshape starts near waist and moves in an arc until hand is over head with fingers pointing left. Palm is always facing down.

title: Overlook
description: Base of C-Handshape with palm facing up starts near nose. Hand moves out slightly sideways.
memory_aid: Turning the nose up on someone.

title: Overnight
description: Both Full Closed Handshapes with palms facing out are positioned at the sides of head. Both hands move down and towards one another simultaneously. They stop moving when right hand covers front of left hand. Left arm remains parallel to waist while right hand continues moving down and over to the right side of signing space. Palms are then facing down.
memory_aid: From the time it grows dark to the morning.

title: Overseas
note: Abroad

title: Oversee
description: Right Bent-V Handshape with palm facing out moves side to side on top of wrist of downturned left Full Closed Handshape.
memory_aid: Pair of eyes looking over a desk.

title: Overtake
note: To pass

title: Overtime
note: An extra period of play

title: Overtime
note: An extra period of play

title: Overweight
description: Both hands are in Full Open Handshapes with palms facing one another and fingers pointing down. They start by the waist and move out to the sides of the signing space.

title: Own
description: Full Closed Handshape with palm facing signer touches chest.

title: Owner
description: Full Closed Handshape with palm facing signer touches chest.

title: Ox
description: Both hands are in L-Handshapes with palms facing out. Thumbs touch the sides of forehead. Hands move in and out repetitively.

title: P
note: 'P' can also be signed with the same Handshape as 'K' but in this tipped forward position so that index finger is pointing out and middle finger is pointing down.
description: Ring and little fingers are folded down. Index and middle fingers are straight with middle finger angled forward. Tip of thumb is touching tips of middle and ring fingers. Hand is bent down so that index finger is horizontal and other fingers are pointing down. Palm is facing down.
memory_aid: Has the leg of a written 'P'.

title: Packed
note: 'Packed' as in no more room.
description: Right Full Open Handshape with palm facing down repetitively hits the side of the left hand which is in an S-Handshape.
memory_aid: Hitting upon hand means nothing more can be put there.

title: Page
note: Leaf in book

title: Pail
description: Upside-down S-Handshape with palm facing signer is in front of the chest. The hand moves up and down.

title: Pain
note: Note the raised shoulders and lowered eyebrows. These are essential parts of the sign.
description: Both hands are in Single-O Handshapes. Tips of fingers are touching one another so that palms face one another. Hands are moved back and forth in a tapping motion.
memory_aid: The throbbing sensation of a painful area.

title: Painful
note: Note the raised shoulders and lowered eyebrows. These are essential parts of the sign.
description: Both hands are in Single-O Handshapes. Tips of fingers are touching one another so that palms face one another. Hands are moved back and forth in a tapping motion.
memory_aid: The throbbing sensation of a painful area.

title: Paint
note: 'Paint' as in to paint a picture, not a wall.
description: Right arm is propped upon left arm. Right Extended Index Finger Handshape with palm facing down is pointing away from signer. Finger of right hand moves slightly up and down.
memory_aid: Looks like someone painting a picture.

title: Painting
note: 'Painting' as in a piece of artwork.
description: Right arm is propped upon left arm. Right Extended Index Finger Handshape with palm facing down is pointing away from signer. Finger of right hand moves slightly up and down.
memory_aid: Looks like someone painting a picture.

title: Paltry
note: Note the lowered eyebrows and 'th' mouth movement. These are essential parts of the sign.
description: Small-T Handshape with palm facing up is positioned in center of signing space. Hand moves forward slightly.
memory_aid: Just a few things can be held between these two fingers.

title: Pangani
note: Name of a place

title: Panic
note: Note the lowered eyebrows, an important part of the sign.
description: Full Open Handshapes with palms facing down are near temples of forehead. Hands move simultaneously in small outward circles.

title: Panties
description: Both Full Closed Handshapes touch either side of the stomach. Palms are facing one another and fingertips are facing down. Hands move up and away in an arc simultaneously.

title: Pants
description: Both Full Closed Handshapes touch either side of the stomach. Palms are facing one another and fingertips are facing down. Hands move up and away in an arc simultaneously.

title: Pants
note: Trousers

title: Papaya
description: Right Extended Index Finger Handshape with palm facing left starts at mouth and moves out repetitively.

title: Paper
description: Full Closed Handshape with palm facing signer slightly moves back and forth from the wrist.
memory_aid: A piece of paper flapping in the air.

title: Paper Clip
note: A small, folded wire or plastic device used to hold sheets of paper together

title: Parable
description: Both Full Closed Handshapes with palms facing one another are placed together. They move side to side from the wrists.
memory_aid: The hands are telling a parable.

title: Paradise
note: A very pleasant and beautiful place

title: Paraffin
description: Right forearm is held straight out from body with hand in an S-Handshape with palm facing left. Arm is moved back and forward repetitively.
memory_aid: Shaking a lantern checking for paraffin.

title: Paraffin
note: A petroleum based thin and colorless fuel oil

title: Paraffin Lamp
note: While 'paraffin lamp' is a two-word phrase in English, it is one sign in KSL.
description: Both hands assume Small-T Handshapes with palms facing sides. Right hand moves to strike against the top of the left hand. Right hand then forms an upside-down S-Handshape with palm facing the signer and moves up and down.
memory_aid: Striking a match, holding the lamp.

title: Paragraph
note: A passage in a text that is about a different subject from the preceding text

title: Parallel
note: Equally distant

title: Paramount
description: Full Closed Handshape with palm facing signer touches chin and moves up to right in strong motion. Hand ends into Thumbs-Up Handshape.

title: Parcel
note: A package wrapped for shipment

title: Parched
description: Right Full Open Handshape with palm facing signer is placed on throat. Fingers move down the throat.

title: Pardon
description: Both hands are in Full Closed Handshapes. Right hand is positioned with palm up. Left hand starts on top of right hand where it moves down on the palm. Hands turn so that right hand is now on top of left hand. Right hand then moves down on palm of left hand.

title: Pardon Me
note: asking for direction

title: Parent
note: Father and mother of a child

title: Parent
note: Father and mother of a child

title: Parent
note: Father and mother of a child

title: Park
note: 1. 'Park' as in to park a vehicle. 2. To see 'park' as in an animal park, go to entry for 'Animal Park'.
description: Full Closed Handshape with palm facing down starts up in center of signing space and moves down in a straight line.
memory_aid: Looks like a car coming to rest.

title: Parklands
note: Name of a place

title: Parliament
note: An institution whose elected members meet to debate the major political issues of a country

title: Part
description: Both hands are in Full Closed Handshapes. Right hand with palm facing left moves down on upturned palm of left hand.

title: Party
description: Both Full Open Handshapes with palms facing out are held at either side of the head. Staying in place, hands twist from the wrists.

title: Pass 1
note: 'Pass' as in to go by.
description: Both Extended Index Finger Handshapes with palms facing one another are pointing up. Right hand moves past left hand.

title: Pass 2
note: 'Pass' as in to be right.
description: Right Extended Index Finger Handshape with palm facing down is held upright with finger pointing left. Hand moves up in a check-like motion. Palm is then facing out and finger pointing up.

title: Passion Fruit
note: While 'passion fruit' is a two-word phrase in English, it is one sign in KSL.
description: Fingers of Claw Handshapes are interlocked with palms not touching. Heels of hands are then brought together so that palms touch.
memory_aid: As if opening a passion fruit.

title: Passover
note: Jews celebration commemorating the Biblical exodus

title: Passport
description: Full Closed Handshapes are held with palms together and fingertips pointing away from body. They open. Then left hand is in a Full Closed Handshape with palm facing up. The right is in an S-Handshape with palm facing signer and strikes repetitively back and forth on left palm.
memory_aid: A stamped piece of paper in a book.

title: Past 1
note: 'Past' as in before.
description: Full Closed Handshape is placed by right side of head with palm facing back. Hand moves back in a straight line.
memory_aid: Indicating a time behind the signer, the past.

title: Past 2
note: 'Past' as in history.
description: Both Full Closed Handshapes with palms facing signer are above right shoulder. They move backward in a circular motion alternately.

title: Paste
note: Glue together

title: Pastor
description: Both G-Handshapes with palms facing one another are together at fingertips. They are placed in front of throat. Hands move outward and fingers close, becoming Single-O Handshapes.
memory_aid: Shape of square collar worn by a pastor.

title: Pastor
note: A minister in Christian church

title: Pasture
description: Full Open Handshapes with palms facing down begin in the center away from body. They move towards the body in a wide circle.

title: Path
description: Both Full Closed Handshapes with palms facing one another are held with fingers pointing out. Hands are moved simultaneously forward.

title: Pathologist
note: An expert in pathology

title: Patience
description: C-Handshape is placed upon heart, thumbside against body. Handshape closes into S-Handshape which moves down and up on heart.

title: Patient 1
note: 1. 'Patient' as in a sick person. 2. Appropriate facial expression is important.
description: Backside of Bent-B Handshape touches cheek.

title: Patient 2
note: 'Patient' as in to be tolerant.
description: C-Handshape is placed upon heart, thumbside against body. Handshape closes into S-Handshape which moves down and up on heart.

title: Paul
note: Name of a Bible character, whose name was changed from Saul

title: Paul
note: Name of a Bible character, whose name was changed from Saul

title: Pauper
description: Claw Handshape with palm facing up is placed to left side of signer. Hand moves in a slightly bouncing motion around to the right side of signer.

title: Pawpaw
note: Fruit from the pawpaw plant

title: Pay
description: Right hand is in Small-T Handshape with palm facing left. Hand moves forward as thumb moves forward past the index finger becoming an A-Handshape.
memory_aid: Looks like someone handing over money.

title: Pay Attention
note: While 'pay attention' is a two-word phrase in English, it is one sign in KSL.
description: Both Full Closed Handshapes, fingers pointing up and palms facing one another, are held at the sides of face. They move straight out from the face as hands move down so that fingertips point away from signer.
memory_aid: Indicating the area where one is watching.

title: Peace
note: Without conflict

title: Peace Corps
description: Both V-Handshapes are held with palms facing one another and fingertips touching. Hands move out and slightly down. They then change into C-Handshapes, with palms still facing one another.

title: Peacock
note: A male or female pheasant of the two genera: pavo or Afropavo, whose males have extravagant tails

title: Peanut Butter
note: A spread made from ground peanuts

title: Peanut Butter
note: A spread made from ground peanuts

title: Pear
note: An edible fruit reduced by the pear tree

title: Pedagogy
description: Both hands are in Flat-O Handshapes with palms facing out. Hands move forward slightly and repetitively.

title: Peddle
description: Both Small-T Handshapes with palms facing one another are positioned in center of signing space. They move forward alternately and repetitively. As hands move forward, the thumbs come up changing into A-Handshapes.
memory_aid: Looks like a person selling wares.

title: Pen
description: Right Extended Index Finger Handshape with palm facing signer touches the side of nose. Hand then changes into a Single-O Handshape with palm facing down. Hand moves quickly up and down while moving slightly to the side.
memory_aid: As if writing with a pen.

title: Penalize
description: Right Extended Index Finger Handshape with palm facing down is in upturned A-Handshape of left hand. Right hand moves out and down as wrist snaps.

title: Pencil
description: Both Extended Index Finger Handshapes with palms facing one another are pointing out. Right Extended Index Finger touches upon the left finger and moves down repetitively.

title: Pencil
note: A writing utensil that uses graphite

title: Pencil Sharpener
note: 1. This type of pencil sharpener is the razor blade. 2. While 'pencil sharpener' is a two-word phrase in English, it is one sign in KSL.
description: X-Handshape with palm facing signer touches the side of mouth. Hand moves down repetitively.
memory_aid: Looks like someone shaving their cheek.

title: Penis
description: Extended Index Finger Handshape with palm facing left is placed at bottom of signing space. Hand is pointing out. It moves up and down.

title: Penitence
description: Right S-Handshape with palm facing signer is circled several times over the area of the heart.
memory_aid: Movement over the chest indicates heartfelt penitence.

title: Penitent
description: Right S-Handshape with palm facing signer is circled several times over the area of the heart.
memory_aid: Movement over the chest indicates heartfelt penitence.

title: People
note: The singular form of 'people' ('person') is signed differently. See PERSON.
description: Both hands are in Full Open Handshapes with palms facing signer. Hands are near chest with thumbs the only fingers touching chest. Hands slightly move down repetitively.

title: Pepper
note: A spice prepared from the plant of the family piperaceae

title: Per
description: Right Extended Index Finger Handshape with palm facing signer is held upright. Hand moves over repetitively.

title: Perceive 1
note: There is no difference in meaning between PERCEIVE 1 and PERCEIVE 2. They are variants of 'perceive' in KSL.
description: The S-Handshape with palm facing back is placed on side of the forehead. Index finger is then extended.
memory_aid: Light going on in the head.

title: Perceive 2
note: 1. There is no difference in meaning between PERCEIVE 1 and PERCEIVE 2. They are variants of 'perceive' in KSL. 2. Note the tongue sticking out. This is an essential part of the sign.
description: Flat-O Handshape with palm facing signer moves towards shoulder opening into Full Open Handshape.

title: Perchance
description: Both hands are in Full Closed Handshapes with palms facing up. Hands move up and down alternately.

title: Perfect
note: Note the lowered eyebrows and tilted head, important parts of the sign.
description: Both F-Handshapes are placed in front of signer with palms facing out.

title: Perform
description: The little-finger side of the right S-Handshape with palm facing left is brought down repetitively on top of the index finger side of the left S-Handshape with palm facing right.

title: Performance
note: 'Performance' as in how one works.
description: The little-finger side of the right S-Handshape with palm facing left is brought down repetitively on top of the index finger side of the left S-Handshape with palm facing right.

title: Perhaps
description: Both hands are in Full Closed Handshapes with palms facing up. Hands move up and down alternately.

title: Period
note: 'Period' as in menstruation.
description: Right Full Open Handshape with palm facing down strikes the side of the neck twice. Hand then moves down body repetitively.
memory_aid: Blood flowing out of the body.

title: Permission
note: This sign can change direction depending on who one is asking. In this video, the direction used indicates that the signer is asking you a question. If she were asking herself a question, the palm would face her. If she were asking many people a question, she would move the hand to indicate different people.
description: Right Bent-B Handshape with palm facing out is held upright supported by the left hand at the elbow. Right hand moves forward once.
memory_aid: Tapping someone to ask a question.

title: Permit
note: 'Permit' as in to allow.
description: Full Open Handshapes with palms facing down start in middle of signing space. Hands move in to touch the chest. As they move, hands close into Flat-O Handshapes.

title: Perplexed
note: Facial expressions help indicate difference in degree of confusion. For example, a more emphatic facial expression would be the equivalent of 'bewildered' (which means 'really confused') while a lesser one would probably be best translated as 'confused'.
description: Both hands are in Claw Handshapes with palms facing one another. The right hand is directly above the left hand. Both hands move simultaneously in opposite circles.
memory_aid: How a mind looks when perplexed.

title: Persist
description: Both Extended Index Finger Handshapes with palms facing signer are pointing at one another. They move forward in a circular motion alternately and repetitively.

title: Person
note: The plural form of 'person' ('people') is signed differently. See PEOPLE.
description: Both Full Closed Handshapes with palms facing one another move down simultaneously to waist level.
memory_aid: Indicating the body of a person.

title: -Person Marker-
note: The person marker is used with many nouns and verbs. For example, one can say UGANDA -PERSON MARKER- to signify 'Ugandan' or WORK -PERSON MARKER- to signify 'worker'.
description: Both Full Closed Handshapes with palms facing one another move down simultaneously to waist level.
memory_aid: Indicating the body of a person.

title: Personal
description: Both Full Closed Handshapes with palms facing one another move down simultaneously to waist level.
memory_aid: Indicating the body of a person.

title: Perspective
note: The facial expression used by the signer in the video indicates a negative perspective. If one wishes to express a positive perspective, the facial expressions should change to reflect so.
description: Right V-Handshape with palm facing down is placed in front of face pointing left. Hand moves up and down from wrist.

title: Pertaining To
note: While 'pertaining to' is a two-word phrase in English, it is one sign in KSL.
description: Extended Index Finger Handshapes are pointing at one another and move around one another in small circles.
memory_aid: Fingers are talking about one another.

title: Pester
note: Note the lowered eyebrows which indicate negativity. This is an important part of the sign.
description: Right Bent-B Handshape with palm facing down taps right shoulder repetitively.

title: Petrol
description: Right L-Handshape with palm facing signer and index finger pointing left moves down from wrist.

title: Petticoat
note: Undercoat

title: Pharisee
note: Jew's religious leader

title: Phone
description: Right Y-Handshape with palm facing signer touches the right side of the face. The thumb is near the ear and the little finger near the mouth.

title: Phone Card
note: While 'phone card' is a two-word phrase in English, it is one sign in KSL.
description: Right Curved-Three Handshape with palm facing down and fingers closed is placed upon palm of upturned left Full Closed Handshape. Right hand moves up and down slightly on left palm.
memory_aid: Looks like one scratching a phone card.

title: Phonograph
note: audio device that captures sound waves onto an engraved archive

title: Phony
description: Both hands are in Full Closed Handshapes. Left hand is positioned in center of signing space with palm down and fingertips pointing right. Right hand, with palm facing left, moves down to touch repetitively upon back of left hand.

title: Photocopier
note: paper copy machine

title: Photocopy
note: With the verb form of this sign the movement is done repetitively. The sign in this entry is a noun, which has only one movement.
description: Left hand is in Full Closed Handshape with palm facing up. Right Claw Handshape with palm facing up is positioned underneath left hand. Right hand moves down in a straight line as it closes into O-Handshape.
memory_aid: Taking from another piece of paper.

title: Photograph
description: Left L-Handshape and Right Modified-C Handshape with palms facing out are in front of face. The index finger of the right hand moves up and down repetitively. Then both Extended Index Finger Handshapes are side by side pointing out. They move away from one another tracing a rectangle.
memory_aid: Sheet that comes from taking a photograph.

title: Phrase
description: Both L-Handshapes with palms facing one another are placed in center of signing space. They move away from one another in a straight line. As they move away, hands close into Single-O Handshapes repetitively.
memory_aid: Looks like words in a phrase.

title: Physical Condition
note: While 'physical condition' is a two-word phrase in English, it is one sign in KSL.
description: Both Full Open Handshapes with palms facing signer are positioned at shoulders. Hands move out while handshapes change to S-Handshapes.

title: Physical Education
note: While 'physical education' is a two-word phrase in English, it is one sign in KSL.
description: Both O-Handshapes with palms facing signer are placed on shoulders. They move out while opening into Full Open Handshapes. This is done repetitively.

title: Physician
note: While 'physician' is one word in English, it is a two-word phrase (MEDICAL, PERSON) in KSL.
description: MEDICAL - Right X-Handshape with palm facing signer taps the side of the left arm. PERSON - Both Full Closed Handshapes with palms facing one another move down simultaneously to waist level.

title: Physics
note: Unit of science

title: Physiotherapy
note: Therapy that uses physical techniques

title: Physique
description: Both Full Open Handshapes start at either side of the chest and move down to touch the waist. Palms are facing the signer.

title: Piano
note: A stringed musical instrument with a keyboard

title: Pick 1
note: 'Pick' as in to choose.
description: F-Handshape starts with palm facing down. Hand moves up from wrist so that palm is facing out.

title: Pick 2
note: 'Pick' as in to take hold of an object and lift it from its place.
description: Full Open Handshape starts with palm facing down. As hand moves up, handshape closes into a Flat-O Handshape. Palm is now facing out.

title: Pick Up
note: 1. 'Pick up' as in to take hold of an object and lift it from its place. 2. While 'pick up' is a two-word phrase in English, it is one sign in KSL.
description: Full Open Handshape starts with palm facing down. As hand moves up, handshape closes into a Flat-O Handshape. Palm is now facing out.

title: Pickpocket
description: Right V-Handshape with palm facing down and fingers pointing right starts at right side of signing space. Hand moves in as fingers close to form an S-Handshape.

title: Picture
description: Left L-Handshape and Right Modified-C Handshape with palms facing out are in front of face. The index finger of the right hand moves up and down repetitively. Then both Extended Index Finger Handshapes are side by side pointing out. They move away from one another tracing a rectangle.
memory_aid: Sheet that comes from taking a picture.

title: Piece
description: Both hands are in Full Closed Handshapes. Right hand with palm facing left moves down on upturned palm of left hand.
memory_aid: A piece of the left hand.

title: Pig
description: Palm of Full Closed Handshape taps the mouth softly.
memory_aid: The flat nose of a pig.

title: Pig
note: A mammal having a hooves, bristles and a nose adapted for digging

title: Pilau
note: Food made from rice, meat and spices, common in coastal Kenya

title: Pill
note: 'Pill' as in medicine.
description: The right hand is in an S-Handshape which faces the chin. The index finger pops out repetitively towards the mouth.

title: Pilot
note: One who controls a plane/ A person who steers a ship

title: Pilsner
description: Both Claw Handshapes with palms facing out are placed side by side in the center of the signing space. Left hand is slightly below right hand. It moves up while right hand moves down. Right hand is then slightly below left hand.
memory_aid: Paws of a lion which is the animal on the Pilsner logo.

title: Pilsner
note: Alcoholic beverage fermented from starch material

title: Pin
note: A small nail with a head and a sharp point

title: Pineapple
description: Right hand in O-Handshape with palm facing out touches the forehead. Hand opens to form Full Open Handshape.

title: Pineapple
note: fruit from the pineapple plant/ coca cola drink

title: Pink
description: Right Extended Index Finger Handshape with palm facing left starts on mouth and moves out in a straight line.
memory_aid: Hand touches the lower lip of the mouth which can look pink.

title: Pioneer
note: First to do something/ JW publisher who reports 70 hours per month

title: Pipe
note: A wind musical instrument/ A rigid tube that transports fluids

title: Pitiless
note: While CRUEL shares the same sign as other English words like 'inhumane', 'mean', and 'rude', they have slightly different facial expressions. The more intense the meanness, the more intense the facial expression. Hence CRUEL gets a more intense facial expression than RUDE does.
description: Claw Handshapes with palms facing down rest upon either side of head. Hands move out simultaneously in a straight line.

title: Place 1
note: 'Place' as in location.
description: Right Full Open Handshape with palm facing down and fingers pointing left is positioned near right shoulder. Hand moves in an inward circular motion while remaining in place.

title: Place 2
note: 'Place' as in to put.
description: Flat-O Handshape with palm facing down starts in front of face. It moves down in a straight line.

title: Plain 1
note: 1. 'Plain' as in obvious. 2. Note lowered head and eyebrows, essential parts of the sign.
description: Flat-O Handshapes with palms facing down start at opposite ends of signing space. Hands move down towards one another as hands open into Full Open Handshapes.
memory_aid: Open hands show that something is plain.

title: Plain 2
note: 'Plain' as in a field.
description: Full Open Handshapes with palms facing down begin in the center away from body. They move towards the body in a wide circle.

title: Plan
description: Both hands are in Full Closed Handshapes with palms facing one another. Hands move slightly up and down alternately. At the same time they are both moving to the right.

title: Planet
description: Slightly bent Full Open Handshapes with palms facing out start together and move around forward until they meet. Palms are now facing signer.

title: Plant 1
note: 'Plant' as in a flower plant.
description: Right Flat-O Handshape is facing up in left C-Handshape. Right hand moves up while changing into Full Open Handshape. This is done repetitively as hands move to left.
memory_aid: Looks like a few plants in the ground.

title: Plant 2
note: 'Plant' as in to plant a flower.
description: Single-O Handshape with palm facing down is placed in front of signer. Hand moves forward as it opens into L-Handshape. This is done repetitively.

title: Plant 3
note: 'Plant' as in to plant a flower.
description: Single-O Handshape with palm facing down is placed in front of signer. Hand moves forward as it opens into L-Handshape. This is done repetitively.

title: Plate
description: Both Full Closed Handshapes with palms facing up are held together at fingertips. They are then separated and brought around in a circle so that they reconnect at the heels.

title: Plateau
description: Full Open Handshapes with palms facing down begin in the center away from body. They move towards the body in a wide circle.

title: Plausible
note: Note raised eyebrows and raised chin. These are important parts of the sign.
description: Both hands are in S-Handshapes with palms facing down. They move up and down from the wrists.

title: Play
note: 'Play' as in to play a game.
description: Full Open Handshapes with palms facing signer are moving around one another in a circle.

title: Plead
note: Note lowered eyebrows and head, essential parts of the sign.
description: Full Closed Handshape with palm facing signer is circled on the chest over the heart.
memory_aid: A plea coming from the heart.

title: Please
note: Note lowered eyebrows and head, essential parts of the sign.
description: Full Closed Handshape with palm facing signer is circled on the chest over the heart.
memory_aid: A plea coming from the heart.

title: Please Repeat After Me
note: Languages and communication

title: Please Say That Again
note: Languages and communication

title: Please Sit Down
note: General conversation

title: Please Speak More Slowly
note: Languages and communication

title: Please Speak More Slowly
note: Languages and communication

title: Please Turn Left
note: asking and givin direction

title: Please Turn Right
note: asking and givin direction

title: Pleased To Meet You
note: Making friends

title: Pleased To Meet You
note: Making friends

title: Pledge
description: Right Extended Index Finger Handshape with palm facing left points to the mouth. Then it opens into a Full Closed Handshape as it moves down to touch upon palm of upturned left Full Closed Handshape.

title: Plentiful
description: Right Full Open Handshape with palm facing down repetitively hits the side of the left hand which is in an S-Handshape.
memory_aid: The hand hits again and again meaning 'plentiful'.

title: Plenty
description: Right Full Open Handshape with palm facing down repetitively hits the side of the left hand which is in an S-Handshape.
memory_aid: The hand hits again and again meaning 'plenty'.

title: Plethora
description: Both hands are in Full Closed Handshapes. Palm of left hand is facing up while palm of right hand is facing down. Right hand starts on top of left hand and moves up in a straight line. Both hands turn from wrists so that they are facing out.
memory_aid: Adding more to what one already has.

title: Plummet
note: 1. 'Plummet' in this sign usually refers to people. 2. 'Plummet' means to fall very far. While one signs FALL they must add facial expressions (i.e. lowered eyebrows) to indicate the more intense PLUMMET.
description: Fingers of V-Handshape are placed on upturned left Full Closed Handshape. Right hand moves up and then down so that palm of V-Handshape is facing up.

title: Plump
description: Both hands are in Full Open Handshapes with palms facing one another and fingers pointing down. They start by the waist and move out to the sides of the signing space.

title: Plums
note: The edible, fleshy stone fruit

title: Plural
description: Right Full Open Handshape with palm facing down repetitively hits the side of the left hand which is in an S-Handshape.
memory_aid: The hand hits again and again meaning 'plural'.

title: Plus
note: 'Plus' as for maths class.
description: Both hands are in Extended Index Finger Handshapes. The left hand is pointing up while the right extended finger touches the left finger horizontally.
memory_aid: Looks like the sign for addition.

title: Pneumonia
note: An inflammation of the lungs caused by microorganisms

title: Pocket
note: Hollow parts on the sides of trousers used to hold things

title: Point 1
note: 'Point' as in to indicate something.
description: Extended Index Finger Handshape points at side of signing space.

title: Point 2
note: 'Point' as in a statement or line of reasoning.
description: Right Extended Index Finger Handshape with palm facing down points to top of upright left Full Closed Handshape with palm facing out. Right hand moves down left hand pointing at different places.
memory_aid: Pointing down arm indicates different points.

title: Poison
note: A substance that is harmful or lethal to a living organism

title: Police Officer
description: POLICE - U-Handshape with palm facing left taps upon forehead. PERSON - Both Full Closed Handshapes with palms facing one another move down simultaneously to waist level.

title: Policeman
note: While 'policeman' is one word in English, it is a two-word phrase (POLICE, PERSON) in KSL.
description: POLICE - U-Handshape with palm facing left taps upon forehead. PERSON - Both Full Closed Handshapes with palms facing one another move down simultaneously to waist level.

title: Policewoman
note: While 'policewoman' is one word in English, it is a two-word phrase (POLICE, PERSON) in KSL.
description: POLICE - U-Handshape with palm facing left taps upon forehead. PERSON - Both Full Closed Handshapes with palms facing one another move down simultaneously to waist level.

title: Polio
note: Acute infection by the poliovirus

title: Polish
note: Smoothness/ A substance used to polish

title: Politician
note: While 'politician' is one word in English, it is a two-word phrase (POLITICS, PERSON) in KSL.
description: POLITICS - S-Handshape with palm facing left is shaken above head. PERSON - Both Full Closed Handshapes with palms facing one another move down simultaneously to waist level.

title: Poll
description: Both hands are in Bent-B Handshapes with palms facing signer and fingers pointing down. Hands move up and down alternately.

title: Pooch
note: To specify the breed of a pooch, fingerspell.
description: The right hand assumes the Full Open Handshape with palm facing out. The back of the hand is near the right cheek. Hand moves sideways repetitively.
memory_aid: The floppy ears of a pooch.

title: Poor
note: Note lowered eyebrows, an important part of the sign.
description: Right Claw Handshape with palm facing signer is positioned at elbow of upright bent left arm. Fingers of right hand move down elbow of left arm.

title: Population
note: To sign this repetitively as done in the sign video means 'populations'. To sign this in the singular form, the movement is not repetitive, only done once to signify 'population'.
description: Both hands, in C-Handshapes with palms facing one another, start at one end of signing space. They move towards one another simultaneously. This is done repetitively as hands move to other side of signing space.

title: Pornography
note: watch, reading materials about sex to stimulate self

title: Porridge
description: Slightly cupped Full Open Handshape with palm facing up moves in an inward circular motion in front of the mouth.

title: Porter
note: A person who carries luggage

title: Portray
description: Right Extended Index Finger Handshape with palm facing signer is pointing to palm of outturned left Full Closed Handshape. Both hands move forward simultaneously in a straight line.
memory_aid: Pointing out something on the left hand to portray it.

title: Position 1
note: 'Position' as in a location.
description: Right Full Open Handshape with palm facing down and fingers pointing left is positioned near right shoulder. Hand moves in an inward circular motion while remaining in place.

title: Position 2
note: 'Position' as in situation.
description: Right Claw Handshape with palm facing down moves up and down on upturned left Full Closed Handshape.
memory_aid: A lot of information in hand.

title: Position 3
note: 1. 'Position' as in one's opinion, attitude. 2. The facial expression used by the signer in the video indicates a negative position. If one wishes to express a positive position, the facial expressions should change to reflect so.
description: Right V-Handshape with palm facing down is placed in front of face pointing left. Hand moves up and down from wrist.

title: Position 4
note: 'Position' as in employment.
description: The little-finger side of the right S-Handshape with palm facing left is brought down repetitively on top of the index finger side of the left S-Handshape with palm facing right.

title: Positive
note: 'Positive' can be used to express the positive sign in mathematics or a HIV positive status.
description: Both hands are in Extended Index Finger Handshapes. The left hand is pointing up while the right extended finger touches the left finger horizontally.
memory_aid: Looks like the sign for addition.

title: Positively
note: 1. 'Positively' as in absolutely. 2. Note raised eyebrows, an essential part of the sign.
description: Both hands are in Full Closed Handshapes. Left hand is positioned in center of signing space with palm up and fingertips pointing right. Right hand, with palm facing left, moves down to touch upon palm of left hand.

title: Possess
description: Fingers of upturned Full Closed Handshape touches middle of chest.
memory_aid: Indicating something on or with the person.

title: Possible
note: Note raised eyebrows and raised chin. These are important parts of the sign.
description: Both hands are in S-Handshapes with palms facing down. They move up and down from the wrists.

title: Possibly 1
note: 'Possibly' as in maybe.
description: Both hands are in Full Closed Handshapes with palms facing up. Hands move up and down alternately.

title: Possibly 2
note: 1. 'Possibly' as in something is possible. 2. Note raised eyebrows and raised chin. These are important parts of the sign.
description: Both hands are in S-Handshapes with palms facing down. They move up and down from the wrists.

title: Post
note: 'Post' as in to mail something.
description: Flat-O Handshape with palm facing down moves down and opens.
memory_aid: Hand is putting a letter in a postal box.

title: Post Office
note: While 'post office' is a two-word phrase in English, it is one sign in KSL.
description: Right S-Handshape with palm facing signer strikes repetitively back and forth on palm of upturned left Full Closed Handshape.

title: Post Office
note: Office for posting letters and packages

title: Post Office
note: Office for posting letters and packages

title: Postpone
description: Full Closed Handshape with palm facing signer and fingers pointing left moves in steps forward repetitively.

title: Postponement
description: Full Closed Handshape with palm facing signer and fingers pointing left moves in steps forward repetitively.

title: Pot
description: Both hands are in Full Closed Handshapes with palms facing one another. Hands are moved down, curving out away from each other and then back. Hands end up next to each other with palms facing up.

title: Pot
note: A vessel used for cooking or storing food

title: Potato
description: The left hand is in a Claw Handshape with palm facing up. The right is in an X-Handshape which moves in small arcs over the left hand.

title: Potent
description: Both hands are in S-Handshapes with palms facing signer. Arms move in close to the body and strike down slightly once.

title: Potential
note: Note raised eyebrows and raised chin. These are important parts of the sign.
description: Both hands are in S-Handshapes with palms facing down. They move up and down from the wrists.

title: Poultry
description: The back of the right hand, in an X-Handshape, touches the mouth. Downward motions are made from the wrist.

title: Poverty
note: Note lowered eyebrows, an important part of the sign.
description: Right Claw Handshape with palm facing signer is positioned at elbow of upright bent left arm. Fingers of right hand move down elbow of left arm.

title: Powder
note: Fine particles to which any dry substance is reduced by pounding or grinding

title: Power 1
note: 'Power' as in electricity.
description: Right Extended Index Finger Handshape with palm facing left points up. It moves slightly up and then changes into a Flat-O Handshape with palm facing down. Still above head, right hand opens into the Full Open Handshape.

title: Power 2
note: 'Power' as in political power.
description: Right Full Closed Handshape with palm facing down is placed at left shoulder. Thumb-side of hand is touching shoulder. Hand moves in an arc to elbow where little-finger side is now touching arm.

title: Powerful
description: Both hands are in S-Handshapes with palms facing signer. Arms move in close to the body and strike down slightly once.

title: Practice
note: 'Practice' as in to rehearse.
description: Both O-Handshapes with palms facing signer are placed on shoulders. They move out while opening into Full Open Handshapes. This is done repetitively.

title: Praise
description: Right Extended Index Finger Handshape with palm facing left points at mouth. It then changes into a Full Closed Handshape as it moves down to upturned left Full Closed Handshape. Right hand claps palm of left hand.

title: Pray
description: Both Full Closed Handshapes are held together with palms facing one another. Head bends down.

title: Precipitation
description: Both Claw Handshapes with palms facing down are held above eye level then moved down repetitively.

title: Precise
note: Note raised eyebrows, an essential part of the sign.
description: Both hands are in Full Closed Handshapes. Left hand is positioned in center of signing space with palm up and fingertips pointing right. Right hand, with palm facing left, moves down to touch upon palm of left hand.

title: Predict
description: Both C-Handshapes with palms facing one another are positioned at right side of signer with right hand before left hand. Hands both twist up and down from wrists in opposite directions repetitively.

title: Prediction
description: Both C-Handshapes with palms facing one another are positioned at right side of signer with right hand before left hand. Hands both twist up and down from wrists in opposite directions repetitively.

title: Predisposition 1
note: Note the mouth movement 'ba ba ba'. This is an important part of the sign.
description: Full Closed Handshape starts at side of signer with palm facing down. Hand moves up from wrist as arm moves slightly forward. Palm is now facing out.

title: Predisposition 2
note: This is usually used with PREDISPOSITION 1. PREDISPOSITION 2 is signed first then PREDISPOSITION 1, which means 'one's predisposition' or LAW HIS/HER.
description: Right L-Handshape starts down with thumb pointing up. Palm is facing left. Hand moves so that thumb of L-Handshape touches shoulder.

title: Prefect
note: The first part of this sign uses the sign SCHOOL.
description: Both hands are in S-Handshapes with palms facing down. The right arm rests upon the left arm. Right Single-O Handshape with palm facing signer is under right shoulder. Hand moves away from body repetitively.

title: Preference 1
note: Note the mouth movement 'ba ba ba'. This is an important part of the sign.
description: Full Closed Handshape starts at side of signer with palm facing down. Hand moves up from wrist as arm moves slightly forward. Palm is now facing out.

title: Preference 2
note: This is usually used with PREFERENCE 1. PREFERENCE 2 is signed first then PREFERENCE 1, which means 'one's preference' or LAW HIS/HER.
description: Right L-Handshape starts down with thumb pointing up. Palm is facing left. Hand moves so that thumb of L-Handshape touches shoulder.

title: Pregnancy
description: Thumbside of Full Closed Handshape with palm facing down is placed on signer below chest. Hand moves out and down in an arc so that little-finger side of handshape touches waist of signer.
memory_aid: Shows the bump of a pregnancy.

title: Pregnant
description: Thumbside of Full Closed Handshape with palm facing down is placed on signer below chest. Hand moves out and down in an arc so that little-finger side of handshape touches waist of signer.
memory_aid: Shows the bump of a pregnancy.

title: Preparation
description: Both hands are in Full Closed Handshapes with palms facing one another. Hands move slightly up and down alternately. At the same time they are both moving to the right.

title: Prepare
description: Both hands are in Full Closed Handshapes with palms facing one another. Hands move slightly up and down alternately. At the same time they are both moving to the right.

title: Prepared
description: R-Handshapes with palms facing out move from side to side repetitively.
memory_aid: R' for ready which means the same as 'prepared'.

title: Present
note: 1. 'Present' as in now. 2. Note raised shoulders, an essential part of the sign.
description: Both Full Closed Handshapes with palms facing out point down. They move down simultaneously twice.

title: Preservation
description: Left Full Closed Handshape with palm facing up is held out, slightly bent at base of fingers. The right hand, in same handshape as left hand but with palm facing down, covers the left in a light clapping motion.

title: Preserve
description: Left Full Closed Handshape with palm facing up is held out, slightly bent at base of fingers. The right hand, in same handshape as left hand but with palm facing down, covers the left in a light clapping motion.

title: President
description: The right hand is in a Small-T Handshape with palm facing out. As it turns inward to body, the hand also moves up.
memory_aid: Indicates the ceremonial whip used by first president Kenyatta.

title: President 2
description: The right hand is in a Small-T Handshape with palm facing out. As it turns inward to body, the hand also moves up.
memory_aid: Indicates the ceremonial whip used by first president Kenyatta.

title: Presidential Escort
note: Police tasked with escorting the president

title: Pressure
note: A force applied to a surface

title: Pretend
description: Flat-O Handshape with palm facing signer touches center of forehead and then moves down to touch chin.

title: Pretty
note: 'Beautiful', 'gorgeous', 'pretty', and 'good-looking' all basically mean the same but differ in intensity. In KSL, this difference in degree is indicated by facial expression. For example, 'beautiful' and 'gorgeous' would have stronger facial expressions than 'pretty' and 'good-looking'.
description: The right hand is in an O-Handshape with palm facing out. Hand moves across face as hand turns opening into Full Open Handshape with palm facing signer.
memory_aid: The hand outlines a pretty face.

title: Prevail
description: Right Extended Index Finger Handshape with palm facing signer is pointing down. Wrist turns so that finger is pointing up.

title: Prevent
description: Both S-Handshapes with palms facing sides are held upright crossed at the wrists. They move forward once.
memory_aid: Arms are preventing you from something.

title: Prevention
description: Both S-Handshapes with palms facing sides are held upright crossed at the wrists. They move forward once.
memory_aid: Arms are preventing you from something.

title: Price
description: Palms of both Small-T Handshapes are facing one another. Thumbs rub over tips of index fingers. Then both hands move up as they turn from wrists opening into Full Open Handshapes with palms facing up.

title: Pricey
note: Note lowered eyebrows, an important part of the sign.
description: Right S-Handshape with palm facing left moves down in a straight line then moves directly back up as hand changes into Full Open Handshape that shakes up and down slightly.

title: Priest
description: Both G-Handshapes with palms facing one another are together at fingertips. They are placed in front of throat. Hands move outward and fingers close, becoming Single-O Handshapes.
memory_aid: Shape of square collar worn by a priest.

title: Priest
note: Clergyman trained to perform services or sacrifices on a church or temple

title: Primary School
note: 'Primary School' is signed here as SCHOOL then PRIMARY. This is typical of sentence structure in KSL. Nouns are signed first and then their adjectives come after. SCHOOL is a noun here and is then modified by the adjective PRIMARY.
description: SCHOOL - Both hands are in S-Handshapes with palms facing down. The right arm rests upon the left arm. PRIMARY - Right Bent-B Handshape with palm facing signer moves to left in slight bouncing motion.
memory_aid: SCHOOL and PRIMARY together mean 'primary school'.

title: Print
note: To produce one or more copies of a text or image on a surface, especially by machine

title: Prison
description: Both E-Handshapes are placed in center of signing space with palms facing one another. Right hand is closer to signer. It moves forward so that wrists of both hands are touching. Both hands then move back and forth in opposite directions from wrists.

title: Prisoner
note: One in a jail

title: Prisoner
note: One in a jail

title: Pristine 1
note: There is no difference in meaning between PRISTINE 1 and PRISTINE 2. They are variants of 'pristine' in KSL.
description: I-Handshapes with palms facing out are at either side of signing space. Wrists turn hands back and up.
memory_aid: Hands turning up signifies something new.

title: Pristine 2
note: There is no difference in meaning between PRISTINE 1 and PRISTINE 2. They are variants of 'pristine' in KSL.
description: Right Thumbs-Up Handshape is held with thumb against right corner of mouth. Palm is facing out. Hand moves forward, turning until palm is facing signer.

title: Privacy
description: Thumbs-Up Handshape is placed on mouth with palm facing signer. Hand moves down and then across on mouth.

title: Private
description: Thumbs-Up Handshape is placed on mouth with palm facing signer. Hand moves down and then across on mouth.

title: Private
note: Belonging only to an individual person or a specific group

title: Probe
description: Both V-Handshapes with palms facing one another are positioned in center of signing space. Hands move slightly back and down while fingers bend in Bent-V Handshapes. This is done repetitively.
memory_aid: Two sets of eyes looking over something.

title: Problem
note: Note lowered eyebrows and tilted head, essential parts of the sign.
description: The left hand is in a Full Closed Handshape with palm facing right. Right Thumbs-Up Handshape with palm facing down touches palm of left hand repetitively.

title: Proceed
description: Both Extended Index Finger Handshapes with palms facing signer are pointing at one another. They move forward in a circular motion alternately and repetitively.

title: Process
note: a series of events to produce a result

title: Proclaim
description: Both Extended Index Finger Handshapes with palms facing signer are pointing at chin. Hands move out and away from one another. Palms then face out.

title: Proclamation
description: Both Extended Index Finger Handshapes with palms facing signer are pointing at chin. Hands move out and away from one another. Palms then face out.

title: Produce
note: To yield, manufacture

title: Profession
description: The little-finger side of the right S-Handshape with palm facing left is brought down repetitively on top of the index finger side of the left S-Handshape with palm facing right.

title: Profession
note: A career

title: Profession
note: A career

title: Professional
description: Both Bent-B Handshapes with palms facing down are held above and slightly in front of head. Right hand moves straight back to head.

title: Proficient
description: Both Bent-B Handshapes with palms facing down are held above and slightly in front of head. Right hand moves straight back to head.

title: Program
description: Both hands are in Full Closed Handshapes. Left hand is held upright so that palm is facing out. Thumb-side of right hand with palm facing down touches top of left hand. It moves down on left arm in steps.

title: Programme
description: Both hands are in Full Closed Handshapes. Left hand is held upright so that palm is facing out. Thumb-side of right hand with palm facing down touches top of left hand. It moves down on left arm in steps.

title: Prohibit
description: Both hands are in Full Closed Handshapes. Left hand is held horizontally in front of signer with palm facing in. Right hand is held to side of signer with palm facing left. Right hand moves to palm of left hand.
memory_aid: Left hand prohibits right hand from moving.

title: Prohibition
description: Both hands are in Full Closed Handshapes. Left hand is held horizontally in front of signer with palm facing in. Right hand is held to side of signer with palm facing left. Right hand moves to palm of left hand.
memory_aid: Left hand prohibits right hand from moving.

title: Project
description: Right V-Handshape with palm facing left is pointing down on upturned left Full Closed Handshape. The right hand moves to the right and lands again on the left palm. Palm of right hand is now facing signer.
memory_aid: Movement of hand indicates that it is working on something important.

title: Prolonged
description: Both Flat-O Handshapes with palms facing signer are together touching at the fingertips. Hands move away from one another in a straight line simultaneously.

title: Promise
description: Right Extended Index Finger Handshape with palm facing left points to the mouth. Then it opens into a Full Closed Handshape as it moves down to touch upon palm of upturned left Full Closed Handshape.

title: Prompt
description: Both hands are in Full Closed Handshapes with palms facing each other. The left hand is in center of signing space facing the right. The right hand slaps upon the palm of left hand in one upward motion.

title: Promptly
note: Note raised shoulders, an essential part of the sign.
description: Both Full Closed Handshapes with palms facing out point down. They move down simultaneously twice.
memory_aid: Indicating the immediate present which is the same as 'promptly'.

title: Proof
description: Both hands are in Full Closed Handshapes. Left hand is positioned in center of signing space with palm up and fingertips pointing right. Right hand, with palm facing left, moves down to touch upon palm of left hand. Once right hand touches down, it moves forward in a slightly up motion.
memory_aid: Arm goes in a straight direction, not off to the side as one would when untruthful.

title: Propaganda
note: A concerted set of messages aimed at influencing the opinions of a large number of people

title: Prophesize
description: Both C-Handshapes with palms facing one another are positioned at right side of signer with right hand before left hand. Hands both twist up and down from wrists in opposite directions repetitively.

title: Prophet
note: Someone who speaks by divine inspiration

title: Propose
description: Fingertips of downturned right Full Closed Handshape tap side of upturned left Full Closed Handshape.
memory_aid: If one does what is proposed, one will get applause.

title: Prosperity
note: The more prosperous one is, the more intense the facial expression and movement are.
description: Claw Handshape with palm facing signer is positioned under right shoulder. Hand moves out in a straight line.

title: Prosperous
note: The more prosperous one is, the more intense the facial expression and movement are.
description: Claw Handshape with palm facing signer is positioned under right shoulder. Hand moves out in a straight line.

title: Prostitute
description: Thumbs-Up Handshape with palm facing signer is placed at bottom center of signing space. Hand moves up and down.

title: Prostitute
note: one giving sexual pleasures for money

title: Prostitute
note: one giving sexual pleasures for money

title: Protect
description: Both S-Handshapes with palms facing sides are held upright crossed at the wrists. They move forward once.

title: Protection
description: Both S-Handshapes with palms facing sides are held upright crossed at the wrists. They move forward once.

title: Protestant
note: Christians who broke from the catholic church

title: Protestant
note: Christians who broke from the catholic church

title: Proud
note: Gratified

title: Proud
note: Gratified

title: Prove
description: Both hands are in Full Closed Handshapes. Left hand is positioned in center of signing space with palm up and fingertips pointing right. Right hand, with palm facing left, moves down to touch upon palm of left hand. Once right hand touches down, it moves forward in a slightly up motion.
memory_aid: Arm goes in a straight direction, not off to the side as one would when untruthful.

title: Province
description: Right Modified-C Handshape with palm facing out is resting on its side. It moves down in a slight side to side motion.

title: Public
description: Heels of both Full Closed Handshapes are touching, with fingers pointing out. Both hands move out to either side of the signing space simultaneously.
memory_aid: Indicates a wide group of people.

title: Publicity
description: O-Handshapes with palms facing out are positioned in front of mouth. Hands move out to either side of the signing space as handshapes open into Full Open Handshapes. Palms are then facing down.

title: Publicize
description: O-Handshapes with palms facing out are positioned in front of mouth. Hands move out to either side of the signing space as handshapes open into Full Open Handshapes. Palms are then facing down.

title: Publisher
note: One who publishes books/ A member of Jehovah's witnesses who preaches

title: Pull Away
note: While 'pull away' is a two-word phrase in English, it is one sign in KSL.
description: Both hands are in Bent-B Handshapes with palms facing signer. Backs of hands are touching one another and then move away directly from one another in a straight line.

title: Pullover
note: A sweater that must be put on by pulling it over the head

title: Pump
note: A device for moving or compressing a liquid or gas

title: Pumpkin
description: Both hands are in Bent-B Handshapes. The hands face one another with fingertips touching and heels apart. Hands are moved down and apart bringing them back together at the heels. Both hands then become Full Closed Handshapes. Left is positioned in center with palm up. Right hand with palm facing left moves to center of left hand. Right hand moves side to side.
memory_aid: The shape and cutting of a pumpkin.

title: Pumpkin
note: The round yellow or orange fruit of the pumpkin plant

title: Pumpkin
note: The round yellow or orange fruit of the pumpkin plant

title: Pumwani
note: Name of a hospital

title: Punch
note: This verb changes movement depending on the object. If it is to punch yourself, the hand moves towards yourself, as shown in this video. If it is to punch someone else, the hand moves away from the signer.
description: S-Handshape with palm facing down moves towards head. Upon touching head, hand moves up slightly.

title: Punish 1
note: There is no difference in meaning between PUNISH 1 and PUNISH 2. They are variants of 'punish' in KSL.
description: Right Extended Index Finger Handshape with palm facing down is in upturned A-Handshape of left hand. Right hand moves out and down as wrist snaps.

title: Punish 2
note: There is no difference in meaning between PUNISH 1 and PUNISH 2. They are variants of 'punish' in KSL.
description: Both E-Handshapes are placed in center of signing space with palms facing one another. Right hand is closer to signer. It moves forward so that wrists of both hands are touching. Both hands then move back and forth in opposite directions from wrists.

title: Pupil
note: While 'pupil' is one word in English, it is a two-word phrase (LEARN, PERSON) in KSL.
description: Right Flat O-Handshape with palm facing signer taps side of forehead. Then both Full Closed Handshapes move down simultaneously to waist level.

title: Purchase
description: The right hand, in a Flat-O Handshape with palm facing up, rests on the palm of upturned left Full Closed Handshape. Right hand moves forward changing into an A-Handshape.

title: Pure
description: Both hands are in I-Handshapes with palms facing out. The right hand is placed behind the left hand. Both move out, away from one another, in a straight line.

title: Purification
description: Both hands are in I-Handshapes with palms facing out. The right hand starts behind the left hand. Both move out, away from one another, in a straight line. Hands then come back together and away repetitively.

title: Purify
description: Both hands are in I-Handshapes with palms facing out. The right hand starts behind the left hand. Both move out, away from one another, in a straight line. Hands then come back together and away repetitively.

title: Purple
description: Right Extended Index Finger Handshape with palm facing left starts at mouth and moves out repetitively.
memory_aid: A bruised lip can look purple.

title: Purpose
description: Both hands are in Extended Index Finger Handshapes. Right hand is closer to signer and its palm is facing in. Finger of right hand points towards the left hand which is held away from the signer with the palm facing in. Right hand moves toward left hand.
memory_aid: An arrow moving towards its target.

title: Put
description: Flat-O Handshape with palm facing down starts in front of face. It moves down in a straight line.

title: Put Off
note: While 'put off' is a two-word phrase in English, it is one sign in KSL.
description: Full Closed Handshape with palm facing signer and fingers pointing left moves in steps forward repetitively.

title: Put On
note: 1. 'Put on' as in to dress. 2. While 'put on' is a two-word phrase in English, it is one sign in KSL.
description: Flat-O Handshapes with palms facing up start at shoulders. They move down simultaneously to waist.

title: Puzzled
note: Facial expressions help indicate difference in degree of confusion. For example, a more emphatic facial expression would be the equivalent of 'bewildered' (which means 'really confused') while a lesser one would probably be best translated as 'confused'.
description: Both hands are in Claw Handshapes with palms facing one another. The right hand is directly above the left hand. Both hands move simultaneously in opposite circles.
memory_aid: How a mind looks when puzzled.

title: Q
note: This sign is the same as 'G' but pointing at the ground.
description: Middle, ring and little fingers are folded down across palm. Thumb is straight but pulled in so that it is in front of the index finger. The index finger is straight and pointing forwards slightly so that it is parallel to the thumb. The thumb and index finger are not touching. The whole hand is turned down with palm facing down.

title: Quality
note: Level of excellence

title: Queen
note: female ruler of a kingdom

title: Queen
note: female ruler of a kingdom

title: Question 1
note: 'Question' as in to have a question, to need to ask something.
description: Right Extended Index Finger Handshape with palm facing out starts in center of signing space. Hand moves down as it changes into an X-Handshape.
memory_aid: Looks like a written question mark - ?.

title: Question 2
note: 1. 'Question' as in to ask something. 2. This sign can change direction depending on who one is asking. In this video, the direction used indicates that the signer is asking you a question. If she were asking herself a question, the palm would face her. If she were asking many people a question, she would move the hand to indicate different people.
description: Right Bent-B Handshape with palm facing out is held upright supported by the left hand at the elbow. Right hand moves forward once.
memory_aid: Tapping someone to ask a question.

title: Quick
note: Note lowered eyebrows, an essential part of the sign.
description: Both hands are in Full Closed Handshapes with palms facing each other. The left hand is in center of signing space facing the right. The right hand slaps upon the palm of left hand in upward motions.

title: Quick-Witted
description: Thumb of right Thumbs-Up Handshape with palm facing left touches the forehead. While it moves slightly forward, hand turns so palm is facing signer.

title: Quiet
note: Note lowered eyebrows, an important part of the sign.
description: Right Extended Index Finger Handshape with palm facing left moves down lips.

title: Quiz
description: Right Extended Index Finger Handshape with palm facing out starts in center of signing space. Hand moves down as it changes into an X-Handshape.
memory_aid: Looks like a written question mark - ?.

title: Quotation Marks
note: While 'quotation marks' is a two-word phrase in English, it is one sign in KSL.
description: Both hands are in Bent-V Handshapes with palms facing one another. They are placed at top of signing space where they move slightly back and forth.

title: Quote
description: Both hands are in Bent-V Handshapes with palms facing one another. They are placed at top of signing space where they move slightly back and forth.

title: R
description: Ring and little fingers are folded against the palm, held down by thumb. Index and middle fingers are straight and crossed with index finger in front. Palm is facing out.

title: Rabbit
note: A mammal with long ears, long hind legs and a short fluffy tail

title: Radio
note: A device that captures signals sent over radio waves and renders the signals as sound

title: Radio
note: A device that captures signals sent over radio waves and renders the signals as sound

title: Rag Sack
note: Back pack

title: Rain
description: Both Claw Handshapes with palms facing down are held above eye level then moved down repetitively.

title: Rainbow
note: A multicolored arch in the sky

title: Raincoat
note: Coat worn to prevent one front getting rained on

title: Raise 1
note: 'Raise' as in to raise a child.
description: Right Bent-B Handshape with palm facing signer starts at bottom of signing space. As hand moves up in a straight line, hand straightens out into a Full Closed Handshape.
memory_aid: Imitates the growing up of a person.

title: Raise 2
note: 'Raise' as in a salary increase.
description: Right Modified-C Handshape with palm facing out starts upside down. Hand uprights itself from the wrist. Palm is still facing out.

title: Ramadhan
note: Holy ninth month of the Islamic lunar calendar during which Muslims fast

title: Ramble
note: 1. 'Ramble' as in to explore about. 2. Note the mouthing 'wah, wah' which is an important part of the sign.
description: Full Open Handshape with palm facing left moves forward in small curves.
memory_aid: Hand represents a person walking about the street.

title: Random
description: Both hands are in Thumbs-Up Handshapes with palms facing signer. They move towards each other and upon touching move out again.
memory_aid: Hands hitting one another is something random.

title: Rapid
note: Note lowered eyebrows, an essential part of the sign.
