description: Both hands are in Full Closed Handshapes with palms facing each other. The left hand is in center of signing space facing the right. The right hand slaps upon the palm of left hand in upward motions.

title: Rash
note: 1. 'Rash' as in being careless. 2. Lowered eyebrows, shrugged shoulders, shaking head and pursed lips are all important parts of the sign. They all indicate carelessness.
description: Full Open Handshapes start at center of signing space with palms facing down. They move up to either side of signing space with palms facing up.

title: Rashes
note: Irritated and inflamed skin

title: Rat
description: Both Extended Index Finger Handshapes with palms facing signer are pointing out. Starting near the nose, right hand moves toward the left hand which is resting in center of signing space. Right finger moves forward repetitively on top of left finger.

title: Rat
note: A medium sized rodent of the family of the genus rattus

title: Rat
note: A medium sized rodent of the family of the genus rattus

title: Razor
description: X-Handshape with palm facing signer touches the side of mouth. Hand moves down repetitively.
memory_aid: Looks like someone shaving their cheek.

title: Read
description: Both Full Closed Handshapes with palms facing signer are together with little-finger sides touching. Hands move from side to side.

title: Ready
description: R-Handshapes with palms facing out move from side to side repetitively.

title: Ready
note: Prepared

title: Real
note: Note raised eyebrows, an essential part of the sign.
description: Both hands are in Full Closed Handshapes. Left hand is positioned in center of signing space with palm up and fingertips pointing right. Right hand, with palm facing left, moves down to touch upon palm of left hand.

title: Realization
description: The fingertips of right Bent-B Handshape with palm facing down pat the forehead repetitively.

title: Realize
description: The fingertips of right Bent-B Handshape with palm facing down pat the forehead repetitively.

title: Really
note: Note raised eyebrows, an essential part of the sign.
description: Both hands are in Full Closed Handshapes. Left hand is positioned in center of signing space with palm up and fingertips pointing right. Right hand, with palm facing left, moves down to touch upon palm of left hand.

title: Rebellious
note: Lowered eyebrows, shrugged shoulders, shaking head and pursed lips are all important parts of the sign. They all indicate carelessness.
description: Full Open Handshapes start at center of signing space with palms facing down. They move up to either side of signing space with palms facing up.

title: Rebuke
description: Right Extended Index Finger Handshape with palm facing left is pointing out. It moves up and down from wrist repetitively.

title: Recall
note: 'Recall' as in to remember.
description: X-Handshape with palm facing signer taps side of head.

title: Receipt
note: The repetitive movement as shown in this video usually indicates the plural form. To indicate the singular form, the movement is only done once.
description: Both Flat-O Handshapes with palms facing signer are held up touching at the fingers. Right hand moves down repetitively while turning at wrist.

title: Receive
description: Right Full Open Handshape with palm facing down starts in the center of the signing space. It moves in towards the signer while closing into a Flat-O Handshape.

title: Recent
note: Note the tongue sticking out. This is an important part of the sign.
description: Finger of L-Handshape with palm facing signer is placed on right shoulder. Hand moves forward changing into Single-O Handshape.

title: Recently
note: not long ago

title: Reckless
note: Lowered eyebrows, shrugged shoulders, shaking head and pursed lips are all important parts of the sign. They all indicate carelessness.
description: Full Open Handshapes start at center of signing space with palms facing down. They move up to either side of signing space with palms facing up.

title: Recognition
description: The fingertips of right Bent-B Handshape with palm facing down pat the forehead repetitively.

title: Recognize
description: The fingertips of right Bent-B Handshape with palm facing down pat the forehead repetitively.

title: Recollect
note: 'Recollect' as in to remember.
description: X-Handshape with palm facing signer taps side of head.

title: Recommend
description: Fingertips of downturned right Full Closed Handshape tap side of upturned left Full Closed Handshape.
memory_aid: If one does what is recommended, one will get applause.

title: Recreation
description: Full Open Handshapes with palms facing signer are moving around one another in a circle.

title: Recurrent
note: Note the lowering of eyebrows which indicate intensity.
description: Palm of Bent-B Handshape of right hand is facing signer. Hand moves in small outward circles, but stays in place.

title: Red
description: Right Extended Index Finger Handshape with palm facing signer bends down repetitively over mouth where tongue is sticking out slightly.
memory_aid: Indicating the colour red by pointing at the tongue.

title: Redo
description: Right Bent-B Handshape with palm facing down moves downward so the fingertips land on palm of the upturned left Full Closed Handshape.
memory_aid: The hand is returning to the same place to start again.

title: Reds
note: alcoholic drink

title: Reduce
note: Note the eyebrows lowering and the tongue sticking out. These are important parts of the sign.
description: Right L-Handshape with palm facing out moves down as fingers close into a Single-O Handshape.

title: Reduction
note: Note the eyebrows lowering and the tongue sticking out. These are important parts of the sign.
description: Right L-Handshape with palm facing out moves down as fingers close into a Single-O Handshape.

title: Reek
note: Note lowered eyebrows, raised mouth and wrinkled nose which all indicate negativity. These are important parts of the sign.
description: Full Open Handshape with palm and fingers facing signer moves up to nose.

title: Refrain 1
note: 1. 'Refrain' as in to stop doing something. 2. Note lowered eyebrows, an important part of the sign.
description: Both hands are in Full Closed Handshapes. Left hand is held parallel to chest with palm facing signer. Palm of right hand is facing left. Right hand moves down in front of left hand.

title: Refrain 2
note: 1. 'Refrain' as in to order someone to stop doing something. 2. Note lowered eyebrows, an important part of the sign.
description: Full Closed Handshape with palm facing out moves forward.
memory_aid: Typical gesture when commanding one to stop.

title: Refugee
description: Full Open Handshapes with palms facing signer are placed on stomach. Hands move over to sides of stomach.
memory_aid: Showing ribs of a starving person.

title: Refund
description: Full Closed Handshape is facing palm up by right side of signing space. It moves up and down in an arc towards center of signing space so that palm is then facing down.

title: Refuse
note: 'Refuse' as in to say no.
description: Both arms with Full Closed Handshapes are held upright and crossed at the wrists. Palms are facing sides. Both hands move down to opposite sides of the signing space. Palms are then facing down.

title: Regarding
description: Extended Index Finger Handshapes are pointing at one another and move around one another in small circles.
memory_aid: Fingers are talking about one another.

title: Regardless
note: Note tilted head and raised eyebrows. These are essential parts of the sign.
description: Both hands are in Extended Index Handshapes. Palms are facing away from signer. Fingers are touching so that they form an 'x'. Hands move out so that fingers point to either side of the signing space.
memory_aid: Fingers move in opposite directions indicating otherwise.

title: Regret
description: Right S-Handshape with palm facing signer is circled several times over the area of the heart.
memory_aid: Movement over the chest indicates heartfelt regret.

title: Regular
note: Note the lowering of eyebrows which indicate intensity.
description: Palm of Bent-B Handshape of right hand is facing signer. Hand moves in small outward circles, but stays in place.

title: Regulate
description: Both hands are in Small-T Handshapes with palms facing down. They are held next to each other. Hands move forward and back alternately.

title: Regulation
description: Right L-Handshape starts down with thumb pointing up. Palm is facing left. Hand moves so that thumb of L-Handshape touches shoulder.
memory_aid: L' for law which means the same as 'regulation'.

title: Rehearsal
description: Both O-Handshapes with palms facing signer are placed on shoulders. They move out while opening into Full Open Handshapes. This is done repetitively.

title: Rehearse
description: Both O-Handshapes with palms facing signer are placed on shoulders. They move out while opening into Full Open Handshapes. This is done repetitively.

title: Reign
description: Both hands are in Small-T Handshapes with palms facing down. They are held next to each other. Hands move forward and back alternately.

title: Reimburse
description: Full Closed Handshape is facing palm up by right side of signing space. It moves up and down in an arc towards center of signing space so that palm is then facing down.

title: Reimbursement
description: Full Closed Handshape is facing palm up by right side of signing space. It moves up and down in an arc towards center of signing space so that palm is then facing down.

title: Reiterate
description: Right Bent-B Handshape with palm facing down moves downward so the fingertips land on palm of the upturned left Full Closed Handshape.
memory_aid: The hand is returning to the same place to start again.

title: Reject
description: Base of C-Handshape with palm facing up starts near nose. Hand moves out slightly sideways.
memory_aid: Turning the nose up on someone.

title: Rejoice
description: Both Full Open Handshapes with palms facing out are held at either side of the head. Staying in place, hands twist from the wrists.

title: Relationship
description: Both hands are in Full Closed Handshapes. The right hand rests at right side with palm facing left. Left hand is next to right hand, but twisted so that palm faces left as well. Both hands move up and down alternately and repetitively.
memory_aid: Indicates the proximity of two items.

title: Relax
description: Both hands are in Full Closed Handshapes with palms facing sides. Hands are crossed at the wrists with fingers pointing down.

title: Relaxation
description: Both hands are in Full Closed Handshapes with palms facing sides. Hands are crossed at the wrists with fingers pointing down.

title: Release
description: Both S-Handshapes with palms facing signer are crossed in front of the body. Hands swing out so that palms face out.
memory_aid: Hands look like they are breaking free from some kind of bind.

title: Reliability
description: U-Handshapes with palms facing down tap right shoulder.

title: Reliable
description: U-Handshapes with palms facing down tap right shoulder.

title: Relief
note: 'Relief' as in to assist those in need.
description: Both Full Closed Handshapes with palms facing up are in the middle of the signing space. The right hand is on top of the left hand. The left hand lifts the right hand slightly.
memory_aid: The left hand is helping the right hand move up.

title: Religion
description: Right Extended Index Finger Handshape with palm facing left points upward slightly and repetitively.

title: Religion
note: Believe in and worship of a supernatural controlling power

title: Religion
note: Believe in and worship of a supernatural controlling power

title: Relinquish
description: Full Open Handshapes with palms facing signer are positioned at side of signing space. They move up from the wrists so that palms are now away from the signer.

title: Relocate
description: Both Flat-O Handshapes with palms facing down are placed at right side of signer. They move in an upward arc to left side.
memory_aid: Hands are picking up something and moving it elsewhere.

title: Remember
description: X-Handshape with palm facing signer taps side of head.

title: Remind
note: This sign can change direction depending on who one is reminding. In this video, the direction used indicates that the signer is being reminded. If she were reminding someone else, the hand would move out. If she were reminding many people, she would move the hand to indicate different people.
description: The right hand is in Bent-B Handshape with palm facing down. Hand taps upon right shoulder repetitively.
memory_aid: Tapping someone to help them remember.

title: Reminder
description: The right hand is in Bent-B Handshape with palm facing down. Hand taps upon right shoulder repetitively.
memory_aid: Tapping someone to help them remember.

title: Remorse
description: Right S-Handshape with palm facing signer is circled several times over the area of the heart.
memory_aid: Movement over the chest indicates heartfelt remorse.

title: Remorseful
description: Right S-Handshape with palm facing signer is circled several times over the area of the heart.
memory_aid: Movement over the chest indicates heartfelt remorse.

title: Remote
note: Note the lowered eyebrows, an important part of the sign.
description: Right hand starts near face in an O-Handshape with palm facing out. Hand moves forward while changing into Full Open Handshape.
memory_aid: Throwing a spear to measure the remote distance.

title: Remove 1
note: 'Remove' as in to eliminate.
description: Both hands are in Full Closed Handshapes. Right hand with palm facing left moves down to swipe across palm of upturned left hand. As right hand moves up, it closes into C-Handshape with palm facing signer.

title: Remove 2
note: 'Remove' as in to take out.
description: Right C-Handshape with palm facing up is in Left C-Handshape with palm facing right. Right hand moves back and up.

title: Repair
description: V-Handshape with palm facing signer is placed upon left Extended Index Finger Handshape which is pointing out. V-Handshape moves up and down on the left hand.
memory_aid: Looks like pliers tightening a part.

title: Repeat
note: 'Repeat' as in to do again.
description: Right Bent-B Handshape with palm facing down moves downward so the fingertips land on palm of the upturned left Full Closed Handshape.
memory_aid: The hand is returning to the same place to start again.

title: Repent
description: Right S-Handshape with palm facing signer is circled several times over the area of the heart.
memory_aid: Movement over the chest indicates heartfelt repentance.

title: Repetitive
description: Right Bent-B Handshape with palm facing down moves downward so the fingertips land on palm of the upturned left Full Closed Handshape.
memory_aid: The hand is returning to the same place to start again.

title: Replace 1
note: 'Replace' as in to change.
description: Both hands are in Extended Index Finger Handshapes. They are held together at the palms. The right hand is closer to the signer. Hands turn around so that left hand is then closer to the signer.
memory_aid: One finger takes place of the other.

title: Replace 2
note: 'Replace' as in to replace a player on a team.
description: Both hands are in Extended Index Finger Handshapes pointing at one another. Hands move in forward circles around one another.
memory_aid: Things are moving around to change.

title: Replica
note: With the verb form of this sign ('replicate') the movement is done repetitively. The sign in this entry is a noun ('replica'), which has only one movement.
description: Left hand is in Full Closed Handshape with palm facing up. Right Claw Handshape with palm facing up is positioned underneath left hand. Right hand moves down in a straight line as it closes into O-Handshape.
memory_aid: Taking from another piece of paper.

title: Reply
description: Right Full Closed Handshape with palm facing signer is pointing left. Fingers of right hand touch mouth and move out forward. While hand is moving, it turns from the wrist so that palm is facing up.
memory_aid: A reply coming from the mouth.

title: Repose
description: Both hands are in Full Closed Handshapes with palms facing sides. Hands are crossed at the wrists with fingers pointing down.

title: Reprimand
description: Right Extended Index Finger Handshape with palm facing left is pointing out. It moves up and down from wrist repetitively.

title: Reproach
description: Right Extended Index Finger Handshape with palm facing left is pointing out. It moves up and down from wrist repetitively.

title: Reproduce
description: Palm of right Full Closed Handshape is facing down. As hand moves slightly forward, hand moves up and down from wrist.
memory_aid: Movement of the body during sex.

title: Reproduction
description: Palm of right Full Closed Handshape is facing down. As hand moves slightly forward, hand moves up and down from wrist.
memory_aid: Movement of the body during sex.

title: Reproductive
description: Palm of right Full Closed Handshape is facing down. As hand moves slightly forward, hand moves up and down from wrist.
memory_aid: Movement of the body during sex.

title: Reprove
note: correct someone

title: Reprove
note: correct someone

title: Request
note: This sign can change direction depending on who one is asking. In this video, the direction used indicates that the signer is asking you a question. If she were asking herself a question, the palm would face her. If she were asking many people a question, she would move the hand to indicate different people.
description: Right Bent-B Handshape with palm facing out is held upright supported by the left hand at the elbow. Right hand moves forward once.
memory_aid: Tapping someone to ask a question.

title: Require
description: The fingertips of upturned Full Open Handshapes are bent in. Both hands move in simultaneously towards the body.

title: Requirement
note: Note lowered eyebrows and head. These are important parts of the sign.
description: Right X-Handshape with palm facing down moves down once.

title: Reschedule
description: Full Closed Handshape with palm facing signer and fingers pointing left moves in steps forward repetitively.

title: Rescue
description: Both S-Handshapes with palms facing signer are crossed in front of the body. Hands swing out so that palms face out.
memory_aid: Hands look like they are breaking free from some kind of bind.

title: Research
description: Both V-Handshapes with palms facing one another are positioned in center of signing space. Hands move slightly back and down while fingers bend in Bent-V Handshapes. This is done repetitively.
memory_aid: Two sets of eyes looking over something.

title: Reside
description: Both A-Handshapes with palms facing signer are pointing down. They start at the waist and move up simultaneously in straight lines up the body. Hands then change into Full Closed Handshapes with palms facing down. They move down to rest in middle of signing space.
memory_aid: Something is residing in that area.

title: Residence
description: Both Full Closed Handshapes with palms facing down are held with fingertips touching, so they form a pyramid a bit above eye level. From this position, the hands separate and move diagonally downward.
memory_aid: This movement traces outline of the roof of a residence.

title: Resolution
description: Index fingers of both Full Open Handshapes with palms facing signer touch either side of forehead. Hands move down and change into F-Handshapes with palms facing one another.

title: Resolve
description: Index fingers of both Full Open Handshapes with palms facing signer touch either side of forehead. Hands move down and change into F-Handshapes with palms facing one another.

title: Respect
description: Right Full Closed Handshape with palm facing signer touches the chest. Head and body bow down slightly.

title: Respite
description: Both hands are in Full Closed Handshapes with palms facing sides. Hands are crossed at the wrists with fingers pointing down.

title: Respond
description: Right Full Closed Handshape with palm facing signer is pointing left. Fingers of right hand touch mouth and move out forward. While hand is moving, it turns from the wrist so that palm is facing up.
memory_aid: A response coming from the mouth.

title: Response
description: Right Full Closed Handshape with palm facing signer is pointing left. Fingers of right hand touch mouth and move out forward. While hand is moving, it turns from the wrist so that palm is facing up.
memory_aid: A response coming from the mouth.

title: Responsibility
description: U-Handshapes with palms facing down tap right shoulder.

title: Responsible
description: U-Handshapes with palms facing down tap right shoulder.

title: Rest
description: Both hands are in Full Closed Handshapes with palms facing sides. Hands are crossed at the wrists with fingers pointing down.
memory_aid: Legs are crossed during a rest.

title: Restaurant
description: Both H-Handshapes with palms facing signer are pointing at one another. They move in repetitive and alternate circles towards mouth.
memory_aid: As if using two spoons to eat.

title: Restrict
description: Both hands are in Full Closed Handshapes. Left hand is held horizontally in front of signer with palm facing in. Right hand is held to side of signer with palm facing left. Right hand moves to palm of left hand.
memory_aid: Left hand is something that restricts.

title: Restriction
description: Both hands are in Full Closed Handshapes. Left hand is held horizontally in front of signer with palm facing in. Right hand is held to side of signer with palm facing left. Right hand moves to palm of left hand.
memory_aid: Left hand is something that restricts.

title: Retaliate
description: Left Extended Index Finger Handshape with palm facing down is pointing right. Right X-Handshape with palm facing out taps once above the left finger and again below.

title: Retaliation
description: Left Extended Index Finger Handshape with palm facing down is pointing right. Right X-Handshape with palm facing out taps once above the left finger and again below.

title: Retribution
description: Left Extended Index Finger Handshape with palm facing down is pointing right. Right X-Handshape with palm facing out taps once above the left finger and again below.

title: Retrieve
description: Full Open Handshape starts with palm facing down. As hand moves up, handshape closes into a Flat-O Handshape. Palm is now facing out.
memory_aid: Picking up something that has been retrieved.

title: Return
note: 'Return' as in a person returning.
description: Full Closed Handshape is facing palm up by right side of signing space. It moves up and down in an arc towards center of signing space so that palm is then facing down.

title: Reveal
description: Right Extended Index Finger Handshape with palm facing signer is pointing to palm of outturned left Full Closed Handshape. Both hands move forward simultaneously in a straight line.
memory_aid: Pointing out something on the left hand to reveal it.

title: Revelation
note: Name of the last Bible book

title: Revenge
description: Left Extended Index Finger Handshape with palm facing down is pointing right. Right X-Handshape with palm facing out taps once above the left finger and again below.

title: Revolve
description: Both Extended Index Finger Handshapes with palms facing signer are pointing at one another. They move forward in a circular motion alternately and repetitively.

title: Rhino
description: Both Extended Index Finger Handshapes with palms facing sides are pointing up. Right hand is in front of left hand. They move up and down repetitively.

title: Rhino
note: A large herbivore native to Africa and Asia with thick grey skin and one or two horns on their snouts

title: Rice
description: Right Extended Index Finger Handshape with palm facing signer touches teeth and draws back to touch tip of thumb, becoming a Single-O Handshape.

title: Rice
note: Cereal plant of the grass family whose seeds are used as food

title: Rich
note: The more rich one is, the more intense the facial expression and movement are.
description: Claw Handshape with palm facing signer is positioned under right shoulder. Hand moves out in a straight line.

title: Ridicule
note: Lowered eyebrows, pursed mouth, intense movement and turned head are all essential parts of this sign. All parts indicate intensity and negativity.
description: Both Extended Index Finger Handshapes are pointing left. Palms are facing one another. Hands move forward and slightly down repetitively.

title: Rift Valley
note: 1. While 'Rift Valley' is a two-word phrase in English, it is one sign in KSL. 2. Names of places are especially prone to variation. There may be another or a few other signs for 'Rift Valley'.
description: Both hands are in Full Closed Handshapes with palms facing down. Hands start at opposite ends of signing space. Hands move down in arc to meet one another.
memory_aid: Indicates the shape of a valley.

title: Right 1
note: 1. 'Right' as in the right hand. 2. Sign RIGHT with your own right arm. Do not reverse for other people.
description: Right hand is in S-Handshape with palm facing down. Arm is held horizontal with fist pointing away from signer. Hand moves slightly to the right repetitively.

title: Right 2
note: 'Right' as in to be correct.
description: Right Extended Index Finger Handshape with palm facing down is held upright with finger pointing left. Hand moves up in a check-like motion. Palm is then facing out and finger pointing up.

title: Right 3
note: 1. 'Right' as in human right. 2. While 'right' is one word in English, it is a two-word phrase (HUMAN, RIGHT) in KSL.
description: Both Full Closed Handshapes with palms facing one another move down simultaneously to waist level. Then left hand is positioned in center of signing space with palm up and fingertips pointing right. Right hand, with palm facing left, moves down to touch upon palm of left hand. Once right hand touches down, it moves forward in a slightly up motion.
memory_aid: Indicating the body and something one is entitled to.

title: Right 3
note: 'Right' as in to be correct.
description: Right Extended Index Finger Handshape with palm facing down is held upright with finger pointing left. Hand moves up in a check-like motion. Palm is then facing out and finger pointing up.

title: Right Now
note: General conversation

title: Rights
note: 1. 'Rights' as in human rights. 2. While 'rights' is one word in English, it is a two-word phrase (HUMAN, RIGHT) in KSL.
description: Both Full Closed Handshapes with palms facing one another move down simultaneously to waist level. Then left hand is positioned in center of signing space with palm up and fingertips pointing right. Right hand, with palm facing left, moves down to touch upon palm of left hand. Once right hand touches down, it moves forward in a slightly up motion.
memory_aid: Indicating the body and something one is entitled to.

title: Rise
note: 'Rise' as in to stand up.
description: Right V-Handshape with palm facing signer is placed on the upturned palm of the left Full Closed Handshape.
memory_aid: Looks like the legs of a standing person.

title: Risk
note: Note lowered eyebrows and sticking-out tongue. These are essential parts of the sign.
description: Right Extended Index Finger Handshape with palm facing left moves from side to side in front of mouth.
memory_aid: A risk is in front of the face.

title: Rival
description: Extended Index Finger Handshapes with palms facing signer point at one another. They move out in a straight line in the opposite directions.
memory_aid: The two fingers are moving away from one another as if they oppose one another.

title: River
description: Both hands are in Full Closed Handshapes with palms facing one another and fingers pointing out. Hands move forward simultaneously in curves.
memory_aid: As if imitating the bends in a river.

title: River Road
note: Name of a road

title: Road
description: Both Full Closed Handshapes with palms facing one another are held with fingers pointing out. Hands are moved simultaneously forward.

title: Road Sign
note: 'Road Sign' is signed here as SIGN then ROAD. This is typical of sentence structure in KSL. Nouns are signed first and then their adjectives come after. SIGN is a noun here and is then modified by the adjective ROAD.
description: Both Extended Index Fingers of both hands are side by side pointing out. They move away from one another tracing a rectangle. Then both Full Closed Handshapes are held out with palms facing one another and fingers pointing out. Hands are moved simultaneously forward.
memory_aid: Shape of sign, shape of road.

title: Roam
note: Note the mouthing 'wah, wah' which is an important part of the sign.
description: Full Open Handshape with palm facing left moves forward in small curves.
memory_aid: Hand represents a person walking about the street.

title: Roar
note: Note lowering of eyebrows and movement of mouth. These are important parts of the sign.
description: S-Handshape with palm facing down is placed under chin. Hand opens into Full Open Handshape.
memory_aid: Hand opening means mouth is roaring.

title: Roasted Maize
note: While 'roasted maize' is a two-word phrase in English, it is one sign in KSL.
description: Right A-Handshape with palm facing signer is placed in front of mouth and moves repetitively up and out.

title: Rob
description: Right V-Handshape with palm facing down and fingers pointing right starts at right side of signing space. Hand moves in as fingers close to form an S-Handshape.

title: Robber
description: Right V-Handshape with palm facing down and fingers pointing right starts at right side of signing space. Hand moves in as fingers close to form an S-Handshape.

title: Rock
description: Right hand is in Claw Handshape with palm facing up. Back of right hand taps upon back of downturned left Claw Handshape.

title: Role
description: U-Handshapes with palms facing down tap right shoulder.
memory_aid: One's role is resting on shoulder.

title: Roll
note: 'Roll' as in to revolve.
description: Both Extended Index Finger Handshapes with palms facing signer are pointing at one another. They move forward in a circular motion alternately and repetitively.

title: Rongai
note: Name of a place

title: Roof
description: Both Full Closed Handshapes with palms facing down are held with fingertips touching, so they form a pyramid a bit above eye level. From this position, the hands separate and move diagonally downward.
memory_aid: This movement traces outline of a roof.

title: Room
description: Both Extended Index Finger Handshapes with palms facing down start side by side and move away from each other then back together in a square-like motion.

title: Rooster
note: If signer wants to emphasize the maleness of 'rooster', sign MALE after CHICKEN.
description: The back of the right hand, in an X-Handshape, touches the mouth. Downward motions are made from the wrist.

title: Roster
description: Both hands are in Full Closed Handshapes. Left hand is held upright so that palm is facing out. Thumb-side of right hand with palm facing down touches top of left hand. It moves down on left arm in steps.

title: Rotten
description: The left arm, in an S-Handshape with palm facing signer, is held upright while right Full Closed Handshape with palm facing signer slaps the left elbow.
memory_aid: As if slapping someone for behaving badly.

title: Roughly
note: 1. 'Roughly' as in approximately. 2. Note shaking of lowered head, an essential part of the sign.
description: Both Full Open Handshapes with palms facing in are placed at either side of the signing space. As they move up and down alternately, hands twist from the wrists.

title: Rubber
note: 'Rubber' as in an eraser.
description: Right Curved-Three Handshape with palm facing down and fingers closed is placed upon palm of upturned left Full Closed Handshape. Right hand moves up and down slightly on left palm.

title: Rubber
note: Pliable material derived from the sap of the rubber tree

title: Rubber
note: Pliable material derived from the sap of the rubber tree

title: Rubber Stamp
note: Stamp made from rubber

title: Rude 1
note: 1. 'Rude' as in to be bad-mannered. 2. While CRUEL shares the same sign as other English words like 'inhumane', 'mean', and 'rude', they have slightly different facial expressions. The more intense the meanness, the more intense the facial expression. Hence CRUEL gets a more intense facial expression than RUDE does.
description: Claw Handshapes with palms facing down rest upon either side of head. Hands move out simultaneously in a straight line.

title: Rude 2
note: 1. 'Rude' as in to be stubborn. 2. Note lowered eyebrows, an important part of the sign.
description: Extended Index Finger Handshape with palm facing signer is pointing to forehead. It then moves down changing to an S-Handshape.
memory_aid: Pointing to the head which is like a rock.

title: Ruin 1
note: 1. There is no difference in meaning between RUIN 1 and RUIN 2. They are variants of 'ruin' in KSL. 2. Note the lowered eyebrows, mouth movement and tilted head. These are all important parts of the sign.
description: Both Small-T Handshapes with palms facing down are placed side by side. Hands move up and slightly away repetitively.

title: Ruin 2
note: 1. There is no difference in meaning between RUIN 1 and RUIN 2. They are variants of 'ruin' in KSL. 2. Note the lowered eyebrows, mouth movement and tilted head. These are all important parts of the sign.
description: Both hands are in A-Handshapes with palm of left hand facing up and palm of right hand facing down. Hands move in opposite directions with right hand always touching top of left hand.

title: Rule 1
note: 'Rule' as in to control.
description: Both hands are in Small-T Handshapes with palms facing down. They are held next to each other. Hands move forward and back alternately.

title: Rule 2
description: Right L-Handshape starts down with thumb pointing up. Palm is facing left. Hand moves so that thumb of L-Handshape touches shoulder.
memory_aid: L' for law which means the same as 'rule'.

title: Run 1
note: 'Run' as in to move very fast.
description: Both S-Handshapes with palms facing one another move in opposing circular motions.

title: Run 2
note: 'Run' as in to control.
description: Both hands are in Small-T Handshapes with palms facing down. They are held next to each other. Hands move forward and back alternately.

title: Rural
description: Extended Index Finger Handshape with palm facing back is placed on top of head with finger pointing up.
memory_aid: Huts in the villages often have sticks protruding from their roofs. Such sticks are said to thwart lightning bolts.

title: Rush
note: 1. Note mouth movement, an essential part of the sign. 2. This is only in the plural form, which means this sign can only be used in sentences like 'They are rushing to go home'.
description: Both O-Handshapes are placed by right side of signer with palm of right hand facing left and palm of left hand facing right. They both move forward opening into Full Open Handshapes that point out.
memory_aid: Looks like a lot of people going somewhere.

title: Russia
note: Names of places are especially prone to variation. There may be another or a few other signs for 'Russia'.
description: Left C-Handshape is placed in center of signing space with palm facing right. Right hand is closer to signer. It is in an Extended Index Finger Handshape with palm facing left. It taps on bottom of C-Handshape.
memory_aid: Looks like the symbol on the flag.

title: Ruthless
note: While CRUEL shares the same sign as other English words like 'inhumane', 'mean', and 'rude', they have slightly different facial expressions. The more intense the meanness, the more intense the facial expression. Hence CRUEL gets a more intense facial expression than RUDE does.
description: Claw Handshapes with palms facing down rest upon either side of head. Hands move out simultaneously in a straight line.

title: Rwanda
note: Names of places are especially prone to variation. There may be another or a few other signs for 'Rwanda'.
description: S-Handshapes with palms facing signer strike across chest repetitively and alternately.
memory_aid: Looks like a gorilla which is what Rwanda is renowned for.

title: S
note: Sometimes there is an added motion of moving the fist downward in an 's' shape movement.
description: Hand is in a clenched fist. Thumb is across index and middle fingers. Palm is facing out.

title: S.T.I
note: Sexually transmitted diseases

title: Saba Saba
note: political day

title: Sad
note: Note lowered eyebrows and head. These are essential parts of the sign.
description: Claw Handshape with palm facing signer touches right cheek and moves out in a straight line.
memory_aid: Hand is like a bucket catching one's tears.

title: Safari Boots
note: Leather boots with a hard rubber sol, manufactured by Bata company

title: Safaricom
note: Telecommunication company

title: Safe
description: Both S-Handshapes with palms facing signer are crossed in front of the body. Hands swing out so that palms face out.
memory_aid: Hands look like they are breaking free from some kind of bind.

title: Safety
description: Right Full Closed Handshape with palm facing left moves upright to shoulder.
memory_aid: Imitates the movement of a guard.

title: Sale
description: Both Small-T Handshapes with palms facing one another are positioned in center of signing space. They move forward alternately and repetitively. As hands move forward, the thumbs come up changing into A-Handshapes.
memory_aid: Looks like a person selling wares.

title: Salt
description: Right hand, in Full Closed Handshape with palm facing signer, is touching lips. Hand is moved away and turned out so the palm is facing out.

title: Salt
note: A substance consisting mainly of sodium chloride, used as a condiment and preservative

title: Salvation
description: Both S-Handshapes with palms facing signer are crossed in front of the body. Hands swing out so that palms face out.
memory_aid: Hands look like they are breaking free from some kind of bind.

title: Samburu
note: Names of tribes are especially prone to variation. There may be another or a few other signs for 'samburu'.
description: Palm of right hand in Full Closed Handshape rests on chest. Hand moves down and out repetitively.
memory_aid: Indicates chest decoration used by the Samburu.

title: Same
description: The sides of the Extended Index Finger Handshapes are brought together once or repetitively. Palms are facing down.
memory_aid: Two same things are brought together.

title: Samosa
description: Both L-Handshapes with palms facing out are held in center of signing space. L-Handshape of right hand taps index finger of left hand.

title: Sanctify
description: Full Closed Handshape with palm facing left and fingertips pointing out starts in front of face. Hand moves in a cross.
memory_aid: Looks like the gesture used in church.

title: Sandals
description: Right Extended Index Finger Handshape with palm facing down makes small lines between the index and middle fingers of downturned left Full Open Handshape.
memory_aid: Looks like the toe strap of a sandal.

title: Sanitation
description: Both hands are in I-Handshapes with palms facing out. The right hand starts behind the left hand. Both move out, away from one another, in a straight line. Hands then come back together and away repetitively.

title: Sanitize
description: Both hands are in I-Handshapes with palms facing out. The right hand starts behind the left hand. Both move out, away from one another, in a straight line. Hands then come back together and away repetitively.

title: Sarong
description: Both hands are in Full Closed Handshapes. Left hand with palm facing out waits by side of waist while right hand with palm facing signer moves in to center of waist. Left hand follows.

title: Satisfactory
description: Both hands are in Full Closed Handshapes with palms facing down. The right hand pats the back of the left hand.
memory_aid: As if patting someone for doing good work.

title: Satisfied
description: Both hands are in Full Closed Handshapes with palms facing down. Right hand with fingers pointing left moves to chest while left hand with fingers pointing right moves to waist.
memory_aid: Hands are saying they are satisfied.

title: Satisfy
description: Both hands are in Full Closed Handshapes with palms facing down. Right hand with fingers pointing left moves to chest while left hand with fingers pointing right moves to waist.
memory_aid: Hands are saying they are satisfied.

title: Saturday
note: Signs for days of the week are especially prone to variation. There may be another or a few other signs for 'saturday'.
description: Both I-Handshapes with palms facing signer are placed together. Hands move up and down alternately.
memory_aid: The sign looks like the one for NEWS because Saturday is the day for sharing news.

title: Saudi Arabia
note: Names of places are especially prone to variation. There may be another or a few other signs for 'saudi Arabia'.
description: Right Full Closed Handshape with palm facing right is above head with fingers pointing down. Hand moves in a circular motion over top of head.

title: Savannah
description: Full Open Handshapes with palms facing down begin in the center away from body. They move towards the body in a wide circle.

title: Save
description: Both S-Handshapes with palms facing signer are crossed in front of the body. Hands swing out so that palms face out.
memory_aid: Hands look like they are breaking free from some kind of bind.

title: Saved
description: Both S-Handshapes with palms facing signer are crossed in front of the body. Hands swing out so that palms face out.
memory_aid: Hands look like they are breaking free from some kind of bind.

title: Say
description: Right Extended Index Finger Handshape with palm facing signer is placed below mouth with finger pointing left. Hand moves forward in an outward circular motion.
memory_aid: Words are coming out of mouth.

title: Scant
note: Note the lowered eyebrows and 'th' mouth movement. These are essential parts of the sign.
description: Small-T Handshape with palm facing up is positioned in center of signing space. Hand moves forward slightly.
memory_aid: Just a few things can be held between these two fingers.

title: Scarce
note: Note the lowered eyebrows and 'th' mouth movement. These are essential parts of the sign.
description: Small-T Handshape with palm facing up is positioned in center of signing space. Hand moves forward slightly.
memory_aid: Just a few things can be held between these two fingers.

title: Scared
note: Appropriate facial expression should accompany this sign. See FEAR.
description: Right O-Handshape with palm facing left rests over the heart. Hand opens and closes repetitively into a Full Open Handshape.

title: Schedule
description: Both hands are in Full Open Handshapes. Left arm is held parallel with palm facing signer. Palm of right hand is facing down. It moves towards left hand and moves down. As it moves back up, palm turns to face left and it moves across left hand.

title: Scheme
description: Both hands are in Full Open Handshapes. Left arm is held parallel with palm facing signer. Palm of right hand is facing down. It moves towards left hand and moves down. As it moves back up, palm turns to face left and it moves across left hand.

title: Schooling
description: Flat-O Handshape with palm facing signer taps side of forehead.

title: Schoolroom
description: SCHOOL - Both hands are in S-Handshapes with palms facing down. The right arm rests upon the left arm. ROOM - With palms facing down, both Extended Index Finger Handshapes start side by side and move away from each other then back together in a square-like motion.
memory_aid: The top of a table and the shape of a room.

title: Science
description: Both A-Handshapes with palms facing one another are placed together in center of signing space. Hands move up and down against one another.
memory_aid: Movement of hands cause a reaction in a scientific experiment.

title: Scold
description: Right Extended Index Finger Handshape with palm facing left is pointing out. It moves up and down from wrist repetitively.

title: Scorn
note: Lowered eyebrows, pursed mouth, intense movement and turned head are all essential parts of this sign. All parts indicate intensity and negativity.
description: Both Extended Index Finger Handshapes are pointing left. Palms are facing one another. Hands move forward and slightly down repetitively.

title: Scowl
description: Both Claw Handshapes with palms facing signer are positioned on either side of the head. They simultaneously move down. While moving, fingers close in some more. Head and eyebrows also move down with fingers.
memory_aid: Looks like the furrowed forehead that accompanies a scowl.

title: Scratch
description: Claw Handshape with palm facing down moves up and down on left arm.

title: Scratch Card
note: While 'scratch card' is a two-word phrase in English, it is one sign in KSL.
description: Right Curved-Three Handshape with palm facing down and fingers closed is placed upon palm of upturned left Full Closed Handshape. Right hand moves up and down slightly on left palm.
memory_aid: Looks like one scratching a phone card.

title: Scream
note: Note lowering of eyebrows and movement of mouth. These are important parts of the sign.
description: S-Handshape with palm facing down is placed under chin. Hand opens into Full Open Handshape.
memory_aid: Hand opening means mouth is screaming.

title: Sea
note: 1. Note lowered eyebrows while signing LARGE. This is an adjective to indicate the largeness of the water. 2. While 'sea' is one word in English, it is a two-word phrase (WATER, LARGE) in KSL.
description: WATER - Right C-Handshape with palm facing left moves up to open lips. At lips, wrist turns upwards. LARGE - Full Open Handshapes with palms facing one another move out and away from each other in a slight arc.

title: Search
note: search' as in to look for.
description: Bent-V Handshape with palm facing out is held by right side of face. Hand is moved out and around, while shaking slightly from wrist.
memory_aid: As if a pair of eyes were searching.

title: Second
note: second' as in a second of time.
description: Right Extended Index Finger Handshape with palm facing out is placed on top of wrist of left arm. Hand is pointing up and moves from the wrist to the right repetitively.
memory_aid: Looks like the second hand on a clock moving.

title: Secondary School
note: secondary school' is signed here as SCHOOL then SECONDARY. This is typical of sentence structure in KSL. Nouns are signed first and then their adjectives come after. SCHOOL is a noun here and is then modified by the adjective SECONDARY.
description: SCHOOL - Both hands are in S-Handshapes with palms facing down. The right arm rests upon the left arm. SECONDARY - Left hand, still in S-Handshape, moves up so that palm faces right. Right hand, still in S-Handshape, touches upon left hand. Palms are facing one another. Right hand then changes into a V-Handshape.
memory_aid: Top of a school desk and then two indicates 'secondary'.

title: Secret
description: Thumbs-Up Handshape is placed on mouth with palm facing signer. Hand moves down and then across on mouth.

title: Secretary
note: A person who keeps records, takes notes and handles general clerical work

title: Secretive
description: Thumbs-Up Handshape is placed on mouth with palm facing signer. Hand moves down and then across on mouth.

title: Sect
description: Both hands, in C-Handshapes with palms facing one another, start at opposite ends of signing space. They move towards one another simultaneously.

title: Sect
note: cult

title: Section
description: Both hands are in Full Closed Handshapes. Right hand with palm facing left moves down on upturned palm of left hand.
memory_aid: A section of the left hand.

title: Secure
note: secure' as in safe.
description: Both S-Handshapes with palms facing signer are crossed in front of the body. Hands swing out so that palms face out.
memory_aid: Hands look like they are breaking free from some kind of bind.

title: Security
description: Right Full Closed Handshape with palm facing left moves upright to shoulder.
memory_aid: Imitates the movement of a guard.

title: See
note: This sign can change direction depending on who or what one is seeing. In this video, the direction used indicates that the signer is seeing you. If someone were seeing her, the hand would move towards her. If she were seeing many people or things, she would move the hand to indicate different people/things.
description: Right Bent-V Handshape with palm facing out starts by right eye. It moves out in a straight line.

title: See You Later
note: Making friends

title: Segment
description: Both hands are in Full Closed Handshapes. Right hand with palm facing left moves down on upturned palm of left hand.
memory_aid: A segment of the left hand.

title: Seize
description: Both Full Open Handshapes with palms facing out move down and forward while hands close into S-Handshapes with palms facing down.

title: Select
description: F-Handshape starts with palm facing down. Hand moves up from wrist so that palm is facing out.

title: Selection
description: F-Handshape starts with palm facing down. Hand moves up from wrist so that palm is facing out.

title: Self-Control
note: Ability to controls one's desires and impulses

title: Selfish
description: Right L-Handshape with palm facing signer touches the side of hip. The hand moves forward and slightly upward while the index finger bends.
memory_aid: As if someone were pulling out a gun.

title: Sell
description: Both Small-T Handshapes with palms facing one another are positioned in center of signing space. They move forward alternately and repetitively. As hands move forward, the thumbs come up changing into A-Handshapes.
memory_aid: Looks like a person selling wares.

title: Sell
note: To transfer goods or provide services in exchange for money

title: Senator
note: An elected member of the senate

title: Send
note: send' as in to mail something.
description: Flat-O Handshape with palm facing down moves down and opens.
memory_aid: Hand is putting a letter in a postal box.

title: Senegal
note: Names of places are especially prone to variation. There may be another or a few other signs for 'senegal'.
description: Both hands are in Small-T Handshapes with palms facing one another. Right hand is placed by mouth while left hand is further in front of the left shoulder. Both hands move forward simultaneously and repetitively.

title: Sensation
description: Middle finger of Middle Finger Extended Handshape touches center of chest and moves up repetitively.

title: Sense
description: Middle finger of Middle Finger Extended Handshape touches center of chest and moves up repetitively.

title: Sentence
description: Both L-Handshapes with palms facing one another are placed in center of signing space. They move away from one another in a straight line. As they move away, hands close into Single-O Handshapes repetitively.
memory_aid: Looks like words in a sentence.

title: Sentient
description: Both A-Handshapes with palms facing signer are pointing down. They start at the waist and move up simultaneously in straight lines up the body.
memory_aid: Hands are outlining the body which is sentient.

title: Separate
description: Both hands are in Bent-B Handshapes with palms facing signer. Backs of hands are touching one another and then move away directly from one another in a straight line.

title: Separate
note: Put apart

title: Separation
description: Both hands are in Bent-B Handshapes with palms facing signer. Backs of hands are touching one another and then move away directly from one another in a straight line.

title: September
note: Name of the 9th month

title: Serious
note: Note lowered eyebrows, an essential part of the sign.
description: Right Extended Index Finger Handshape is placed on center of forehead. Palm is facing left. Hand moves down repetitively.
memory_aid: Indicates that the forehead is lowered when one is serious.

title: Serve
description: Palms of both Full Open Handshapes are facing up. Hands move forward alternately and repetitively.

title: Service
description: Palms of both Full Open Handshapes are facing up. Hands move forward alternately and repetitively.

title: Set 1
note: set' as in to put.
description: Flat-O Handshape with palm facing down starts in front of face. It moves down in a straight line.

title: Set 2
note: set' as in to be ready.
description: R-Handshapes with palms facing out move from side to side repetitively.
memory_aid: R' for ready which means the same as 'set'.

title: Setting
note: setting' as in a place.
description: Right Full Open Handshape with palm facing down and fingers pointing left is positioned near right shoulder. Hand moves in an inward circular motion while remaining in place.

title: Settle
description: Both Full Closed Handshapes with palms facing down move down in a straight line.

title: Seven
description: The left hand is in an S-Handshape with palm facing right (which means 'five') and the right hand forming a V-Handshape (which means 'two') touches upon the knuckles of the left hand.

title: Several
description: Right Full Open Handshape with palm facing down repetitively hits the side of the left hand which is in an S-Handshape.
memory_aid: The hand hits again and again meaning 'several'.

title: Sex
note: 1. 'sex' as in copulation. 2. 'sex' has several KSL variants. You can see another variant in dictionary entry 'sTD'.
description: Palm of right Full Closed Handshape is facing down. As hand moves slightly forward, hand moves up and down from wrist.
memory_aid: Movement of the body during sex.

title: Shade
note: shade' as in curtains.
description: Both hands, in Small-T Handshapes and palms facing one another, start at opposite ends of signing space. With wrists moving from side to side, both hands move towards each other until they meet.

title: Shadow
note: shadow' as in to follow another.
description: Both hands are in Bent-B Handshapes with palms facing down. The left hand is slightly behind and to the left of the right hand. Both hands move simultaneously forward and to the right.
memory_aid: Left hand is shadowing right hand.

title: Shake Well Before Use
note: Instructions on bottle

title: Shall
description: Full Closed Handshape with palm facing signer and fingers pointing left moves in steps forward repetitively.

title: Shame
note: Note lowered eyebrows and raised shoulders. These are essential parts of the sign.
description: Right Claw Handshape with palm facing signer moves back and forth in front of face.
memory_aid: As if trying to hide from shame.

title: Shape
note: shape' as in the shape one's in or one's health.
description: Both Full Open Handshapes with palms facing signer are positioned at shoulders. Hands move out while handshapes change to S-Handshapes.

title: Share
description: Both hands are in Full Closed Handshapes. Right hand is on palm of upturned left hand. Palm of right hand is facing left. Right hand moves back and forth on left palm.

title: Sharp
description: Right Extended Index Finger Handshape with palm facing signer moves up to tap palm of downturned left Full Closed Handshape.

title: Shave
description: X-Handshape with palm facing signer touches the side of mouth. Hand moves down repetitively.
memory_aid: Looks like someone shaving their cheek.

title: She
description: Extended Index Finger Handshape points at side of signing space.

title: Sheep
description: Right hand is in Bent-B Handshape and positioned near face. Palm is facing right. Slight back and forth motions are made.
memory_aid: Indicates the shaggy wool of a sheep.

title: Sheep
note: A woolly ruminant of the genus ovis

title: Sheep
note: A woolly ruminant of the genus ovis

title: Sheet
note: sheet' as in a piece of paper.
description: Full Closed Handshape with palm facing signer slightly moves back and forth from the wrist.
memory_aid: A sheet of paper flapping in the air.

title: Shelter
description: Both Full Closed Handshapes with palms facing down are held with fingertips touching, so they form a pyramid a bit above eye level. From this position, the hands separate and move diagonally downward.
memory_aid: This movement traces outline of the roof of a shelter.

title: Shepherd
note: one looking after sheep

title: Sheria House
note: Name of a building

title: She's Unconscious
note: Emergencies

title: Shilling 1
note: There is no difference in meaning between SHILLING 1 and SHILLING 2. They are variants of 'shilling' in KSL.
description: Right Extended Index Finger Handshape with palm facing out and finger pointing up touches upon palm of upturned left Full Closed Handshape.
memory_aid: Holding one shilling in your hand.

title: Shilling 2
note: There is no difference in meaning between SHILLING 1 and SHILLING 2. They are variants of 'shilling' in KSL.
description: Right Extended Index Finger Handshape with palm facing signer points down on palm of upturned left Full Closed Handshape. Right hand then turns up so that finger is pointing up and palm is facing signer.
memory_aid: Indicating one shilling in your hand.

title: Shiny
description: Both hands, in O-Handshapes with palms facing out, start side by side in center of signing space. Both hands move simultaneously outward away from each other in slight arc. Hands open into Full Open Handshapes.
memory_aid: Indicates light given out by some light source.

title: Ship
description: Both hands are in the Full Closed Handshapes with bottom sides touching one and with palms facing one another. Both hands move together forward in an up and down motion.
memory_aid: Shape of a ship out on the water.

title: Shirt
note: The first part of this sign uses CLOTHES.
description: Single-O Handshape with palm facing signer is touching near the right shoulder. Hand moves away from and back to the signer repetitively. Then both hands assume Full Closed Handshapes with palms facing up and touch opposite upper arms. Hands slightly move back and forth repetitively.
memory_aid: Indicating the fabric and then short sleeves of a shirt.

title: Shiver
note: Note lowered eyebrows and raised shoulders, essential parts of the sign.
description: Both S-Handshapes with palms facing each other are placed at sides of body. In this position the arms move in slightly and repetitively.

title: Shock
note: Note the lowered eyebrows and mouth movement. These are important parts of the sign.
description: Palms of both Claw Handshapes are facing signer. Hands start at either side of the signing space. They move in together towards the chest of signer.
memory_aid: Imitating the reaction of a shocked person.

title: Shocked
note: Note the lowered eyebrows and mouth movement. These are important parts of the sign.
description: Palms of both Claw Handshapes are facing signer. Hands start at either side of the signing space. They move in together towards the chest of signer.
memory_aid: Imitating the reaction of a shocked person.

title: Shoe
description: Both Small-T Handshapes with palms facing out move in simultaneously from the wrists. Palms are then facing the signer.

title: Shop 1
note: shop' as in a store.
description: Right X-Handshape with palm facing signer taps the right cheek.
memory_aid: Looks like the sign for 'sweets' which can be bought in a shop.

title: Shop 2
note: shop' as in to buy things.
description: Right Claw Handshape with palm facing down is above upturned left Full Closed Handshape. Both hands start at right side of signer. As they move to left side, right hand moves down repetitively.

title: Shoplifter
description: Right V-Handshape with palm facing down and fingers pointing right starts at right side of signing space. Hand moves in as fingers close to form an S-Handshape.

title: Shopping
description: Right Claw Handshape with palm facing down is above upturned left Full Closed Handshape. Both hands start at right side of signer. As they move to left side, right hand moves down repetitively.

title: Shore
note: While 'shore' is one word in English, it is a two-word phrase (WATER, WAVES) in KSL.
description: WATER - Right C-Handshape with palm facing left is just below the mouth. Movement is slightly upwards repetitively. WAVES - Full Open Handshapes with palms facing down move away from each other while hands tilt repetitively.
memory_aid: As if drinking a glass of water and mimicking the motions of waves.

title: Short 1
note: short' as in not a lot of time.
description: Both hands are in Full Closed Handshapes with palms facing one another. Hands start at ends of signing space and move in a straight line towards one another.
memory_aid: Indicates a short period of time.

title: Short 2
note: 1. 'short' as in not very tall. 2. This sign is used to refer to people or animals.
description: Right hand, in a Claw Handshape with palm facing down, moves down in a straight line.
memory_aid: Indicates the shortness of a person.

title: Short 3
note: short' as in not a lot of time.
description: Both hands are in Full Closed Handshapes with palms facing one another. Hands start at ends of signing space and move in a straight line towards one another.
memory_aid: Indicates a short period of time.

title: Shorts
note: small distance/ little height/ less/ pants

title: Shot
note: shot' as in an injection.
description: V-Handshape with thumb sticking out and palm facing right moves down to elbow of left hand. While moving, thumb moves down to touch base of index and middle fingers.

title: Should
note: Note lowered eyebrows and head. These are important parts of the sign.
description: Right X-Handshape with palm facing down moves down once.

title: Should 2
note: Note lowered eyebrows and head. These are important parts of the sign.
description: Right X-Handshape with palm facing down moves down once.

title: Shoulders
note: Part of the body between the base of the neck and forearms

title: Shout
note: Note lowering of eyebrows and movement of mouth. These are important parts of the sign.
description: S-Handshape with palm facing down is placed under chin. Hand opens into Full Open Handshape.
memory_aid: Hand opening means mouth is shouting.

title: Show
description: Right Extended Index Finger Handshape with palm facing signer is pointing to palm of outturned left Full Closed Handshape. Both hands move forward simultaneously in a straight line.
memory_aid: Pointing out something on the left hand for show.

title: Shriek
note: Note lowering of eyebrows and movement of mouth. These are important parts of the sign.
description: S-Handshape with palm facing down is placed under chin. Hand opens into Full Open Handshape.
memory_aid: Hand opening means mouth is shrieking.

title: Shudder
note: Note lowered eyebrows and raised shoulders, essential parts of the sign.
description: Both S-Handshapes with palms facing each other are placed at sides of body. In this position the arms move in slightly and repetitively.

title: Shut
description: Left Full Closed Handshape is held with palm facing signer. Right Full Closed Handshape is held with palm out. The right hand moves forward and to side so the palm covers the back of the left hand.

title: Shy
note: Note lowered eyebrows, an important part of the sign.
description: Full Open Handshape with palm facing signer moves up and down face.
memory_aid: Hiding one's face because of shyness.

title: Sick
note: Appropriate facial expression is important.
description: Backside of Bent-B Handshape touches cheek.

title: Sieve
note: A device to separate large particles from smaller ones/ process of separating large particles from smaller ones

title: Sign
note: sign' as in sign language.
description: Both hands are in Full Open Handshapes with palms facing signer. Right hand is pointing left while left hand is pointing right. They move back and forth in opposite directions. As they pass one another, they touch at the fingers.

title: Significance
note: Note head tilt, head nod and lowered eyebrows. These are essential parts of the sign.
description: Both hands, in Full Closed Handshapes with palms facing out, are at face level and moved simultaneously down to chest level.
memory_aid: Hands move over a significant object.

title: Significant
note: Note head tilt, head nod and lowered eyebrows. These are essential parts of the sign.
description: Both hands, in Full Closed Handshapes with palms facing out, are at face level and moved simultaneously down to chest level.

title: Silent
note: Note lowered eyebrows, an important part of the sign.
description: Right Extended Index Finger Handshape with palm facing left moves down lips.

title: Silly
description: Right S-Handshape with palm facing left strikes center of forehead.

title: Silver
description: X-Handshape with palm facing signer taps on teeth. Then Claw Handshape with palm facing up is held upright and twisted from wrist repetitively.
memory_aid: Almost white like teeth and moving it around to see it shine.

title: Silver
note: A white metallic element, atomic number 47

title: Similar
description: The sides of the Extended Index Finger Handshapes are brought together once or repetitively. Palms are facing down.
memory_aid: Two similar things are brought together.

title: Simple
description: Both Full Open Handshapes with palms facing signer move slightly down closing into Flat-O Handshapes repetitively.
memory_aid: Hands seem to be squeezing something soft, not hard, indicating 'simple'.

title: Simplicity
description: Both Full Open Handshapes with palms facing signer move slightly down closing into Flat-O Handshapes repetitively.
memory_aid: Hands seem to be squeezing something soft, not hard, indicating 'simplicity'.

title: Since 1
note: since' as in from that time to the present.
description: Both hands are in Full Closed Handshapes with palms facing signer. Left hand is at left side of signing space. Right hand starts in front of right shoulder and moves until it hits the palm of left hand.
memory_aid: Right hand represents the time left up to the left hand.

title: Since 2
note: since' as in because.
description: Full Open Handshapes start palm down. They move up from the wrists so that palms are facing up.
memory_aid: Reason turning up in your hands.

title: Sincere
description: Both hands are in Full Closed Handshapes. Left hand is positioned in center of signing space with palm up and fingertips pointing right. Right hand, with palm facing left, moves down to touch upon palm of left hand. Once right hand touches down, it moves forward in a slightly up motion.
memory_aid: Arm goes in a straight direction, not off to the side as one would when untruthful.

title: Sing
description: Right Full Closed Handshape with palm facing signer starts above wrist of left arm. Hand moves back and forth over the upturned left Full Closed Handshape.

title: Single
description: Right Extended Index Finger Handshape with palm facing the body moves in small circles.
memory_aid: The index finger indicates a single thing.

title: Singular
description: Right Extended Index Finger Handshape with palm facing the body moves in small circles.
memory_aid: The index finger indicates a single thing.

title: Sink
description: Bent-B Handshapes are held together side by side with palms facing up. They move upward and outward, away from one another, in a curve. The hands then come together and rub.
memory_aid: Shows the shape of a sink.

title: Sip
description: Right C-Handshape with palm facing left moves up to open lips. At lips, wrist turns upwards.
memory_aid: An imaginary glass is tipped at the open lips.

title: Sister
note: The first part of this sign uses GIRL, indicating female.
description: Right A-Handshape with palm facing up taps the side of chest. Then the sides of both Extended Index Finger Handshapes are brought together repetitively.

title: Sister-In-Law
note: Husband's or wife's sister

title: Sister-In-Law
note: Husband's or wife's sister

title: Sit
description: Both hands are in U-Handshapes with palms facing down. The right U-Handshape comes down to rest upon the U-Handshape of the left hand.

title: Sit Down
note: While 'sit down' is a two-word phrase in English, it is one sign in KSL.
description: Both hands are in U-Handshapes with palms facing down. The right U-Handshape comes down to rest upon the U-Handshape of the left hand.

title: Site 1
note: site' as in home.
description: Right Extended Index Finger Handshape with palm facing signer touches tip of nose.
memory_aid: Home is center of life like nose is center of face.

title: Site 2
note: site' as in a place.
description: Right Full Open Handshape with palm facing down and fingers pointing left is positioned near right shoulder. Hand moves in an inward circular motion while remaining in place.

title: Situate
description: Flat-O Handshape with palm facing down starts in front of face. It moves down in a straight line.

title: Situation
description: Right Claw Handshape with palm facing down moves up and down on upturned left Full Closed Handshape.
memory_aid: A lot of information in hand.

title: Six
description: The left hand is in an S-Handshape with palm facing right (which means 'five') and the right Extended Index Finger Handshape (which means 'one') touches upon the knuckles of the left hand.

title: Sixteen
note: This sign is composed of two signs, the first being TEN and the second SIX. They are signed continuously. There should be no pause in between.
description: TEN - Both A-Handshapes with palms facing one another are brought together. SIX - The left hand is in an S-Handshape with palm facing right and the right Extended Index Finger Handshape touches upon the knuckles of the left hand.

title: Sketch
description: Left arm supports right arm. Right Small T-Handshape with palm facing left moves in an arc towards signer with repetitive motion.

title: Skies
note: The first part of this sign uses BLUE.
description: Right Extended Index Finger Handshape with palm facing out is moved side to side slightly from the wrist. Then both Full Closed Handshapes with palms facing up move up above the head where they move away from one another in a straight line.

title: Skill
description: Both Bent-B Handshapes with palms facing down are held above and slightly in front of head. Right hand moves straight back to head.

title: Skim
description: Both Full Closed Handshapes with palms facing signer are together with little-finger sides touching. Hands move from side to side.

title: Skinny
description: Both Full Closed Handshapes start at either side of the waist. Palms are facing signer and fingers are pointing out. Hands move up simultaneously to chest. Palms are now facing up.

title: Skirt
description: Both Full Closed Handshapes with palms facing up touch either side of the waist. Hands move down from wrists in small motions simultaneously.
memory_aid: Indicates the bottom part of a skirt.

title: Skirt
note: Clothing worn by women that hangs from the waist and covers the lower part of the body

title: Skirt
note: Clothing worn by women that hangs from the waist and covers the lower part of the body

title: Sky
note: The first part of this sign uses BLUE.
description: Right Extended Index Finger Handshape with palm facing out is moved side to side slightly from the wrist. Then both Full Closed Handshapes with palms facing up move up above the head where they move away from one another in a straight line.

title: Sky
note: The atmosphere

title: Slander
note: Lowered eyebrows, pursed mouth, intense movement and turned head are all essential parts of this sign. All parts indicate intensity and negativity.
description: Both Extended Index Finger Handshapes are pointing left. Palms are facing one another. Hands move forward and slightly down repetitively.

title: Slave
description: Both V-Handshapes with palms facing down point to neck. The right hand touches the front part of the neck while the left hand touches the left side.
memory_aid: Looks like chains put on a slave.

title: Sleep
description: Both hands are placed together in Full Closed Handshapes with palms facing one another. The signer's head leans to the right and rests on the back of the left hand.

title: Sleep 2
description: Both hands are placed together in Full Closed Handshapes with palms facing one another. The signer's head leans to the right and rests on the back of the left hand.

title: Slender
description: Both Full Closed Handshapes start at either side of the waist. Palms are facing signer and fingers are pointing out. Hands move up simultaneously to chest. Palms are now facing up.

title: Slim
description: Both Full Closed Handshapes start at either side of the waist. Palms are facing signer and fingers are pointing out. Hands move up simultaneously to chest. Palms are now facing up.

title: Slippers
description: Right Extended Index Finger Handshape with palm facing down makes small lines between the index and middle fingers of downturned left Full Open Handshape.
memory_aid: Looks like the toe strap of a slipper.

title: Slippers
note: Flip-flop

title: Slow
description: Both hands are in Full Closed Handshapes with palms facing out. They move backwards in a circular motion simultaneously and repetitively so that palms face down.
memory_aid: Looks like the movement of a slow object.

title: Sluggish
description: Both hands are in Full Closed Handshapes with palms facing out. They move backwards in a circular motion simultaneously and repetitively so that palms face down.
memory_aid: Looks like the movement of a sluggish object.

title: Slumber
description: Both hands are placed together in Full Closed Handshapes with palms facing one another. The signer's head leans to the right and rests on the back of the left hand.

title: Slums
note: A dilapidated neighborhood where people live in a state of poverty

title: Small 1
note: 1. 'small' as in not very tall. 2. This sign is used to refer to people or animals.
description: Right hand, in a Claw Handshape with palm facing down, moves down in a straight line.
memory_aid: Indicates the smallness of a person.

title: Small 2
note: 1. 'small' as in a small object. 2. This sign refers to objects only. 3. Note face scrunch and lowered eyebrows, important elements of this sign.
description: Right G-Handshape with palm facing left is held in front of the face.

title: Small 3
note: 1. 'small' as in not much. 2. Note the lowered eyebrows and 'th' mouth movement. These are essential parts of the sign.
description: Small-T Handshape with palm facing up is positioned in center of signing space. Hand moves forward slightly.
memory_aid: Just a few things can be held between these two fingers.

title: Small Change
note: While 'small change' is a two-word phrase in English, it is one sign in KSL.
description: X-Handshape with palm facing down taps palm of upturned left Full Closed Handshape.
memory_aid: Tapping the top of a coin.

title: Small Pox
note: An acute, highly infectious disease caused by variola virus

title: Smart
description: Thumb of right Thumbs-Up Handshape with palm facing left touches the forehead. While it moves slightly forward, hand turns so palm is facing signer.

title: Smell 1
note: smell' as in a good smell or to smell something.
description: Full Open Handshape with palm and fingers facing signer moves up to nose.
memory_aid: Hand represents a smell that reaches the nose.

title: Smell 2
note: 1. 'smell' as in a bad smell. 2. Note lowered eyebrows, raised mouth and wrinkled nose which all indicate negativity. These are important parts of the sign.
description: Full Open Handshape with palm and fingers facing signer moves up to nose.

title: Smile
description: Both Extended Index Finger Handshapes with palms facing down point at sides of mouth. Both hands move up and outward, following the line of the cheekbones.

title: Smite
note: This verb changes movement depending on the object. If it is to smite yourself, the hand moves towards yourself, as shown in this video. If it is to smite someone else, the hand moves away from the signer.
description: S-Handshape with palm facing down moves towards head. Upon touching head, hand moves up slightly.

title: Smoke
note: smoke' as in to smoke a cigarette.
description: V-Handshape with palm facing signer taps side of mouth.

title: Snack
description: Right Flat-O Handshape with palm facing down taps repetitively on the mouth.

title: Snail
note: Animals of the class glastropoda, having a coiled shell

title: Snare
note: snare' as in to trap someone.
description: Both Full Open Handshapes with palms facing out move down and forward while hands close into S-Handshapes with palms facing down.

title: Sniff
description: Full Open Handshape with palm and fingers facing signer moves up to nose.
memory_aid: Hand represents a smell that reaches the nose.

title: Snow
note: The frozen crystalline state of water

title: Soap
description: Both hands are in Full Closed Handshapes with palms facing one another. Hands are together and rub back and forth.
memory_aid: As if washing hands with soap.

title: Sob
note: While 'cry', 'sob', 'wail' and so on share the same essential meaning, they all differ in intensity. The same is true in KSL. The difference in intensity is indicated by facial expression and movement of hands.
description: Extended Index Finger Handshapes with palms facing signer are placed under each eye. They move down in straight lines repetitively.
memory_aid: Looks like tears falling down one's face.

title: Soccer
description: Both hands are in Full Closed Handshapes with palms facing signer. Right hand is pointing down while left hand is pointing out. Back of right hand moves up to repetitively touch palm of left hand.

title: Social
note: A festive gathering

title: Sock
description: Right Full Closed Handshape with palm facing right touches the wrist of left arm and then moves back to touch down near the elbow.
memory_aid: Looks like a sock on the foot.

title: Socks
note: A knitted or woven covering for the foot

title: Soda
description: Right U-Handshape with palm facing down rests upon the left hand which is in an S-Handshape with palm facing right. The right U-Handshape then moves up in an arc so that the wrist is higher than the fingers.
memory_aid: Taking off the cap on a soda.

title: Software
note: Encoded computer instructions

title: Software
note: Encoded computer instructions

title: Soggy
description: Right Bent-B Handshape with palm facing signer taps backside of downturned left Full Closed Handshape.

title: Soil Erosion
note: Changing of a surface by mechanical action

title: Solar
description: Right O-Handshape with palm facing down is placed by right side of head. As it slightly moves down, hand opens into Full Open Handshape.
memory_aid: Shape of sun, rays of sun.

title: Solely
description: Right Extended Index Finger Handshape with palm facing the body moves in small circles.
memory_aid: The index finger indicates a sole thing.

title: Solemn
note: Note lowered eyebrows, an essential part of the sign.
description: Right Extended Index Finger Handshape is placed on center of forehead. Palm is facing left. Hand moves down repetitively.
