memory_aid: Indicates that the forehead is lowered when one is solemn.

title: Solicit
description: Claw Handshape with palm facing up is placed to left side of signer. Hand moves in a slightly bouncing motion around to the right side of signer.

title: Solid
description: Right hand is in Claw Handshape with palm facing up. Back of right hand taps upon back of downturned left Claw Handshape.

title: Solitary
description: Right Extended Index Finger Handshape with palm facing the body moves in small circles.
memory_aid: The index finger indicates a solitary person.

title: Solution
note: Note mouth movement, an essential part of the sign.
description: Flat-O Handshapes with palms facing up move down simultaneously. As they move down, thumbs move forward so that hands become A-Handshapes.

title: Solve
note: Note mouth movement, an essential part of the sign.
description: Flat-O Handshapes with palms facing up move down simultaneously. As they move down, thumbs move forward so that hands become A-Handshapes.

title: Somalia
note: Names of places are especially prone to variation. There may be another or a few other signs for 'somalia'.
description: Right bent Full Closed Handshape with palm facing signer touches the right side of the forehead. While moving away from forehead, hand closes into an O-Handshape. This is done repetitively.
memory_aid: The soft hair of some Somalians.

title: Sombre
note: Note lowered eyebrows, an essential part of the sign.
description: Right Extended Index Finger Handshape is placed on center of forehead. Palm is facing left. Hand moves down repetitively.
memory_aid: Indicates that the forehead is lowered when one is sombre.

title: Some
description: Both hands are in Full Closed Handshapes. Right hand with palm facing left moves down on upturned palm of left hand.

title: Some Time
note: time

title: Some Time
note: time

title: Somersault
description: Both Extended Index Finger Handshapes with palms facing signer are pointing at one another. They move forward in a circular motion alternately and repetitively.

title: Sometime
note: Note shaking of lowered head, an essential part of the sign.
description: Both Full Open Handshapes with palms facing in are placed at either side of the signing space. As they move up and down alternately, hands twist from the wrists.
memory_aid: Hands are unsure if they can do more.

title: Sometimes
note: Note shaking of lowered head, an essential part of the sign.
description: Both Full Open Handshapes with palms facing in are placed at either side of the signing space. As they move up and down alternately, hands twist from the wrists.
memory_aid: Hands are unsure if they can do more.

title: Somewhat
note: Note shaking of lowered head, an essential part of the sign.
description: Both Full Open Handshapes with palms facing in are placed at either side of the signing space. As they move up and down alternately, hands twist from the wrists.

title: Son
note: The first part of this sign uses BOY.
description: The right G-Handshape with palm facing left is placed on the chin so the index finger is in front of the chin and the thumb is underneath. The hand is pulled down slightly and the fingers come together. Right hand, in a Full Closed Handshape with palm facing down, moves down in a straight line.

title: Song
description: Right Full Closed Handshape with palm facing signer starts above wrist of left arm. Hand moves back and forth over the upturned left Full Closed Handshape.

title: Soon 1
note: 1. There is no difference in meaning between SOON 1 and SOON 2. They are variants of 'soon' in KSL. 2. Note the lowered eyebrows and scrunched face. These are important parts of the sign.
description: Right G-Handshape with palm facing left is held in front of the face.

title: Soon 2
note: 1. There is no difference in meaning between SOON 1 and SOON 2. They are variants of 'soon' in KSL. 2. Note the lowered eyebrows, an essential part of the sign.
description: Both Bent-B Handshapes with palms facing signer are in front of body. The right hand is in front of the left hand. Right hand moves back and forth repetitively.

title: Sore
note: 1. 'sore' as in something that is tender, not a scab or wound. 2. Note the raised shoulders and lowered eyebrows. These are essential parts of the sign.
description: Both hands are in Single-O Handshapes. Tips of fingers are touching one another so that palms face one another. Hands are moved back and forth in a tapping motion.
memory_aid: The throbbing sensation of an area that is sore.

title: Sorrowful
note: Note lowered eyebrows and head. These are essential parts of the sign.
description: Claw Handshape with palm facing signer touches right cheek and moves out in a straight line.
memory_aid: Hand is like a bucket catching one's tears.

title: Sorry
description: Right S-Handshape with palm facing signer is circled several times over the area of the heart.
memory_aid: Movement over the chest indicates a heartfelt sorry.

title: Sorry
note: apologizing

title: Sorry, I'm Late
note: apologizing

title: Soul
note: person

title: Sound
description: S-Handshape with palm facing down is placed under chin. Hand opens into Full Open Handshape.
memory_aid: A lot of noise coming from the mouth.

title: Sounds Like A Plan
note: Making friends

title: Soup
description: Right Extended Index Finger Handshape moves down from the nose to the base of throat. Palm is facing left.

title: Sour
note: Note the lowered eyebrows and puckered mouth. These are important parts of the sign.
description: Right A-Handshape with palm facing up is held against right cheek and pulled away. Mouth puckers as hand is moved away.

title: Sour Milk
note: Milk having an acidic, sharp or tangy taste

title: Source
note: Note the slight puffing of mouth as well as the tongue sticking out slightly. These are essential parts of the sign.
description: Right O-Handshape with palm facing signer starts at the bottom center of the signing space. The left hand is in a Full Open Handshape facing the chest. While right hand moves up towards the left hand, it opens into a Full Open Handshape. Left hand has moved down.
memory_aid: Something coming out of the ground.

title: South
description: Right Full Closed Handshape with palm facing down and fingers pointing left moves down in a straight line.

title: South Africa
note: Names of places are especially prone to variation. There may be another or a few other signs for 'south Africa'.
description: Right Full Closed Handshape with palm facing down and fingers pointing away from signer moves down in a straight line. Then both hands are in Full Closed Handshapes with palms facing down. Right hand is resting upon back of left hand. It moves back and forth, still touching back of left hand.
memory_aid: Indicates the south then the colour of skin.

title: Sow
description: Single-O Handshape with palm facing down is placed in front of signer. Hand moves forward as it opens into L-Handshape. This is done repetitively.

title: Space 1
note: space' as in a confined area.
description: Both Extended Index Finger Handshapes with palms facing down start side by side and move away from each other then back together in a square-like motion.

title: Space 2
note: space' as in available area.
description: Right Full Open Handshape with palm facing down and fingers pointing left is positioned near right shoulder. Hand moves in an inward circular motion while remaining in place.

title: Spain
note: Names of places are especially prone to variation. There may be another or a few other signs for 'spain'.
description: Right Full Closed Handshape with palm facing up is placed on left forearm. While right hand moves over to upper arm, it turns over so that palm is facing down.

title: Spare Time
note: While 'spare time' is a two-word phrase in English, it is one sign in KSL.
description: Both hands are in Full Closed Handshapes with palms facing sides. Hands are crossed at the wrists with fingers pointing down.
memory_aid: Legs are crossed during spare time.

title: Spectacles
description: Both Modified-C Handshapes with palms facing one another touch the face by eyes.

title: Spell
note: spell' as in to spell a word.
description: Full Open Handshape is positioned by the shoulder with palm facing down. Fingers wriggle as hand moves from side to side.
memory_aid: Indicates the shape of alphabetic letters.

title: Spell Your Name
note: Making friends

title: Spell Your Name
note: Making friends

title: Spend
description: The right hand, in a Flat-O Handshape with palm facing up, rests on the palm of upturned left Full Closed Handshape. Right hand moves forward changing into an A-Handshape.

title: Sperm
note: Note mouth movement, an essential part of the sign.
description: Right O-Handshape with palm facing left is in center of signing space. It moves forward as hand opens into Full Closed Handshape.

title: Spin
description: Both Extended Index Finger Handshapes with palms facing signer are pointing at one another. They move forward in a circular motion alternately and repetitively.

title: Spinach
description: Left Extended Index Finger Handshape with palm facing down is pointing right. Right F-Handshape with palm facing down moves down left finger and then shakes down in a double motion.
memory_aid: Like cleaning off stalks of vegetables.

title: Spinach
note: A particular edible plant, or its leaves

title: Spirit
note: Body not made of flesh/ Alcoholic drink

title: Split
description: Both hands are in Bent-B Handshapes with palms facing signer. Backs of hands are touching one another and then move away directly from one another in a straight line.

title: Spoil 1
note: 1. 'spoil' as in to ruin something. 2. There is no difference in meaning between SPOIL 1 and SPOIL 2. They are variants of 'spoil' in KSL. 3. Note the lowered eyebrows, mouth movement and tilted head. These are all important parts of the sign.
description: Both Small-T Handshapes with palms facing down are placed side by side. Hands move up and slightly away repetitively.

title: Spoil 2
note: 1. 'spoil' as in to ruin an object. 2. There is no difference in meaning between SPOIL 1 and SPOIL 2. They are variants of 'spoil' in KSL. 3. Note the lowered eyebrows, mouth movement and tilted head. These are all important parts of the sign.
description: Both hands are in A-Handshapes with palm of left hand facing up and palm of right hand facing down. Hands move in opposite directions with right hand always touching top of left hand.

title: Spoken
description: Bent-V Handshape with palm facing signer moves in small inward circular motions in front of mouth.

title: Spoon
description: Right U-Handshape with palm facing signer taps mouth.
memory_aid: As if eating with a spoon.

title: Spot
note: spot' as in a place.
description: Right Full Open Handshape with palm facing down and fingers pointing left is positioned near right shoulder. Hand moves in an inward circular motion while remaining in place.

title: Spread 1
note: spread' as in something being distributed.
description: Both Flat-O Handshapes with palms facing down are together in center of signing space. They move out and away from one another as hands open into Full Open Handshapes.

title: Spread 2
note: spread' as in an infection moving through the body.
description: Right O-Handshape with palm facing signer starts above wrist of left arm. As right hand moves up left arm, handshape opens into Full Open Handshape.

title: Sprite
note: coca cola drink

title: Sprout
description: Left C-Handshape with palm facing signer surrounds right Flat-O Handshape which is facing up. Right hand moves up as it opens into Full Open Handshape.

title: Spurious
description: Both hands are in Full Closed Handshapes. Left hand is positioned in center of signing space with palm down and fingertips pointing right. Right hand, with palm facing left, moves down to touch repetitively upon back of left hand.

title: Squabble
description: Both hands, in S-Handshapes with palms facing one another, move back and forth alternately.

title: Staff
note: staff' as in employees.
description: Right S-Handshape with palm facing signer moves down to rest on upturned left Full Closed Handshape.

title: Stage
note: stage' as in matatu stage.
description: Full Closed Handshape with palm facing down starts up in center of signing space and moves down in a straight line.
memory_aid: Indicates a place like the stage.

title: Stand
note: stand' as in to be in an upright position.
description: Right V-Handshape with palm facing signer is placed on the upturned palm of the left Full Closed Handshape.
memory_aid: Looks like the legs of a standing person.

title: Stand 2
note: stand' as in to be in an upright position.
description: Right V-Handshape with palm facing signer is placed on the upturned palm of the left Full Closed Handshape.
memory_aid: Looks like the legs of a standing person.

title: Stand By
note: 1. 'stand by' as in to wait. 2. While 'stand by' is a two-word phrase in English, it is one sign in KSL.
description: Both hands are in Bent-B Handshapes with palms facing signer. Hands are pulled back in towards body.

title: Stand Up
note: While 'stand up' is a two-word phrase in English, it is one sign in KSL.
description: Right V-Handshape with palm facing signer is placed on the upturned palm of the left Full Closed Handshape.
memory_aid: Looks like the legs of a standing person.

title: Standard
description: Both hands are in Extended Index Finger Handshapes. Right hand starts above left hand. Palms are facing one another. Finger of right hand touches down on the left. Then hands turn around so that finger of left hand touches down on the right.
memory_aid: Both fingers do the same thing which is the standard.

title: Standpoint
note: The facial expression used by the signer in the video indicates a negative standpoint. If one wishes to express a positive standpoint, the facial expressions should change to reflect so.
description: Right V-Handshape with palm facing down is placed in front of face pointing left. Hand moves up and down from wrist.

title: Stapler
note: A device that bind together sheets of paper by driving a thin metal staple through the sheets

title: Star
description: Right O-Handshape with palm facing down is held above head. It moves across while hand opens into Claw Handshape repetitively.
memory_aid: Looks like stars in the night sky.

title: Stare
note: This sign can change direction depending on who or what one is staring at. In this video, the direction used indicates that the signer is staring at you. If someone were staring at her, the hand would move towards her. If she were staring at many people or things, she would move the hand to indicate different people/things.
description: Right Bent-V Handshape with palm facing out starts by right eye. It moves out in a straight line.
memory_aid: As if staring at an object.

title: Start
description: Right Extended Index Finger Handshape is placed between index and middle fingers of left hand in V-Handshape. Palms of both hands are facing signer. Hands move backwards, away from each other.
memory_aid: Hands open up to start something.

title: Starvation
note: Note lowered eyebrows, raised shoulders and tilted head. These are all important parts of the sign.
description: Both Bent-B Handshapes with palms facing up are pointing to the stomach. Hands move in slightly.
memory_aid: Pointing at the stomach to indicate it needs food.

title: Starve
note: Note lowered eyebrows, raised shoulders and tilted head. These are all important parts of the sign.
description: Both Bent-B Handshapes with palms facing up are pointing to the stomach. Hands move in slightly.
memory_aid: Pointing at the stomach to indicate it needs food.

title: State
note: state' as in to say something.
description: Both Extended Index Finger Handshapes with palms facing signer are pointing at chin. Hands move out and away from one another. Palms then face out.

title: State House
note: Where the Kenyan president is Housed

title: State House
note: Where the Kenyan president is Housed

title: Statement
description: Both Extended Index Finger Handshapes with palms facing signer are pointing at chin. Hands move out and away from one another. Palms then face out.

title: Status
note: A person's condition, position or standing

title: Status 1
note: status' usually refers to one's health status.
description: Right Extended Index Finger Handshape with palm facing down points to top of upright left Full Closed Handshape with palm facing out. Right hand moves down left hand pointing at different places.

title: Status 2
note: status' as in how things are.
description: Right Claw Handshape with palm facing down moves up and down on upturned left Full Closed Handshape.
memory_aid: A lot of information in hand.

title: Stay
description: Both Full Closed Handshapes with palms facing down move down in a straight line.

title: Stay
note: Dwell/ stop/ remain/ sojourn

title: Stay
note: Dwell/ stop/ remain/ sojourn

title: Stay
note: Dwell/ stop/ remain/ sojourn

title: Stay 2
description: Both Full Closed Handshapes with palms facing down move down in a straight line.

title: Std
note: 1. 'sTD' as in a sexually transmitted disease. 2. SEX as used here is different from the main entry shown in this dictionary. See 'sex' for another variant.
description: SEX - Both Full Closed Handshapes are held together at fingertips, but heels are apart. They move forward repetitively. DISEASE - Backside of Bent-B Handshape touches cheek.

title: Steal
description: Right V-Handshape with palm facing down and fingers pointing right starts at right side of signing space. Hand moves in as fingers close to form an S-Handshape.

title: Steer
note: steer' as in to steer a vehicle.
description: Both S-Handshapes with palms facing signer are held in front of body. Hands move up and down alternately and repetitively.

title: Stench
note: Note lowered eyebrows, raised mouth and wrinkled nose which all indicate negativity. These are important parts of the sign.
description: Full Open Handshape with palm and fingers facing signer moves up to nose.

title: Stern
note: Note lowered eyebrows, an essential part of the sign.
description: Right Extended Index Finger Handshape is placed on center of forehead. Palm is facing left. Hand moves down repetitively.
memory_aid: Indicates that the forehead is lowered when one is stern.

title: Stigma
note: Shunning someone

title: Still 1
note: still' as in continuing.
description: Both Extended Index Finger Handshapes with palms facing signer are pointing at one another. They move forward in a circular motion alternately and repetitively.

title: Still 2
note: 1. 'still' as in but. 2. Note tilted head and raised eyebrows. These are essential parts of the sign.
description: Both hands are in Extended Index Handshapes. Palms are facing away from signer. Fingers are touching so that they form an 'x'. Hands move out so that fingers point to either side of the signing space.
memory_aid: Fingers move in opposite directions indicating otherwise.

title: Stink
note: Note lowered eyebrows, raised mouth and wrinkled nose which all indicate negativity. These are important parts of the sign.
description: Full Open Handshape with palm and fingers facing signer moves up to nose.

title: Stockings
description: Both S-Handshapes with palms facing signer are pointing down. They are placed on waist and move up simultaneously. Then right Full Closed Handshape with palm facing down moves up along lower part of left arm.

title: Stockings
note: A soft garment worn on the foot and lower leg

title: Stone
description: Right hand is in Claw Handshape with palm facing up. Back of right hand taps upon back of downturned left Claw Handshape.

title: Stool
description: Both Extended Index Finger Handshapes with palms facing down are side by side. They move away from each other then back together again to form a square. Then they move down and out in the opposite direction.
memory_aid: The shape of a stool and its legs.

title: Stool
note: Solid excrement

title: Stool
note: Solid excrement

title: Stop
note: Emergencies

title: Stop 1
note: 1. 'stop' as in to halt something. 2. Note lowered eyebrows, an important part of the sign.
description: Both hands are in Full Closed Handshapes. Left hand is held parallel to chest with palm facing signer. Palm of right hand is facing left. Right hand moves down in front of left hand.

title: Stop 2
note: 1. 'stop' as in to halt someone. 2. Note lowered eyebrows, an important part of the sign.
description: Full Closed Handshape with palm facing out moves forward.
memory_aid: Typical gesture when commanding one to stop.

title: Stop The Car
note: Emergencies

title: Storage
description: Left Full Closed Handshape with palm facing up is held out, slightly bent at base of fingers. The right hand, in same handshape as left hand but with palm facing down, covers the left in a light clapping motion.

title: Store 1
note: store' as in a shop.
description: Right X-Handshape with palm facing signer taps the right cheek.
memory_aid: Looks like the sign for 'sweets' which can be bought in a store.

title: Store 2
note: store' as in to keep something.
description: Left Full Closed Handshape with palm facing up is held out, slightly bent at base of fingers. The right hand, in same handshape as left hand but with palm facing down, covers the left in a light clapping motion.

title: Storm
note: storm' as in a thunderstorm.
description: Both Claw Handshapes with palms facing down are held above eye level then moved down repetitively.

title: Story
note: While 'story' is a noun in English, it can be a verb in KSL. For example, CHILDREN STORY means 'The children are telling a story.' The KSL STORY is similar to the English verb 'talk'.
description: Both Full Closed Handshapes with palms facing one another are placed together. They move side to side from the wrists.
memory_aid: The hands are telling a story.

title: Stove
description: Both hands are in Single-O Handshapes with palms facing down. The right Single-O Handshape moves forward to strike the left hand. Then the right hand moves forward and back in a circle, striking imaginary points along the way.
memory_aid: As if lighting a match, then lighting a series of wicks.

title: Straighten Up
note: While 'straighten up' is a two-word phrase in English, it is one sign in KSL.
description: Both hands are in I-Handshapes with palms facing out. The right hand starts behind the left hand. Both move out, away from one another, in a straight line. Hands then come back together and away repetitively.

title: Straightforward
note: Note lowered head and eyebrows, essential parts of the sign.
description: Flat-O Handshapes with palms facing down start at opposite ends of signing space. Hands move down towards one another as hands open into Full Open Handshapes.

title: Strand
note: strand' as in to leave behind.
description: Full Open Handshapes with palms facing signer are positioned at side of signing space. They move up from the wrists so that palms are now away from the signer.

title: Stream
note: stream' as in a small river.
description: Both hands are in Full Closed Handshapes with palms facing one another and fingers pointing out. Hands move forward simultaneously in curves.
memory_aid: As if imitating the bends in a stream.

title: Street
description: Both Full Closed Handshapes with palms facing one another are held with fingers pointing out. Hands are moved simultaneously forward.

title: Strength
description: Both hands are in S-Handshapes with palms facing signer. Arms move in close to the body and strike down slightly once.

title: Stretch
description: Both Flat-O Handshapes with palms facing signer are together touching at the fingertips. Hands move away from one another in a straight line simultaneously.

title: Strict
note: Note lowered eyebrows and sticking-out tongue. These are essential parts of the sign.
description: Right Extended Index Finger Handshape with palm facing left moves from side to side in front of mouth.
memory_aid: Strict' is signed as DANGEROUS because of the Kiswahili word '-kali' which means 'sharp, fierce, and strict'.

title: Strike
note: 1. 'strike' as in to hit. 2. This verb changes movement depending on the object. If it is to strike yourself, the hand moves towards yourself, as shown in this video. If it is to strike someone else, the hand moves away from the signer.
description: S-Handshape with palm facing down moves towards head. Upon touching head, hand moves up slightly.

title: Strive
description: Palms of both I-Handshapes are facing signer. As they are moving forward simultaneously, hands turn so that palms are facing out.

title: Strong
description: Both hands are in S-Handshapes with palms facing signer. Arms move in close to the body and strike down slightly once.

title: Structure
description: Both hands are in Full Closed Handshapes with palms facing signer. One hand is placed on top of the other alternately and repetitively.

title: Struggle
description: Both S-Handshapes with palms facing signer are together at fingers. Arms move side to side.
memory_aid: Both hands are pushing one another struggling to win.

title: Stubborn 1
note: 1. There is no difference in meaning between STUBBORN 1 and STUBBORN 2. They are variants of 'stubborn' in KSL. 2. Note lowered eyebrows, an important part of the sign.
description: Extended Index Finger Handshape with palm facing signer is pointing to forehead. It then moves down changing to an S-Handshape.
memory_aid: Pointing to the head which is like a rock.

title: Stubborn 2
note: 1. There is no difference in meaning between STUBBORN 1 and STUBBORN 2. They are variants of 'stubborn' in KSL. 2. Note lowered eyebrows, an important part of the sign.
description: Right hand is in S-Handshape with palm facing up. Back of right hand touches upon back of downturned left S-Handshape.

title: Stubborn 3
note: 1. There is no difference in meaning between STUBBORN 1 and STUBBORN 2. They are variants of 'stubborn' in KSL. 2. Note lowered eyebrows, an important part of the sign.
description: Extended Index Finger Handshape with palm facing signer is pointing to forehead. It then moves down changing to an S-Handshape.
memory_aid: Pointing to the head which is like a rock.

title: Stuck
description: Both V-Handshapes with palms facing down point to neck. The right hand touches the front part of the neck while the left hand touches the left side.
memory_aid: Looks like chains put on a slave.

title: Student
note: While 'student' is one word in English, it is a two-word phrase (LEARN, PERSON) in KSL.
description: Right Flat O-Handshape with palm facing signer taps side of forehead. Then both Full Closed Handshapes move down simultaneously to waist level.

title: Study
description: Both S-Handshapes with palms facing down are placed against head at temples.

title: Study 2
description: Both S-Handshapes with palms facing down are placed against head at temples.

title: Stupid
description: Right S-Handshape with palm facing left strikes center of forehead.

title: Stv
note: TV station

title: Subject
note: subject' as in a topic, not a school subject.
description: Both hands are in Bent-V Handshapes with palms facing one another. They are placed at top of signing space where they move slightly back and forth.

title: Substitute 1
note: substitute' as in a substitute teacher.
description: Both hands are in Extended Index Finger Handshapes. They are held together at the palms. The right hand is closer to the signer. Hands turn around so that left hand is then closer to the signer.
memory_aid: One finger takes place of the other.

title: Substitute 2
note: substitute' as in to substitute a player on a team.
description: Both hands are in Extended Index Finger Handshapes pointing at one another. Hands move in forward circles around one another.
memory_aid: Things are moving around to change.

title: Subtract
description: Right C-Handshape with palm facing left moves down on palm of left Full Closed Handshape with palm facing right. As right hand moves down, it flattens out into Full Open Handshape with palm facing down.

title: Subtraction
description: Right C-Handshape with palm facing left moves down on palm of left Full Closed Handshape with palm facing right. As right hand moves down, it flattens out into Full Open Handshape with palm facing down.

title: Succeed
description: Right Extended Index Finger Handshape with palm facing signer is pointing down. Wrist turns so that finger is pointing up.

title: Success
description: Right Extended Index Finger Handshape with palm facing signer is pointing down. Wrist turns so that finger is pointing up.

title: Sudan
note: Names of places are especially prone to variation. There may be another or a few other signs for 'sudan'.
description: Right X-Handshape with palm facing signer taps right side of nose.
memory_aid: Refers to nose ornaments worn by people of Sudan.

title: Sudden
description: Both hands are in Full Closed Handshapes with palms facing each other. The left hand is in center of signing space facing the right. The right hand slaps upon the palm of left hand in one upward motion.

title: Suffer
note: Note lowered eyebrows and shaking head. These are essential parts of the sign.
description: Full Open Handshapes with palms facing down start at right side of signer. They move simultaneously in a slight arc to left side.

title: Suffice
description: Both hands are in Full Closed Handshapes with palms facing down. Right hand with fingers pointing left moves to chest while left hand with fingers pointing right moves to waist.
memory_aid: Hands are saying it is sufficient.

title: Sufficient
description: Both hands are in Full Closed Handshapes with palms facing down. Right hand with fingers pointing left moves to chest while left hand with fingers pointing right moves to waist.
memory_aid: Hands are saying it is sufficient.

title: Sufuria
note: Round aluminum container open at the top, used for cooking

title: Sugar
description: Right Full Closed Handshape with palm facing signer taps mouth.

title: Sugar
note: Small white solid particles made from the sugar cane

title: Sugarcane
description: Both hands are in Small-T Handshapes with palms facing one another. Right hand is placed by mouth while left hand is further in front of the left shoulder. Both hands move forward simultaneously and repetitively.

title: Sugarcane
note: A tropical grass, the sap of which is a source of sugar

title: Suggest
description: Fingertips of downturned right Full Closed Handshape tap side of upturned left Full Closed Handshape.
memory_aid: If one does what is suggested, one will get applause.

title: Suit
note: A set of clothes to be worn together, especially a man's matching jacket and trousers

title: Suitable
description: Both hands are in Full Closed Handshapes with palms facing down. Right hand with fingers pointing left moves to chest while left hand with fingers pointing right moves to waist.
memory_aid: Hands are saying it is suitable.

title: Sukuma Wiki
note: While 'sukuma wiki' is a two-word phrase, it is one sign in KSL.
description: Left Extended Index Finger Handshape with palm facing down is pointing right. Right F-Handshape with palm facing down moves down left finger and then shakes down in a double motion.
memory_aid: Like cleaning off stalks of vegetables.

title: Sum
description: Both hands are in Extended Index Finger Handshapes. The left hand is pointing up while the right extended finger touches the left finger horizontally.
memory_aid: Looks like the sign for addition.

title: Summon
description: Full Closed Handshape with palm facing out is placed at right side of signer. As hand is changing into A-Handshape, it moves towards signer.

title: Sums
description: Both hands are in Extended Index Finger Handshapes. The left hand is pointing up while the right extended finger touches the left finger horizontally.
memory_aid: Looks like the sign for addition.

title: Sun
description: Right O-Handshape with palm facing down is placed by right side of head. As it slightly moves down, hand opens into Full Open Handshape.
memory_aid: Shape of sun, rays of sun.

title: Sun Up
note: While 'sun up' is a two-word phrase in English, it is one sign in KSL.
description: O-Handshape with palm facing up starts at side of signing space. While moving up, hand opens into Full Open Handshape.
memory_aid: The emerging rays of the sun.

title: Sunday
note: Signs for days of the week are especially prone to variation. There may be another or a few other signs for 'sunday'.
description: Right Full Closed Handshape with thumb bent and palm facing left touches forehead. It moves forward in a straight line.
memory_aid: Indicates one's serious demeanour when in church on Sunday.

title: Sunday 2
note: Signs for days of the week are especially prone to variation. There may be another or a few other signs for 'sunday'.
description: Right Full Closed Handshape with thumb bent and palm facing left touches forehead. It moves forward in a straight line.
memory_aid: Indicates one's serious demeanour when in church on Sunday.

title: Sunder
description: Both hands are in Bent-B Handshapes with palms facing signer. Backs of hands are touching one another and then move away directly from one another in a straight line.

title: Sundown
description: Slightly bent Full Open Handshape with palm facing down starts in center of signing space. As it moves down to right of signing space, hand closes into Flat-O Handshape with palm facing up.

title: Sunlight
description: Right O-Handshape with palm facing down is placed by right side of head. As it slightly moves down, hand opens into Full Open Handshape.
memory_aid: Shape of sun, rays of sun.

title: Sunrise
description: O-Handshape with palm facing up starts at side of signing space. While moving up, hand opens into Full Open Handshape.
memory_aid: The emerging rays of the sun.

title: Sunrise 2
description: O-Handshape with palm facing up starts at side of signing space. While moving up, hand opens into Full Open Handshape.
memory_aid: The emerging rays of the sun.

title: Sunset
description: Slightly bent Full Open Handshape with palm facing down starts in center of signing space. As it moves down to right of signing space, hand closes into Flat-O Handshape with palm facing up.

title: Sunshine
description: Right O-Handshape with palm facing down is placed by right side of head. As it slightly moves down, hand opens into Full Open Handshape.
memory_aid: Shape of sun, rays of sun.

title: Super Highway
note: A main direct multi-lane public road

title: Superb
description: Full Closed Handshape with palm facing signer touches chin and moves up to right in strong motion. Hand ends into Thumbs-Up Handshape.

title: Superior 1
note: superior' as in the best.
description: Full Closed Handshape with palm facing signer touches chin and moves up to right in strong motion. Hand ends into Thumbs-Up Handshape.

title: Superior 2
note: superior' as in boss.
description: Both S-Handshapes with palms facing down start at waist level. They move up to chest level simultaneously.
memory_aid: Looks like the stature of a superior.

title: Supermarket
description: Right Claw Handshape with palm facing down moves back repetitively.
memory_aid: As if grabbing things off supermarket shelves.

title: Supervise
description: Right Bent-V Handshape with palm facing out moves side to side on top of wrist of downturned left Full Closed Handshape.
memory_aid: Pair of eyes looking over a desk.

title: Supervisor
description: Right Bent-V Handshape with palm facing out moves side to side on top of wrist of downturned left Full Closed Handshape.
memory_aid: Pair of eyes looking over a desk.

title: Supper
note: While 'supper' is one word in English, it is a two-word phrase (EAT, EVENING) in KSL.
description: EAT - Right Flat-O Handshape with palm facing down taps repetitively on the mouth. EVENING - Right hand is in Full Closed Handshape with palm down. Hand moves to left end of signing space and moves back and forth slightly.
memory_aid: Action of eating, position of sun.

title: Sure
note: Note raised eyebrows, an essential part of the sign.
description: Both hands are in Full Closed Handshapes. Left hand is positioned in center of signing space with palm up and fingertips pointing right. Right hand, with palm facing left, moves down to touch upon palm of left hand.

title: Surplus
description: Both hands are in Full Closed Handshapes. Palm of left hand is facing up while palm of right hand is facing down. Right hand starts on top of left hand and moves up in a straight line. Both hands turn from wrists so that they are facing out.
memory_aid: Adding more to what one already has.

title: Surprised 1
note: 1. There is no difference in meaning between SURPRISED 1 and SURPRISED 2. They are variants of 'surprised' in KSL. 2. Note movement of eyebrows. This is an important part of the sign.
description: Both O-Handshapes with palms facing out are placed on either side of head. They both move up and away from head while opening into Full Open Handshapes.
memory_aid: At first, hands indicate the shape of normal eyes and then open to indicate widened eyes.

title: Surprised 2
note: 1. There is no difference in meaning between SURPRISED 1 and SURPRISED 2. They are variants of 'surprised' in KSL. 2. Note movement of eyebrows. This is an important part of the sign.
description: Both O-Handshapes with palms facing out are placed on either side of head. They both move up and away from head while opening into Full Open Handshapes.
memory_aid: At first, hands indicate the shape of normal eyes and then open to indicate widened eyes.

title: Surprised 2
note: 1. There is no difference in meaning between SURPRISED 1 and SURPRISED 2. They are variants of 'surprised' in KSL. 2. Note raised eyebrows, an essential part of the sign.
description: Both F-Handshapes with palms facing out are placed at either side of head. They move towards one another repetitively.

title: Surrender
description: Full Open Handshapes with palms facing signer are positioned at side of signing space. They move up from the wrists so that palms are now away from the signer.

title: Survival
description: Both A-Handshapes with palms facing signer are pointing down. They start at the waist and move up simultaneously in straight lines up the body.

title: Survive
description: Both A-Handshapes with palms facing signer are pointing down. They start at the waist and move up simultaneously in straight lines up the body.

title: Sustained
description: Both Flat-O Handshapes with palms facing signer are together touching at the fingertips. Hands move away from one another in a straight line simultaneously.

title: Swahili
note: Names of tribes are especially prone to variation. There may be another or a few other signs for 'swahili'.
description: Right X-Handshape with palm facing signer scratches little-finger side of left Full Closed Handshape.

title: Swahili
note: Language spoken mostly in East Africa, born of the hybridization of the Arabic and Bantu cultures

title: Swap
description: Both hands are in Extended Index Finger Handshapes. They are held together at the palms. The right hand is closer to the signer. Hands turn around so that left hand is then closer to the signer.
memory_aid: One finger takes place of the other.

title: Sweater
description: Both hands are in Full Open Handshapes with palms facing out. The right hand touches upon the left wrist, then the left hand touches upon the right wrist.
memory_aid: Indicates ends of the sleeves on a sweater.

title: Sweater
note: A knitted jacket

title: Sweden
note: Names of places are especially prone to variation. There may be another or a few other signs for 'sweden'.
description: Slightly bent right Full Open Handshape with palm facing down is placed on top of downturned left Full Closed Handshape. As right hand moves up, it closes into Flat-O Handshape. This is done repetitively.
memory_aid: This sign is taken from Swedish Sign Language.

title: Sweep
note: sweep' as in to wipe out.
description: Both hands are in Full Closed Handshapes. Right hand with palm facing left moves down to swipe across palm of upturned left hand. As right hand moves up, it closes into C-Handshape with palm facing signer.

title: Sweet
description: Right Extended Index Finger Handshape with palm facing out points to right side of neck. Hand twists down on neck. Palm is now facing back.
memory_aid: Sweetness is felt in the throat.

title: Sweet Dreams
note: good night wishes

title: Sweetheart
description: Both Modified-C Handshapes with palms facing one another are placed over area of heart. Index fingers move down repetitively.

title: Sweetheart
note: lovers

title: Sweets
description: The tongue pushes out on the right cheek so that a bump is visible. X-Handshape with palm facing left taps the bump on the cheek.

title: Swift
description: Both hands are in Full Closed Handshapes with palms facing each other. The left hand is in center of signing space facing the right. The right hand slaps upon the palm of left hand in one upward motion.

title: Switch
description: Both hands are in Extended Index Finger Handshapes. They are held together at the palms. The right hand is closer to the signer. Hands turn around so that left hand is then closer to the signer.
memory_aid: One finger takes place of the other.

title: Switzerland
note: Names of places are especially prone to variation. There may be another or a few other signs for 'switzerland'.
description: Right Modified-C Handshape with palm facing signer is placed on chest where it moves down and then across the chest.
memory_aid: The cross on flag of Switzerland.

title: Syllabus
description: Right C-Handshape with palm facing left moves down in steps on upright left Full Closed Handshape with palm facing out.
memory_aid: Indicates things listed on a syllabus.

title: Syntax
description: F-Handshapes with palms facing one another are connected at thumb and index fingers. Hands let go of one another, twisting around and reconnecting at thumb and index fingers. This is done repetitively as hands move to left side of signing space.

title: Syrup
note: Any viscous liquid

title: T
note: This sign can also be made with index finger pointing straight out along side of folded middle finger and thumb straight up against knuckle of index finger. See 'VCT' in this dictionary for a demonstration.
description: Middle, ring and little fingers are folded down across palm. Thumb is pointing up against side of middle finger. Index finger is folded over top of the tip of thumb. Palm is facing out.
memory_aid: Looks like the top of a written 'T'.

title: Tabernacle
note: Place sacrifices were offered in Israel

title: Table
description: Both hands are in Full Closed Handshapes with palms facing down. Hands start side by side and move out away from one another. They then turn so that palms are facing one another and move down simultaneously.
memory_aid: The top and legs of a table.

title: Taita
note: Names of towns are especially prone to variation. There may be another or a few other signs for 'Taita'.
description: Right Extended Index Finger Handshape with palm facing up taps the side of upturned left Full Closed Handshape.
memory_aid: Similar to the sign for Swahili.

title: Take 1
note: 'Take' as in to get something.
description: Right Full Open Handshape with palm facing down starts in the center of the signing space. It moves in towards the signer while closing into a Flat-O Handshape.

title: Take 2
note: 'Take' as in to capture someone.
description: Both Full Open Handshapes with palms facing out move down and forward while hands close into S-Handshapes with palms facing down.

title: Take A Seat
note: While 'take a seat' is a three-word phrase in English, it is one sign in KSL.
description: Both hands are in U-Handshapes with palms facing down. The right U-Handshape comes down to rest upon the U-Handshape of the left hand.

title: Take Away
note: While 'take away' is a two-word phrase in English, it is one sign in KSL.
description: Right C-Handshape with palm facing left moves down on palm of left Full Closed Handshape with palm facing right. As right hand moves down, it flattens out into Full Open Handshape with palm facing down.

title: Take It Easy
note: General conversation

title: Take Off
note: While 'take off' is a two-word phrase in English, it is one sign in KSL.
description: Right C-Handshape with palm facing left moves down on palm of left Full Closed Handshape with palm facing right. As right hand moves down, it flattens out into Full Open Handshape with palm facing down.
memory_aid: Taking something off from left hand.

title: Take Out
note: 1. 'Take out' as in to remove. 2. While 'take out' is a two-word phrase in English, it is one sign in KSL.
description: Right C-Handshape with palm facing up is in Left C-Handshape with palm facing right. Right hand moves back and up.

title: Taken Aback 1
note: 1. There is no difference in meaning between TAKEN ABACK 1 and TAKEN ABACK 2. They are variants of 'taken aback' in KSL. 2. Note movement of eyebrows. This is an important part of the sign. 3. While 'taken aback' is a two-word phrase in English, it is one sign in KSL.
description: Both O-Handshapes with palms facing out are placed on either side of head. They both move up and away from head while opening into Full Open Handshapes.
memory_aid: At first, hands indicate the shape of normal eyes and then open to indicate widened eyes.

title: Taken Aback 2
note: 1. There is no difference in meaning between TAKEN ABACK 1 and TAKEN ABACK 2. They are variants of 'taken aback' in KSL. 2. Note raised eyebrows, an essential part of the sign. 3. While 'taken aback' is a two-word phrase in English, it is one sign in KSL.
description: Both F-Handshapes with palms facing out are placed at either side of head. They move towards one another repetitively.

title: Taking Long
note: time

title: Tale
description: Both Full Closed Handshapes with palms facing one another are placed together. They move side to side from the wrists.
memory_aid: The hands are telling a tale.

title: Talk
description: Extended Index Finger Handshapes with palms facing one another start by the mouth. Hands move out and back alternately and repetitively.
memory_aid: Fingers represent words being exchanged between two people.

title: Tall
description: Right Full Closed Handshape with palm facing left moves up in a straight line.
memory_aid: Indicating the height of a tall person.

title: Tally
description: Left hand is in a Claw Handshape with palm facing up. Right Extended Index Finger Handshape with palm facing signer touches upon fingers of left hand, which close after being touched.

title: Tantamount
description: Both hands are in Bent-B Handshapes with palms facing down. Hands touch at the fingertips.

title: Tanzania
note: Names of places are especially prone to variation. There may be another or a few other signs for 'Tanzania'.
description: Right Single-O Handshape with palm facing signer moves down slightly and repetitively in front of mouth.
memory_aid: Refers to the upper lip of former president Nyerere.

title: Tanzanian
note: While 'Tanzanian' is one word in English, it is a two-word phrase (TANZANIA, PERSON) in KSL.
description: TANZANIA - Right Single-O Handshape with palm facing signer moves down slightly and repetitively in front of mouth. PERSON - Both Full Closed Handshapes with palms facing one another move down simultaneously to waist level.
memory_aid: Refers to the upper lip of former president Nyerere.

title: Tardy
description: Right Full Closed Handshape starts with palm facing up. It moves down and back towards right side of signer.

title: Target
description: Both hands are in Extended Index Finger Handshapes. Right hand is closer to signer and its palm is facing in. Finger of right hand points towards the left hand which is held away from the signer with the palm facing in. Right hand moves toward left hand.
memory_aid: An arrow moving towards its target.

title: Task
description: The little-finger side of the right S-Handshape with palm facing left is brought down repetitively on top of the index finger side of the left S-Handshape with palm facing right.

title: Taste
description: Right Extended Index Finger Handshape with palm facing signer taps tongue.

title: Taxi
note: The first part of this sign uses CAR.
description: Both S-Handshapes with palms facing signer. Hands are moved up and down alternately and repetitively. Then right Full Closed Handshape with palm facing back moves to top of head.
memory_aid: Steering wheel of a car, sign of a taxi.

title: Tea
description: Right Single-O Handshape with palm facing signer is placed by mouth. As hand moves up towards the mouth, it twists from wrist so that palm is facing out.

title: Tea Leaves
note: Leaves from tea plant

title: Teach
description: Both hands are in Flat-O Handshapes with palms facing out. Hands move forward slightly and repetitively.

title: Teacher
note: 1. While 'teacher' is one word in English, it is a two-word phrase (TEACH, PERSON) in KSL. 2. See HEADMASTER for another KSL sign variant of 'teacher'.
description: TEACH - Both hands are in Flat-O Handshapes with palms facing out. Hands move forward slightly and repetitively. PERSON - Both Full Closed Handshapes with palms facing one another move down simultaneously to waist level.

title: Team
description: Both hands, in C-Handshapes with palms facing one another, start at opposite ends of signing space. They move towards one another simultaneously.

title: Tear Apart
note: While 'tear apart' is a two-word phrase in English, it is one sign in KSL.
description: Both hands are in Bent-B Handshapes with palms facing signer. Backs of hands are touching one another and then move away directly from one another in a straight line.

title: Tears
note: 1. 'Tears' as in to cry tears. 2. While 'cry', 'sob', 'wail' and so on share the same essential meaning, they all differ in intensity. The same is true in KSL. The difference in intensity is indicated by facial expression and movement of hands.
description: Extended Index Finger Handshapes with palms facing signer are placed under each eye. They move down in straight lines repetitively.
memory_aid: Looks like tears falling down one's face.

title: Technical
description: Right Extended Index Finger Handshape taps the side of left Full Closed Handshape. Palm of right hand is facing signer while palm of left hand is facing away.
memory_aid: Pointing to a part of some machine.

title: Technology
description: Right Extended Index Finger Handshape taps the side of left Full Closed Handshape. Palm of right hand is facing signer while palm of left hand is facing away.
memory_aid: Pointing to a part of some machine.

title: Tedious
note: Appropriate facial expression is important for this sign. One should lower eyebrows and otherwise indicate boredom.
description: Right Full Closed Handshape with palm facing signer taps mouth.

title: Telephone
description: Right Y-Handshape with palm facing signer touches the right side of the face. The thumb is near the ear and the little finger near the mouth.

title: Telescope
description: Both C-Handshapes with palms facing one another are positioned at right side of signer with right hand before left hand. Hands both twist up and down from wrists in opposite directions repetitively.

title: Television
note: Box used to receive digital and analogue signals as video and sound

title: Tell
note: This sign can change direction depending on who one is telling. In this video, the direction used indicates that the signer is telling you something. If she were told something, the hand would move towards her. If she were telling many people something, she would move the hand to indicate different people.
description: Right Extended Index Finger Handshape with palm facing signer points to mouth. It then moves out in a straight line while hand turns down so that palm is facing up.

title: Tell Me
note: General conversation

title: Tell Me
note: General conversation

title: Temple
note: A building for worship

title: Temple
note: A building for worship

title: Ten
description: Both A-Handshapes with palms facing one another are brought together.
memory_aid: All ten fingers folded together represent 'ten'.

title: Tena
note: Name of a place

title: Tend
note: 'Tend' as in to take care of someone or something.
description: Both Full Closed Handshapes with palms facing signer are held upright. Right hand touches back of left hand and moves up repetitively.

title: Tendency 1
note: Note the mouth movement 'ba ba ba'. This is an important part of the sign.
description: Full Closed Handshape starts at side of signer with palm facing down. Hand moves up from wrist as arm moves slightly forward. Palm is now facing out.

title: Tendency 2
note: This is usually used with TENDENCY 1. TENDENCY 2 is signed first then TENDENCY 1, which means 'one's tendency' or LAW HIS/HER.
description: Right L-Handshape starts down with thumb pointing up. Palm is facing left. Hand moves so that thumb of L-Handshape touches shoulder.

title: Term
note: 'Term' as in a word.
description: Both G-Handshapes with palms facing one another are touching at fingers. Hands move away slightly from one another while closing into Single-O Handshapes. This is done repetitively.

title: Terrible
description: The left arm, in an S-Handshape with palm facing signer, is held upright while right Full Closed Handshape with palm facing signer slaps the left elbow.
memory_aid: As if slapping someone for behaving badly.

title: Terror
note: 1. 'Terror' as in one feels terror. 2. Appropriate facial expression should accompany this sign. See FEAR.
description: Right O-Handshape with palm facing left rests over the heart. Hand opens and closes repetitively into a Full Open Handshape.

title: Test
description: Right Extended Index Finger Handshape with palm facing out starts in center of signing space. Hand moves down as it changes into an X-Handshape.
memory_aid: Looks like a written question mark - ?.

title: Testimony
note: Statement made by a witness in a court

title: Testing
note: trial/ challenge/ A session in which a product or piece of equipment is examined

title: Testing 2
note: trial/ challenge/ A session in which a product or piece of equipment is examined

title: Tetanus
note: Disease caused by an infection of an open wound

title: Text
description: Both G-Handshapes with palms facing one another are touching at fingers. Hands move away slightly from one another while closing into Single-O Handshapes. This is done repetitively.

title: Text Me
note: Family and relationships

title: Textbook
description: Full Closed Handshapes are held with palms together and fingertips pointing away. Palms are facing signer. Hands open and close repetitively with sides always touching.

title: Thank You
note: While 'thank you' is a two-word phrase in English, it is one sign in KSL.
description: Right Full Closed Handshape with palm facing signer starts below mouth. Hand moves down in an arc so that palm ends facing up.
memory_aid: Gratitude from mouth is given to another.

title: Thank You
note: appreciation

title: Thank You Very Much
note: appreciation

title: Thanks For Your Help
note: appreciation

title: The Bill, Please
note: At a restaurant/ at a hotel

title: The Bill, Please
note: At a restaurant/ at a hotel

title: The Line Is Busy
note: Languages and communication

title: The Line Is Busy
note: Languages and communication

title: The Weather Is?
note: Weather

title: Their
description: Both Full Closed Handshapes with palms facing out start at center of signing space. They move slightly up from the wrists repetitively as they move away from one another to either side of the signing space.
memory_aid: Indicating that something belongs to others.

title: Theirs
description: Both Full Closed Handshapes with palms facing out start at center of signing space. They move slightly up from the wrists repetitively as they move away from one another to either side of the signing space.
memory_aid: Indicating that something belongs to others.

title: Them
description: Right Full Closed Handshape with palm facing up and fingers pointing out moves in a slight arc from left to right.

title: Theme
description: Both hands are in Bent-V Handshapes with palms facing one another. They are placed at top of signing space where they move slightly back and forth.

title: There
description: The right hand, in a Full Closed Handshape with palm facing up, points to the right.

title: There's Been An Accident
note: Emergencies

title: There's Been An Accident
note: Emergencies

title: They
description: Right Full Closed Handshape with palm facing up and fingers pointing out moves in a slight arc from left to right.

title: Thief
description: Right V-Handshape with palm facing down and fingers pointing right starts at right side of signing space. Hand moves in as fingers close to form an S-Handshape.

title: Thigh
note: The upper leg of a human

title: Thika
note: Names of towns are especially prone to variation. There may be another or a few other signs for 'Thika'.
description: Right hand, in L-Handshape with palm facing signer, passes over eyes repetitively.
memory_aid: Same sign as 'blind' for the blind school in Thika.

title: Thika Road
note: Name of a road that leads to and from thika

title: Thika 2
note: Names of towns are especially prone to variation. There may be another or a few other signs for 'Thika'.
description: Right hand, in L-Handshape with palm facing signer, passes over eyes repetitively.
memory_aid: Same sign as 'blind' for the blind school in Thika.

title: Thin
description: Both Full Closed Handshapes start at either side of the waist. Palms are facing signer and fingers are pointing out. Hands move up simultaneously to chest. Palms are now facing up.

title: Thin 2
description: Both Full Closed Handshapes start at either side of the waist. Palms are facing signer and fingers are pointing out. Hands move up simultaneously to chest. Palms are now facing up.

title: Thing 1
note: There is no difference in meaning between THING 1 and THING 2. They are variants of 'thing' in KSL.
description: Both hands are in Full Open Handshapes with palms facing up. They start side by side and move away from one another in a slight bouncing motion.

title: Thing 2
note: There is no difference in meaning between THING 1 and THING 2. They are variants of 'thing' in KSL.
description: Both Extended Index Finger Handshapes with palms facing down are pointing out. Right hand starts above left hand. Hands move towards one another slightly and then reverse while switching so that left hand is now on top. This is done repetitively.

title: Think
note: Note lowered eyebrows and head, essential parts of the sign.
description: Right Extended Index Finger Handshape with palm facing down points to right side of forehead.

title: Thirst
description: Right Full Open Handshape with palm facing signer is placed on throat. Fingers move down the throat.

title: Thirsty
description: Right Full Open Handshape with palm facing signer is placed on throat. Fingers move down the throat.

title: Thirteen
note: This sign is composed of two signs, the first being TEN and the second THREE. They are signed continuously. There should be no pause in between.
description: TEN - Both A-Handshapes with palms facing one another are brought together. THREE - Right hand extends little, ring, and middle fingers and moves up so that palm is facing out.

title: Thirty
note: This sign is composed of two signs, the first being THREE and the second ZERO. They are signed continuously. There should be no pause in between.
description: THREE - Right hand extends little, ring, and middle fingers. Palm is facing signer. ZERO - Hand forms an O-Handshape with palm facing out.

title: Thirty 2
note: This sign is composed of two signs, the first being THREE and the second ZERO. They are signed continuously. There should be no pause in between.
description: THREE - Right hand extends little, ring, and middle fingers. Palm is facing signer. ZERO - Hand forms an O-Handshape with palm facing out.

title: This Evening
note: time

title: This Morning
note: time

title: Thorn
description: Right Extended Index Finger Handshape with palm facing signer moves up to tap palm of downturned left Full Closed Handshape.

title: Thoughtless
note: Lowered eyebrows, shrugged shoulders, shaking head and pursed lips are all important parts of the sign. They all indicate carelessness.
description: Full Open Handshapes start at center of signing space with palms facing down. They move up to either side of signing space with palms facing up.

title: Thrash
description: Hand assumes K-Handshape. Palm is facing signer and hand is tipped down. Thumb moves away from index and middle fingers and moves back down as wrist snaps. This is done repetitively.
memory_aid: The thumb is a cane coming down on two legs represented by the middle and index fingers.

title: Threat
note: Note lowered eyebrows and sticking-out tongue. These are essential parts of the sign.
description: Right Extended Index Finger Handshape with palm facing left moves from side to side in front of mouth.
memory_aid: Something threatening in front of face.

title: Threatening
note: Note lowered eyebrows and sticking-out tongue. These are essential parts of the sign.
description: Right Extended Index Finger Handshape with palm facing left moves from side to side in front of mouth.
memory_aid: Something threatening in front of face.

title: Three
description: Right hand extends little, ring, and middle fingers. Palm is facing signer.

title: Throat
note: The gullet

title: Through
note: 'Through' as in to travel through.
description: Left Full Closed Handshape with palm facing down is held parallel to chest. Right Full Closed Handshape with palm facing signer moves towards and over left hand. Once right hand is over left hand, it turns so that it moves in a straight line and that palm is facing left.
memory_aid: Right hand is going through the center of signing space.

title: Throw
note: 'Throw' as in to discard.
description: Both O-Handshapes with palms facing out are held in front of face. Right hand is slightly ahead of left hand. Both hands move simultaneously forward and down as hands open into Full Open Handshapes.

title: Throw Away
note: While 'throw away' is a two-word phrase in English, it is one sign in KSL.
description: Both O-Handshapes with palms facing out are held in front of face. Right hand is slightly ahead of left hand. Both hands move simultaneously forward and down as hands open into Full Open Handshapes.

title: Thump
note: This verb changes movement depending on the object. If it is to thump yourself, the hand moves towards yourself, as shown in this video. If it is to thump someone else, the hand moves away from the signer.
description: S-Handshape with palm facing down moves towards head. Upon touching head, hand moves up slightly.

title: Thunder
note: The sound caused by the discharge of atmospheric electrical charge

title: Thunderstorm
description: Both Claw Handshapes with palms facing down are held above eye level then moved down repetitively.

title: Thursday
note: Signs for days of the week are especially prone to variation. There may be another or a few other signs for 'Thursday'.
description: Right hand is in Full Closed Handshape with palm facing left. Left hand, also in Full Closed Handshape with palm facing signer, supports the right forearm. Right hand moves side to side from the wrist.

title: Thursday 2
note: Signs for days of the week are especially prone to variation. There may be another or a few other signs for 'Thursday'.
description: Right hand is in Full Closed Handshape with palm facing left. Left hand, also in Full Closed Handshape with palm facing signer, supports the right forearm. Right hand moves side to side from the wrist.

title: Thwack
note: This verb changes movement depending on the object. If it is to thwack yourself, the hand moves towards yourself, as shown in this video. If it is to thwack someone else, the hand moves away from the signer.
description: S-Handshape with palm facing down moves towards head. Upon touching head, hand moves up slightly.

title: Thwart
description: Both hands are in Full Closed Handshapes. Left hand is held horizontally in front of signer with palm facing in. Right hand is held to side of signer with palm facing left. Right hand moves to palm of left hand.
memory_aid: Left hand is something that thwarts.

title: Ticket
note: The repetitive movement as shown in this video usually indicates the plural form. To indicate the singular form, the movement is only done once.
description: Both Flat-O Handshapes with palms facing signer are held up touching at the fingers. Right hand moves down repetitively while turning at wrist.

title: Tidy
description: Both hands are in I-Handshapes with palms facing out. The right hand is placed behind the left hand. Both move out, away from one another, in a straight line.

title: Tidy Up
note: While 'tidy up' is a two-word phrase in English, it is one sign in KSL.
description: Both hands are in I-Handshapes with palms facing out. The right hand starts behind the left hand. Both move out, away from one another, in a straight line. Hands then come back together and away repetitively.

title: Tie 1
note: 'Tie' as in a necktie.
description: Right Full Closed Handshape with palm facing down is pointing out just below chin. Hand moves down so that palm touches chest.
memory_aid: Looks like the body of a tie.

title: Tie 2
note: 'Tie' as in to come together.
description: Both hands are in Full Closed Handshapes with palms facing one another and thumbs up. They start at opposite ends of the signing space and come together until the palms touch.

title: Timber
description: Both C-Handshapes with palms facing down are together. They move away from one another then back again in a straight line.

title: Time
description: Right Extended Index Finger Handshape with palm facing left taps the wrist of downturned left S-Handshape.

title: Time
note: The inevitable progression into the future

title: Time Up
note: time

title: Time Will Tell
note: time

title: Times
note: 'Times' as in multiplication.
description: Both hands are in Extended Index Finger Handshapes with palms facing one another. The left hand is pointing right while the right extended finger is pointing left. They are side by side, touching at the knuckles.
memory_aid: Looks like the sign for multiplication.

title: Times Tower
note: Name of a building in Nairobi which houses the Kenya Revenue Authority

title: Timetable
description: Both hands are in Full Open Handshapes. Left arm is held parallel with palm facing signer. Palm of right hand is facing down. It moves towards left hand and moves down. As it moves back up, palm turns to face left and it moves across left hand.

title: Timetable
note: Order of events

title: Timid
note: Note lowered eyebrows, an important part of the sign.
description: Full Open Handshape with palm facing signer moves up and down face.
memory_aid: Hiding one's face because of being timid.

title: Tiny 1
note: 1. 'Tiny' as in not very tall. 2. This sign is used to refer to people or animals.
description: Right hand, in a Claw Handshape with palm facing down, moves down in a straight line.
memory_aid: Indicates the tininess of a person.

title: Tiny 2
note: 1. 'Tiny' as in a small thing. 2. This sign refers to objects only. 3. Note face scrunch and lowered eyebrows, important elements of this sign.
description: Right G-Handshape with palm facing left is held in front of the face.

title: Tired
description: Both Claw Handshapes with palms facing signer rest upon the chest. Hands turn down and out so that palms are facing up.

title: Tiresome
note: Appropriate facial expression is important for this sign. One should lower eyebrows and otherwise indicate boredom.
description: Right Full Closed Handshape with palm facing signer taps mouth.

title: Title 1
note: 'Title' as in a person's title.
description: Left Full Closed Handshape is held upright with palm facing right. The thumb of right G-Handshape with palm facing signer touches palm of left hand while index finger touches back of left hand. Right hand moves slightly down and out, while fingers close into a Single-O Handshape. This is done repetitively.
memory_aid: Tag of a person or thing.

title: Title 2
note: 'Title' as in the name of a book.
description: Both hands are in Bent-V Handshapes with palms facing one another. They are placed at top of signing space where they move slightly back and forth.

title: To
description: Right hand is in Extended Index Finger Handshape with palm facing signer and finger pointing down. Hand moves from wrist so that finger is now pointing away from signer.
memory_aid: A person going to a place.

title: To Go
note: General conversation

title: To Go
note: General conversation

title: Today
description: Right Extended Index Finger Handshape with palm facing signer points down.

title: Today
note: This day

title: Toes
note: Each of the five digits on the end of the foot

title: Together 1
note: TOGETHER 1 is used for two people or things. See TOGETHER 2.
description: Both hands are in Full Closed Handshapes with palms facing one another and thumbs up. They start at opposite ends of the signing space and come together until the palms touch.

title: Together 2
note: TOGETHER 2 is used for three or more people/things. See TOGETHER 1.
description: Both hands are in Thumbs-Up Handshapes, with thumbs pointing up. Hands are put together and moved in a circular motion.

title: Toil
description: The little-finger side of the right S-Handshape with palm facing left is brought down repetitively on top of the index finger side of the left S-Handshape with palm facing right.

title: Toilet
description: Both hands are in Full Closed Handshapes with palms facing one another. Tips of hands come together repetitively making a triangular shape.
memory_aid: The roof of a toilet room.

title: Toilets
note: A lavatory

title: Tolerance
description: C-Handshape is placed upon heart, thumbside against body. Handshape closes into S-Handshape which moves down and up on heart.

title: Tolerant
description: C-Handshape is placed upon heart, thumbside against body. Handshape closes into S-Handshape which moves down and up on heart.

title: Tomato
description: Right Extended Index Finger Handshape with palm facing signer points to tongue. Right hand moves down as it turns into a Claw Handshape with palm facing up.
memory_aid: Red as the tongue, held in the hand.

title: Tomato
note: Fruit of a tomato plant, treated as a vegetable in horticulture

title: Tomato Sauce
description: TOMATO - Right Extended Index Finger Handshape with palm facing signer points to tongue. Right hand moves down as it turns into a Claw Handshape with palm facing up. POUR - Right hand in Modified C-Handshape (loosely held, other fingers are also out) moves in a circular motion. Palm is facing down.
memory_aid: As if holding a tomato and then a jar and tipping it down to pour.

title: Tomorrow
description: Right Extended Index Finger Handshape with palm facing out taps right corner of mouth.

title: Tongue
note: A flexible muscular organ in the mouth that is used to move food around and testing

title: Tonsils
note: Inflammation of the tonsillitis

title: Too
description: The sides of the Extended Index Finger Handshapes are brought together once or repetitively. Palms are facing down.
memory_aid: Two same things are brought together.

title: Too Much
note: While 'too much' is a two-word phrase in English, it is one sign in KSL.
description: Right Full Open Handshape with palm facing down repetitively hits the side of the left hand which is in an S-Handshape.
memory_aid: Hitting upon hand means nothing more can be put there.

title: Tooth
note: A hard calcareous structure present in the mouth of vertebrates, used for eating

title: Toothache
note: Pain in a tooth

title: Top 1
note: 'Top' as in the top part of an object.
description: Right hand in Full Closed Handshape starts near waist and moves in an arc until hand is over head with fingers pointing left. Palm is always facing down.
memory_aid: Indicates the top of an object.

title: Top 2
note: 'Top' as in the best.
description: Full Closed Handshape with palm facing signer touches chin and moves up to right in strong motion. Hand ends into Thumbs-Up Handshape.

title: Topic
description: Both hands are in Bent-V Handshapes with palms facing one another. They are placed at top of signing space where they move slightly back and forth.

title: Topic 2
description: Both hands are in Bent-V Handshapes with palms facing one another. They are placed at top of signing space where they move slightly back and forth.

title: Top-Secret
description: Thumbs-Up Handshape with palm facing signer traces a cross on the mouth. Then hand assumes K-Handshape. Palm is facing left and hand is tipped down. Thumb moves away from index and middle fingers and moves back down as wrist snaps.

title: Torch
note: 'Torch' as in to set something on fire.
description: Both hands are in O-Handshapes with palms facing one another. The right hand moves to touch the top of the left hand. Both hands simultaneously change into Full Open Handshapes and move up slightly shaking.
memory_aid: The lighting of a match and the shape of flames.

title: Tortoise
note: A land dwelling reptile whose body is enclosed in a shell

title: Total
note: 'Total' as in all.
description: Both Full Closed Handshapes with palms facing down start side by side. As hands turn up, they move away from one another in a circle. At the end they come back together touching at the fingers. Palms are facing up.

title: Totality
description: Both Full Closed Handshapes with palms facing down start side by side. As hands turn up, they move away from one another in a circle. At the end they come back together touching at the fingers. Palms are facing up.

title: Touch
description: Right hand, in a Bent-B Handshape with palm facing down, touches upon the downturned left Full Closed Handshape.

title: Tough 1
note: 1. 'Tough' as in difficult. 2. Note lowering of eyebrows, which is an essential part of this sign.
description: Both hands, in S-Handshapes with palms facing signer, are held upright. Arms move back and forth simultaneously and repetitively.

title: Tough 2
note: 'Tough' as in something hard.
description: Right hand is in Claw Handshape with palm facing up. Back of right hand taps upon back of downturned left Claw Handshape.

title: Tough 3
note: 'Tough' as in strong.
description: Both hands are in S-Handshapes with palms facing signer. Arms move in close to the body and strike down slightly once.

title: Tour
description: Both Extended Index Finger Handshapes with palms facing down point out. They move forward alternately and repetitively.

title: Tout
note: 1. There is no difference in meaning between TOUT 1 and TOUT 2. They are variants of 'tout' in KSL. 2. The last part of this sign uses the sign PERSON.
description: The left hand is in a Curved-Three Handshape with palm facing signer. Right Extended Index Finger Handshape with palm facing left touches against back of the left fingers and then moves down repetitively. Both Full Closed Handshapes with palms facing one another move down simultaneously to waist level.
memory_aid: This imitates the way touts hold money.

title: Tout
note: One collecting money in a passenger serving vehicle

title: Tow
description: Both X-Handshapes are linked. Palm of right hand is facing down while palm of left hand is facing signer. Both hands move to right simultaneously.
memory_aid: The right is towing the left.

title: Town
description: Right hand in Bent-B Handshape with palm facing down moves in an arc.

title: Toy
note: The first part of this sign uses MAKE.
description: Both hands are in Flat-O Handshapes. Palm of right hand is facing down while palm of left hand is facing up. The right hand opens and closes on top of left hand. Then right hand, in a Claw Handshape with palm facing down, moves in a straight line to the left repetitively.
memory_aid: Playing with a small toy car.

title: Track
note: 'Track' as in to go in someone's footsteps.
description: Both hands are in Bent-B Handshapes with palms facing down. The left hand is slightly behind and to the left of the right hand. Both hands move simultaneously forward and to the right.
memory_aid: Left hand is tracking right hand.

title: Tract
note: A small booklet/ an area or expanse

title: Tractor
note: 1. Note the mouth movements. They are an important part of the sign. 2. First part of this sign uses the sign DRIVE.
description: Both S-Handshapes with palms facing signer are moved up and down alternately and repetitively. Then right Claw Handshape with palm facing back is placed above shoulder. Hand is opened and closed repetitively.
memory_aid: Driving a tractor and smoke from an exhaust pipe.

title: Tradition
description: Both F-Handshapes with palms facing one another are linked. Hands move back and forth.
memory_aid: Tradition is what links people together.

title: Traditional
description: Both F-Handshapes with palms facing one another are linked. Hands move back and forth.
memory_aid: Tradition is what links people together.

title: Traffic Jam
note: A situation in which all road traffic is stationary or very slow

title: Traffic Police
note: Unit of the police that deals with transportation

title: Trail
note: 'Trail' as in to go in someone's footsteps.
description: Both hands are in Bent-B Handshapes with palms facing down. The left hand is slightly behind and to the left of the right hand. Both hands move simultaneously forward and to the right.
memory_aid: Left hand is trailing right hand.

title: Train 1
note: 'Train' as in a type of transportation.
description: Right Full Closed Handshape with the palm facing left is by right side of signer. Arm moves in forward circular motions.
memory_aid: Imitating the moving wheels on a train.

title: Train 2
note: 'Train' as in to practice.
description: Both O-Handshapes with palms facing signer are placed on shoulders. They move out while opening into Full Open Handshapes. This is done repetitively.

title: Train 3
note: 'Train' as in a type of transportation.
description: Right Full Closed Handshape with the palm facing left is by right side of signer. Arm moves in forward circular motions.
memory_aid: Imitating the moving wheels on a train.

title: Training
description: Both O-Handshapes with palms facing signer are placed on shoulders. They move out while opening into Full Open Handshapes. This is done repetitively.

title: Tranquil
note: Note lowered eyebrows, an important part of the sign.
description: Right Extended Index Finger Handshape with palm facing left moves down lips.

title: Transfer
description: Both Flat-O Handshapes with palms facing down are placed at right side of signer. They move in an upward arc to left side.
memory_aid: Hands are picking up something and moving it elsewhere.

title: Transform
description: Both hands are in A-Handshapes with palms touching one another. The right hand is closest to the signer. Hands turn over still touching so that left hand is now closer to the signer.

title: Transformation
