description: Both hands are in A-Handshapes with palms touching one another. The right hand is closest to the signer. Hands turn over still touching so that left hand is now closer to the signer.

title: Transfusion
note: medical process of transferring blood from one person to another

title: Translate
description: Both F-Handshapes with palms facing one another are touching at the fingertips. Staying in place, they move up and down from the wrists in opposite directions.

title: Translation
description: Both F-Handshapes with palms facing one another are touching at the fingertips. Staying in place, they move up and down from the wrists in opposite directions.

title: Translator
description: Both F-Handshapes with palms facing one another are touching at the fingertips. Staying in place, they move up and down from the wrists in opposite directions.

title: Transmission
note: From one person to another

title: Transmutation
description: Both hands are in A-Handshapes with palms touching one another. The right hand is closest to the signer. Hands turn over still touching so that left hand is now closer to the signer.

title: Transmute
description: Both hands are in A-Handshapes with palms touching one another. The right hand is closest to the signer. Hands turn over still touching so that left hand is now closer to the signer.

title: Trap
description: Both V-Handshapes with palms facing down point to neck. The right hand touches the front part of the neck while the left hand touches the left side.
memory_aid: Looks like chains put on a slave.

title: Trapped
description: Both V-Handshapes with palms facing down point to neck. The right hand touches the front part of the neck while the left hand touches the left side.
memory_aid: Looks like chains put on a slave.

title: Travel
description: Both Extended Index Finger Handshapes with palms facing down point out. They move forward alternately and repetitively.

title: Treasurer
note: One who deals with money in a group

title: Tree
description: Both hands, in Full Open Handshapes with palms facing one another, are held up from elbows. Hands twist from wrists and arms move to right.

title: Tremendous
note: Note the raising of eyebrows which indicate largeness. This is an essential part of the sign.
description: Full Open Handshapes with palms facing one another start above the shoulders. They move apart and upwards.
memory_aid: Showing the size of something tremendous.

title: Tribe 1
note: 1. There is no difference in meaning between TRIBE 1 and TRIBE 2. They are variants of 'tribe' in KSL. 2. To sign this repetitively as done in the sign video means 'tribes'. To sign this in the singular form, the movement is not repetitive, only done once to signify 'tribe'.
description: Right Full Closed Handshape with palm facing down swipes back repetitively on back of downturned left Full Closed Handshape.

title: Tribe 2
note: 1. There is no difference in meaning between TRIBE 1 and TRIBE 2. They are variants of 'tribe' in KSL. 2. To sign this repetitively as done in the sign video means 'tribes'. To sign this in the singular form, the movement is not repetitive, only done once to signify 'tribe'.
description: Both hands, in C-Handshapes with palms facing one another, start at one end of signing space. They move towards one another simultaneously. This is done repetitively as hands move to other side of signing space.

title: Trinity
note: Believe in Three gods in one

title: Trinity
note: Believe in Three gods in one

title: Trip
description: Both Extended Index Finger Handshapes with palms facing down point out. They move forward alternately and repetitively.

title: Triumph
description: Right Extended Index Finger Handshape with palm facing signer is pointing down. Wrist turns so that finger is pointing up.

title: Trouble
note: Note lowered eyebrows and tilted head, essential parts of the sign.
description: The left hand is in a Full Closed Handshape with palm facing right. Right Thumbs-Up Handshape with palm facing down touches palm of left hand repetitively.

title: Troubled
note: Note the lowered eyebrows, an important part of the sign.
description: Full Open Handshapes with palms facing down are near temples of forehead. Hands move simultaneously in small outward circles.

title: Trousers
description: Hands in Full Closed Handshapes with palms facing one another are pointing down. Together hands move down on each leg.

title: Trousers
note: An article of clothing that covers the part of the body between the waist and ankles and is divided into separate part for each leg

title: Truck
description: Both X-Handshapes are linked. Palm of right hand is facing down while palm of left hand is facing signer. Both hands move to right simultaneously.
memory_aid: The right is trucking the left.

title: True
note: Note raised eyebrows, an essential part of the sign.
description: Both hands are in Full Closed Handshapes. Left hand is positioned in center of signing space with palm up and fingertips pointing right. Right hand, with palm facing left, moves down to touch upon palm of left hand.

title: Trust
description: Both hands are in Full Closed Handshapes. Left hand is positioned in center of signing space with palm up and fingertips pointing right. Right hand, with palm facing left, moves down to touch upon palm of left hand. Once right hand touches down, it moves forward in a slightly up motion.
memory_aid: Arm goes in a straight direction, not off to the side as one would when untruthful.

title: Truth
note: Note raised eyebrows, an essential part of the sign.
description: Both hands are in Full Closed Handshapes. Left hand is positioned in center of signing space with palm up and fingertips pointing right. Right hand, with palm facing left, moves down to touch upon palm of left hand.

title: Truthful
description: Both hands are in Full Closed Handshapes. Left hand is positioned in center of signing space with palm up and fingertips pointing right. Right hand, with palm facing left, moves down to touch upon palm of left hand. Once right hand touches down, it moves forward in a slightly up motion.
memory_aid: Arm goes in a straight direction, not off to the side as one would when untruthful.

title: Try
description: Palms of both I-Handshapes are facing signer. As they are moving forward simultaneously, hands turn so that palms are facing out.

title: T-Shirt
note: The first part of this sign uses CLOTHES.
description: Single-O Handshape with palm facing signer is touching near the right shoulder. Hand moves away from and back to the signer repetitively. Then both hands assume Full Closed Handshapes with palms facing up and touch opposite upper arms. Hands slightly move back and forth repetitively.
memory_aid: Indicating the fabric and then short sleeves of a t-shirt.

title: T-Shirt
note: A lightweight shirt without buttons, with short sleeves and no color

title: Tub
description: Bent-B Handshapes are held together side by side with palms facing up. They move upward and outward, away from one another, in a curve. The hands then come together and rub.
memory_aid: Shows the shape of a tub.

title: Tubal Ligation
note: A surgical procedure for sterilization

title: Tubal Ligation
note: A surgical procedure for sterilization

title: Tuberculosis
note: Infection of the lungs

title: Tuesday
note: Signs for days of the week are especially prone to variation. There may be another or a few other signs for 'Tuesday'.
description: Right U-Handshape with palm facing signer taps chin.
memory_aid: Two fingers for Tuesday the second day of the week.

title: Tug
description: Both X-Handshapes are linked. Palm of right hand is facing down while palm of left hand is facing signer. Both hands move to right simultaneously.
memory_aid: The right is tugging the left.

title: Tumble
description: Both Extended Index Finger Handshapes with palms facing signer are pointing at one another. They move forward in a circular motion alternately and repetitively.

title: Turkana
note: Names of tribes are especially prone to variation. There may be another or a few other signs for 'Turkana'.
description: Right Extended Index Finger Handshape with palm facing signer points to face between bottom lip and chin. Hand twists from wrist.

title: Turkey
note: 1. 'Turkey' as in the country. 2. Names of places are especially prone to variation. There may be another or a few other signs for 'Turkey'.
description: Right G-Handshape with palm facing out and fingers pointing down is placed on nose. Hand moves slightly back and forth.

title: Turn
note: 'Turn' as in to turn around.
description: Right Extended Index Finger Handshape with palm facing signer points down. Hand moves forward and to the left in a circular motion. Palm is still facing body.

title: Turn Into
note: While 'turn into' is a two-word phrase in English, it is one sign in KSL.
description: Both hands are in A-Handshapes with palms touching one another. The right hand is closest to the signer. Hands turn over still touching so that left hand is now closer to the signer.

title: Tusker
note: 'Tusker' as in the beer named Tusker.
description: Thumbs of both Modified-C Handshapes with palms facing one another tap either side of mouth.

title: Tusker
note: Alcoholic beverage fermented from starch material

title: Tutor
description: Both hands are in Flat-O Handshapes with palms facing out. Hands move forward slightly and repetitively.

title: Twelve
note: This sign is composed of two signs, the first sign being TEN and the second TWO. They are signed continuously. There should be no pause in between.
description: TEN - Both A-Handshapes with palms facing one another are brought together. TWO - Right hand with V-Handshape and palm facing left is brought up.

title: Twenty
note: This sign is composed of two signs, the first being TWO and the second ZERO. They are signed continuously. There should be no pause in between.
description: TWO - Right hand is in V-Handshape with palm facing the body. ZERO - Hand forms an O-Handshape with palm facing out.

title: Twenty 2
note: This sign is composed of two signs, the first being TWO and the second ZERO. They are signed continuously. There should be no pause in between.
description: TWO - Right hand is in V-Handshape with palm facing the body. ZERO - Hand forms an O-Handshape with palm facing out.

title: Twins
note: Two born by the same mother on the same day

title: Twins
note: Two born by the same mother on the same day

title: Two
description: Right hand is in V-Handshape with palm facing the body.

title: Two Beers, Please
note: Eating and drinking

title: Typewriter
note: A device used to print text by pressing keys that cause type to be impressed onto paper

title: Typical 1
note: 1. 'Typical' as in something normal. 2. Note lowered eyebrows, an essential part of the sign.
description: U-Handshapes with palms facing one another are placed in center of signing space. Hands move up and down simultaneously.
memory_aid: Repetitive motion indicates something that happens a lot.

title: Typical 2
note: 1. 'Typical' as in something that happens often. 2. Note the lowering of eyebrows which indicate intensity.
description: Palm of Bent-B Handshape of right hand is facing signer. Hand moves in small outward circles, but stays in place.

title: U
description: Ring and little fingers are folded against the palm, held down by thumb. Index and middle fingers are straight up and together. Palm is facing out.

title: Uchumi
note: supermarket chain

title: Ugali
description: Right Claw Handshape is held with palm facing up. Fingers open and close repetitively.

title: Ugali
note: Food stuff made by mixing maize flour in hot water

title: Uganda
note: Names of places are especially prone to variation. There may be another or a few other signs for 'Uganda'.
description: Right Uganda-Handshape with palm facing down taps underside of chin.

title: Uganda 2
note: Names of places are especially prone to variation. There may be another or a few other signs for 'Uganda'.
description: Right Uganda-Handshape with palm facing down taps underside of chin.

title: Ugly
note: Note facial expression, an important part of the sign.
description: Both Claw Handshapes with palms facing out start side by side. They move in opposite directions.

title: Uhuru Highway
note: Name of a highway

title: Uji
description: Slightly cupped Full Open Handshape with palm facing up moves in an inward circular motion in front of the mouth.

title: Ukwala
note: supermarket chain

title: Ultimate
description: Right Full Closed Handshape starts with palm facing up. It moves down and back towards right side of signer.
memory_aid: Indicating the past in the timeline.

title: Umoja
note: Name of a place

title: Unambiguous
note: Note lowered head and eyebrows, essential parts of the sign.
description: Flat-O Handshapes with palms facing down start at opposite ends of signing space. Hands move down towards one another as hands open into Full Open Handshapes.
memory_aid: Open hands show the unambiguity of something.

title: Unattainable
note: Note lowered and shaking head, important parts of the sign.
description: Both hands are in S-Handshapes with palms facing one another. They move towards and past one other to reach other sides of signing space. They move back towards center of signing space. At the same time they are turning over so that palms are up. They then move down to respective sides of the signing space. The right hand ends up by the right side of the signing space and the left hand ends up by the left side.

title: Unbelievable
note: 'Unbelievable' as in wonderful.
description: Index finger of Modified-C handshape is resting on top of chin while thumb is underneath chin. Head moves slightly side to side.

title: Unbiased
description: Full Closed Handshapes with palms facing signer touch sides of forehead. Hands move out to sides of signing space while wrists move out so that palms are facing out.
memory_aid: Mind is open, free of bias.

title: Uncertain
description: Both hands are in Full Closed Handshapes. Left hand is parallel to waist with palm facing up. Little-finger side of right hand is placed upon palm of left hand and moves side to side.
memory_aid: The right hand is swaying to and fro with indecision.

title: Uncle
note: The first part of this sign uses the sign BOY, indicating male.
description: Right G-Handshape with palm facing signer is placed on the chin so the index finger is in front of the chin and the thumb is underneath. The hand is pulled down slightly and the fingers come together. The hand then turns down to touch the right side of the body, changing hand to Extended Index Finger Handshape. Finger is pointing out.

title: Uncle
note: Father or mother's brother

title: Uncouth
note: While CRUEL shares the same sign as other English words like 'inhumane', 'mean', and 'rude', they have slightly different facial expressions. The more intense the meanness, the more intense the facial expression. Hence CRUEL gets a more intense facial expression than RUDE does.
description: Claw Handshapes with palms facing down rest upon either side of head. Hands move out simultaneously in a straight line.

title: Under
description: Left hand is in Full Closed Handshape with palm facing down. Right hand is in Extended Index Finger Handshape with palm facing down. It moves down in an arc to point left under the left hand.
memory_aid: Right hand is under left hand.

title: Underneath
description: Left hand is in Full Closed Handshape with palm facing down. Right hand is in Extended Index Finger Handshape with palm facing down. It moves down in an arc to point left under the left hand.
memory_aid: Right hand is underneath left hand.

title: Understand 1
note: There is no difference in meaning between UNDERSTAND 1 and UNDERSTAND 2. They are variants of 'understand' in KSL.
description: The S-Handshape with palm facing back is placed on side of the forehead. Index finger is then extended.
memory_aid: Light going on in the head.

title: Understand 2
note: 1. There is no difference in meaning between UNDERSTAND 1 and UNDERSTAND 2. They are variants of 'understand' in KSL. 2. Note the tongue sticking out. This is an essential part of the sign.
description: Flat-O Handshape with palm facing signer moves towards shoulder opening into Full Open Handshape.

title: Undertake
description: Palms of both I-Handshapes are facing signer. As they are moving forward simultaneously, hands turn so that palms are facing out.

title: Underwear
description: Both Full Closed Handshapes touch either side of the stomach. Palms are facing one another and fingertips are facing down. Hands move up and away in an arc simultaneously.

title: Unfeasible
note: Note lowered and shaking head, important parts of the sign.
description: Both hands are in S-Handshapes with palms facing one another. They move towards and past one other to reach other sides of signing space. They move back towards center of signing space. At the same time they are turning over so that palms are up. They then move down to respective sides of the signing space. The right hand ends up by the right side of the signing space and the left hand ends up by the left side.

title: Uninteresting
note: Appropriate facial expression is important for this sign. One should lower eyebrows and otherwise indicate boredom.
description: Right Full Closed Handshape with palm facing signer taps mouth.

title: Union
description: Both hands are in Full Open Handshapes with palms facing one another. Both hands start slightly away from the center of signing space. The right hand is above the left hand. Hands move to the center as hands close into S-Handshapes.
memory_aid: Bringing things together for setting up a union.

title: Unit
note: 'Unit' as in a Deaf program attached to a hearing school.
description: Both hands are in C-Handshapes with palms facing one another. They move towards one another until right hand envelops left.

title: Unite
description: Both hands are in Full Closed Handshapes with palms facing one another and thumbs up. They start at opposite ends of the signing space and come together until the palms touch.

title: Universal
description: Slightly bent Full Open Handshapes with palms facing out start together and move around forward until they meet. Palms are now facing signer.

title: University
description: Both Bent-B Handshapes with palms facing down are held above and slightly in front of head. Right hand moves straight back to head.

title: University Way
note: Name of a road

title: Unkempt
note: Note the lowered eyebrows and scrunched face, important parts of the sign.
description: Right Extended Index Finger Handshape with palm facing left moves from side to side in front of face.
memory_aid: Hand seems to be waving away an unpleasant odour.

title: Unkind
note: While CRUEL shares the same sign as other English words like 'inhumane', 'mean', and 'rude', they have slightly different facial expressions. The more intense the meanness, the more intense the facial expression. Hence CRUEL gets a more intense facial expression than RUDE does.
description: Claw Handshapes with palms facing down rest upon either side of head. Hands move out simultaneously in a straight line.

title: Unleavened Bread
note: Bread used by Jews for Passover celebration

title: Unlike
description: Extended Index Finger Handshapes with palms facing out are held upright. Left hand moves forward while finger of right hand bounces off and turns away from left finger. Palm of right hand is then facing signer.

title: Unprejudiced
description: Full Closed Handshapes with palms facing signer touch sides of forehead. Hands move out to sides of signing space while wrists move out so that palms are facing out.
memory_aid: Mind is open, free of prejudice.

title: Unspoiled
note: Note the lowered eyebrows and tilted head, important parts of the sign.
description: Both F-Handshapes are placed in front of signer with palms facing out.

title: Unsure
description: Both hands are in Full Closed Handshapes. Left hand is parallel to waist with palm facing up. Little-finger side of right hand is placed upon palm of left hand and moves side to side.
memory_aid: The right hand is swaying to and fro with indecision.

title: Unsympathetic
note: Lowered eyebrows, shrugged shoulders, shaking head and pursed lips are all important parts of the sign. They all indicate carelessness.
description: Full Open Handshapes start at center of signing space with palms facing down. They move up to either side of signing space with palms facing up.

title: Untidy
note: Note the lowered eyebrows and scrunched face, important parts of the sign.
description: Right Extended Index Finger Handshape with palm facing left moves from side to side in front of face.
memory_aid: Hand seems to be waving away an unpleasant odour.

title: Until
description: Both hands are in Full Closed Handshapes with palms facing signer. Left hand is at left side of signing space. Right hand starts in front of right shoulder and moves until it hits the palm of left hand.
memory_aid: Right hand represents the time left until the left hand.

title: Unwilling
description: Both arms with Full Closed Handshapes are held upright and crossed at the wrists. Palms are facing sides. Both hands move down to opposite sides of the signing space. Palms are then facing down.
memory_aid: Typical gesture of an unwilling person.

title: Up
description: Right Extended Index Finger Handshape with palm facing out is moved up so that finger points at sky.

title: Up To
note: 1. 'Up to' as in until. 2. While 'up to' is a two-word phrase in English, it is one sign in KSL.
description: Both hands are in Full Closed Handshapes with palms facing signer. Left hand is at left side of signing space. Right hand starts in front of right shoulder and moves until it hits the palm of left hand.
memory_aid: Right hand represents the time left up to the left hand.

title: Upcountry
note: Village

title: Update
description: O-Handshapes with palms facing out are positioned in front of mouth. Hands move out to either side of the signing space as handshapes open into Full Open Handshapes. Palms are then facing down.

title: Upset
note: angry

title: Urgent
description: Both hands are in Full Closed Handshapes with palms facing each other. The left hand is in center of signing space facing the right. The right hand slaps upon the palm of left hand in one upward motion.

title: Urinate
description: Right Extended Index Finger Handshape with palm facing signer is placed at bottom center of signing space. Hand is pointing down as it moves down and slightly out repetitively.

title: Urine
note: Liquid excrement

title: Us
description: Right Extended Index Finger Handshape with palm facing signer points at right shoulder. It moves down to left where it curves out a little.
memory_aid: Hand indicates the signer and some other people.

title: Use
description: Right U-Handshape with palm facing out moves in a circular motion on top of downturned left Full Closed Handshape.

title: Usual 1
note: 1. 'Usual' as in something normal. 2. Note lowered eyebrows, an essential part of the sign.
description: U-Handshapes with palms facing one another are placed in center of signing space. Hands move up and down simultaneously.
memory_aid: Repetitive motion indicates something that happens a lot.

title: Usual 2
note: 1. 'Usual' as in something that happens often. 2. Note the lowering of eyebrows which indicate intensity.
description: Palm of Bent-B Handshape of right hand is facing signer. Hand moves in small outward circles, but stays in place.

title: Usually
note: Note lowered eyebrows, an essential part of the sign.
description: U-Handshapes with palms facing one another are placed in center of signing space. Hands move up and down simultaneously.
memory_aid: Repetitive motion indicates something that happens a lot.

title: Utilize
description: Right U-Handshape with palm facing out moves in a circular motion on top of downturned left Full Closed Handshape.

title: V
description: Ring and little fingers are folded against the palm, held down by the thumb. Index and middle fingers are straight and spread out. Palm is facing out.

title: V.C.T
note: Voluntary Counseling and testing services

title: Vacant
description: Left Full Closed Handshape lies with palm facing up. Full Closed Handshape of right hand with palm facing left moves from side to side upon palm of left hand.

title: Vacant
note: not occupied

title: Vacation
description: Full Open Handshape with palm facing signer touches chest.
memory_aid: Taking time off to breathe, to relax.

title: Vaccination
description: V-Handshape with thumb sticking out and palm facing right moves down to elbow of left hand. While moving, thumb moves down to touch base of index and middle fingers.

title: Vaccine
description: V-Handshape with thumb sticking out and palm facing right moves down to elbow of left hand. While moving, thumb moves down to touch base of index and middle fingers.

title: Vagina
description: Both L-Handshapes with palms facing signer are pointing down. Hands move together repetitively so that thumbs and index fingers are touching.

title: Vagina
note: The passage leading from the vulva to the cervix of the uterus

title: Valentine
note: Celebration of St. Valentine on 14th February

title: Valid
description: Right Extended Index Finger Handshape with palm facing down is held upright with finger pointing left. Hand moves up in a check-like motion. Palm is then facing out and finger pointing up.

title: Validate
description: Right hand is in Extended Index Finger Handshape with palm facing signer and finger pointing up. Left Full Closed Handshape is in front of waist with palm facing up. Finger of right hand moves down touching upon palm of left hand and then up. Palm of right hand is then facing out.
memory_aid: A validating check on a form.

title: Validation
description: Right hand is in Extended Index Finger Handshape with palm facing signer and finger pointing up. Left Full Closed Handshape is in front of waist with palm facing up. Finger of right hand moves down touching upon palm of left hand and then up. Palm of right hand is then facing out.
memory_aid: A validating check on a form.

title: Valley
description: Both hands are in Full Closed Handshapes with palms facing down. Hands start at opposite ends of signing space. Hands move down in arc to meet one another.
memory_aid: Indicates the shape of a valley.

title: Variant
description: Both Extended Index Finger Handshapes with palms facing down are positioned in the center of the signing space pointing out. Hands move up and down alternately.
memory_aid: The different levels in a group.

title: Variation
description: Both Extended Index Finger Handshapes with palms facing down are positioned in the center of the signing space pointing out. Hands move up and down alternately.
memory_aid: The different levels in a group.

title: Variety
description: Both Extended Index Finger Handshapes with palms facing down are positioned in the center of the signing space pointing out. Hands move up and down alternately.
memory_aid: The different levels in a group.

title: Vary
description: Both Extended Index Finger Handshapes with palms facing down are positioned in the center of the signing space pointing out. Hands move up and down alternately.
memory_aid: The different levels in a group.

title: Vast
note: Note the raising of eyebrows which indicate largeness. This is an essential part of the sign.
description: Full Open Handshapes with palms facing one another start above the shoulders. They move apart and upwards.
memory_aid: Showing the size of something vast.

title: Vct
note: 1. 'VCT' as in Voluntary Counselling and Testing. 2. The 'T' in this video is a variant. See 'T' in main entry of dictionary for another variant. 3. This is an example of fingerspelling.
description: The letters V, C, and T are spelled in succession.

title: Vegetable
note: 'Vegetable' can also be expressed by naming the various vegetables, e.g. CABBAGE, ONION, CARROT, and so on.
description: Right F-Handshape with palm facing down is shook downward repetitively.

title: Vegetables
note: A plant raised for some edible part of it

title: Vehicle
description: Both S-Handshapes with palms facing signer are moved up and down alternately and repetitively. Then both hands are placed in the B-Handshapes with palms facing down at eye level. B-Handshapes are moved apart, angled down and then flattened out.
memory_aid: Steering a wheel, outline of a car.

title: Vend
description: Both Small-T Handshapes with palms facing one another are positioned in center of signing space. They move forward alternately and repetitively. As hands move forward, the thumbs come up changing into A-Handshapes.
memory_aid: Looks like a person selling wares.

title: Vengeance
description: Left Extended Index Finger Handshape with palm facing down is pointing right. Right X-Handshape with palm facing out taps once above the left finger and again below.

title: Venture
description: Palms of both I-Handshapes are facing signer. As they are moving forward simultaneously, hands turn so that palms are facing out.

title: Verb
description: Both hands are in S-Handshapes with palms facing signer. Right hand is closer to the body. While staying in place, both hands move alternately in circles away from the body.
memory_aid: The hands are engaged in some action.

title: Verb
note: doing word

title: Verbal
description: Right V-Handshape with palm facing signer is placed at base of neck. Hand moves up throat repetitively.

title: Verify
description: Both hands are in Full Closed Handshapes. Left hand is positioned in center of signing space with palm up and fingertips pointing right. Right hand, with palm facing left, moves down to touch upon palm of left hand. Once right hand touches down, it moves forward in a slightly up motion.
memory_aid: Arm goes in a straight direction, not off to the side as one would when untruthful.

title: Verse
note: small section of the bible

title: Very
note: This sign is often used to indicate intensity of an action, e.g. 'It is raining very hard' would be signed as RAIN VERY.
description: Left Full Closed Handshape with palm facing right is pointing out. Thumb of right Thumbs-Up Handshape with palm facing signer is placed on center of left palm. Never leaving palm, the thumb moves back and forth slightly repetitively.
memory_aid: Something that would leave an imprint.

title: Very 2
note: This sign is often used to indicate intensity of an action, e.g. 'It is raining very hard' would be signed as RAIN VERY.
description: Left Full Closed Handshape with palm facing right is pointing out. Thumb of right Thumbs-Up Handshape with palm facing signer is placed on center of left palm. Never leaving palm, the thumb moves back and forth slightly repetitively.
memory_aid: Something that would leave an imprint.

title: Vet
note: A doctor who treats animals

title: Video
description: A slightly bent Full Open Handshape with palm facing out is held thumb side up. Hand is moved forward repetitively.
memory_aid: As if putting a videotape in a VCR.

title: View
description: Right Bent-V Handshape with palm facing out starts by right eye. It moves out in a straight line.

title: Viewpoint
note: The facial expression used by the signer in the video indicates a negative viewpoint. If one wishes to express a positive viewpoint, the facial expressions should change to reflect so.
description: Right V-Handshape with palm facing down is placed in front of face pointing left. Hand moves up and down from wrist.

title: Vilify
note: Lowered eyebrows, pursed mouth, intense movement and turned head are all essential parts of this sign. All parts indicate intensity and negativity.
description: Both Extended Index Finger Handshapes are pointing left. Palms are facing one another. Hands move forward and slightly down repetitively.

title: Village
description: Extended Index Finger Handshape with palm facing back is placed on top of head with finger pointing up.
memory_aid: Huts in the villages often have sticks protruding from their roofs. Such sticks are said to thwart lightning bolts.

title: Violin
note: Musical four stringed instrument generally played with a bow

title: Virgin
note: This sign is used for females only. For men, you would sign SEX NOT-YET.
description: Both Extended Index Finger Handshapes with palms facing one another are placed on chest with fingers pointing out.

title: Virus
description: Right Extended Index Finger Handshape with palm facing down is pointing out. Finger closes into an X-Handshape repetitively.

title: Visit
description: Full Open Handshape with palm facing signer is placed on chest. Thumb and middle finger are touching body. Hand moves up chest.
memory_aid: Tidying yourself up for a visitor.

title: Visitor
description: Full Open Handshape with palm facing signer is placed on chest. Thumb and middle finger are touching body. Hand moves up chest.
memory_aid: Tidying yourself up for a visitor.

title: Vocabulary
description: Both G-Handshapes with palms facing one another are touching at fingers. Hands move away slightly from one another while closing into Single-O Handshapes. This is done repetitively.

title: Vocal
description: Right V-Handshape with palm facing signer is placed at base of neck. Hand moves up throat repetitively.

title: Vocation
description: The little-finger side of the right S-Handshape with palm facing left is brought down repetitively on top of the index finger side of the left S-Handshape with palm facing right.

title: Voi
note: This is an example of fingerspelling. There is not yet a standard sign for 'Voi', however there may be signs in Voi for the town's name.
description: The letters V, O, and I are spelled in succession.

title: Voice
description: Right V-Handshape with palm facing signer is placed at base of neck. Hand moves up throat repetitively.

title: Volleyball
description: Both hands, in Full Closed Handshapes, are held together. First on the right side of head, hands move forward once. Then movement is repeated on left side.

title: Voluntary
note: Handshape can be either Single-O Handshape or F-Handshape.
description: Right Single-O Handshape with palm facing signer is under right shoulder. Hand moves away from body repetitively.

title: Volunteer
note: Handshape can be either Single-O Handshape or F-Handshape.
description: Right Single-O Handshape with palm facing signer is under right shoulder. Hand moves away from body repetitively.

title: Vomit
note: puke

title: Vote
description: Both hands are in Bent-B Handshapes with palms facing signer and fingers pointing down. Hands move up and down alternately.

title: Vote
note: Participate in an election

title: Vote
note: Participate in an election

title: Voucher
note: The repetitive movement as shown in this video usually indicates the plural form. To indicate the singular form, the movement is only done once.
description: Both Flat-O Handshapes with palms facing signer are held up touching at the fingers. Right hand moves down repetitively while turning at wrist.

title: Vow
description: Right Extended Index Finger Handshape with palm facing left points to the mouth. Then it opens into a Full Closed Handshape as it moves down to touch upon palm of upturned left Full Closed Handshape.

title: W
description: Tip of little finger is touching tip of thumb. Index, middle and ring fingers are straight and slightly spread out. Palm is facing out.

title: Wail 1
note: 1. 'Wail' as in to cry. 2. While 'cry', 'sob', 'wail' and so on share the same essential meaning, they all differ in intensity. The same is true in KSL. The difference in intensity is indicated by facial expression and movement of hands.
description: Extended Index Finger Handshapes with palms facing signer are placed under each eye. They move down in straight lines repetitively.
memory_aid: Looks like tears falling down one's face.

title: Wail 2
note: 1. 'Wail' as in to scream while crying. 2. Note lowering of eyebrows and movement of mouth. These are important parts of the sign.
description: S-Handshape with palm facing down is placed under chin. Hand opens into Full Open Handshape.
memory_aid: Hand opening means mouth is wailing.

title: Wait
description: Both hands are in Bent-B Handshapes with palms facing signer. Hands are pulled back in towards body.

title: Wait For Me
note: General conversation

title: Wajir
note: This is an example of fingerspelling. There is not yet a standard sign for 'Wajir', however there may be signs in Wajir for the town's name.
description: The letters W, A, J, I, and R are spelled in succession.

title: Wake
description: Right arm, with hand in S-Handshape and palm facing up, is held horizontally to the side. Arm moves up until vertical with body.

title: Wake Up
note: While 'wake up' is a two-word phrase in English, it is one sign in KSL.
description: Right arm, with hand in S-Handshape and palm facing up, is held horizontally to the side. Arm moves up until vertical with body.

title: Walk
description: Right V-Handshape with palm facing right is held with fingers pointing down. The fingers move back and forth alternately as the hand moves across the signing space.

title: Walk 2
description: Right V-Handshape with palm facing right is held with fingers pointing down. The fingers move back and forth alternately as the hand moves across the signing space.

title: Walk Around
note: 1. Note the mouthing 'wah, wah' which is an important part of the sign. 2. While 'walk around' is a two-word phrase in English, it is one sign in KSL.
description: Full Open Handshape with palm facing left moves forward in small curves.
memory_aid: Hand represents a person walking about the street.

title: Wander
note: Note the mouthing 'wah, wah' which is an important part of the sign.
description: Full Open Handshape with palm facing left moves forward in small curves.
memory_aid: Hand represents a person walking about the street.

title: Want
description: Fingers of right hand, in Full Open Handshape with palm facing signer, move down repetitively on throat.

title: War
description: Hands are in Modified-C Handshapes with palms facing one another and thumbs pointing up. Right hand is behind left hand. They move simultaneously side to side.

title: Warn
description: Right Extended Index Finger Handshape with palm facing left is pointing out. It moves up and down from wrist repetitively.

title: Warning
description: Right Extended Index Finger Handshape with palm facing left is pointing out. It moves up and down from wrist repetitively.

title: Warthog
note: A species of wild pig native to Africa

title: Wary
note: Note lowered eyebrows and tilted head. These are essential parts of the sign.
description: Both Full Open Handshapes with palms facing down are slowly moved forward in circles.

title: Wash 1
note: 'Wash' as in to wash clothes.
description: Both hands are in A-Handshapes. Right hand with palm facing down rests on upturned left hand. The right hand moves repetitively side to side.

title: Wash 2
note: 'Wash' as in to wash the body.
description: Both hands are in slightly curved Full Open Handshapes with palms facing up. They throw themselves over the left shoulder and then over the right side.

title: Wash 3
note: 'Wash' as in to wash hands.
description: Both hands are in Full Closed Handshapes with palms facing one another. Hands are together and rub back and forth.

title: Watch
note: 1. 'Watch' as in to see something. 2. This sign can change direction depending on who or what one is watching. In this video, the direction used indicates that the signer is watching you. If someone were watching her, the hand would move towards her. If she were watching many people or things, she would move the hand to indicate different people/things.
description: Right Bent-V Handshape with palm facing out starts by right eye. It moves out in a straight line.

title: Watchman
description: Right Full Closed Handshape with palm facing left moves upright to shoulder.
memory_aid: Imitates the movement of a watchman.

title: Water
description: Right C-Handshape with palm facing left moves up to open lips. At lips, wrist turns upwards.
memory_aid: An imaginary glass is tipped at the open lips.

title: Watermelon
note: Note the mouth movement, an important part of the sign.
description: Both C-Handshapes with palms facing signer are placed at right side of signing space. Hands move in a straight line to the left.

title: Watermelon
note: Fruit of the watermelon plant

title: Waver
description: Both hands are in Full Closed Handshapes. Left hand is parallel to waist with palm facing up. Little-finger side of right hand is placed upon palm of left hand and moves side to side.
memory_aid: The right hand is swaying to and fro with indecision.

title: Wavering
description: Both hands are in Full Closed Handshapes. Left hand is parallel to waist with palm facing up. Little-finger side of right hand is placed upon palm of left hand and moves side to side.
memory_aid: The right hand is swaying to and fro with indecision.

title: Way
description: Both Full Closed Handshapes with palms facing one another are held with fingers pointing out. Hands are moved simultaneously forward.

title: We
description: Right Extended Index Finger Handshape with palm facing signer points at right shoulder. It moves down to left where it curves out a little.
memory_aid: Hand indicates the signer and some other people.

title: Weak
note: Note lowered eyebrows, an essential part of the sign.
description: Both hands are in Full Closed Handshapes. The left hand is held in the middle of the signing space with palm facing up. Fingertips of the upright right hand are resting on palm of left hand. Right hand moves back and forth from wrist, never leaving the left hand.
memory_aid: Fingers represent legs which are weak.

title: Weakness
note: Note lowered eyebrows, an essential part of the sign.
description: Both hands are in Full Closed Handshapes. The left hand is held in the middle of the signing space with palm facing up. Fingertips of the upright right hand are resting on palm of left hand. Right hand moves back and forth from wrist, never leaving the left hand.
memory_aid: Fingers represent legs which are weak.

title: Wealth
note: The more wealthy one is, the more intense the facial expression and movement are.
description: Claw Handshape with palm facing signer is positioned under right shoulder. Hand moves out in a straight line.

title: Wealthy
note: The more wealthy one is, the more intense the facial expression and movement are.
description: Claw Handshape with palm facing signer is positioned under right shoulder. Hand moves out in a straight line.

title: Wear
description: Flat-O Handshapes with palms facing up start at shoulders. They move down simultaneously to waist.

title: Weary
description: Both Claw Handshapes with palms facing signer rest upon the chest. Hands turn down and out so that palms are facing up.

title: Weather
description: Full Open Handshapes with palms facing one another point out. They start at ends of signing space and move back and forth alternately.

title: Webuye
note: Names of towns are especially prone to variation. There may be another or a few other signs for 'Webuye'.
description: Right B-Handshape with palm facing left is moved up and down from wrist in front of mouth.

title: Wedding
description: Both F-Handshapes with palms facing one another begin at opposite sides of forehead and move simultaneously down and out past shoulders.

title: Wedding
note: Ceremony uniting two people in matrimony

title: Wedding
note: Ceremony uniting two people in matrimony

title: Wednesday
note: Signs for days of the week are especially prone to variation. There may be another or a few other signs for 'Wednesday'.
description: Right F-Handshape with palm facing signer moves in small circles in front of face.

title: Wee
note: 1. 'Wee' as in not very tall. 2. This sign is used to refer to people or animals.
description: Right hand, in a Claw Handshape with palm facing down, moves down in a straight line.
memory_aid: Indicates the weeness of a person.

title: Week
note: The right hand can change to indicate a different period of time. If the right hand is a '3', it means 'three weeks' and so on.
description: Right Extended Finger Handshape with palm facing signer touches palm of left Full Closed Handshape with palm facing signer. Right hand moves across left hand towards the fingers.
memory_aid: Looks like a week from the calendar.

title: Weekend
description: Right Extended Finger Handshape with palm facing signer touches palm of left Full Closed Handshape with palm facing signer. Right hand moves across left hand towards the fingers. Then right hand opens into Full Closed Handshape with palm facing left. It moves down in front of left hand.
memory_aid: Looks like an end to a week from the calendar.

title: Weep
note: While 'cry', 'sob', 'wail' and so on share the same essential meaning, they all differ in intensity. The same is true in KSL. The difference in intensity is indicated by facial expression and movement of hands.
description: Extended Index Finger Handshapes with palms facing signer are placed under each eye. They move down in straight lines repetitively.
memory_aid: Looks like tears falling down one's face.

title: Weigh
description: Both hands are in Full Closed Handshapes with palms facing up. They start at bottom edges of the signing space. Alternately and repetitively the hands move up and down.

title: Welcome
description: Both Full Closed Handshapes with palms facing left are held up near right side of body. Both move down simultaneously in an arc closer to the body. Hands end up in middle of signing space with palms facing up.

title: Well 1
note: 1. 'Well' as in a state of being, as in being fine. 2. The signer here is mouthing the Kiswahili word 'sawa'.
description: Both Thumbs-Up Handshapes with palms facing one another are shaken slightly from side to side.
memory_aid: Typical gesture for saying something is well.

title: Well 2
note: 'Well' as in a borehole.
description: WATER - Right C-Handshape with palm facing left is placed just below the mouth. Movement is slightly upwards repetitively. HOLE - Right Extended Index Finger Handshape with palm facing signer points down and makes small circles as it moves down.
memory_aid: As if drinking a glass of water and then indicating a hole in the ground.

title: Well, I Never
note: General conversation

title: Well, I Never
note: General conversation

title: Wellbeing
description: Both Full Open Handshapes with palms facing signer are positioned at shoulders. Hands move out while handshapes change to S-Handshapes.

title: West
note: Do not reverse direction for others. Sign WEST to your left.
description: Right W-Handshape with palm facing out is moved to the left.

title: Western
note: Do not reverse direction for others. Sign WEST to your left.
description: Right W-Handshape with palm facing out is moved to the left.

title: Wet
description: Right Bent-B Handshape with palm facing signer taps backside of downturned left Full Closed Handshape.

title: Whack
note: This verb changes movement depending on the object. If it is to whack yourself, the hand moves towards yourself, as shown in this video. If it is to whack someone else, the hand moves away from the signer.
description: S-Handshape with palm facing down moves towards head. Upon touching head, hand moves up slightly.

title: What
note: Lowered eyebrows can indicate a question. Thus it is very important that while asking a 'what' question, eyebrows are lowered.
description: Full Open Handshapes are held with palms facing down and then flipped over so that palms are facing up.

title: What A Lovely Day
note: Making friends

title: What Are You Doing?
note: Family and relationships

title: What Date Is It Today?
note: time

title: What Do You Mean?
note: General conversation

title: What Do You Say?
note: General conversation

title: What Do You Study?
note: Education

title: What Do You Study?
note: Education

title: What Do You Think?
note: General conversation

title: What Does Xx Mean?
note: Languages and communication

title: What For
note: 1. 'What for' as in why? 2. Lowered eyebrows can indicate a question. Thus it is very important that while asking a 'what for' question, eyebrows are lowered. 3. While 'what for' is a two-word phrase in English, it is one sign in KSL.
description: Shoulders are shrugged as downturned Full Open Handshapes turn over so that palms are facing up.

title: What Happened?
note: Emergencies

title: What Is That?
note: General conversation

title: What Is Your Name?
note: Making friends

title: What Is Your Name?
note: Making friends

title: What Is Your Phone Number?
note: Making friends

title: What Is Your Phone Number?
note: Making friends

title: What Languages Do You Speak?
note: Making friends

title: What School Did You Go To?
note: Education

title: What Time Is It?
note: time

title: What Was That?
note: General conversation

title: What's Good?
note: General conversation

title: What's New?
note: General conversation

title: What's On Your Mind?
note: General conversation

title: What's On Your Mind?
note: General conversation

title: What's The Matter?
note: family and relationships

title: What's The Matter?
note: family and relationships

title: What's Your Favorite Food?
note: Making friends

title: What's Your Favorite Food?
note: Making friends

title: What's Your Job?
note: Making friends

title: Wheat
description: Right Extended Index Finger Handshape with palm facing down rubs the outside of palm of upturned left Full Closed Handshape.

title: Wheelbarrow
description: Both hands are in S-Handshapes with palms facing up. Hands move forward simultaneously.

title: When
note: Lowered eyebrows can indicate a question. Thus it is very important that while asking a 'when' question, eyebrows are lowered.
description: Right Extended Index Finger Handshape with palm facing out is moved slightly side to side from the wrist.
memory_aid: Looks like the hand of a clock.

title: Where
note: Lowered eyebrows can indicate a question. Thus it is very important that while asking a 'where' question, eyebrows are lowered.
description: Both Full Open Handshapes with palms facing up are held at sides of signing space. They are then moved slightly side to side.
memory_aid: Hands are moving around in space looking for the answer.

title: Where Are We?
note: asking for directions

title: Where Are You From?
note: Making friends

title: Where Can I Find A Hotel?
note: Hotel

title: Where Do You Live?
note: Making friends

title: Where Do You Work?
note: work

title: Where Does This Bus Go?
note: asking for directions

title: Where Does This Train Go?
note: asking for directions

title: Where Is The Toilet?
note: asking for directions

title: Where You At?
note: asking for directions

title: Whether
note: Note tilted head, an important part of the sign.
description: Both hands are in Full Open Handshapes with palms facing down. Hands turn so that palms are facing up.

title: Which One Is The Best?
note: general conversation

title: Whirl
description: Both Extended Index Finger Handshapes with palms facing signer are pointing at one another. They move forward in a circular motion alternately and repetitively.

title: White
note: 'White' as in the colour white, not 'white people'. See WHITE PERSON in this dictionary.
description: Right Extended Index Finger Handshape with palm facing signer is held in front of mouth. Finger bends down repetitively to form an X-Handshape.

title: White Person
note: While 'white person' is a two-word phrase in English, it is one sign in KSL.
description: Right Extended Index Finger Handshape with palm facing signer is placed on edge of palm of upturned left Full Closed Handshape. Right hand moves up repetitively in a slight inward circular motion.
memory_aid: Light colour of palm is same as the skin of a white person.

title: Who
note: Lowered eyebrows can indicate a question. Thus it is very important that while asking a 'who' question, eyebrows are lowered.
description: Right Extended Index Finger Handshape with palm facing signer points to the mouth and moves in small circles.
memory_aid: A circle around the mouth asking for a name.

title: Who Are You?
note: Making friends

title: Whole
description: Both Full Closed Handshapes with palms facing down start side by side. As hands turn up, they move away from one another in a circle. At the end they come back together touching at the fingers. Palms are facing up.

title: Whom
note: Lowered eyebrows can indicate a question. Thus it is very important that while asking a 'who' question, eyebrows are lowered.
description: Right Extended Index Finger Handshape with palm facing signer points to the mouth and moves in small circles.
memory_aid: A circle around the mouth asking for a name.

title: Who's Calling?
note: family and relationships

title: Whose
note: Lowered eyebrows can indicate a question. Thus it is very important that while asking a 'who' question, eyebrows are lowered.
description: Right Extended Index Finger Handshape with palm facing signer points to the mouth and moves in small circles.
memory_aid: A circle around the mouth asking for a name.

title: Why
note: Lowered eyebrows can indicate a question. Thus it is very important that while asking a 'why' question, eyebrows are lowered.
description: Shoulders are shrugged as downturned Full Open Handshapes turn over so that palms are facing up.

title: Wide
description: Both Full Closed Handshapes with palms facing one another and fingers pointing out start side by side. They move away in opposite directions. They turn slightly at ends so that palms are facing out.

title: Wide-Ranging
description: Heels of both Full Closed Handshapes are touching, with fingers pointing out. Both hands move out to either side of the signing space simultaneously.
memory_aid: Indicates a wide group of people.

title: Wife
note: The first part of this sign uses WOMAN, indicating female.
description: Right Full Closed Handshape with palm facing down is pointing out. It is placed on chest where it moves up and down from the wrist. Then both hands form I-Handshapes with little fingers bent. The left hand is held sideways so palm is facing signer. The right little finger hooks on the left little finger.

title: Will
description: Full Closed Handshape with palm facing signer and fingers pointing left moves in steps forward repetitively.

title: Will Not
note: While 'will not' is a two-word phrase in English, it is one sign in KSL.
description: Both arms with Full Closed Handshapes are held upright and crossed at the wrists. Palms are facing sides. Both hands move down to opposite sides of the signing space. Palms are then facing down.

title: Will You Marry Me?
note: Dating and romance

title: Will You Marry Me?
note: Dating and romance

title: Willing
description: Fingers of right hand, in Full Open Handshape with palm facing signer, move down repetitively on throat.

title: Win
description: Right Extended Index Finger Handshape with palm facing signer is pointing down. Wrist turns so that finger is pointing up.

title: Wind
description: Full Open Handshapes with palms facing one another point out. They start at ends of signing space and move back and forth alternately.

title: Window
description: Both Extended Index Finger Handshapes with palms facing out are pointing up and out. They start above and in front of head. They move out, down and back together. Right hand in Small-T Handshape with palm facing left moves towards and away from signer repetitively.
memory_aid: The shape of and the act of opening a window.

title: Wipe Out
note: While 'wipe out' is a two-word phrase in English, it is one sign in KSL.
description: Both hands are in Full Closed Handshapes. Right hand with palm facing left moves down to swipe across palm of upturned left hand. As right hand moves up, it closes into C-Handshape with palm facing signer.

title: Wish
description: Both Full Closed Handshapes with palms facing signer are placed by the side of the head. Left hand is closer to signer and lower than right hand. Both move fingers down into Bent-B Handshapes repetitively.

title: Witchcraft
description: Full Closed Handshape with palm facing signer is positioned before mouth. Hand moves down on mouth as mouth blows upon palm. Hand then moves to right side of signer where it assumes O-Handshape. O-Handshape moves to center of signing space while turning into a Full Open Handshape with palm facing left.

title: With
description: Both hands are in Full Closed Handshapes with palms facing one another and thumbs up. They start at opposite ends of the signing space and come together until the palms touch.

title: With Child
note: While 'with child' is a two-word phrase, it is one sign in KSL.
description: Thumbside of Full Closed Handshape with palm facing down is placed on signer below chest. Hand moves out and down in an arc so that little-finger side of handshape touches waist of signer.
memory_aid: Shows the bump of a pregnancy.

title: Without
description: Both Full Closed Handshapes with palms facing signer move back and forth in opposite directions. The fingers of both hands come in contact as they move pass each other.
memory_aid: Right hand is not with left hand.

title: Witness
note: One giving evidence of an account

title: Woman
description: Right Full Closed Handshape with palm facing down is pointing out. It is placed on chest where it moves up and down from the wrist.

title: Womb
note: Organ through which the young are conceived in mammals

title: Wonderful
description: Index finger of Modified-C handshape is resting on top of chin while thumb is underneath chin. Head moves slightly side to side.

title: Wonderful 2
description: Index finger of Modified-C handshape is resting on top of chin while thumb is underneath chin. Head moves slightly side to side.

title: Won't
note: While 'won't' is a contraction of 'will not' in English, it is one sign in KSL.
description: Both arms with Full Closed Handshapes are held upright and crossed at the wrists. Palms are facing sides. Both hands move down to opposite sides of the signing space. Palms are then facing down.

title: Wood
note: 'Wood' as in lumber or firewood.
description: Both C-Handshapes with palms facing down are together. They move away from one another then back again in a straight line.
memory_aid: Showing the shape of a piece of wood.

title: Word
description: Both G-Handshapes with palms facing one another are touching at fingers. Hands move away slightly from one another while closing into Single-O Handshapes. This is done repetitively.
memory_aid: The shape of a whole word.

title: Work
description: The little-finger side of the right S-Handshape with palm facing left is brought down repetitively on top of the index finger side of the left S-Handshape with palm facing right.

title: Work Out
note: 1. 'Work out' as in to physically train. 2. While 'work out' is a two-word phrase in English, it is one sign in KSL.
description: Both O-Handshapes with palms facing signer are placed on shoulders. They move out while opening into Full Open Handshapes. This is done repetitively.

title: Workplace
description: Right S-Handshape with palm facing signer moves down to rest on upturned left Full Closed Handshape.

title: World
description: Slightly bent Full Open Handshapes with palms facing out start together and move around forward until they meet. Palms are now facing signer.

title: Worm
description: Right Extended Index Finger Handshape with palm facing down is pointing out. Finger closes into an X-Handshape repetitively.

title: Worn-Out
description: Both Claw Handshapes with palms facing signer rest upon the chest. Hands turn down and out so that palms are facing up.

title: Worried
note: Note the lowered eyebrows, an important part of the sign.
description: Full Open Handshapes with palms facing down are near temples of forehead. Hands move simultaneously in small outward circles.

title: Worry
note: Note the lowered eyebrows, an important part of the sign.
description: Full Open Handshapes with palms facing down are near temples of forehead. Hands move simultaneously in small outward circles.

title: Would
description: Full Closed Handshape with palm facing signer and fingers pointing left moves in steps forward repetitively.

title: Wound
note: 1. 'Wound' as in an injury, a cut. 2. While 'wound' is one word in English, it is a two-word phrase (SICK, CUT) in KSL.
description: SICK - Backside of Bent-B Handshape touches cheek. CUT - Fingertips of Bent-B Handshape with palm facing signer then move along backside of downturned left Full Closed Handshape.

title: Wrap
note: 'Wrap' as in a leso or kanga.
description: Both hands are in Full Closed Handshapes. Left hand with palm facing out waits by side of waist while right hand with palm facing signer moves in to center of waist. Left hand follows.

title: Wrathful
note: The eyebrows are lowered, indicating anger. The head also moves slightly to the side.
description: Right Claw Handshape with palm facing signer moves to the forehead.
memory_aid: The forehead is usually furrowed in anger.

title: Wristwatch
description: Right Extended Index Finger Handshape with palm facing left taps the wrist of downturned left S-Handshape.

title: Write
description: Right Single-O Handshape with palm facing out moves to right in slight up and down motions.
memory_aid: Looks like the action of writing.

title: Write Down
note: While 'write down' is a two-word phrase in English, it is one sign in KSL.
description: Right Single-O Handshape with palm facing out moves to right in slight up and down motions.
memory_aid: Looks like the action of writing.

title: Wrong
description: Right Extended Index Finger Handshape with palm facing out makes an 'X' in the air.
memory_aid: X' in the air indicates something wrong.

title: Wrong 2
description: Right Extended Index Finger Handshape with palm facing out makes an 'X' in the air.
memory_aid: X' in the air indicates something wrong.

title: X
description: Middle, ring and little fingers are folded down with thumb folded across middle finger. Index finger is up but bent. The hand is turned so that palm is facing left.

title: X-Ray
note: Short wavelength electromagnetic radiation

title: Y
description: Index, middle and ring ringers are folded against palm. Little finger and thumb are straight and spread wide. Palm is facing out.

title: Yaya Centre
note: Name of a place

title: Year
description: Left Extended Index Finger Handshape with palm facing down is pointing right. Right Extended Index Finger Handshape with palm facing left is pointing out. The right finger comes down once on middle of left finger.
memory_aid: Marking a notch for each year.

title: Yearn
description: Fingers of right hand, in Full Open Handshape with palm facing signer, move down repetitively on throat.

title: Yell
note: Note lowering of eyebrows and movement of mouth. These are important parts of the sign.
description: S-Handshape with palm facing down is placed under chin. Hand opens into Full Open Handshape.
memory_aid: Hand opening means mouth is yelling.

title: Yellow
description: Modified-C Handshape with palm facing signer is next to ear. Hand moves back and forth from the wrist.

title: Yes
description: Right S-Handshape with palm facing out moves up and down from wrist.

title: Yesterday
description: Right Extended Index Finger Handshape with palm facing down is pointed repetitively over right shoulder.

title: You
description: Right Extended Index Finger Handshape with palm facing down is pointing out.

title: You Are Welcome
note: Family and relationships

title: You Are Welcome
note: Family and relationships

title: You Have Beautiful Eyes
note: Dating and romance

title: You Sign Very Well
note: Languages and communication

title: You Sign Very Well
note: Languages and communication

title: Young
description: Right Bent-B Handshape with palm facing signer starts chest high then moves down.

title: Youngster
description: Right Bent-B Handshape with palm facing signer starts chest high then moves down.

title: Your
note: Note the mouth movement 'ba ba ba'. This is an important part of the sign.
description: Full Closed Handshape starts with palm facing down in center of signing space. Hand moves up from wrist as arm moves slightly forward.

title: You'Re Beautiful
note: Dating and romance

title: You'Re Right
note: General conversation

title: Yours
note: Note the mouth movement 'ba ba ba'. This is an important part of the sign.
description: Full Closed Handshape starts with palm facing down in center of signing space. Hand moves up from wrist as arm moves slightly forward.

title: Yours Faithfully
note: General conversation

title: Yours Sincerely
note: General conversation

title: Yours Truly
note: letter writing

title: Yourself
description: Right X-Handshape starts with palm facing left and finger touching forehead. As it moves forward, hand turns down and around so that finger is pointing left.
memory_aid: Pointing at you and telling you to it something yourself.

title: Z
description: Middle, ring and little fingers are folded. Thumb is folded across middle and ring fingers. Index finger is extended out. Palm is facing out. The hand is moved so that the tip of index finger draws out a 'Z' shape. The motion is (1) from left to right, (2) angled down from right to left, (3) from left to right.

title: Zambia
note: Names of places are especially prone to variation. There may be another or a few other signs for 'Zambia'.
description: Both Full Closed Handshapes are held upright crossed at wrists. Palm of right hand is facing left while palm of left hand is facing right. Hands move backward once.
memory_aid: Looks like the bird on flag of Zambia.

title: Zebra
description: Both V-Handshapes with palms facing signer start on middle of stomach. Right hand is above left hand. They move away from one another repetitively.

title: Zebra
note: Mammal native to Africa, has black and white stripes

title: Zero
description: O-Handshape is held upright with palm facing out.

title: Zero 2
description: O-Handshape is held upright with palm facing out.

title: Zimbabwe
note: Names of places are especially prone to variation. There may be another or a few other signs for 'Zimbabwe'.
description: Right Bent-B Handshape with palm facing left is held upright. Hand moves to right repetitively.
